comment: The staff are very nice and patient with everyone. The waffle fries are a bit dry so you will need some condiments on the side. They have a variety of drinks which all are pretty delicious. I love there spicy chicken sandwich. I would recommend more people to come.

Just had to bring may ratings down for this specific Chick-Fil-A. I was highly disappointed just coming from there now, for they had a deal with eventbrite to purchase $1 Grilled Chicken Club. I had signed up for the event with eventbrite to go today for the exclusive deal. Upon going and expecting to purchase the chicken club for again what was said to be a $1 I was told they didn't have any more. That East first frustration here. After being told there weren't any left, one of the lady's making the sandwiches asked if I wanted to supplement the grilled chicken club for something else. I replied sure and requested a spicy deluxe sandwich instead for the deal. I was given the sandwich, then in going to pay what I expected to be a $1 for the supplement sandwich that I got instead, I was told by the lady at the register that they don't take gift cards or deal codes, when what I had in my hand was the specific deal with the address for the eventbrite deal. I ended up paying full price for the sandwich and left completely pissed off. I may even go as far as to contacting Chick-Fil-A itself to discuss this because the whole ordeal was very mishandled and unprofessional. Will no longer go to this Chick-Fil-A location!

The most convenient they can get. I live at 5 University Place, and all it takes to get here is going down the elevator and walking 10 seconds. I understand most people don't have that luxury, so it won't be part of my review. But other than that, this place is just a fast food restaurant. Lines move fast, but are also long.The reason why I cannot recommend this place is out of the 10 times I've eaten here. The food has made my stomach ache maybe 3 times. I don't think it's okay to have any restaurant where there's 1/3 chance of being sick from your meal. I've had better chick-fil a, I've had better chicken, and I've had better experiences. 2/5
They always get your order wrong no matter what you ask for .. place is. Clean so 2 stars
Had a great spicy chicken sandwich. Was really good. Very nice staff , good teamwork . Enjoyed their place.

Long lines for the lunch rush, but it goes quickly. Staff take your order in line and are fast but polite.The waffle fries were a little dry, but that's not going to stop me from eating Chick-fil-A. Love their sweet tea and unique ketchup packets.

A huge line of people waiting to eat at this place. Why? I dont know. The food was tasteless and no better than typical fare. People have no sense of taste, or will eat anything that is pumped up to be good. Forget this place! I give this place a 1/4 star!

I got delivery of a box of chicken nuggets from here, and they were pretty good. Of course, by the time they arrived, they were no longer hot nor crunchy, but that's to be expected. They were a bit too salty, but the chicken was pretty moist and not dried out. It was enjoyable, but quite average.
The foods made quick and everything tastes fresh. The line gets a tad long but it's expected. Food is less than $10 and great place to grab lunch on the go.

Good place to go when am hungry and looking for something quick to eat around NYU.The food is always good. And the sauce! Oh the Chick-fil-A sauce is soooo good! You gotta try it.It's self service so you pay as you're exiting the food area...like a typical college cafeteria. You can also pay with NYU campus cash.Plenty of places to sit but it can get extremely crowded at lunch time when NYU students are out of class.

I really love this placeRichard Lacy with Keller Williams for every food item on the menu. The place was very clean and the food was delicious I went to the Chick-fil-A around 11 AM on 67 though the closest one to 34. And I ate up there everything was clean including the bathroom with impress me I have a southwestern salad with chicken and a cup of coffee and that was the lesson
The food was great I really enjoyed it . Me and wife went for a quick bit and it was great . The only thing was the cashier was all in a bad mood and really was nasty
Fix your hours. You aren't open on saturdays yet your yelp and google profiles say you are. Sad!
basic menu, but its good for what it is -- got a chicken sandwich.

It's not the biggest Chick-fil-A in town, but it is the most accessible. Located in a place, not many people know since it's inside an NYU residence hall. Heads up to people who are not NYU students, it is open to the public, you just need to get it through a small door right beside the main entrance of Weinstein. Apparently, you have a lot of crazy things inside there which I discovered a year later.A bad thing about this place is that most of the food is like a take out order, so the food is made and kept for a while. Alas, fries don't feel like fries anymore. But still worth the money as you save the travel till Times Square.
Delicious! I always like chicken :) The burger is juicy, and I also enjoy the chicken nub. The inly problem is that there are only few seats, so we have to take the food out to eat.

If I could give these clowns zero stars I would because the location is CLOSED for the summer.  No signs,  no updates on Google,  nothing.  I walked thirty blocks to get there for lunch.  Closed.  You stink and I hate your mom's face.
Huh? How does this dry, tasteless sandwich get any good reviews at all? Even the tempting-looking waffle fries had nothing to recommend them.One of the mysteries of life (and NYU).
I don't go to Nyu but I praise them for having chik fil a . I live in nj but our chik fil a is far I grew up on chik fil a in the south

This place was too hyped up in my opinion. The fried chicken were soggy and the fries were tasteless. It was an alright experience overall. But a good choice for a quick bite but would not come all the way to just eat it nor wait in line for it. 3 star in my book.

i read that even if the owners are right-wing-fascists and religious fanatics, the food was good and cheap. but is not, bread soggy and repulsive, chicken dry as cardboard, the only taste came from 2 slices of pickle. ambience depressing, service ghetto style. never again!

For those of us at NYU, Chik Fil A in the city is nothing new.   The Weinstein Food Court has had Chik for years.  But, finally, Chik is open to the public.  Its good food, fast service and served in a clean establishment, just like it is all over the American suburbs.  Ive always thought an orange would work better than pickles on their fried chicken sandwiches.   As good as Chick is , it can't compare with the new Buttermilk Fried chicken sandwich at Mcdonald's.  CEO Steve Easterbrook is doing good work.
It's great to find this in the city.  Good was good.  It's easy to find if you know where to look.

NYU's best-kept secret.October 3rd is in many people's calendar and not just because of Mean Girls; Chick-fil-a is opening a free-standing restaurant in NYC! However, this won't be the first Chick-fil-a operation in the city. Deep inside an NYU building lies an express counterpart, and I've been going for years to fulfill my deepest chicken sandwich cravings.Yes, their menu offering is very limited. They only have the original sandwich, nuggets, and waffle fries, but hey, that's more than enough to make me happy. And when compared to other lunch options in the area, you can get two sandwiches and still spend less than normal.A couple insider tips: walk in with confidence. NYU students can easily sense fear, and you want to blend in as much as possible. If there's a long line of people not moving, it's most likely because they're waiting for fries. Feel free to bypass and grab a sandwich from the dispensing station. Use a red tray to carry your food, and make sure you get into a line that takes payment aside from NYU dining dollars. I've usually never had a problem, but sometimes they can switch it up on you. Oh, and stock up on sauces. Ketchup is actually located after checkout, so don't ask for it at the counter.Eat more chickin!
Samwiches and secret proprietary Chic-fil-A sauce sometimes run out early; lots of scared NYU freshman.

WOW! I am not a fast food kind of guy. I love cooking and I love Chicken. For that reason, I just don't have chicken when I'm out .I am always disappointed. Chick-Fil-A is GREAT! I honestly can't get over how GOOD the chicken is. MUCH better than my own and a MILLION times better than KFC or any other place that sells cooked chicken. It's hard to explain how food tastes, but trust me, TRY CHICK-FIL-A ! ! !What a pleasant surprise. I'll certainly be going here often!

*** Expensive, Catered to NYU students, Not worth a visit *** Located in one of the NYU buildings, this place is pretty much hidden unless you know about it. My only complaint is the portions are small compared to their actual locations (back in California). This is food court style, so there are other options to choose from. But, Chick-fil-A basically has the standard sandwich, nuggets, and fries here.

It's Chick-fil-a...already amazing.  It's stuck inside a college dining hall...would probably hate that if it didn't give me nostalgia to my college days at UNCC where we too had a Chick-fil-a in one of our dining halls.  The menu has the essential dining options that this chain carries.  Missing the lemonade and sweet tea though.

[Visited just before their announcement of an NYC expansion]Within Weinstein Passport Dining Hall* and unmarked from the street, it's easily accessible and the heat lamps make for a quick chicken sandwich pickup (they carry no spicy chicken, coffee, etc. so the listing should be changed to ...Express). For a warm, simple, tasty sandwich for under $4, not a terrible option.*Charged as ARAMARK WEINSTEIN FOOD CO

A hidden gem in this NYU dining hall.  Just walk in "with purpose," head right, and you're golden! Limited menu, but perfect for getting your fix of nuggets and waffle fries.  Just don't get too used to it, New York.  This joint keeps a students' schedule and thus goes on summer break from May-August.  Prepare for the pangs of withdrawal.

I hate that New York doesn't have a stand alone Chick-fil-A but I'm so every grateful that we have access to NYU's food court. The menu is extremely limited offering sandwiches, nuggets and waffle fries and they recently started offering the nugget trays up to a 200 count! This will suffice and alleviate a drive to NJ just to indulge in some real chicken nuggets and not the sub par offered at McD or Wendys.

For my tuition money, I should be getting a full service Chik-fil-A but this express one will do for now. I just feel really bad for anyone who is coming from the outside and has to eat in the high school cafeteria with no windows.Yes, you do not have to be an NYU student to get in. Just walk through the freshman dorm entrance, which is a bit awkward. As for the food:I got the grilled chicken sandwich which was excellent. The lettuce and tomatoes were extremely fresh and the chicken was made perfectly.I also got a side of fries which could have been a little more crispy which I am used to but they were still OK.They people behind the counter were super stingy with their sauce and would not give me more than one when I went back for a second and third time. I NEED multiple honey roasted mustard sauce packets & secret sauce! the guy behind the counter just did not understand. Anyways, I am still glad that there is a Chik-Fil-A and I still did my Chik-Fil-A happy dance in my seat. The one in Paramus is MUCH better if you ever get a chance to go!

I've been a long time fan of chick fil a. It was my first job. I once drove an hour and a half to my closest location and go their iconic samdwich and fries which I ate immediately. But to make that drive worth it I bought myself a 250 nugget party platter. A party it truly was.Anyway I moved to New York in November and I crave it with a fierceness. I thought they were only in jersey but I stumbled upon this on Google maps. But before I go down to NYU (i live in the Bronx) I want to make sure you DO NOT have to be a student. That would truly break my heart. Can anyone tell me some good news. Please and thank you
I disagree with Chick-fil-a's stance on gay rights, but I do agree with their stance on chicken.

The gift and the curse, the Chick-fil-A Express at NYU. When choosing a school to further my education and give a ridiculous amount of money to I did a search on Google Maps. That search was for a Chick-fil-A. (gasp) The Universe has spoken! What a gift! Not only does NYU have a Chick-fil-A, but the only one within the five boroughs. Good ol southern fried chicken from Jawja (Georgia)! They didn't invent the chicken, just the chicken sandwich. So, with NYU having a Chick-fil-A on campus, we all know the story after that. Hey, apparently I have good company that thinks like me. content.usatoday.com/com…The curse, this is only an express location.I can get my ridiculously priced 12 piece nuggets, but not 4 piece strips. They always run out of Chick-fil-A sauce, my first preference for dunking my nuggets in. It's a combination of honey mustard, barbecue and ranch sauce. Yeah I could just mix them all myself, but Chick-fil-A fiqured out the perfect ratio mix. Dear management, please start ordering more of your namesake sauce. It consistently runs out quicker than the others. For those who will inevitably not be able to secure some Chick-fil-A sauce, Polynesian would be my second choice. Moving on...I can't get my Chick-fil-A Breakfast Platter:  scrambled eggs, a breakfast portion of their famous boneless breast of chicken, a freshly baked buttermilk biscuit and white pepper gravy with sausage. Do you know how difficult, yet awesome at the same time, to use your one biscuit as a egg and chicken biscuit, a strawberry jam biscuit and honey biscuit all at the same time?! Then to make an already insanely good breakfast platter even better, I've gotten a side of grits before at certain locations in SC. Okay I need a moment to get myself together.My third problem with this express location.... They don't have shakes! Still till this day, I haven't had a better shake than Chick-fil-A's Cookie Cream Shake! ...hold the whip cream, but still put the cherry on the top please. Thanks! BTW, this is from a person whose first job was at Sonic, America's Drive In.So with all that said... Yeah, I'll be back at Chick-fil-A getting a 12-piece nugget with some Chick-fil-A sauce between classes soon. One more good, you too can go grab a bite of southern greatness. No NYU ID is required to go access your chicken and waffle fries. Nuggets, sandwiches, and salads are available along with a dinner mint.

This is a sad, sad excuse for a Chick fila. I don't know if I've ever experienced disappointment such as I did biting into a nugget at NYU's dining hall "chick fila". Any high ratings likely belong to an individual that has never visited a real restaurant.  the chicken wasn't anywhere near to the caliber of chick fila's juicy, tender, and crispy deliciousness. it was dry and chewy. blegh. i don't even think they fried the meat with the company's signature peanut oil. the fries were soggy and cold.a tear ran down my face as I chucked my food, half-finished, into the first trashcan I could find outside the dining hall. it seems we'll have to wait until they decide to open a legitimate establishment in NYC, for this place is a fraud.

So ass. This is the terrible, aborted but somehow still alive, version of Chick Fil-A. This place gets hyped for being the only one in the city, but it'd be better off it there just weren't any here at all. Chick Fil-A's food is good. This is the antithesis of that. This is the Chinese knock off version of that. The fries are alright, but everything else sucks. The sandwiches are dry, and don't even remotely resemble the real deal. The nuggets are also dry, and not crunchy at all. The salads...why would you get a salad from here? I'd rather eat at downstein.

I ate at non peak hours. So I assume the food had been sitting there for some time. My fries were dry and not hot. My chick fil a sandwich was a good temp and it was crispy. But it lacked a sheen that I've seen in most places when I've eaten in the south. I wonder if they use peanut oil like the rest of the chick fil as do. But it didn't taste like it. It was better than no chick fil a but definitely wasn't up to par

Crave for this all the time. I need to have it at least three times a week. Nuggets, sandwiches, and fries are all good. I recommend trying it with chick-fil-a sauce or ketchup mixed with mayonnaise. But the veges that come with the sandwich are not always fresh and ready to go.. Still, I love it.
Tried my first one. YUK!Not for me.They say it's healthier.I don't see it.Not coming back.

Not the same as down south. I just like waffle fries. That's what they are good for. Not worth the clogged arteries or hormones. Save yourself. The lemonade is sugar water not worth the diabetes. Part of the appeal of other locations is the southern charm...no charm here, just greasy cafeteria food. If you want a flashback to junior high school, eat here.

Sorry, the NYU location still gets one lousy star. But my friend Thomas Y. points out that you don't have to drive to MD to get the real thing, because they have a mall location in Paramus! yelp.com/biz/chick-fil-a… By all means, make the short drive to check it out.

Never went to a Chick Fil-A before and when I saw that they had one and only one in the NYC decided to give it a try. The place was actually in the NYU cafeteria but anyone could go in and buy the food there. I had the 8 piece nuggets and the chicken sandwich. The breading on both tasted almost like the seasoning and breading from KFC. Both were made from real breast meat and not really processed like. It was a bit more salty that I would like but overall I liked it. The waffle fries were nice were fresh and crispy. Shout out to the lady at the cashier that was really friendly.

The food is absolutely disgusting and I am not a food snob by any means (I have had my fare share of meals from taco bell). I felt sick after my meal and suffered nausea the rest of the day. The thought of this place makes me sick.

Putting everything else aside Chick Fil-A is (f*cking) delicious and although this particular location is a Chick Fil-A Express it is just as good as any other. They only have two options for you to choose from here an 8 piece chicken nuggets or a chicken sandwich. And no Chick Fil-A meal is complete without their tasty waffle fries or their famous Chick Fil-A sauce.
Just went back here out of desperation and it is still as dumpy and greasy as it ever was.

My favourite. Ever ever favourite burger. Why? Christian, delicious, fresh and always always friendly staff are here for you. I bring alll my friends here and I really hope it will be here forever- this is how i love it. They have amazing nuggets!!! Omg and sauces?! I wish i could take them home LOL. Thank you guys. Way to go!!!!

So this is like Chick fila turned into cafeteria style... it is still the same chicken sandwich, don't get me wrong, but there is something that just isn't right. Food is good but it lacks the service that all restaurant versions come with. The veggies are in little tubs and have to be put into the sandwich. There is no spicy chicken sandwich and well yea... All other chick fila I would give 4.5 rounded up to 5 but here it's gonna be 3.5 rounded down to 3. Mostly because the taste is a little off and I don't know how fresh the ingredients here are.

Maybe this stuff once every two weeks is acceptable for a balanced diet. As if my sub-conscience can process that! Of all places, this is where I feel at my most decadent self.Watch out if you come into this food court around 10:45, 12:15, 1:45, 3:15, 4:30 or 6:10 (times that mass amounts of NYU classes let out). It will be crowded, the line will be unforgiving (there are only two if not one cashiers) and good luck having a tray. Not to mention that the sandwiches, nuggets and especially waffle fries are being constantly grabbed; there have been lines literally waiting for waffle fries.I always personally grab condiments when I get my chicken sandwich, fries and 16 oz. fountain drink. There are your Chic Fil-A condiments, like dressings, mustard, ketchup, mayonnaise and honey at the station, and then there are also Newman's Own dressings at the salad bar in the center behind the Chic Fil-A station, and salt, pepper and Heinz ketchup in the dining area after the cashier. It's a big deal for me. Yesterday, I put Bleu cheese dressing, mustard and ketchup over my chicken sandwich and tossed my fries in just Bleu. It was blissful, sinfully so! The creamy thick liquids coupled with that warm fried white meat and those hot and salted potato waffle fries coated in some high-sodium flavor. Really it's these moments that my mind has thrown such cautionary words away and instead put my tongue and teeth up front to make me enjoy myself. I won't call this offensive stuff gourmet, but it's still damn pleasurable eating.

Since this is the only Chick Fil A in NYC, I'm not really that surprised that anyone can walk in here(though that's not really good security wise, but I digress). All you have to do is walk in, grab either a Chick Fil A sandwich, waffle fries, and/or chicken nuggets(or all 3, hey I'm not judging), pay the cashier, and you can either sit down and enjoy your food or grab a plastic bag and take it to go. Watch the waffle fries, though, they're very addictive and the sandwich is pretty ok too.

When you take Chick Fil-A which is known to have Southern hospitality and open one in NYC.  You get ghetto service.  Every Chick Fil-A establishment I've been to outside of NYC have very consistent service and this is the one that I felt the most annoyed by.  Many of my usual favorite items did not match my expectations.  I got this dry and hard waffle fries and my Chicken sandwich was very sloppy, the buns were not even toasted properly and the worst part was the lettuce looked like it was stepped on and picked up from the ground.
food is good, a sprinkle of salt on the fries when they come of grease, would not hurt.

Food cravings can go a long way. Without delving into any boring chemistry, it's safe to say that a craving can go so far as to make the object of your obsession  taste like the best thing you've ever eaten, even if it was in fact made of camel turd. Now I'm not saying that this particular chick fil-a has been using a mammals' feces in their spicy chicken sandwich . . . because unfortunately, they have no spicy chicken sandwiches. Strike 1 . . . let's continue.Located in the food court of University Place, the appearance of this chick fil-a looks as dreary as the people working there. Most of them were kind of just standing there and spacing out and for the ones who weren't staring at the wall, they were awkwardly staring as we looked at the limited options available to us. I've never felt more tension at a fast food establishment asking for sauce. Sure, I asked for 4 different ones but I can't help that chick fil-a makes such a wide array of delicious sauces. Anyway, I ordered a chicken sandwich, 8 pieces of chicken tenders, and some waffle fries. I will say the waffle fries were delicious but that's because I asked for fresh ones and had to wait 15 minutes for them. The chicken sandwich was okay at best but definitely on the dry side while the chicken tenders were beyond dry; even generous dousings of chick fil-a and polynesian sauce couldn't provide adequate hydration. I did initially enjoy the meal when i was still having chick fil-a hunger pains but as the dryness started to sober me up, I realized that this chick fil-a is sadly under-performing. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't horrible or anything but coupled with some pretty lackluster service and an overall general feeling of desertion, I have to say that i'll only be visiting when my cravings for chick fil-a are causing unbearable pain.

I used to be addicted to Chick-fil-a before I moved to New York. This place is a horrendous joke compared to the Chick-fil-a's in Texas where I'm from.Chick-fil-a in Texas-Top notch service-Delicious, to-die-for chicken-Friendliest staff everChick-fil-a at NYU-Rude, unfriendly staff-Like, am I even eating chicken?-I'm pretty sure the protocol is saying "MY PLEASURE" when I say "THANK YOU." Or at least SMILE. Who's training these INCOMPETENT IDIOTS?They won't even let you take more than one sauce per sandwich. Like, they'll literally fight you for it if you attempt to take more than one. As if Chick-fil-a is going to lose anything significant giving away a couple more sauces or each NYU student doesn't already pay $60,000 a year. If the NYU students protested this Chick-fil-a for serving them atrocious "chicken," they might have actually made an irrefutable case.
NYU campus eating area. I love Chick fil a.  Premade chicken sandwiches and fries. No shakes. Limited seating area.
The best fast food chicken sandwich in the country.

I never had Chick Fil-A before coming to school in New York and I was addicted to it the latter half of my freshman year (and I know it's probably absolutely terrible for my health). I still like to drop in every once in a while to get a chicken sandwich, preferably not during peak lunch times because the food court becomes unbelievably crowded. The sandwich and waffle fries are pretty good with the "Chick Fil-A Sauce."

Food is totally delicious and the service is always great. They are friendly, efficient and they make you feel as if they genuinely  appreciate your business, which is almost impossible to find these days in other fast food restaurants. The owners personal opinion should not matter. Just because they don't support any one else's personal views does not make them hateful or homophobic!  Where is all the tolerance and respect that is suppose to be given but not received ?

Oh dear lord. I love fried chicken. I have no idea what I just ate here.The sandwiches are pre-cooked and are pining on the counter. Same for the latex fries. I could swear the meal was from a realtor's prop kit, you know the ones they use in model houses for show. My tastebuds couldn't communicate to my brain what was happening down there.Now for the setting. I didn't go to college in the US. Maybe that's why I'm still alive today and didn't commit suicide. The sheer obnoxiousness of these brats is insane. Loud, impolite, inconsiderate with downright neanderthalian intellect. What's with the pimples?!!? get treatment for God's sake! Got me wondering if my insurance would still cover me under these circumstances.If I had to compile a list of advance-signs of the fall of mankind, this would be there.
Not bad for being the only one in the city.  I loved it when I was in GA for 6 months, just the quality isn't the same but the fries are still a bomb!

People treat this place like PDT: "Secret Chick-Fil-A location in NYU Dorm. Ooooh."What's so secret about walking into a building that has a food court, grabbing a shit load of chicken sandwiches and sitting next to 20yr olds talking about fake IDs? The grilled chicken sandwich was confusing but luckily, I also picked up the regular chicken sandwich. And fries. The waffle fries will have you screaming.But be careful, you will have some fat NYU kids breathing down your back waiting for the next order of fries/sandwiches to come out.I'm not big so I let them breathe.

Never had Chick-Fil-A before, so I decided to give it a go at the only seemingly secret location in NYC, at NYU on Friday. The nuggets were the show stopper. Tender, flavorful, lightly battered bits of greasy heaven, that one might be ready to confess their sins at the pulpit for. The sandwich was also good. The pickle added a little something different, that screams, "we are not your average chicken chain." The waffle cut fries, are light, flavorful, but nicely done, and just brings together the entire meal.  The scene is, it's basically in a brightly lit, cafeteria, located in one of the dorms. You go in, make a hard right, and there it is. The cafeteria is rather large and adequate so you can eat there, or bag your meal yourself to go. The bags are located by the register, to the far right hand side of the cafeteria.  The chicken sandwiches, nuggets, and fries are all under a heat lamp, so you basically grab, and go. You can't be too picky because after all you are an outsider infiltrating NYU's territory here. Observe the students, and execute your order is my best advice to you, if you're patronizing for the first time. Very good food, that might take some getting used to if you're not familiar with your food being fried in peanut oil. The food is pretty damn good.

Whenever I go home I always have to swing by a Chick Fil-A and get their waffle fries (try with polynesian sauce!). So glad there's one in the city! Also, kinda fun to pretend you're in college again. Next time, I'll bring along my hoodie and sketchbook.

I wasn't raised raised on a farm so I'm not sure if the chicken we normally eat comes from the female bird (hen) or male (cock).  After all it's just meat from the same type of bird, right?   For all we know, that person there is eating hen while her friend is putting cock in his mouth.And really, when you have meat that's perfectly rubbed and the skin lubricated just right, in the heat of the moment all sorts of things can happen... especially if there's a group of thighs and breasts all piled up together in a Fil-A twister party.I went with my friend Jenn who loves big breast.  That's all she wants... and that's fine.  Who am I to judge? Unfortunately this place loses a couple of stars because you aren't given a choice.   All the chicken meat is ground into patties, nuggets and strips and doesn't resemble how it was born.  It's as though they abandoned God's plan and re-worked the chicken to conform to their value (meal) system. Personally, I'm not picky when it comes to parts, but I do like the dark meat.  Oh yeah.  It's a shame some people are intolerant about dark meat because once you've had it... anyway, I digress.  Back to this eatery.The staff were great, bending over backwards for my every desire.  Believe it or not this was my first chicken sandwich... I've just never had the desire to have my meat between buns.  But, "try everything once" I say.  At Chick Fil-A they use a little bit of peanut oil and some butter to help lubricate things.  And don't be surprised to find they've also snuck a pickle in your buns as well.The manager suggested we come back for breakfast sometime and try his sausage.Jenn said maybe... if she can chow on a muffin.  We'll see.
Chicken tastes like rubber, no flavor. Just more bad fast food making America fat
Good food good price don't care what they opinions are... its just food ....

Other than the "ambiance", this place is everything you should expect from a fast food place. Not a gourmet chicken experience, but the fried chicken sandwich is actually very good and much better than what's offered at the golden arches. And while I love McDonald's fries, these waffle fries are excellent. Worth the experience!
Inedible fried chicken pieces, not sure why this chain is so popular in the south and midwest. Then again, maybe that says more about those places than the "food" they serve.
I was amazed at how good the sandwich and fries are. All the fuss in the press made me go for the first time. Wish er had one midtown or on the UES.
Great food and reasonable price! I love this place a big time!! :)

Never tried a Chick Fil-A until they talked about it on the news. SOOOO I tried and I LOVED it!!! and the pickle :)Put the food aside... I for one DON'T care what gay groups think, and I'm NOT anti-gay, I just support FREE SPEECH! AND I am glad to see FREE SPEECH at NYU!!!! and not shutting it down.on another side note, from all the hate email I'm getting form the "so called tolerant" people that have been writing me... lets not forget that ~30 states put gay marriage on the ballot, and was defeated each time... what does that tell you??? hate to bust the bubble of the hateful people that wrote me :)  and thanks to all that supported free speech. and GOOD chicken!!!

This is the BEST food in NYU !!!! I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE CHICK FIL A !!!!! The food taste sooooooo GOOD. I ALWAYS EAT HERE AND ALWAYS WILL EAT HERE. IT'S MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT. THANK YOU CHICK FIL A FOR AN AWESOME FOOD. CHICK FIL A IS THE BEST.  WHEN I SAY BEST I MEAN NUMBER 1, NOMERO 1 the best. SIMPLY THE BEST!!!!!!! NUMBER 1

I was so excited when I heard there was a Chick Fil-A in NYC but when I got there I didn't realize it was a fast food version of it with only a few selections from the menu.  Ask for the sauce from the employees behind the counter because they don't put it out in front. I guess it's great for the average NYU student but it just doesn't cut it if you already experience the euphoria that is Chick Fil-A in California.

When a friend of mine invited me to get dinner at Chik Fil-A, I didn't realize I'd have to enter an NYU dorm-cum-cafeteria to get there. The much vaunted fried chicken sandwich chain chose to set down its NYC roots in the mayhem of an undergraduate food court and so be it.The slackerish, disheveled liberal arts majors complaining about their workload and cold-hearted professors make an interesting backdrop to this glorified fast food experience. The chicken sandwich is good, probably better than what you'd get at McDonalds or KFC. And it's reasonably cheap. The waffle fries are also pretty good. Overall, not a bad choice (assuming your world is circumscribed to an NYU dining hall).

Waffle fries, chicken sandwiches (tomatoes & lettuce on the side), salads, nuggets, and... well, that's about it. This chain inside an NYU dining hall is open to the public but has limited selections and is pretty much a pre-made, heat-lamp version of the actual restaurant, but it's still pretty darned tasty and the only one of its kind here in NYC.Plus if you go at the end of the year, students have leftover meal punches and you can oftentimes get food for free! :P

The fact that this is the ONLY Chick Fil A near and far, I will not complain about their limited menu. All I really need is a chicken sandwich and a lemonade and I am happy. I do wish they served breakfast though...who doesn't love the chicken biscuit?

3.5 stars...Chik-Fil-A is a southern fast food chain who's menu is primarily just chicken. They also pride themselves on their waffle fries, lemonade, their service, and fact that they're a Christian business who remains closed on Sundays (something unheard of for a successful chain). Their only location this far north is a tiny express window with a limited menu inside of one of NYU's dining halls. There is no sign outside and no indication that there is a Chik-Fil-A hiding inside because it's not really meant for the public BUT the general public are allowed in the dining hall (I asked). You'll feel like you're sneaking back to college which is fun, don't worry about seeming old because I saw some NYU professors and older students here too. I got a grilled chicken sandwich which was tasty but not nearly as fresh, plump, or cheap as a proper Chik-Fil-A location. The service was also pretty off. It was cool going back to college for lunch but I won't be coming back anytime soon.

Why didn't Weinstein have Chick Fil-A when i was an undergrad? Nooo instead we had wack BK and wack Pizza Hut Express.Chick Fil-A is amazing. It absorbs alcohol to perfection. The chicken sandwich is crispy on the outside and the chicken retains its moisture. The waffle fries are hit and miss with the crispiness. I guess it depends on how long it has been sitting underneath the heat lamp. The chicken nuggets are solid too but again a hit or miss with the heat lamp. Will this place be getting 4 stars if i was sober while eating this? I don't know..... probably not. However, I mean if i was sober, most likely i wouldn't be checking Chick Fil-A anyway. Caveat, eating Chick Fil-A while sitting inside a dining room inside a Freshman NYU dorm makes one feel really really really old. Luckily, once i take my 1st bite into the sandwich, all of that goes away as the sandwich transports me to heavenly bliss.
Right now there is a cop in front of the dorm checking ID - only NYU folks get in. Apparently there was a protest today related to this:  nyulocal.com/on-campus/2…

The only Chick fil A in the city is in an NYU dining hall! Not quite as good as going to a stand alone Chick fil A in the south but it satisfies a craving and it's fun to go eat in a college dining hall and remember what it was like to be in college again!

It is indeed Chick-Fil-A. Is it amazing? No, not really. Will it do? Yes. Let's explore why.This Chick-Fil-A is actually part of NYU's campus and is in a dorm food court next to Quiznos and some other fastfood stores. It's an express version, so basically there are much fewer items, the chicken sandwich, salad, chicken nuggets, and waffle fries. The hot items are made and placed under a heat lamp. Come during lunch time, hope that chick-fil-a's is going well and that they're cooking consistently.For the food, assuming you're lucky enough to get it fresh, you've hit gold. I had a chicken sandwich that was somewhere in between fresh and cold, so I didn't have it too bad. And it tasted reasonably well for fastfood and the sauces help a lot.More than anything else though, their waffle fries are amazing. I loved it. There's not too many places I've had waffle fries from, but this surely tops anything else I've had. I don't know the technicalities of purchasing if you're not a NYU student. Apparently other people have bought from here, successfully. I had a friend from NYU accompany me and help me pay for it. I do plan on coming back for the fries and maybe enjoying it with a shack burger from madison square park.

This Chick-Fil-A is just plain gross.  Sure it's cheap, but that's about all it has got going for it.  Everything is placed under the heat lamp, and no care is gone into the preparation of your food.  They do not offer milkshakes, the chicken is full of nerve endings, and the atmosphere lacks any sort of Chick-Fil-A feeling.  The one thing I normally like about eating at Chick-Fil-A is that it doesn't feel like you are eating at McDonalds.  Well, here it feels just like McDonalds, and I am not digging it.  I guess I will have to go back to Texas for my Chick-Fil-A because this just doesn't do it for me.
I didnt get the famous burgers but the chicken nuggets were too greasy and dry. They are also a lot smaller than McDonald's. I don't think I will come back here.

I went here again- it's not as good as a regular Chick-fil-A.  The problem is that they make a bunch of Chick-fil-A sandwiches and put them under a heat lamp.  They should just make fewer of them, and they'd be fresher.  I'd have no problem waiting a few minutes for a just-made sandwich.  They're to die for!  Still, this does satisfy my Chick-fil-A craving when I can't make it out to suburbia.

Went here tonight (opens til 11pm on Sat) .. at 10pm, there were tons of sandwiches and nuggets under the heatlamp so I assumed they were fresh .. I was super excited to finally have some chick-fil-a after almost 3 years without ..after my first bite, my heart sunk .. the top bun was soggy .. the bottom bun  was actually hard and stale .. the chicken was bland .. it was absolutely the worst sandwich I've ever had!I was even more disappointed because this was my bf's first chick-fil-a experience .. for years I've been talking about how chick-fil-a makes the ultimate chicken sandwich .. now he thinks I'm nuts .. I had to convince him that it's usually better than this and that those sandwiches probably sat under the heatlamp since 6pm ..sigh, so sad.

Does this taste the Chick-Fil-A most of us are used to?  Mostly.  It is under a heat lamp but its still got all of the same flavors.Is it a freaking Chick-Fil-A in Manhattan?!  YES!One day I hope there will be a real Chick-Fil-A either right next to my apartment or office, but in the mean time this will most definitely do.Walk into the dorm and keep heading straight.  You'll take a right once you get into the dining room tables and then you'll see it.... yay!

Sad writing this review b/c I thought I'd get a first check -in or it was  a well kept secret.You techincally are supposed to be a student.  But, hey, nevertheless, it's good.   Just say you're their TA.  The ChickFil A sandwich is awesome and frankly, no line cuz everyone wants Quiznos for some twisted reason.  Enjoy.

Although not as fresh as it should be since it bakes under a heat lamp all day, if you're craving a damn good chicken sandwich nestled next to two iconic slices of pickles  with a side of waffle fries, this is where you must go.

I kinda wish I never found Chick Fil-A, but I guess it's inevitable when you live in the same building.  It's disgusting, guilt-inducing and ridiculously hard to resist. 8 months after my first sandwich (and carton of waffle fries), I'm still lured by the smell of oil bubbling from who-knows-where (and believe me, you don't want to know where).  It's made for some extremely tense standoffs between the salad bar and fried ___ bar, but being the lazy and weak-willed college student I am, it's not hard to imagine how most of these situations are resolved: grilled chicken salads!Yes, the best thing about Chick Fil-A is their salads, if only for allowing me to grab some fries at no extra cost.The only problem I have with this place, aside from the pounds that somehow stuck onto me after constant visiting, is their business procedures.  I guess it's cute to be closed on Sundays (they cite tradition from the 1800's), but if they're sticking to tradition, why not go all the way?  Have the chickens raised on-site!  Hand cut the potatoes!  Use sla- you get the idea.
yayayay!  I didn't know there was a Chick-fil-A so close to me.  So yummy, I love this fast food brand, and I'm not a fast food person.

Thank God for this hidden treasure!Yes it's in a NYU dining hall. But if you feel too weird eating with students you can get plastic bag and take it to Washington Square Park. Unfortunately they do close the dining hall down for the summer. Still, when it's open I'll go out of my way for a delicious chic-fil-a sandwich any day of the week... Except Sunday that is.Oh and also someone mentioned the map is wrong. Looks like they still haven't updated it. It's at the Northeast corner of Washington Square Park, not immediately by Union Square.

Whaaaaaa? I've lived in NYC for how long without realizing that Chick Fil A at NYU was open to old farts like me?Thank the L-rd it is!While I feel old and poor walking into an NYU dorm, thank goodness it's here (and so close to my apartment!) and open to the public...I digress...The food is delicious (chicken nuggets and waffle fries with honey mustard...say the safe word!) and the cost is college-affordable (and therefore Ryan K affordable).I salute you, Chick Fil A. I salute you, and I love you.Seriously.

I LOVE CHICK FIL AI LOVE CHICK FIL AI LOVE CHICK FIL AI don't care if it's a heat lamp situation, if you go at the right time, you get fresh food. And it's DELICIOUS. I've never eaten Chick Fil A and then regretted it later though... cause it's right tasty!I am an NYU grad student and I do happen to frequent some of the university dining establishments occasionally, and I have noticed that the employees in this dining hall are way nicer and much less stupid than the employees at the other campus dining areas. It's probably the Chick Fil A. Chick Fil A: The most delicious thing to come out of organized religion. (they're a Christian-oriented company. If all Christians were about delicious fried chicken and waffle fries, I'd be singing Hallelujah!)

Yes, it's in an NYU dorm. Please don't pay with a credit card. Inevitably, they're more used to NYU swipe cards than they are with debit cards. This means it takes twice as long to get out of there, with a growing line of Tisch hispters staring at you menacingly. This location has bizarre hours. Monday-Thursday: 11:00am-1:00amFriday: 11:00am-3:00pmSaturday: 12:00pm-11:00pm

Don't be shy.  They never check ID, so even if you're not affiliated with NYU, you can get your Chick-Fil-A on.  Yes, it's inside some NYU dorm and it's a counter at a food court, so do not be alarmed.  They are just students: they may be annoying, but harmless.I'd go with the nuggets, since the sandwich buns get pretty unhappy sitting on the metal shelf, kept warm in the foil bag.On the other hand, I always want my silly little two tiny-ass pieces of pickles, so I usually end up with the sandwich, sad buns and all.

I'm originally from Atlanta, the home of Chick-fil-a.  So I consider myself kinda an expert, especially since I've looked into opening one here.  (they're not interested in expanding, sadly)  I'm amazed that this location is open to the public bc I heard u had to be a student.  Now I know that's not true, but its hard to find.  Here's some background:Chick-fil-a is a franshise but they are very particular about where they are located.  They are predominantly a southern chain;  the most northern one I've found is in Philly.  And I look whenever I leave the city.  It is owned and started by a very religious gentleman named Truit Cathy.   This is why they are closed on Sundays.  (He believes everyone deserves a day of rest.)  As fast food goes, its not the worst for you.  You're better off getting the nuggets than the sandwich, but those pickles are so damn good!!  The nuggets come with sauce options like honey mustard, BBQ, and my favorite, Polynesian.  Sooo much better than McD's!  If you go to a full Chick-fil-a, try an ice cream cone.  Its suprisingly good for large scale production.  I'm baffled why this would hurt someone's stomach for the first time.  (one reviewer said this.)  Its just fried chicken in peanut oil.  And I'm pretty sure the millions of people in the South that try this for the first time haven't had this problem.  Nor did my Yankee husband have any gastrointestinal issues when he popped his Chick-fil-A cherry 8 years ago.  I finally got him used to eating chicken biscuits for breakfast too!!  Another not-to-be missed item from the Chicken King...

geez, funny and witty reviews indeed. but before i make my own review, i need to try this popular chicken sandwich i hear so much about. may i ask for the real address? when i searched it through google maps, i can see that the nearest subway station is 8th street N,R,W... :) is this correct? or should i start from Union Square? :))

I don't really eat fast food as much as I used to, but today while I was working diligently I heard a lot of excitement outside of the cubicles. I went around and there was a group of employees from Chik Fil-A giving out chicken sandwiches, cow pez dispensers and a cow plush! I asked my co-workers and they're like "it's free...no question about that" but still I wanted to know why out of the ordinary these people came to our office. Turns out Chik Fil-A was mentioned in one of our products, so it's a yearly surprise that they would show up at the office and give us free food and toys! The chicken sandwich is really good! It's not dry like other chicken sandwiches where you take a bite and need to wash it down with something. The outside was crispy and not burnt, the inside was very juicy and tender. I would say it's one of the best chicken sandwiches I ever had or maybe I just haven't had fast food for a really long time.

One star for being closed until September.  What about the kiddies that take summer courses?  What about me?  What about me, Chick Fil-A?  Did you forget about your favorite Florida girl living in the city and sometimes she just needs you; craves you; wants you?  So inconsiderate... even if you are just basking under heat lamps.

Note: The map on this page is somehow mislead by the weird address. This place is right off Washington Square, not by Union Square.It's in a public area of the residence hall at this address. I didn't really feel like I was "sneaking in", but it does feel a bit strange until you make it to the food court, which is three doors in and through a turnstile to the right. If you hit the Kosher area, you've gone too far!While it's true that this is a "heat lamp" location, I doubt my sandwich was out for more than five minutes since I went during lunch time. The easily accessible items were fried and grilled chicken sandwiches, some kind of chicken nugget-style items in boxes, and waffle fries. There was also a sign to ask if you were looking for something else. My fries were made on demand.The special sauces were passed out under the watchful control of the staff. It appeared the limit was two. I took one barbecue sauce an I thought it was plenty. Mints, mayonnaise, and mustard were on the customer side of the counter, so I took a bunch.Since this is a college food court, all counters share the same beverage selection, as well as big ketchup and mustard pumps past the registers.This was the first time I had Chick-Fil-A and I found the fried chicken sandwich quite tasty. It had rather thin breading, and lots of chicken, which was to my liking. I also like the fact that it's just chicken and a couple pickle pieces, allowing you full control of the rest. (It appears McDonalds and KFC have copied this concept recently).Price: $6.12 including tax for fried chicken sandwich, waffle fries, and a medium soda.

I'm half-typing while I eat what I'm typing about...working diligently to keep the ketchup from dropping on the keyboard...so far, so good.  Now a moderately rational individual would ask, "Why wouldn't you just stop eating and type, or wait until you're done THEN write the review?"  Well, the problem is, I can't do either.  I refuse to wait while Chik-fil-a food is in front of me, to eat it.   Yet, I feel inspired to write because this food just satisfied a major craving.  For fried chicken?  for fries?  NO! for Chik-fil-a.  Very few places create cravings in me, but after the introduction to this place...my taste buds were never the same.It's practically criminal that there are no other chik-fil-a's in the city, however, I assume if you talk to oppressive city folk, they'll tell you that chain stores just damage this place.  Well, call me a moderate, but frankly, a good mix of both never hurt anyone and please stop stifling my desire to enjoy it.  Thank you. :)So...to the typical layoutAtmosphere:  It's in NYU's food court...need I say more?Food:  Faboo Baloo!Service:  Non-existent...it's Highway Service Station-styleOverall:  Great food for fast food...nothing more, nothing less!

This Chick-Fil-A defeats the whole purpose of exactly WHY I love this chain so much.I walked around aimlessly trying to find it, but discovered it's in Weinstein Hall with other eateries such as Java City Cafe and Wasabi.I don't remember the CA prices but here it's $1.55 for large fries, $2.85 for a chicken sandwich, and lemonade (price not known).The chicken sandwiches are just sitting out there and the cooks bring more out as they prepare them, so about 15 sandwiches sit out there, not cooked and served fresh like on the West Coast. The same goes with the fries.And the saddest part!..... the condiments of Ranch, BBQ, Honey Mustard sauces are distributed by the cashier ladies and there is a limit of 1 per person. !!! ACK. How can this be? My favorite part of this chain IS the condiments and yet to be limited w/ their small rectangular sized portions of only 1ounce is ridiculous!Yet, seeing as how I'm so homesick for California eateries/my fave fast food chain, I purchased my Chick-Fil-A meal.I consumed the waffle fries first and used the sauces sparingly and instead resorted to eating Ketchup provided by the NYU cafeteria so I wouldn't be done so fast with my BBQ sauce. I opened the chicken sandwich which was wrapped in a folded foil bag and it looked dry. It was okay. It could have been GREAT if I had some delicious Ranch sauce to go with it....My lemonade was too sweet.A fly hovered around me. Oh, NYU cafeteria, maybe you should take some pointers from UCI Dining. I think I'm slowly learning to stay away from CA places that I love and discover NY places.Goodbye Chick-Fil-A until I return to Cali.

I love Chick Fil-A.  It is one of three franchises I would open if I had to run a manhattan franchise.  Especially since they don't have one in Manhattan...well, there is one...this one at NYU.  It is in an NYU dining hall.  In order to get you some chick fil-a you are gonna have to sneak in and pass as a student.  Oddly, this isnt that hard, which is scary.  But, if you want some chicken thats been sitting under a heat lamp and is kinda chick fil-a but not really, this is your best bet.  I figure this kinda but not really chick fil-a is ok.  Kinda a woman but not really is not.  Choose your poisons wisely.

GET ME A CHICKEN SANDWICH AND SOME WAFFLE FRIES... FO' FREE! It's what goes through my mind whenever I see Chick Fil-A. Ummm... I never had Chick Fil-A until about two months ago, when I figured I might as well check it out. Cuz I'm adventurous like that. So I ate it... and it tasted good (esp. those waffle fries)... but then I got sick afterwards. Maybe my stomach just was not properly conditioned to handle it? Not sure. But a lot of people I know who are trying it for the first time have had this problem.Three stars because it did taste pretty damn good for being a fast food chicken sandwich. Also location... since it's the only one in the whole city. That's kinda cool.

RIGHT UNDER MY NOSE :^)i want to start off saying I LOVE CHICK FIL-A!ok so i was down south enjoying a great chick-fil-a sandwich as I got into deep thought I was pondering to myself if they had this in the city I WOULD LIVE THERE so i was on the website via my iphone (being a fat ass) just for laughs i did a search for the closet chick-fil-a to me and BAM!!!!  to my surprise they said there was one right downtown =-o in a NYU diner hall... in disbelief immediately called my friend who goes to NYU for confirmation and YES I LIVE THERE  once a week I pose as a NYU student and do lunch here the dead give away... the only person that doesn't pay with a student id LOLRATING: its a part of a school's cafeteria so i cant rate it on its own but its cool as far as cafez go same signature sandwich and waffle fries you know and love just like a "real" chick-fil-a IT IS CLOSED ON SUNDAYits not a FULL menu but a good enough fix for the chick-fil-a addiction

Let's get down to the nitty grit. Does anyone have intimate knowledge of the inner workings of the NYC CFA? Those sandwiches must be fresh at some point in the day. If anyone is out of a job right now, perhaps you can take up a shift? We need to know the drop times of the fresh batches. What time of day is the best bet for a fresh CFA lunch? How early does one have to eat dinner to avoid soggy bread? And where exactly is the kitchen that produces these heavenly nuggets?

I WANTED to love it, but it just wasn't meant to be.  Anyone who's ever lived or been to the south knows how important a weekly fix of Chick-Fil-A can be for a person regardless of dietary restrictions and weight commitments.  When I'd learned of the NYU location I was simply thrilled b/c I could finally have my original chicken sandwich from the best fast food restaurant on the planet!The thing is, these sandwiches are all premade sitting in bulk under heat lamps for God knows how long.  This isn't the way it's supposed to be people!  When I tore open the sandwich sleeve to ravenously feast on the bird---the bread was soggy, stale, and replete w/pickle juices.  The chicken was good, but it wasn't GREAT like it usually is.I also ordered the waffle fries and nuggets, which were pretty true to regular form and taste, no complaints there.  I'll say this---for those of us who know Chick-Fil-A for the delicious cuisine that it is, NYU's location can provide the proper fix.  However, if your mission is to devirginate someone, head on over to one of the chains in Jersey.  This location will not give them the necessary satisfaction.

When I first found out there was a Chick Fil-A in NYC hiding only 2 blocks from me and then passed through the dining room turnstiles it was as if I were entering a fat kids' heaven.  (cue the heavenly *aaaaahhh* sound and backlighting).I was so excited I ate 3 8 piece boxes (they were out of 12) and a large fries.  I was disgusted at myself in theory, but secretly wanted more and only my fear of embarrassment in letting my friend witness my pigfest kept me from returning for a second round.The downside of my chick-heaven discovery--that winter I "happened" to gain 7 pounds.  The upside --after the winter of my discovery I was so sick of Chick Fil A that I haven't returned since!

Man, I can't even tell you how disappointed I was when I finally found this place. I was THRILLED. I grew up eating Chick-Fil-A, being a tried and true Southerner, and the only thing that I had to complain about in regards to moving to New York, was that there weren't Chick-Fil-A's anywhere. Then I heard about the one at NYU. Score!...Except not really. The sandwiches were all soggy, and had been sitting under heat lamps presumably all day. I actually had to discard the bottom half of my bun, because the chicken grease had soaked through it to the point that it was disintegrating. Lame City. I mean, the chicken is still delicious, you can't take away from that, but the presentation blew, and the bun? I just want my bun intact, thanks. Maybe another day though, and it'll be more agreeable. I hope so.

Let me set the scene.  Three + years ago I'm at a party with my friends (all of whom are from the South).  I mention how I ate at Chick-Fil-A for lunch the other day in an NYU dorm (I was working at NYU at the time), expecting reactions like, "Really?  I didn't know there was a Chick-Fil-A in the city!"  Notsomuch.Cue a full-on bitchslap across the face from my best friend Patrick, who was horrified that I hadn't told him about the existence of a Chick-Fil-A in the city.  Needless to say, I ate at Chick-Fil-A with Patrick the following Monday...with a bruised face.

I am sad for liking Chick Fil-A.  I know it.  But for many years I suffered because there was no CFA in NYC.  I had to go south to get my fix.  Then one day on the Talk boards someone said "There is one, in a dining room @ NYU."  I rushed to the scene - could it be true?YES!The happy dance I did attracted many surprised onlookers.  I think I may have even earned a dollar or two.It's true, you don't need to have an NYU ID to get in and indulge your Chick love.  Just be aware that this, like all other Chick Fil-As, is not open on Sunday.  Yes, it's fast food.  Yes, it's chain fast food.  Yes, they do put cocaine in the breading so that you'll eat and eat and never stop and want to eat more even if you're full.  (Okay, so maybe I am lying about the cocaine part.  But there's SOMETHING in that breading...)  But it's Chick Fil-A!  And there's only one.You know you want it.

Attention: You don't need a student ID to eat at the Chick Fil-A @ NYU.  You can enter the food court without any problems since they only check for IDs if you enter the dorms.  Another side note is that they are not open during the summer months!I'm a big fan of Chick Fil-A and was pleasantly surprised to find this gem.  Although they only offer the original chicken sandwiches, chicken nuggets, and cross cut fries, it's definitely worth the visit to satisfy my Chick Fil-A craving.

I order online and it only took 5 minutes for the grilled chicken sandwich to be ready, it was a little cold, but when I order the spicy one, it was hot and delicious. I guess you need to order the popular ones for it to be hot.

I don't get what all the hype is about. The service is adequate, the food is acceptable on the level of other fast food chains., about on a level with Burger King. The religious overtones and hating on lgbt people are a huge turn off. The chicken sandwich at Popeyes is much much better.
Service was great the spicy chicken sandwich was great with the chick-Fil-a sauce. The waffle fries are fantastic also. Quick service and restaurant was clean.
Junk food, anti-LGBTQ+ agenda. Not a good combo. Also, a full lane of Flatbush Avenue blocked night and day is a safety hazard. What more can I say?

This spot being the sole location in Brooklyn is always crowded. The location doesn't make parking to retrieve your order very easy being on Flatbush Ave across from Barclay Center. We have used the mobile app with excellent success and minimizing waiting times. Consider using it when placing your order.Now the food has always been consistently delicious and hot and we order the classics. Chicken sandwich, spicy chicken, waffle fries and Mac and cheese. Never once had a complaint about food really only the congestion surrounding the restaurant.

So I wanted to see what the rave was about at Chick-fil-A since I happen to be in the area. Tried online ordering through my app I just downloaded and that was an absolute fail.  No worries. I kindly went inside and I was greeted at the door. (True Story) then escorted to the manager.Ok I went into the wrong entrance and the wrong ramp. However, all staff were still kind and friendly, including the manager. sorry forgot his name but he was absolutely friendly and he still honored my online order with accommodations. I was even able to get my rewards brownie. Yes it was yummy and delicious.  The chicken and fries at Chick Fil A speak themselves hence they are always packed no matter the location.  But good customer service is hard to come by in Brooklyn, New York sometimes on a Saturday during this pandemic . So that was well appreciated.Always go for the Chick Fil A sauce followed by Polynesian, my personal pick. For Drink half Lemonade and unsweetened tea. Choices that make me just smile. No drive thru here.

The workers here deserve a pay raise. This is the heart of Brooklyn during a pandemic. Everyone greets you like an actual human being and the level of respect is shared throughout. All Covid protocols are in effect and followed, no Karens in this side of the country. The spicy chicken sandwich is amazing, all the rants about it are too real. Got it to go because of dining restrictions, my cat tried to eat it but that's a no-no. The war with Popeyes is a coin toss, love this spot tho.

This was my first time ever at Chick-fil-A, and it surely didn't disappoint. It was a little after 11PM, a friend and I wanted a quick item or two from Shack Shack, but they were closed; so we decided to venture here.I don't eat chicken, so I only had the waffle fries which I thought were excellent. My friend got a kids meal for her daughter. We all were extremely satisfied--I've heard so many good things about their lemonade, but I forget to order it...maybe next time!

I love chick-fil-a, I'm from the south where it's HUGE, so I was glad when I moved up here, one was close by. The employees are super nice, but they're slacking. The last time I went in a couple days ago, they had 1 line you ordered in, paid at the counter, then moved to another "line" to wait for food, then squeeze past people to exit. I think they're trying to take COVID precautions but it's just more crammed which defeats the whole purpose. So many unnecessary steps, it felt like they were trying to put in so many steps to distract from your wait time. I ordered waffle fries well done because I used to work at CFA and they're even better when super crispy. I'm aware that can also take longer, so I'm willing to let them do their thing and not complain. They weren't slammed but after I ordered, waited in line, then paid, it took about 10 minutes for just a 12 count meal with well done fries. The employee called me over to get my meal in the middle of talking to other customers, showed me the bag, and gave it to me quickly. All I saw was the nuggets and fries for a second and it looked correct. I get home to maybe a small handful of fries (it looks wet because I was walking in the rain to get home). It was such a bummer. They always forget sauces, give me the wrong drink, or short me on fries when paying extra for the large because it was a rough day. Just don't count on them for a perfect meal.

I'm sorry Chick-fil-A Flatbush/Atlantic, but I found a piece of plastic from my daughter's sandwich. I hope you would do better than this. I came far from home and got so upset about this. My daughter couldn't have her lunch.

Being  across the street from Brooklyn's arena, this place attracts quite a lot of people in the neighborhood/tourists and it is extremely difficult to find somewhere to sit most times. You may have to opt to order take out rather than dining in. The food is good and I enjoy it. Restrooms are very soiled, unfortunately.

Sauce limit?? No other chick fil a does this. I guess when In Brooklyn charge as much as possible.Update: only gets 3 stars because it's chick fil a However the staff isn't very polite, like I've experienced in all other locations.

The first time I tried Chick-fil-A was many years ago in Virginia and fell in love the first bite. So you could imagine my excitement when I learned that Brooklyn was opening it's very own. The location is convenient as it's located near Atlantic Ave train station. I don't really have anything negative to say about this location besides the crowds of middle and high schoolers that swarm this location. If you overlook that, this location is pretty decent. The staff is friendly and the food is what you would expect from any other location.
Love the frosted lemonade and chicken sandwich. Gets really crowded so order ahead to avoid long lines

I try there mobile app and I think it was waste time. They don't start making your order til you check in, so what's the point of it? My friend went in the store and got his food faster then I did and I used the mobile app. The staff was nice. The place looked super clean. No complaints about the store.

There's nothing negative to say about this heaven on Earth establishment! The customer service here is exceptional in terms of speedines, accuracy of your order, and overall kindness. Yes this place is pricey, however, it is well worth it as far as the quality of your meal is concerned.There are open during the COVID crisis for takeout, however, UBER eats is not an option unfortunately. Glass protection/barriers has been installed  between the customer and cashier. This location is conviently located across the street from The Barclay's Center ehich allows you to grab some grub before or after a social event.

I am not sure if this is the everyday operations for this location, being across from the Barclay's Center, but it is a bit hectic.  There is no parking and the risk you take parking out front come with its own set of issues.  The process of picking up orders from the app are very different, its the same as walking in: go check-in and wait outside between 15-25 minutes.  Everyone is spread out as best as they can outside telling the workers your name.  Then eventually you are called and they hand you food at the exit. The taste is good as any other location but I was not comfortable with the crowded waiting.  Maybe there should be a better process/waiting area for the app orders.

I came to chic fil a for breakfast. I ordered an egg white grill without cheese. I get to my job and the bread is so hard it feels like a hockey puck. I couldn't eat it. So called the restaurant and spoke to a manager who told me I could get a sandwich during lunch since I couldn't come back at that time. She told me to come ask for her upon arrival. The restaurant was packed! I stood on the line for about 10 minutes, all for the cashier to tell me to step to the side. After waiting another 10 minutes, someone told me that the manager I spoke to was coming( Debra). 10 minutes later Debra hands me a card and then tells me I have to get back on the longggg line to place my order. I'm more than annoyed after waiting 30 minutes to now get on the line again.  Customer service was a huge miss!! This situation could've been handled way better.

First time having their sandwich, Went there many times but the line were to long, so I would normally go to Popeyes. I ordered the spicy chicken deluxe, I was actually surprised for how good this actually tasted. The fries was a bit under cooked, but with the crack sauce it was bomb. The sauce that came with the sandwich is like crack, you would just keep going back for more. Thanks for the Coronavirus I was able to get in and out in under 5 mins. Won't be long again before I go back.

I love chick fil a but, not this location. Went in during the night shift to get some nuggets and fries. Why did I do that‍. Nuggets were basura (Trash)! Gotta do better. You all owe me a free meal. Gave two stars cause the fries were good. Also the staff were much nicer when they first opened. Guess they are adapting to that NY VIBEZ!

You're not supposed to go to Chick-fil-A immediately after a yoga class. But there I was at 9:30pm ordering nuggets and diet Dr Pepper. It was a big deal when CFA opened across from Barclays. It's located right next to Shake Shack on super busy Fulton. The space is massive, and I'm sure it gets pretty packed on game nights at Barclays.The customer service was really great while ordering. My order came out super quickly. Nothing was missing. All around a positive experience!
The food was great but no sauce was placed in my bag...seriously? Most ppl eat here because of the amazing sauces you offer but here I was with food and ZERO sauces. Never again

I've been to chick fil a all down the east coast and PA. This is the worst ooze I've ever seen. The staff is not friendly.. we ordered from yelp, delivery guy super cool. Chick fiil a lacking. I ordered extra Extra pickles. Nope. I ordered " a shit ton of Chick-fil-A sauce. Nope. To add insult to injury they send  3 sauces for 8 sandwiches and 5 fries. Huh? Think we will pass on this franchise. Even the one at NYC was better. And that Was complete trash.  If your having yyour first go, I'd say head in to Manhattan. At least you can get some real chick fil a feel.

I will never visit this chick fil a again. This is just like any other McDonald's in Brooklyn. Horrible! Horrible service, horrible staff! It's super unorganized to be next to a  sports stadium. The cashiers and the people taking your order do not communicate correctly ( how if they take orders on the iPad), they overcharge you. They're so busy trying to get people off the line, they don't check to make sure they have the right order down. The chick fil a in manhattan are so much better. The service that you'd expect from chick fil a  is what you come for, outside of the food being okay. If i wanted shitty service (excuse my language lol) i would have went to McDonald's! This is the second time i had an issue at this location, and 3rd time for all chick fil a I've visited. First and second time was my fault. I will be sure NEVER to visit this location again. Do not work in customer service if you don't like people!!! ‍

I love that we finally have a chick fil-a in Brooklyn   Food was fresh and tasted as good as any other location chick fil a sauce is still the fave. The cookies and cream shake is another winner   If you haven't tried this place ignore all the political drama and go it's chicken c'mon Service was fast and employees were very friendly. I will be returning however not as frequently as I'd like to but at least I don't have to troop out to Long Island for it

So this is my first time having Chick-fil-A (well technically my second, but I don't remember if I liked it or not the first time). I ordered the Spicy Chicken sandwich and 8-piece nuggets... they messed up my order. Instead of nuggets, I received waffle fries... I went back to the counter and informed the cashier, who quickly corrected it. When I got back to work and opened my Spicy Chicken sandwich, there were no pickles. I was super disappointed b/c I love pickles... but the nuggets made up for it. They were the BEST chicken nuggets I've ever gotten from a fast food restaurant! I would definitely go back to this location during the week... the line moves super quickly. I would probably avoid it on the weekend though, it gets super crowded!

I'm one of those people who was not big on the  chicken sandwich hype going on with the different fast food chains but I really wanted to see what the big deal was. I have been contemplating on whether the wait on a long line was really worth it. I went with a friend who was very inpatient and didn't think it was worth it to stand on a long line to wait for a sandwich. After a long 15 minute wait I finally got to the counter to order a spicy chicken sandwich and a small strawberry milkshake .My plan was to take it home but I was to anxious to taste and see what it was like much to my disappointment I didn't like the sandwich,  the bun was very greasy and the chicken salty although crunch but I couldn't finish it. The only good thing was the milkshake it was thick and very creamy I enjoyed everything about,  but the sandwich was a big flop for me. I might come back another time to see if things have changed .
Good, but food can be over salty sometimes. The nuggets were so salty I couldn't finish them and it was 12 pieces :(. Stop over salting everything please.

The product is 5 stars. The service is is fine.  However, the parasites from doordash and these e food deliveries fucking suck the big one.  If the asshole rich hipsters want their food come and pick it up like everyone else.  Wasn't fun at all.  Bikes and crap chained up on the ramp for those with disabilities.  Fucked up. Ban these idiots they give zero fucks about the service you guys expect to give. Also, you have a major trash problem in the area.  Bags and empty plastic containers litter the entire local area and subways.  How much are you contributing to the local clean up of that.  Not cool.

I know, I know. I shouldn't be supporting Chick-fil-A.But I had a $10 meal credit to use, and struck out so many times trying to get the Popeyes sandwich.I've only ever been to one other Chick-fil-A, but it's not exaggeration to say this new one is the worst one ever. Mobile order pickup is a shitshow, especially with the Doordash guys crowding the pickup counter trying to get people's attention. There's a kiosk at the front that you can use to tell them you're there, but it's only if you use the app. So me and a few other non-delivery people were waiting a long ass time for our orders.All the while, the people behind the register are just yelling out customer names at the top of their lungs. And for some reason, a manager(?) decided rush hour was the best time to train/admonish some of the staff.The place is also full of high school kids.That said, the food is also trash. Not at all the great chicken sandwich I remember. And the waffle fries were soggy and not crisp at all. And they didn't honor my request for extra sauce that I wrote in on the pickup notes. Of course, if you go up to the counter and ask, they'll give you all the sauces in the world free of charge, but they had taped up my bag and I was just trying to get the hell out of there.Basically, go get the ChickenShack next door instead.And also dock CFA a star for their political views.

I wish they would invest in more training for NYC. By far the worst I've been to - and a bunch of high school kids behind the counter could be the problem. Their attitudes are horrible and customer service is always subpar. I never hear the usual.."my pleasure" or "have a great day". The minute I got to the counter the girl greeted me by saying "name?" - not a smile, nothing. Maybe she was having a bad day or I'm just so used to chick-fil-a's outstanding customer service.I wish I could like this location because it's in such a great neighborhood, but I have no interest in revisiting.

For the most part, this is a great Chick Fil A, the staff is mostly polite and the food comes out fast and hot. The problem with this Chick Fil A is the lack of security. I'm sorry to put it like this, but this location becomes ghetto when the kids come around after school. Last time I was there I had to walk out because they were fighting and throwing chairs near the exit, and of course I was in the middle of it. Chick Fil A staff failed to call the police or do anything about the situation. It becomes a huge issue when customer's safety are put at risk. Having a hired police officer on site at all times would solve the problem here almost entirely. My best advice is to avoid from 2-6 that is when this restaurant tends to get crazy. I do hope corporate addresses the issue at this location.
I love the food but the restrooms needs some attention. This business just open and makes no sense that the restrooms are being ignored.

I love Chic Fil-a. Jus not this one, even in comparison to the ones in midtown. Something is always off with my order. Today, I paid almost 7 bucks for a large superfood side only to arrive home and learn that just means you get a large container that is less than half full, probably containing less than a small order. Won't be visiting again.

You don't have to ask me twice who would win the chicken sandwich contest...Chik-Fil-A will always win in my book. Political opinions aside, the food is just too good to resist. It was actually my first job working at a Chick-fil-a and I'll always feel some sort of way towards it. I mean have you tried their waffle fries?!I was so excited to hear one was coming to Brooklyn and close to where I live! Ugh so hard to resist. Whenever I go home to the south it's always a place I go because I know the service and food are so good. This place does a pretty good job of keeping up. I will say I've gone a couple times now and the line is always out the door, which isn't a bad thing but be prepared to wait. They're pretty good at taking your order in line and moving the orders through so by the time you get to the front your food is pretty much ready. I will say it'd be nicer if there was more seating, instead of standing spots. I guess this is the NY lay out for Chik-Fil-As since the ones in the city are the same. So be prepared to take to-go because seats are never open. The staff for the most part have always been super fast and friendly but it's what you can expect from primarily high school aged employees.I love getting a #7 grilled chicken sandwich w/ bacon, lettuce, cheese and tomato that comes with fries and a coke. Can't go wrong there or go for the classic chicken sandwich. Even the salads are good. If you've been curious, it's something you definitely should try!
They messed up my mobile order (gluten-sensitive). No response, no refund.This would be unacceptable anywhere, but I expected more from Chick-fil-a.

Newly opened Chick-fil-A right by Barclay center! Fast food fried chicken and comfort food cravings can be satisfied at this corner because it neighbors a shake shack (although i find chick-fil-A to be much more satisfying)Overall the service is par. They have a separate door and line for pick up orders and walk in guests.
