The place is very clean, and a kit of standing room but seats are limited.For breakfast I had their biscuit sandwich which was amazing. The biscuit was warm soft and flakey. The hashbrown is also a perfect crispy. For lunch i had a spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries. The sandwich couldve been far spicier. It doesn't even compare to the MCD spice level.Also inquire about their many sauces. I was a huge fan of the Polynesian sauce and their original chick-fil-A sauce

I came here a day after they had their grand opening.  I've been back a couple of times after this as well. The service is too notch as this location. The lines are long but it moves quickly I would say no more than 10 minutes from the door to the register. They have employees there to take your order while you're on line and then you give your name at the register and pay and receive your meal. I've dined in as well and it was fine fast food restaurant dining as far as the service goes. I don't know how long they will keep this up. Since this is extremely exceptional servicefor Chick-fil-A. I'm a long time customer and never got treated like this. I'm a long time customer and typically they might come around if they have enough staff and take care off your needs especially if you have kids with you, but it's not standard. This time they asked me how the food was, if I needed any more sauces, napkins, refills, the works!I'm going to end this with some highlights for the busy NYer:-Exceptional service-Long but fast moving lines-Consistent great tasting food-No inside playcape for kids-No drive thru or parking-Great location right across from Barclay's!
Not sure I get it.  Granted I didn't have the burger but the chicken sandwich.  Like seems long for reason that's lost on me.  I think it's standard fast food.
Pretty slow and inefficient for a Chick-Fil-A, especially a new one. Minimum seating.

Great service and better food. Couldn't give it a five due to size.  What were they thinking? It is crazy too small and very little seating.  I am so disappointed plus metal stools really? Are we in kindergarten?

The line was long but it moves pretty fast the service was a one A little pricey but it was worth it Spicy chicken was salty n  and order of french fries I could've split it with my friend we didn't have to buy two orders n Refill drinks plus.  A person came up to me when I was standing in the line and said something about we shouldn't eat there because They do not support LTB I told  her understand and I May not go back because  it's to pricey for me But it sure beats McDonald's fake food any day

.Pretty cool Restaurant Chick-fill-a ,There based in Atlanta ,Georgia . (i love there religious beliefs closed on a Sunday , because i attend church as well myself on a Sunday  ) Today was the Grand opening of this location located right across from the barclays center- stadium -Home of the "Brooklyn Nets "(Welcome to Brooklyn Chick-filla-a ) what took you so long to come in to Brooklyn the best borough in New York hands down lol.it's was very crowded i guess because today was the grand opening . I believe nesley took my order on her tablet while i was waiting on line . and when i got to the cash wrap-cash register . steve larken or stephen larken took my order very quick and smooth i'll definitely come back here . I've order the grilled chicken sandwich with lettuce tomato and American cheese and a medium DR' Pepper soft soda .There going to be nice competition with Shake-Shack there literally right next door !!!!!very convenient by the MTA transportation:subway:2,3,4,5, Q,B ,D,N, R,-Trains .Atlantic Avenue & Flatbush Avenue.L.I.R.R -  (Atlantic Avenue, Flatbush Avenue -Barclays Stadium station).G -Train, Fulton street.C -Train, Lafayette Avenue.buses:B41, B25, B103,B67,B37,etc  buses lines

BOTTOM LINE: I'll be backTIP/S: best ice ever...WHO: Party of 2WHY: grand opening WHAT: (Deets) I came for the grand opening. Quit events headphones (and the DJ) had us jamming between announcements. We were provided breakfast (a cold bottle of Dasani & warm chicken biscuit) in addition to our entertainment. Each participant received a branded swag bag containing a t-shirt, & plastic cup. Altogether the event took 2 hours (plus the 30 minute window) and with exactly 100 participants, no raffle was needed! The outcome: a year's worth of free #1s WHEN: 9/12/19 Red Carpet EventWHERE: take awayHOW: public transportation 2/3/4/5/B/D/N/Q/R trains; b41//B45/B63/B67BATHROOM: gender neutral, 2 roomsWIFI: did not use DRESS CODE: As you likeSERVICE: upbeat, prompt

Service and staff here were quick and pleasant. Once we got back we opened our food and realized both of our sandwiches were over cooked. The flavor was definitely missing that signature CFA taste. Fries were the only thing keeping this afloat. Could if just been the time of night but it wasn't the best eating experience for a CFA. hopefully next time it will be better, if not going to the time square location.

TERRIBLE.  Was told my the app prior to leaving my home, the app after scanning in and the server that my order was being made after waiting and asking her to check.  Meanwhile, people who ordered after arriving left with their food.  Then the supervisor tells me it isn't their mistake but mine because the payment needs to be updated.  So why was I lied to and kept waiting for over 20 minutes?!?!?!  The problem sear supervisor is systemic - the app, the server and you!  Recommend owning up to own mistakes versus not blaming the customer after giving wrong information three times and wasting valuable time, defeats the purpose of a mobile order ahead.  This system needs to be fixed.
She was rude and had an attitude. Then tried to ask me if I want any sauces then says we have limited sauces select only 2. Order number 7031 name olinda

I just received my delivery order and yet again Chick-fil-A has screwed up my order: no fries this time. On another occasion they completely left out any of the dipping sauces. More than once the food has arrived cold. Whoever they have coordinating their orders for delivery is obviously careless or incompetent. It's a shame as their food is good overall.

Their chicken sandwich is overhyped. On it's own it doesn't taste that great. You definitely need one of the sauce packets - either the chick fil a sauce or the polynesian sauce to go with the sandwich. You can also let the cashier know if you don't want pickles in your sandwich. FYI - you only get one free sauce packet per sandwich so if you want another sauce be prepared to pay extra. Pretty big location at Flatiron. There is outdoor seating available.

Really surprised to see the bad reviews here - I grew up in the south so I've had a lifetime of Chick-Fil-A (it started in GA), and I'm very happy to finally get the food & drinks I love here in NYC.I think there have been a lot of improvements since the last reviews as well. I just stopped in today, and I was greeted with a smile, along with mints and handwipes. I also received a surprise reward in app, so be sure to use it when ordering. I ordered via the app and picked it up in minutes. There are tables on the street now so you can also sit & eat outside. The staff are very nice and helpful too.Hope you can give CFA a try again!

I work near this location and have ordered numerous times, and they NEVER give enough fries. The picture attached is how I received my last order (I did not eat any before I took the picture). So disappointing!!

Tried to tell me I could only get 1 sauce each when I got 2 sandwiches and fries. Never had a Chick-fil-A anywhere tell me that. And I offered to pay for more. And she pulled in the manager. I called customer service. Ain't even about the money. But I did come from BK to get my order I usually get and they were wildly rude. And also were barking customers names. Guess it's McDonald's now?
I usually love them, but I got food poisoning from their Cobb Salad today. Terrible experience

I ate  At this location today for the 1st time. I ordered the chicken sandwich Deluxe and   The 8 piece  Nugget. The food was absolutely nasty.   Both the sandwich and the nuggets tasted like dish soap. I will stick with the location on Fulton street and lower man

So this is definitely not the first time but they are stingy with the fries. If you are paying almost $13 for a meal, why would you give a large size fries for the amount of small size. I get it that it's the city prices but you are almost paying $3 more then it would be outside the city. Must also be a reason why they don't give out surveys in emails anymore

Regular sandwich. What's the hype? These millennials are a trip. I see lines out the WA ZOO for food at any of these locations. So I said let me try it today. No lines.. Big glasses for you to keep BACK and order with your mask over your mouth. So I repeated my order several times. Bingo she gets it. I walk outside with my food and I put that special sauce on it. Regular tasting sandwich to me. Cold bun. Room temperature chicken. Luke warm fries. The only thing lit here is my strawberry shake. I like the taste of the fries though.... a little too much salt but other than that it's ok. $25.00 for 2 meals. Bruh. Let it be HOT and then we're in business. You millennials need to sit your azz down and stop hyping food. They did the same thing with Popeyes. I fell for it twice.
Great service , smiling staff, delicious hand spun cookies and cream shake. Was a fun treat to slide into this safe haven in the midst of rush hour
Woohoo! As good as it gets!Great, friendly staff.  Amazing food.
Need to improve efficiency on mobile orders.  Taking way too long and multiple people getting crossed up.

Chick-fil-A has some of my favorite fast food chicken, and I'm glad they start serving lunch at 10:30 am. I'm clearly not the only one, because the last time I was at this location, a lot of the tables were already full before 11 am. They get really busy here, but the line moves quickly, plus there's always the mobile order option. The service has been very friendly and more attentive than other locations, and the employees are always around cleaning and helping out. Don't forget to use the app for rewards, especially this month when they're giving out free nuggets as a reward!

We ordered last-minute catering for our small office and the catering manager was so accommodating. The staff were prompt and the food was made so quickly! I wasn't able to carry the food alone in the rain and one of their staff members came out to assist me with carrying them to my office in the rain. Above and beyond expectations! Thank you.

I'm here right now and Chick-fil-A employee Sharon is ROCKING my world. Not a minute goes by without her offering us water, clearing our table, handing me a napkin when I got ice cream on my jacket, offering us more sauce packets, bringing us an extra bag for take-home without us asking because she knew my sister wasn't going to finish her salad. So impressed! Give Sharon a raise!

Tonight it's have the 1st time I came to this location the experience was not so good.   The one lady that helped me was kind of friendly, but when I got my food the sub par quality was a shocker. When I took it back to the counter the attitude that came from the shift manager was unnecessary. My BF also had a problem with his meal and ended up getting a refund due to the reaction from the staff. I chalked it up to them being overwhelmed with the amount of customers came in, so I tried them again. This time the staff was a little nicer the lines was shorter but the store itself was a little dirty. For new location this was the unexpected. But this time my sandwich was fresh and tasty. I would come back if I'm really craving their chicken sandwiches and I'm too far from the other locations.

Who doesn't like Chick-fil-A? Those who haven't tried their incredibly good chicken sandwich, maybe? I'm a fan of their spicy chicken sandwich... that pickle added that crunch... so good.  They opened one near my work and my coworkers have become regulars real fast! They even go for breakfast... which I skip, almost always. That's just over-doing it! LOL Lines out the door the first week, and during peak lunch hour but crowd has died down a bit.  Use their mobile order app - it's quicker and takes only 5 mins to get your food. Clean with seatings, regular line to your left and mobile pick up to your right.  Enjoy that Chick-Fil-A experience!

Just horrible.. horrible service and i live down the block from this location practically neighborsI made it a order online for pick up on Saturday morning  and for some reason it wasn't showing up in their system, talking about the situation with the manager did not help he was very dismissive and did not offer a solution! After waiting more than 20 minutes i just wanted my money back ! And he tells us "figure it out with your bank" wow just WOWI'll be telling all my neighbors about this experience and the local business around the area
Where is my lettuce and tomato on my chick fil a deluxe sandwich? And why do those tenders look like chewed up pieces of chicken?

First timer to Chick Fil A.  I heard many praises about their chicken sandwich.   The signatures dish is par for the fast food restaurant industry.  Unsure why it rated so high.  It was dry, not tender.   Bun and toppings were standard.  Given it is a fast food place, the restaurant could do with some coordination of order and pickup.  'Stand over there' not really helpful.  Also, an explanation somewhere of sauces would have been helpful- staff assumed I knew.  The rotating menu on. The monitors moved too quickly for a first timer.  All tables full at 4 in the afternoon.  The restaurant was clean.  My one visit will probably be the last.

I was so happy to see this location open up.  It's right near a credit union I bank with and I needed to get lunch one day as I was passing by.  One note is that seating is at a premium; space is limited here.  The upside is staff is right on top of keeping the dining area clean.  It wasn't difficult or too long a wait to get my order and the food was the same quality as any other Chick-Fil-A.  I'm not wild about the NYC pricing and lack of space but maybe it's more sedate a different time of day?  I'll have to find out sometime.

10:01, Monday, October 28, 2019.1 meal CFA biscuitFirst Timer and probably Last TimeBiscuit was very dry that it crumbled as I unwrapped the sandwhich. Chicken was a tender and dry as well.The box of hash browns. Some were crispy yet, soft on the inside while half were just greasy and wet.Orange Juice was warm but, it was wet and I needed it to get the biscuit down.

The cashier was lovely, I cannot and won't complain. But my Cobb salad came without a dressing and it was when the bizarrest (and quite unpleasant) conversation of my week took place. So, I got to my table, set it up for my kid and me, and opened my salad box. There was no dressing in the paper or plastic bag our meal came in. No biggie. I walked up to the counter and asked a different employee for a salad dressing. Here comes insult 1. The first thing that she said was, "I can only give you a dressing if you have our salad. Did you even buy a salad with us?" I told her I did and pointed at my table. She walked back with me and checked my table for the presence of absence of a dressing. Which was Insult 2. Yes, I walk into restaurants and ask for single-serving packets of salad dressings in random. Or I stuff the aforementioned packets in my shoes and ask for a second helping just for the heck of it. No, I don't, and there is Trader Joe's across the street. They probably have better salad dressings, anyway.On the way back to the counter, I asked her if they had a blue cheese dressing. She said no, they didn't have it, looked at me like I was unreasonably demanding, and said they only had one kind of a salad dressing (hard to me believe), an avocado lime ranch. Then she added that it was a recommended dressing. In the whole fast food chain, they only carry one kind of dressing? Then she said something along the line she would only give it to me since my salad  came without a dressing (Insult 1, part 2). Which she had already established by inspecting my table, as if she couldn't take my word for it. What kind of customer service  is it? I don't know what to make of it. Was it a lack of training or poor social skills in general?
I hope this location gets better because I really love chic fil a however if I ask for my food well done and you have me wait 15 mins I expect my food well done.

It was a pleasure to see Chick Fil A after a day of walking and shopping in NYC.I was craving the mac and cheese as I had it a few days before in Atl airport.The staff was friendly and efficient.The food arrived in a timely fashion.I was not impressed by the mac and cheese. It did not have the creaminess that i am used to. It was dry and did not have the baked cheese  crust inside or on top I am used to.I have had it in Birmingham,Nashville,Atl metro and this was the worse. The sandwich was good. My fries were ok. I normally request double fried at other locations. They seemed confused how to do.The location was clean and so were the restroomsI doubt if i would go back as 17usd for a deluxe meal and side of mac is bit pricy.Expecially since the same meal normally cost me 13usd at airports and cheaper in stand alone stores in the southern area.

I LOVE Chick-fil-A and grew up eating it. I ordered from this location on door dash because I was feeling sentimental and missing the southern flair of their chicken sandwich and Arnold Palmer.  My order came to $18 which is steep for fast food but I figured Chick-fil-A was worth it. NOPE! They got BOTH items in my order wrong. I asked for no ice in my drink and they packed it full of CRUSHED ice (i.e. basically watered down and impossible to remove when it got to me). I could've dealt with the ice had they not messed up my sandwich. I'm simple: chicken sandwich no pickles. I just want to chicken and buns. Instead, they sent me a sandwich with pickles, cheese, tomatoes, and lettuce. All of which had soaked into the sandwhich and the cheese was melted onto the chicken making it impossible to remove. I've never had this poor of service from a Chick-fil-A EVER!!! Ruined my night.

Just came back from chick fil A on the 22nd location.  Took a bite out of my spicy chicken sandwich and found MOLD on the bottom of the bun. DISGUSTING!!! And this place is new too. Very disappointed!!!!
They gave me 7 pc nuggets instead of 8. It's not rocket science to count to 8...Food is good though. Lines are super long probably because of the grand opening.
Absolutely 5 star operation, staff was over the top courteous to everyone, food was excellent! The service was quick and organized even at peak time. Definitely will be back!

The food is great, of course, but I usually review places when I find the customer service to be exceptional, as I am today. the FiDi location is a hard location to work at, I imagine. Between numerous tourists and NYC workers, I can imagine is must be tough to maintain a courteous, helpful, and professional demeanor. But the staff here manages to assume great attitudes across the board. Today I was helped by Michael, who ensured that my order was fully taken of immediately upon my arrival. The store was very busy, but he never made me feel as if I were imposing on his time - in fact, Michael helped me as if I were the only customer there, even as he was working with multiple parties. Chick-fil-A brings on great staff, and Michael is a great representative for the company. Thank you, Michael!

It's my first time trying out chick fil a and The chicken burger is delicious but a bit expensive almost $20 I recommend trying out the chicken burger also the customer service is not bad not much people in the morning.
Consistent and well organized like all chick fil a locations I've been to across the country.Just note that this one gets a TON of foot traffic, so if you're in a hurry during peak times, don't come.

Their pick up process is a pain.  It's outside in the entryway to the store.Everyone just hanging outside waiting to pick up their order, smoking cigarettes, etc. I waited and waited for my simple order, and then believe that it was given to someone else because they had a bunch of bags and they simply handed them all to another customer.The nice young man did ask me what I ordered and went in and got my order but I waited way too long.  Maybe when Covid is over, I'll give them another try.

So I decided to order my lunch here on my break how about i spent my whole break waiting for my food . This was at 8pm on Friday , 25 minutes later the boy giving out mobile orders told me not to rush him because he's trying to follow baddies on Instagram. Then said my order wasn't in the system .ok . I walked in I got my food at 8:30pm .poor customer service .
got our order wrong, didn't give us our drinks or ask if we wanted sauce and cashier was rude.

I recently downloaded the Chick-fil-A app because a friend let me know they were giving out free chicken sandwiches. Needless to say, I always love a free meal so I proceeded to make my way to the Chick-fil-A on Fulton Street. Due to Covid they closed their dining area. You have to wait on line to order with the staff in front and pick up your food at the end. There is also a pickup window for those who ordered online.This was my first time here so I did not know the usual process. I told the staff in front this is my first time here to which they replied "Really?!" I guess I must be one of the only people in New York City who have not tried Chick-fil-A yet haha. Well there is a first time for everything. I picked up my chicken sandwich and ordered a side of waffle fries. Everything came out delicious. I only wished there was an area to sit down and properly enjoy my food. I ended up eating most of the waffle fries in the bag on my way home. I sat down quickly and ate the sandwich because I was so hungry. Needless to say I did not end up getting any good photos of the food. I will come by again hopefully when everything is open to go for round 2!

Been here a few times and they keep screwing up the order. Why is it hard to put a sandwich and the fries in the bag? Also, why was the kid at the pick up counter combing his hair as he was handing me the order.....gross

Another great Chick-fil-A store that has fast service and great employees despite the crowd of people. Whether you order for pick up or order in-store, you get your food relatively quickly and at a warm temperature. Their customer service is superb. The male staff doing the pickup orders is super friendly and all smiles. Definitely makes the experience and the wait more enjoyable.

I came here on Saturday afternoon for lunch and it was amazing. I have come here many times and it is always very fast and the workers were efficient. I really enjoyed the dining area because they have a rooftop but right now with cornavirus you can not eat there. The food was perfectly cooked and fresh. The employees are always friendly and patient sometimes it takes me a while to decide what I am going to get.
Name: Princess G Cashier:....... sad, but your cashier this dumb. Sammy you don't know how to spell. Literally a Disney name.

Love the service at this location.  The staff are all friendly and willing to help.  I always come in to redeem my points and somehow there are always issues with the app but I always leave a satisfied patron.  The food is 100% consistent and the orders are always on point.
Doesn't except cash? How is this legal? What a horrible joke of a chick Fill e. I will never go back to this location, what kind of stupid establishment doesn't accept cash
My hubby order spicy chicken sandwich from seamless, I am not a burger or fast food girl! But it's absolutely delicious spicy!!! Love it!
Wuick clean service! They wear gloves masks and dont take cash so better for transactions! Smoother and no hands on cash so thats great!

Literally, a mess. I've ordered from them like 3 time and for whatever reason they never seem to add any sauces to my order even when requested. I'm o suppose to eat my nuggets dry? Like come on. Smh.

Chick-fil-A is by far my favorite chain of "fast-food" restaurants. Even though it's considered fast food, their chicken sandwiches and waffle fries feel like a much more high-class feel than the price would lead you to expect. It's a southern classic from when I lived in Texas, and feels like such a nostalgic experience when I order it now. It's definitely got a sentimental place in my heart for me, especially that lemonade! Chick-fil-A lemonade is famous in Texas, and the one in this location lives up to the rosy memories I have of it as well.

This place is a social distancing nightmare.  They have taken out the kiosk where you can do a contactless check-in and now even mobile orders have to wait on line to get to a register to interact with a person who then tells you that your order will be right out.  No one seems to know where you should wait and after asking several times I was pointed to this area along the wall with these small partitions that are maybe 2 feet tall if that... they might have protected my shins, but they certainly didn't divide me off from others in the store.  I waited for what seemed like forever, and I was starting to think that if I didn't bunch up at the register like the others my food would never come out.  After that crowd had cleared and I waited another 10 minutes or so, the employee they have standing outside the restaurant came in and called my name.  She said they had been looking for me to give me my food. Well clearly the person who took her my food had to have walked right by me to give it to her.  I'm confused.  It seems like this restaurant has gone in the wrong direction during this pandemic.

I went to Chick-fil- A this evening for carry-out and the gentlemen handing out the food, did not wear a mask!  He has a mask down on his chin, with his mouth and nose uncovered. He was very close with customers, handing out the food---this is not safe!! I won't go back.

Chick-fil-A genuinely has extremely delicious fast food. Their chicken is great, they offer a variety of burgers and fries that I enjoy with their sweet and sour sauce. This location is great because there's always seats available, which makes sense because they have so much seating! I can often comfortably drop by and quickly grab a meal. I only had to wait around 10 minutes. I'm sure ordering online would make the process much faster but I tend to order in person because I feel it is easy and fast enough. I definitely recommend trying out chick-fil-a, especially this spot with tons of great service and great food.
Read the news on this shake shack they like to poison people intentionally. The people who did this should definitely be fired and charged for such a crime.

A great restaurant, delicious burgers and fries, especially love their sweet and sour sauce. This Chick-fil-A lovated in a really busy area allows you to either shop first then eat or eat first then go out and shop. The store is big and offers lots of seating areas even though it's always busy around. I personally would order on the phone to avoid waiting in line, go in grab your food when it's ready and either eat there if i have nothing to do or to take it home and eat it at home. Whatever the situation Chick-fil-A will fill you up.
Used their mobile app and watched the status go from prep to will be delivered to gone!  Had to go inside and reorder.I'm not understanding why this location is consistently troublesome.

A Cool Chick-fil-A located in the heart of Lower Manhattan near the World Trade Center the financial district -wall street area, near Century 21 department store and the Westfield world trade center mall and the Brookfield Plaza mall. The lines get very long During noon during the weekdays because everyone is on lunch break. but since the coronavirus epidemic broke out in March 2020 it doesn't seem to be crowded in this chick-fil-a location. because everyone is on quarantine and working from home . there lot of cool clothing stores in the area to shop while you get your food. (and there are closed on Sundays for there religious church beliefs).there a shake shack in the Fulton Street transit hub station upstairs. tuff competition.very convenient by the MTA transportation:subway:2,3,4,5,A,C,J,M,Z-Trains.Fulton  street & Nassau street . Train station.R,W-Train.Cortlandt street .Train station.E-Train.World Trade Center .Train Station.Bus:M5, etc buses

A great regular Chick-Fil-A location with an amazing organization. They do well in managing their line and mobile orders. They often have lines to order that goes out the door during lunch hours. As it's in a busy area, they have multiple floors for eating in.It's always crowded during lunch hours. I usually mobile order 5-10 minutes ahead.  My order would be ready in 5 minutes or less of entering the store as they have they separate pick up line for mobile orders. The staff are also very kind and don't mind going to the back to make sure your order hasn't been skipped. I always get a spicy chicken sandwich with Chick-Fil-A sauce and it always tastes great.
Their Mountain Salad is very filling and nutrious.  It also is only 200 calaries so it fits easily into my diet.

Long lines and great service. I was given two orders for the price of one. High volume location especially on weekends or during the holidays. Plan accordingly if you are on lunch. Lines do move fast. Again, great service. Love their food!
aaah yes yo amor this chick-fil-a better than the uno on 86th because it's right near myy school. it gets crowded but they get everyone's orders quick. all chick-fil-a's employees estas soooo kind.

Lol this is literally the worst chick fil a I've ever been to in my entire life. Always terrible and rushed service. The man who greets at the door with insist on touching your arm or shoulders in some way after you explicitly tell him not to. I asked for sauce and extra pickles. Got no sauce and 1 pickle. Oh and my fries are cold. Hard pass

I stopped by this location for the first time today for a quick bite to eat. I must say they work fast here. I placed my order and got my order in prob under 4 mins which was amazing. The food was consistent with other stores I have been too. Overall this location was pretty good no complaints here....
These 8 pieces are not bigger than my thumb and tasted like gone bad....really chick-fil-a? i i will go to burger king or McDonald's for nuggets going forward

I came for the fries just the fries during my lunch walk thru the oculus . I got a nice freebie using the app free nuggets!!!! However the large fries I ordered and paid for were not large it was a small Order because of the napkins pushed inside of the carton! Really???? All I wanted and craved were fries:(

Love this location.  Clean, fresh food, and timely service.  I always order on my Chick-Fil-A app to minimize the wait time.  Seating upstairs with self serve refills (except lemonade). Very convenient.

Despite the fact Chic-fil-A has traditionally worn its antiquated and concerning "religious" beliefs on its sleeve, they do manage to make a good chicken sandwich for a reasonable price.  After the bumpy road the company traversed trying to make its way into the city, it seems that they're here to stay (and have certainly lasted longer than its similarly antiquated brethren, Carl's Jr., which shut down in just 5 months despite its location at Penn Station; a hotbed for the market who would prefer its "technically not prison food" food).  This is the first location I've visited after escaping the south. I cam around 9am and the store wasn't unbearably busy.  You enter and walk through the zig zagged line as if you're approaching a Six Flags ride and place your order for one of their various chicken products fried in their signature batter (which includes pickle juice, giving it that signature "southern fired" flavor).  Place your order as your called, stand in the waiting area, and respond to your name once your order is ready. There are three floors, including an upstairs seating area and I believe a roof top, through I've seen neither myself.As for the food, I'm a traditionalist; less in the "we should donate to organizations that forcibly attempt to re-educate homosexual people" and more in the "maybe just order the chicken sandwich without all the extra stuff on it" sense, so I always gravitate to the traditional chicken sandwich of the chicken biscuit for breakfast.  These are the products that made chic-fil-a the company they are today so why alter what works? Not to mention they're one of the few places you can get a true southern biscuit for breakfast.  Feel free to add lettuce and cheese and everything else, but its all superfluous.  For a reasonably priced ($10 for a meal with about a dozen little hashbrown bites and a small coffee) and reasonably reliable breakfast, I'll likely return, unless their ownership decides to take some unnecessary but predictably deplorable political step.  No need to eat chicken with a bunch of weird religious biases when you can just go to Popeyes.

This location so far is one of the least impressive spots to me. I feel like overall, it is not like 42nd Grand Central because they do not handle crowds with such ease. Plenty of times here at Fulton Street, crowds are redic, redic but to be fair a lot of friends I know that work in that area do not like the average food choices around in this area in general.Chick Fil A does serve its purpose in that area to get a quick bite. Milkshakes in general are something you should get here. Salads are an option as well if you do not want the traditional chicken sandwich or spicy chicken sandwich. The place is huge, there is even a rooftop area which I have yet to see. Overall, the place just needs to improve customer service and reduce customer wait time. Good to have the place around or course it is just now open on Sundays to satisfy your chicken cravings. Grilled Chicken Nuggets are also very underrated, try this in the future.

This location is alright...but beware of Alianne. She's incredibly rude, very sassy and questioned my order and tried to be smart about it. She had no sense of customer service and I felt like a burden just for ordering my breakfast...probably won't be going back to this location..

This is a first for me. I've heard of chick-fil-A mainly because they have been in the news for being racist and homophobic. Later, I found out that people really like their sandwiches and decided to give then a try, inspite of their corporate beliefs. I came during lunch time, so of course there was a bit of a long line. Surprisingly it moved pretty quick. I ordered a deluxe sandwich and in less than a minute a guy was calling my name. Staff is super friendly and there's even a guy at the entrance who opens the door for you. I Love their condiments station, especially their ketchup. Place looked very clean too. I didn't check the seating upstairs though. The flavor: sandwich was very well prepared for a fast food place. Tomatoes and lettuce was very fresh and chicken was nicely cooked.

I'm not into writing reviews for chain restaurants but I always have a pleasant experience with the same woman there so I had to. According to my receipt, her name is Liavy but I'll double check. She's always friendly early in the morning, very fast, and no matter how big my order is, she always gets it back. I've seen her work faster and my efficiently but herself then times that I've seen 3 people doing everything she does. I wish there was an option to leave a review on the receipt but there isn't so this will have to suffice. Food is great too, I prefer the breakfast.

Spacious Chick-Fil-A goodness. This location has 3 floors of seating area and while it gets crowded quickly, the staff gets the orders in as soon as you hit the door. The staff is always warm & congenial & the food is always great & fresh. Def stop by when your near WTC.

There was a hair in my food. Very unappetizing. Line is already crazy long so to wait for 30 minutes to find unsanitary food is obviously very disappointing. There are a lot of other great options in the Oculus and Fulton center.

This location has the most terrible customer service I've experienced. The first time I order they didn't submit it . When I walked to the cashier they had to resubmit my order again. I've been in line waiting for my food for at least an hour , I've been asking employees for help but they just ignore us, and walk away . I'M NEVER COMING BACK to this location.Update: They didn't submit the second time either ! No wonder I waited nearly an hour. They said that our name wasn't in the system which doesn't make sense since we had a receipt which clearly had our name on it. No stars.

Five stars. But if i could give ten stars i would. Place is clean the food is amazing! First time eating chick fila and will definatly eat from there again. From the fries to that spicey chicken sandwich.. each bite is MAGICAL.

I love chick fil a and this location is very nice. It's spacious and the staff here are friendly. Wait time for lunch is not bad. About 5-10 minutes. The chicken sandwich here is delicious. It's nice and warm and the chicken is crispy and they always ask if you want sauce. The bun is soft and has two pickles. Chicken is well seasoned too. Delicious!

I usually don't write reviews for fast food restaurants, especially if it is a chain restaurant but I had a really great experience here. It's the least I can do. Walked in and was surprised to see they had a few workers with the iPads for expediting orders. (I've only ever seen this at their drive through locations). Service was swift & great (as expected, I mean it is Chick-fil-A). After receiving my order, I noticed my chicken strips were cold. I brought it to their attention and not only were they super accommodating, but they even allowed me to get a deluxe sandwich instead (this cost more than the strips). Thank you to the staff for looking out!

Price is same as any other fast food chain, but their food is to the utmost standard of quality in taste. Any one of It's chains should provide the same standard of food quality and service, they answer to a higher power.
What can I say its Chik-fil-a , no other words needed. The best chicken sandwich, staff is kind and well spoken. Love the food and the staff.

I had to try the new Mac and Cheese.  It is so very good, with a cheesy topping, and oh so satisfying.  Very excellent addition to the menu.To make up for the carbs in the Mac and Cheese, I chose to forgo the bread in the spicy chicken sandwich.  I ordered on the app, so I added a spicy filet, pickles, lettuce, tomato and pepper jack cheese.  It came to a little less than the spicy chicken deluxe.  I also got the market salad with spicy grilled chicken.  Awesome salad, with spicy chicken, apples, blueberries, strawberries, feta cheese, perfect with the zesty apple cider vinaigrette.

Best chicken in Manhattan. Surprisingly, they actually have really healthy food. They have grilled chicken nuggets which are incredible. It's literally just grilled chicken. They also make killer sandwiches. The sauces are amazing. The shakes are fantastic. It's a spectacular place.

OK I've been avoiding this for at least two months, but I have no choice but to give this Chick-fil-A (NYC Fulton Street) one star. If there was an opportunity to give zero stars, this Chick-fil-A qualifies. I'm not even sure where to start so I'll start with my most current experience. Today I went to this Chick-fil-A, ordered in advance through the app, btw- two caramel frosted coffee's, a small ice cream cone and a small Dr Pepper. When I got to the store, I checked in immediately and WAITED 22 MINUTES after I was told my order was ready through the app. I watched at least 15 customers on line order their food, get it and leave during that time. Now there's a little bit of history behind me waiting at this particular Chick-fil-A, i'll get to that in a minute. I kindly asked to speak to a crew leader, and then watched that very crew leader stock one whole case of cups right in front of my face before even giving me an ear to hear my complaint. His excuse was that they had to retrieve coffee mixture in order to complete my order. That was a crock of bull because I watched them make at least 10 frozen coffees and give them to customers that ordered a long time after I arrived and put my mobile order in the kiosk. Flashback to two weeks ago when I ordered one caramel frosted coffee and waited 15 minutes for that one beverage. When I inquired as to why my name wasn't called yet, one clown face girl with extremely large eyelashes (that caused me to lurch back when she blinked), Sharpied-in eyebrows and an attitude that made Naomi Campbell look like Cinderella, said in her thick Adam-Apple assisted Lou Rawls voice, "Ain't nobody call that name." Completely ignoring that most wretched individual, I asked the crew leader who happened to walk by, "what's the deal with my order?" Apparently not being able to read the brightly labeled name imprinted on my shirt, asked me my name and then even went so far as to have me pull up the order on my app's history in order to verify that I actually placed the order! Seriously?! "No, I didn't order anything, dummy, I'm just standing here in my work uniform trying to cop a free beverage!" What a buffoon! Then after verifying ON THEIR SCREEN, my order, turns around to the counter to see the beverage sitting on the counter with my name tagged on the receipt! And this dude is a crew leader?! I made him make me a new one. He reluctantly complied after retrieving what was left of his fortitude. And there was the time the mobile ordering was down, the ice cream machine broken AND the AC not working on one of the hottest days of the summer...sigh. I just can't win at this one. All in all, I DO NOT RECOMMEND this Chick-fil-A at all. This Chick-fil-A is by far the absolute worst Chick-fil-A I have ever been to in my life and I have been to many many Chick-fil-A's. The place is dirty (truth), the majority of the crew have rotten attitudes, the crew leaders are completely clueless, and their service time is absolutely atrocious. It seems as though the crew conveniently takes time conversing with one another about what they're going to do after work while making mobile order customers wait extensively for their orders. SMH. The red flag should've slapped me when I walked in to a Chick-fil-A and observed a hired security guard on watch (that's also pretty clueless himself).

The Fulton location is ran very poorly. They are under staffed constantly and they close off the 3rd floor seating when it's packed. The drink machine on the second floor is never working so you have to go to the first floor to get refills and you end up waiting a while. By far the worst manhattan location

Chick-fil-a is awesome. This location is the absolute worst. Pre-ordered food 10 minutes before getting there so we didn't have to wait on line. Ended up wait 40 MINUTES for the order. The employees are slow and clearly don't want to be there. Between the employees, the service, and rowdy people.. definitely won't be coming back or recommending this location.

Very poor level of customer service and unorganized location. The food quality isn't as good as other locations I've visited. If you're in the mood to get yelled at by the employees while trying to order food, amongst general mayhem definitely come here. Overall, I'm very disappointed and won't be returning.

I live around the block from their 86th st location; i figured it must good with constant lines day and night.... boy was i wrong.We stopped in earlier today to see what all the hype was about. We ordered their rubbery,inedible grilled  nuggets and a very greasy chicken sandwich. Place is absolutely terrible ... i mean awful.  Nuggets were bonny grilled skin and the sandwich was just terrible.They use a nice fresh bun with lettuce & tomato to mask the cheap meat.Sticking to shakeshack or chirping. Seriously, avoid this place.
The service is super slow and staff seems lost. The food portions are so small and not worth the price. Plus, the food are not as fresh as the chick-fil-a in New Jersey.

I'm sorry but this is the worst CFA that I've ever visit. I'm a red member (it should tell you how often I eat @CFA). First, I didn't get the warm welcome like when I visit other CFA. 2nd, The cashier didn't even mention their trademark words 'my pleasure' even when i say thank you. 3rd, they even messed up my order with missing the fries. the messiest CFA, trash was overflowed the trash can. The soda machine on the 2nd floor none of the drinks were available not even the ice. Why do you bother to have a big building when you can't even maintain the cleanliness.

This is the greatest fast food chain of all time. The wait staff is 75% kind, and 25% not rude. I would say most other fast food chains in the city you've got a majority chance you'll simply be grunted at. Great location, great seating. Very kind management. Thanks chic fil a !!

I go to this place anytime I'm in NYC and it's always been quite good. For the past few days though it hasn't been good. Limited menu, the chicken looks like they haven't been fed and a bunch of trainees. The trainees are doing they're best and they're good kids but the food quality is not what I've had in other stores, which is the primary disappointment. Come back in a few weeks. Maybe they'll have improved.

This chick fil A is more spacious & faster then the others in the city. Staff was great & they took my order before I approached the register by the time I got there I just had to pay & get my drink . I think I was on the line less then 3 min.  Food was great / cashier liavy was awesome. ! Also the team member wearing the blue shirt that took my order w/ the tablet was helpful as well.  Chick fil A is always fast but this location made me comfortable & the seating on the diff floors is lit!

Chick Fil A was ok.Chicken Nuggets- small, not really crispy. The seasoning is good.Waffle fries- smells good. It's not crisp enough to my liking. Maybe they should make the waffle fries thinner. Has a sort of mushy feeling from some of the thicker parts.Sauces- the sauces at chick fil a are soooo good. Def get one of each.
Incomplete orders, special instructions not being followed and they don't pick up the phone Won't order from this location again

Soooo in case y'all didn't know, Chick-fil-A tastes better on a rooftop! This is apparently the largest one in the U.S. and I'm happy to have dined here and ate my msg (sad truth) fried chicken biscuit in peanut oil...on a rooftop!! Did I say that already? We even had a mini photo shoot up there. Yea, photographers...do iiiit.Came here on a Friday morning for breakfast around 10 with about 10 other people. We ordered online because we weren't sure we'd make it in time to order off the breakfast menu. Turns out breakfast ends at 10:30 afterall though it says 10 am online. They just wanted us to have a heart attack is all. Why you gotta do us like that, NY?The restaurant was clean and well kept. They said "my pleasure" which was a pleasure. Gotta have a code to use the bathrooms...welcome to New York. 5 stories y'all and 5 stars for the rooftop 'cause ummm...where they do that at?! New Yorrrrrrrk!

Probably the worst CFA I've been to - and I've been to 30+ locations. I placed my mobile order (which contained breakfast items) at 10:20 AM. I arrived at the restaurant at 10:50 AM. An employee with an iPad told me, after taking my name, that my order would be made promptly. At 11:10 AM, no food yet. I talked to another employee who was delivering orders to people in the pickup area - which they shouted at customers to remain in - who took me to the front counter. We found out that my order wasn't showing up in their system. We re-input the same order and I go back and wait. At 11:30, I ask the same delivery employee for a status update. The man next to me said he had been waiting long as well, and the employee responded, "now, don't go blaming me for your problem. I just got to work, it's not my fault." -- not quite the CFA hospitality they're known for! The employee sighed, took my receipt to the front again, and a supervisor and another employee came out and said that they couldn't serve breakfast after 10:30 AM (couldn't they have figured this out when I first showed up?) and offered me anything on the lunch menu for free. A fine offer, but after I placed that order, they messed up THAT, too (gave me a fruit cup and no fries)! I asked for them to correct it, and the employee that helped me seemed apologetic but exasperated. I heard other customers around me mumble that their orders were incorrect, too. Don't come here unless you don't care about waiting, your order being correct, or have the patience to wait it out for 45 minutes for your order to be correct.

Was in town visiting and had just taken some first timers to the memorial and we decided to grab a it here - because I can honestly say I've never had a bad experience at a Chic Fil A. Until I met this place. It was very busy, as usual - most of them are. Waited in line to place our order and watched people order, pay and go. When it was my time in line - I stood beside a family member as they placed their order and payed and a lady that works there came up behind me and line and asked me if they had called me to come up next to order. I said, "no, she hasn't called anyone that's been in like the entire time I've been standing up here, they've just been flowing through" well then she asks me to step back in line - I said, "Ma'am that's my niece that just ordered and she's already paid." She then looks at the cashier and said, "did you say next to him?" - she said no. Well at that point I was mad an embarrassed in a crowded line of people, so I said - I'm not moving - she can take my order. I ordered the #1 with no pickle. I got my food and made my way upstairs to meet the rest of my family. I open my sandwich and saw that it was full of pickles, I wasn't happy but I traded that bread side and pickles with someone at the table that liked pickles! But then I notice there is an ant on my bun. Yeah I'm furious at this point. I walk over to the condiment station where 2 managers were standing and told them, they turned their back to me and started whispering. Then the female said she'd go downstairs to get me another one - I said, "I'll go with you". So we got on the elevator and she proceeds to tell me that there was nothing on my bread and it was part of the bun. I said "so your buns have wings? - ma'am I know that was a bug, don't tell me what I didn't see" she says, "there's no need to be upset baby love (yeah she called me that)" so I in turn said, "there's no need for you to tell me what I didn't see, just give me a refund when we get downstairs and you won't have to worry about me". She didn't - she gave me another sandwich and I went back upstairs. In a few minutes she comes up to me and hands me a car for a free sandwich - no words, no apology,  nothing! Wow! Y'all could learn a lot from the south's chic fil a - their customer service is astounding. Not this one!

Got their breakfast chicken biscuit which had a nicely crisp fried chicken between two buttery biscuits. It's not very big but still fulfilling. The biscuits were actually really good since they were toasted well and soft in the middle. The fried chicken was also tasty. And of course, had to add the Chick-fil-A sauce. The regular sandwiches on the other hand are just alright. I think the combination of the biscuit and chicken was great.
Best chicken burger place in FiDiFriendly crew and yummy food.I will come back soon, keep it up guys.

This was the most disorganized and actually only disorganized Chick I've ever been to. I've never had to reach across the counter to get my food because the person just set it there and went on about her business. And it was... dare I say... indifferent service from the cashier? Just disappointing.
Service at this location is pitiful. 30 minutes waits consistently and wrong orders. Not even crowded

This used to be my go to, but the staff is becoming a lot less friendly and the service is getting worst. This is in the financial district, people who are on their breaks don't have 45 minutes to wait for a BEVERAGE, not even food. I had to wait 45 minutes for a passion lemonade, I already had my food. And the manager didn't help either, I walked away. Shoulda went to Wendy's

Do yourself a favor and place your order on their mobile app. It will save you a ton of time having to wait in the very long line to place your order. If you used their mobile app, it will give you a code to enter into the check-in tablet in the pick-up area. Once your food is ready, an employee will bring out your food and call out your name. On one occasion an employee called out Emily instead of my name and was kind of mean towards me as she thought I was trying to take a girl's food! :)The food here was your standard Chick-fil-A food. It's the reason why there's always a long line at any Chick-fil-A. Eat mor chikin! :)Although I always took my order to go, I saw that this location had multi-level dining area upstairs.

Didn't take long but restaurant started falling off. The mobile app orders have been wrong the last 5 times I ordered. Either don't get part of the order (salad items or cheese sauce paid extra for) or get the dressing that comes with the salad instead of the one you put in your basket.  Didn't complain first two times but left messages after 3rd and 4th Times. Forgot about it. No one ever called me back.  Left message this 5th time and contacted their HQ.
Hear all the the hype about this place ? And after my 2 week straight eating the hype is real

This Chick-fil-A was very prompt and on point the first time I visited, soon after the grand opening.I'm not sure what happened since then, but there were what seemed like 1000 workers and the line was still moving really slow. Observing the cashiers, I see that one of them would rather carry on entire conversations with the customers about Six Flags and random stuff like that than to move the line, which is her job.But all of that aside, I was lucky enough not to get that girl as my cashier -- she was too busy talking to take the next person anyway.My cashier, Titanna, was amazing, fast, nice and polite. After she took our order, the wait time was short and the experience was great.
Ordered the spicy chicken sandwich. Flavors we're good. The bread was a bit soggy. Good value and filling though.

The food is always delicious. This location seemed to be very busy and a little unorganized during a lunch rush. I came on a Saturday afternoon around 4ish and to my surprise the line was almost hitting the door. No biggie, it's chick fil a. It's to be expected. There was employees coming to the line to take orders, which i assumed would make the line run quicker. surprisingly, it did not. As i waited in line for what seemed like forever, when i finally got to the register, she asked my name, which i told her, and she went to grab my order. After waiting at the register for what seemed like an eternity, my food was placed down, and the cashier ran off again to grab my drink. While my food sat by the wet ice that one of the employees just finished spilling all over the place while trying to refill ice bins. Neither that employee nor my cashier attempted to move my bag of food away from the ice that was now causing a puddle under and around my paper take away bag. The cashier finally came back after 5 mins to inform me that they were out of sweet tea for my half and half. Annoyed already, i asked for just lemonade, which took another 5 mins. The entire time employees are speaking amongst themselves laughing and paying little to no attention to the customer. (The joys of living in nyc) this location used to be better. The service needs to improve. Especially during a busy time like lunch rush. Also, it would be nice for everyone to get on the same page because i really wanted that half and half. The three stars are for the deliciousness that is chick fil a. The service blows. Probably will go to the others further uptown in the city. The customer service there is always top notch (which is what you'd expect from chick fil a) this location you definitely felt like you were in McDonald's. Horrible!

Absolute sh*t-show. The mobile ordering machines were down, there were a few dozen people waiting to order, there were a few dozen people waiting to pick-up, the fourth floor was closed, the third floor was closed, half of the second floor was closed, and the only area available for seating was filthy. Cups & napkins & containers & wrappers all over. And even though all but one seating area was closed, there were no signs anywhere saying such, so people were going up and down the stairs, people were going up and down the elevators. This of course caused people to harass one another over taking too long, not eating fast enough, etc. And this is all the fault of management. Why were they accepting so many orders when they weren't ready or willing or able to provide any seating. And at these prices ($6.63 for a spicy chicken sandwich  that was small & dry & not crispy & extremely salty) there are plenty of preferable alternatives which might cost an extra dollar or two, but the portions are bigger and the presentation is better and none of the above mentioned chaos would ever happen... Oh, and $3 for a soda, and the refill machines on the second floor were broken, so if you want a refill then you have to wait in line all over again? FFS...

It was my first time in this restaurant. When I walked in there was a long line. I wanted to turn around and leave but I've heard so much about this place that I had to try it. Surprisingly, the line moves very fast. They were very organized. I ordered the grilled chicken club and my friend ordered the chicken strips. They were both very tasty and fresh. They also have a sitting area. Their fries were not greasy either. If you're in the mood for chicken you have to go to this place.
Food was great, only this restaurant can't seem to work too well under pressure. Love this location.

This location is huge with 3 levels. Seating is upstairs and they have very clean bathrooms. The staff is always friendly. I mostly do pick up through the app The favorite items are the waffle fries and the spicy chicken sandwich and the tenders. I need to try the tortilla soup They have good hours even during the weekends.

I come here often for lunch and usually do mobile order so I'm not waiting on a line outside of the main doors that leads to the side walk. Today their computers for mobile orders must've been down bc I waited on the line longer to check in than people who were waiting outside to order. I was still waiting to check in when people who were outside were already getting their food. As one of the locations with the most traffic it was absolutely ridiculous and an inconvenience nor did a manager or anyone step to us to apologize. There are people with mobile devices in their hands taking the regular lines when they should've had at least one helping with the mobile orders

I am an avid Chick-fil-A eater and fan. It is always my go-to fast food restaurant when available. In fact, I rarely choose to eat at other fast food restaurants but will still come to Chick-fil-A once or twice a month.My favorite meal to eat at any Chick-fil-A is the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich with a medium waffle fries. From the start, the sandwich is much better than other fast food sandwiches due to the amazing bun- soft and buttery. Besides that, the chicken is usually much larger than the amount provided at other fast food restaurants and so crispy and delicious. The pepper jack cheese and other toppings are a nice touch to give it that extra bit of texture and taste. I also always order the spicy version, but it's honestly not that spicy, just gives it some nice additional flavor. The waffle fries are best shaped for dipping sauces (my personal favorite is Chick-fil-A sauce) and great for fry lovers. They're not overly fried which can be a good or bad based on your personal preference.Don't come here to eat healthy, I'm sure those options are fine, but I always come knowing that I'm going to get the fried options and felt that it was worth it every time.The service here is very good, but sometimes I feel like they are understaffed. At least twice I have had to wait about 10 minutes for my food, which is pretty long for fast food. It really depends on what time you come, if there's enough employees for the rush hour but the line has died down, you'll get your food instantly, but come during non-peak hours or the middle of rush hour and it might take awhile. Also, the food is pretty hot when I receive it, but usually it would be more satisfying if it were hotter. I feel like this is a consequence of having to serve so many customers since it's located in downtown Manhattan.Lastly, I'll add that you should join Chick-fil-A's loyalty program if you like it. You get rewards decently often, and I have received multiple free sandwiches and fries through redemptions and "Just Because" gifts that owners will give out sometimes!

Always extremely fast and kind. My only complain is they always give a very small amount of fries, they don't even fill up the container. It's disappointing but I'll continue to return because I love their food.

Incomplete order. I did not receive the same attention as the other customer at counter, due to the lengthy conversation the cashier was having.They forgot the cookie I ordered and the half and half lemonade was undrinkable. It was mostly pulp and didn't taste like a half and half lemonade.I won't be returning to this location anymore.

This is one of my friend's favorite fast food restaurants so we decided to come here for lunch. There are two good things that happened on our excursion:1. Thankfully, the line was short. However, they were training workers independently instead of interacting with customers so it became a moot point. 2. There is ample seating. However, we did come here a little after 11a so not during peak times. This is not my first time at this particular location. However, yes, that word is getting a bit repetitive, that was when it recently opened so they were on their game. The service was fast and the food was good. This is not the case today. My friend got the new grilled chicken sandwich meal with lettuce, tomato, and American cheese. He also got a small cookies and cream milkshake. I got the spicy chicken deluxe meal, it was plain with pepperjack cheese. Both our meals came with waffle fries and medium drinks. I ordered the root beer and got it. My friend ordered a Sprite and got... lemonade. Okay then. Both our sandwiches were cold. Calling it lukewarm would be pushing it. We both should have known something was amiss when we got our order like two minutes after we were done ordering it. I can't say for sure but I don't think he was a fan of his meal. He called the Honey Roasted Barbecue sauce that comes separately from the sandwich: interesting. I didn't really enjoy my meal except for the Garlic and Herb Ranch sauce I asked for on the side.The Waffle Fries were dry. I used both the ranch sauce and mayo in them. I also needed to add salt. My spicy chicken was all right but it wasn't mind-blowing or satisfying. Before I began my meal, I told my friend I was still going to be hungry and guess what? I am. At the time of writing this review, my friend hadn't tasted the milkshake yet so maybe the whole meal might not be a complete waste of money. For the prices Chic-fil-a is touting, it isn't worth it. Save your money.

Chick fil a has gone down hill. Today I go in and not a packet of ketchup to be had. Who sells nuggets or fries without ketchup? So ask the manager and was totally insulted. The way I was talked to was offensive as last time I checked I am paying. Chick fil a sorry it's not Christian to treat customers like they are idiots for asking where is the ketchup. You gotta do better and be better. Get rid of the tall manager at counter that's an ass hole . Not good for business to insult customers.

The absolute best fast food place ever! If you can't buy super expensive healthy foods but not super cheap fast food, this is the perfect middle. Chick fil a is known for their chicken burgers (which never fail to impress and don't even mention the best fries ever created) but they have alternative healthy sides like salads to feel better about yourself. They also make their own "Chick Fil a" sauce that is one of a kind. It is very affordable too! The only thing is that if you're going to the one in FiDi, you better download the app and order through that ahead of time because the lines get so long they make people wait in front of the store just to order! At night the lines get shorter but it's still a wait usually. If you're getting the standard chicken burger meal, you usually won't wait more than five minutes. The absolute best part is that the entire staff is friendly and they never seem to be too busy to be nice. Whenever there's an issue they handle it with grace. 10/10
Bought a spicy chicken sandwich at their new Fulton Transit Center kiosk for $6.95 plus tax only to realize that it was $5.39 at the restaurant, which is above the transit center.  Not nice.

Overall atrocious service for mobile pick up orders. At 10:15am I placed a mobile order for an iced coffee and checked in at the kiosk at 10:17am. The kiosk directed me to the mobile pick up area to the left of the cashiers. I waited until 10:30am (13 minutes for an iced coffee?) And finally asked about it. It had been sitting behind the counter the entire time. They never called my name to let me know it was ready. Then I got the coffee and it was over a third empty (see photo). Overall I'm extremely disappointed with the lack of urgency or apologies for the delay for an iced coffee (where you have to get your own straw/creamer).

I don't care what the news says - when it comes down to it, Chick Fil A is simply delicious. I love chick fil a. It's pretty much the only fast food that I opt to eat. Whenever I have guests from out of the country who are looking for cheap eats, I always bring them to do an "American Fast Food" experience at Chick Fil A. One of my out of country guests loved it so much she went back the next day. The other one loved the Chick Fil A sauce so much he asked for more to take back home. The fried chicken sandwiches are warm, crispy, and tender. The bread is soft and buttery, and the pickles bring out the flavor of the chicken and really tie the whole sandwich together. The waffles fries are my favorite fast food fries. Chick Fil A has such a wide range of sauces that make ketchup almost irrelevant. My go to order is a Chick Fil A sandwich with waffle fries and Polynesian sauce!

Ordered 3 sandwiches, fries, nuggets, drink and a salad on the app. After we picked up and brought back to the office, we realized that the salad was missing and by that time we were too far to go back. My co-worker wasn't able to eat her lunch. Despite my repeated attempts to call to get a refund on the salad, nobody picks up or responds to my voicemails. Also left a complaint on the app, but no response. Horrible customer service.

just had the best experience at any cfa ever! and i'm from the south, so that says a lot! both of my servers had a fun energy and made sure my order was complete, even though it was busy! i love going here for dinner!!

Always extremely fast and kind. My only complain is they always give a very small amount of fries, they don't even fill up the container. It's disappointing but I'll continue to return because I love their food.

Incomplete order. I did not receive the same attention as the other customer at counter, due to the lengthy conversation the cashier was having.They forgot the cookie I ordered and the half and half lemonade was undrinkable. It was mostly pulp and didn't taste like a half and half lemonade.I won't be returning to this location anymore.

He called the Honey Roasted Barbecue sauce that comes separately from the sandwich: interesting. I didn't really enjoy my meal except for the Garlic and Herb Ranch sauce I asked for on the side.The Waffle Fries were dry. I used both the ranch sauce and mayo in them. I also needed to add salt. My spicy chicken was all right but it wasn't mind-blowing or satisfying. Before I began my meal, I told my friend I was still going to be hungry and guess what? I am. At the time of writing this review, my friend hadn't tasted the milkshake yet so maybe the whole meal might not be a complete waste of money. For the prices Chic-fil-a is touting, it isn't worth it. Save your money.

Chick fil a has gone down hill. Today I go in and not a packet of ketchup to be had. Who sells nuggets or fries without ketchup? So ask the manager and was totally insulted. The way I was talked to was offensive as last time I checked I am paying. Chick fil a sorry it's not Christian to treat customers like they are idiots for asking where is the ketchup. You gotta do better and be better. Get rid of the tall manager at counter that's an ass hole . Not good for business to insult customers.

The absolute best fast food place ever! If you can't buy super expensive healthy foods but not super cheap fast food, this is the perfect middle. Chick fil a is known for their chicken burgers (which never fail to impress and don't even mention the best fries ever created) but they have alternative healthy sides like salads to feel better about yourself. They also make their own "Chick Fil a" sauce that is one of a kind. It is very affordable too! The only thing is that if you're going to the one in FiDi, you better download the app and order through that ahead of time because the lines get so long they make people wait in front of the store just to order! At night the lines get shorter but it's still a wait usually. If you're getting the standard chicken burger meal, you usually won't wait more than five minutes. The absolute best part is that the entire staff is friendly and they never seem to be too busy to be nice. Whenever there's an issue they handle it with grace. 10/10
Bought a spicy chicken sandwich at their new Fulton Transit Center kiosk for $6.95 plus tax only to realize that it was $5.39 at the restaurant, which is above the transit center.  Not nice.

Overall atrocious service for mobile pick up orders. At 10:15am I placed a mobile order for an iced coffee and checked in at the kiosk at 10:17am. The kiosk directed me to the mobile pick up area to the left of the cashiers. I waited until 10:30am (13 minutes for an iced coffee?) And finally asked about it. It had been sitting behind the counter the entire time. They never called my name to let me know it was ready. Then I got the coffee and it was over a third empty (see photo). Overall I'm extremely disappointed with the lack of urgency or apologies for the delay for an iced coffee (where you have to get your own straw/creamer).

I don't care what the news says - when it comes down to it, Chick Fil A is simply delicious. I love chick fil a. It's pretty much the only fast food that I opt to eat. Whenever I have guests from out of the country who are looking for cheap eats, I always bring them to do an "American Fast Food" experience at Chick Fil A. One of my out of country guests loved it so much she went back the next day. The other one loved the Chick Fil A sauce so much he asked for more to take back home. The fried chicken sandwiches are warm, crispy, and tender. The bread is soft and buttery, and the pickles bring out the flavor of the chicken and really tie the whole sandwich together. The waffles fries are my favorite fast food fries. Chick Fil A has such a wide range of sauces that make ketchup almost irrelevant. My go to order is a Chick Fil A sandwich with waffle fries and Polynesian sauce!

Ordered 3 sandwiches, fries, nuggets, drink and a salad on the app. After we picked up and brought back to the office, we realized that the salad was missing and by that time we were too far to go back. My co-worker wasn't able to eat her lunch. Despite my repeated attempts to call to get a refund on the salad, nobody picks up or responds to my voicemails. Also left a complaint on the app, but no response. Horrible customer service.

just had the best experience at any cfa ever! and i'm from the south, so that says a lot! both of my servers had a fun energy and made sure my order was complete, even though it was busy! i love going here for dinner!!

Always extremely fast and kind. My only complain is they always give a very small amount of fries, they don't even fill up the container. It's disappointing but I'll continue to return because I love their food.

Incomplete order. I did not receive the same attention as the other customer at counter, due to the lengthy conversation the cashier was having.They forgot the cookie I ordered and the half and half lemonade was undrinkable. It was mostly pulp and didn't taste like a half and half lemonade.I won't be returning to this location anymore.

This is one of my friend's favorite fast food restaurants so we decided to come here for lunch. There are two good things that happened on our excursion:1. Thankfully, the line was short. However, they were training workers independently instead of interacting with customers so it became a moot point. 2. There is ample seating. However, we did come here a little after 11a so not during peak times. This is not my first time at this particular location. However, yes, that word is getting a bit repetitive, that was when it recently opened so they were on their game. The service was fast and the food was good. This is not the case today. My friend got the new grilled chicken sandwich meal with lettuce, tomato, and American cheese. He also got a small cookies and cream milkshake. I got the spicy chicken deluxe meal, it was plain with pepperjack cheese. Both our meals came with waffle fries and medium drinks. I ordered the root beer and got it. My friend ordered a Sprite and got... lemonade. Okay then. Both our sandwiches were cold. Calling it lukewarm would be pushing it. We both should have known something was amiss when we got our order like two minutes after we were done ordering it. I can't say for sure but I don't think he was a fan of his meal. He called the Honey Roasted Barbecue sauce that comes separately from the sandwich: interesting. I didn't really enjoy my meal except for the Garlic and Herb Ranch sauce I asked for on the side.The Waffle Fries were dry. I used both the ranch sauce and mayo in them. I also needed to add salt. My spicy chicken was all right but it wasn't mind-blowing or satisfying. Before I began my meal, I told my friend I was still going to be hungry and guess what? I am. At the time of writing this review, my friend hadn't tasted the milkshake yet so maybe the whole meal might not be a complete waste of money. For the prices Chic-fil-a is touting, it isn't worth it. Save your money.

Chick fil a has gone down hill. Today I go in and not a packet of ketchup to be had. Who sells nuggets or fries without ketchup? So ask the manager and was totally insulted. The way I was talked to was offensive as last time I checked I am paying. Chick fil a sorry it's not Christian to treat customers like they are idiots for asking where is the ketchup. You gotta do better and be better. Get rid of the tall manager at counter that's an ass hole . Not good for business to insult customers.

Chick fil a is known for their chicken burgers (which never fail to impress and don't even mention the best fries ever created) but they have alternative healthy sides like salads to feel better about yourself. They also make their own "Chick Fil a" sauce that is one of a kind. It is very affordable too! The only thing is that if you're going to the one in FiDi, you better download the app and order through that ahead of time because the lines get so long they make people wait in front of the store just to order! At night the lines get shorter but it's still a wait usually. If you're getting the standard chicken burger meal, you usually won't wait more than five minutes. The absolute best part is that the entire staff is friendly and they never seem to be too busy to be nice. Whenever there's an issue they handle it with grace. 10/10
Bought a spicy chicken sandwich at their new Fulton Transit Center kiosk for $6.95 plus tax only to realize that it was $5.39 at the restaurant, which is above the transit center.  Not nice.

Overall atrocious service for mobile pick up orders. At 10:15am I placed a mobile order for an iced coffee and checked in at the kiosk at 10:17am. The kiosk directed me to the mobile pick up area to the left of the cashiers. I waited until 10:30am (13 minutes for an iced coffee?) And finally asked about it. It had been sitting behind the counter the entire time. They never called my name to let me know it was ready. Then I got the coffee and it was over a third empty (see photo). Overall I'm extremely disappointed with the lack of urgency or apologies for the delay for an iced coffee (where you have to get your own straw/creamer).

I don't care what the news says - when it comes down to it, Chick Fil A is simply delicious. I love chick fil a. It's pretty much the only fast food that I opt to eat. Whenever I have guests from out of the country who are looking for cheap eats, I always bring them to do an "American Fast Food" experience at Chick Fil A. One of my out of country guests loved it so much she went back the next day. The other one loved the Chick Fil A sauce so much he asked for more to take back home. The fried chicken sandwiches are warm, crispy, and tender. The bread is soft and buttery, and the pickles bring out the flavor of the chicken and really tie the whole sandwich together. The waffles fries are my favorite fast food fries. Chick Fil A has such a wide range of sauces that make ketchup almost irrelevant. My go to order is a Chick Fil A sandwich with waffle fries and Polynesian sauce!

Ordered 3 sandwiches, fries, nuggets, drink and a salad on the app. After we picked up and brought back to the office, we realized that the salad was missing and by that time we were too far to go back. My co-worker wasn't able to eat her lunch. Despite my repeated attempts to call to get a refund on the salad, nobody picks up or responds to my voicemails. Also left a complaint on the app, but no response. Horrible customer service.

just had the best experience at any cfa ever! and i'm from the south, so that says a lot! both of my servers had a fun energy and made sure my order was complete, even though it was busy! i love going here for dinner!!

This two star is not for the food. But for the mysterious ketchup that end up stain on my cream color parka.  And I didn't even order ketchup at all. It was part of my fault for not paying much attention to surroundings when waiting for pickup. When I got my food and entered Fulton center, I suddenly saw there are ketchup on my left sleeve. Then I start to notice there is ketchup on my hair and my collar.
