I guess this is a friendly warning for everyone who is on their phone when waiting in lines, cause you never know when you are going to be covered up in ketchup:(

I forking love chick-fil-a! It's sooooo good! The food here is real compared to other fast food places and the nuggets, yummmm Chick-fil-a has the best chicken and fries like omg their food is so good! I totally recommend that you go to chick-fil-a sometime! The one thing I do not like about chick-fil-a is that they are not open on sundays, so when I'm near one it's normally a Sunday which will mean no chick-fil-a for me that dayPS: also it's good Bc no matter what size nugget you order (or at least for me) they always put more than what you order so you get more for your money! One time I got a 12 piece nugget and it had about 17 nuggets!

Excellent service!! Not like your typical fast food joints. They're pretty friendly, their nuggets and burgers are pretty good. I really just love how they are very nice and sweet and ready to get you're order. I love chic-fil-a

I'm only giving this location 2 stars for the Chick fil a recipe!  This particular location is going to give the franchise a bad rep.  Service seems to get worse each time I visit, dining area always filthy!  Hire better staff here please and thanks!
In the words of tony the tiger there greeeaaatt!!!Idk what else to say cause my review is too short.

Chic Fil a is my favorite restaurant and it never fails to satisfy what i want. The spicy chicken sandwich deluxe is my favorite and the sweet and spicy Polynesian sauce is great. Hands down fav fast food place

Walked 10 mins in freezing cold since I wanted Chick-fil-A for lunch & felt to treat myself.Ordered side of Honey Mustard for each item & it's on the receipt but the staff who was making jokes & laughing & singing the whole time I was there didn't bother to put 2 honey mustards with the order. Didn't even eat all of it. Waste of $18. Learned my lesson.
I loveeeee chick fil a! I'm here way too often. I love the service and ofcourse the food. Service is speedy and they always give me enough sauce.. this is a big deal!

First time going to this joint and it was a marvelous impression from top to bottom! Their offerings are hands down better than any McDonald's or Burger King I've gone to in my entire lifetime, and I can tell just from the way they present their food--from the ingredients right down to the design of their packaging. Service was efficient as well, though I have to admit that it could get busier during peak hours which might mean bearing a little more patience. You can, however, skip the lines and order from your phone through their user-friendly app (which is exactly what I did before I walked through their doors). Chick-fil-A is certainly worth a try if you're ever craving some fast food, so consider ordering from them if you have any money to spend. Their chicken sandwiches, waffle fries, and desserts are simply irresistible, and now all I can say is that I wish to go back and order from them again :)

I love Chick-fil-A. The lines are always long during lunchtime but they move very fast. The food is amazing and the workers are pretty friendly and attentive. They have an option for mobile and computer orders in case you don't want to stand in line. It is pretty expensive compared to other states. There's an upstairs for seating and this location is pretty clean.
The Chic-fil-A on Fulton Street is exactly what any Chic-fil-A should be. Prompt service, great food, and friendly employees. Perfect!

When I initially entered this restaurant,  I wanted to turn right back around due to the extensive line. Then I thought to myself, their chicken is worth it! Not to mention how exceptional the customer service is at any of these locations is.I ordered the chicken deluxe sandwich with waffle fries and a vanilla shake. The staff here are infamous for calling your name out and personally providing you with your meal. This makes the experience much more personable. There's so much sauces to choose from and they're far from stingy about their ketchup packages. Glad they made this particular location but not so happy about the fact that they made it after I stopped working in the area. Nevertheless I'll drop by here if I'm on the area and starving.

All of my wildest dreams came true this morning after I got to eat chicken minis on the rooftop. As always, Chick-fil-A service is top notch. To help with a line, an employee took my order on his iPad. My food was ready moments later. The elevator was out of order so we trekked the stairs to the rooftop. A little chilly but so worth it. On a random note, they were out of ketchup! Thankfully their sauce selection is on point so we were able to continue living, even without ketchup.

I don't understand their ordering system. I came into order and there's a woman with a handheld device taking orders she tells me to proceed to he register but she takes orders from 3 people behind me as I stand and wait for my order to be taken!!! Horrible system....now I'm standing here and everybody who came in after me already received their order. FAIL

Beautiful large space!! The service is also very good! I am a big fan of the waffle fries dipped in the garlic and herb ranch. The chicken nuggets are alright..I find them to be too salty for my liking. I decided to try out the cold brew coffee but it was incredibly gross, it tasted very watery and artificially. Anyways the food is sometimes a hit or a miss but what I really like is the amount of seating and space this place has!! They also have clean and nice bathroom which is a huge plus. Will definitely be back here!

Now this is the location to go to if you want to have an experience closer to what you'd get going to a location in the South with some NYC flair added for good measure.  I was amazed they had seating on a weekday afternoon; at every single other Chick-fil-A I've been to in Manhattan, seating is impossible and if you're visiting alone, you're never getting a place to sit.  If by some miracle you do, that seat or table surface will inevitably be disgusting.It was actually quiet at this one as well.  Just look around to find quiet areas.  They apparently even have a rooftop floor at this one.  It's also right next to the Fulton Street train station so very convenient to mass transit.  This is the one I'd push to take my family to if they came to visit since it felt far less cramped or disgusting and I wasn't waiting forever to pick up a mobile order.  I'll definitely return if I'm in the area.

I have been a Chick-fil-A addict since 2005 of my freshmen year in college and they never disappoint at all. My visit to the fulton st location was like any other time I've went the staff was helpful energetic the store was clean and the food was deee-licious the only thing I could say was that my 1/2 & 1/2 wasn't on point like the location on 37th St & 6th ave maybe it was the drink or the server who made it but other than that I enjoyed my meal
The service here is terrible. Overstaffed and still took 15 mins to get a chicken biscuit. Ridiculous.

This location gets two stars for two main reasons:1) they ran out of Chick-fil-A sauce and ketchup2) the upstairs dining area looked like a bomb went offAside from the horrible maintenance, the food was good as always.

Can't go wrong with chikfila! The food was great as always and the location is huge! I feel like social media has hyped up this chick fil a since it is the largest location and has a rooftop. I wouldn't be too excited, because yes--it was three-four stories and had a lot of seating, but it wasn't anything glamorous. The rooftop didn't have much of a view or anything like that. If you're in the area and want quick, cheap food though, this is always a great option.My personal favorite is the spicy chicken sandwich. Favorite sauce is for sure the chikfila original sauce!

My mouth was watering because I haven't had this in a long while. I used to go ti Chick- fil-a when I was growing up in Pennsylvania. It tastes just as good. I love their chicken. Today I had chicken nuggets, their waffle fries, and a drink. The meal was delicious.  The Fulton location is huge. I came early to skip the long lunch lines. I would recommend everyone try  Chick- fil-a at least once.

Limiting the number of sauces to 3? Really? Didn't realize place is turning into McDonalds. Girl was nice but when I asked to buy more she looked at me like a deer in headlights. It was busy and didn't want to be complicated... so I told her not to worry. Come on chick fil a .... don't ruin your southern charm!

The largest Chick-fil-A opened on Fulton Street earlier this year, and being a fan of their chicken sandwiches and waffle fries, visiting this location has been on my list of things to do for a while. I dropped by recently during the free nuggets promotion, picking up some waffle fries on the side.This location is truly huge. The first floor is dedicated to ordering. I went at a little bit of an off time, so the line wasn't ridiculously long, but still decent. It moved pretty quickly though, and the workers took some orders from the line to help speed things up. Since I ordered from the line, everything was ready by the time I got up to the cashier, making things really efficient. Floors 2 and 3 have plenty of seating, and then there's the roof deck, which has some additional seating and a nice view.  All the staff I interacted with on my visit were friendly.As for the food, it was pretty much the same as what you'd find at every Chick-fil-A. I was happy to have a chance to try the free nuggets, but they were a lot smaller than I thought they would be, more of a snack than lunch. I was glad I tried them, but will likely stick to my usual chicken sandwiches and waffle fries (and sometimes salads) in the future.  I'd come back to this location though, as it's very conveniently located and the overall experience was good.

Great spot for lunch! This location has a very long line that stretches outside at lunch but they do a great job of moving it along and fairly quickly. As for the food itself, I always get a deluxe crispy chicken sandwich with pepper jack cheese and it's great. I love their chicken here. Also the waffle fries are great and all together make up a pretty filling meal.

This is my go to spot before work for breakfast and for lunch. The biscuits are good and the chicken is always crispy. My only complaint would be in service - usually i get my food before my drink. And it's not like they are making coffee. It's an iced tea. I would go back again(which i do) but they need to work on that aspect.

I came here yesterday to meet a friend for a small dinner. Its your usual set up for a chick fil a but there are multiple levels to sit and eat. They also have a rooftop, with nice views of the WTC. Service is always friendly and fast! Also one of the better and healthier options for fast food.

5 stars for the view, 2 stars for the nuggets and 0 stars for the grilled nuggets.    I love the spicy  chicken sandwich, so don't get me wrong , but the nuggets just isn't that great .    Next time the nuggets are free, I'll pass.
Waited in line for half hour and then we were told they have no cheese and no sauce ! So never go to chick fil A in NYC Busy and stupid

It should've been 5 stars because I am from GA and I live and breathe Chick-fil-A but I am leaving 3 stars because they simple ran out of ranch sauce for my chicken nuggets. I was not told they ran out and was not given a substitute for the sauce. This is unacceptable and I am very disappointed.

Decided to try it out for the first time at the biggest location! I ordered spicy chicken and medium waffle fries. I was pretty impressed with spicy chicken, it had a pleasant kick to it, it wasn't dry and the portion was substantial. However, it did cost like $5 just for the sandwich, which I think is pretty expensive for fast food. The fries were lackluster, I think I still would take McDonald fries over these. There were too soft and not seasoned enough. I did appreciate their location though, they have roof seating, which adds a little bit of glamour to this fast food dining!
Just love this place! Glad they came to New York, would always go to the location in Virginia. Always fresh, place always clean. A long wait at times but worth it! Much success to this location.

Well I know it's a homophobic chicken sandwich but if I'm being objective about this, it was damn good.I was racing from Asbury Park, through Newark, before moving onto the subway to try and get out to freakin Brooklyn- all with no food between sunup and sundown. This paints a picture, because I never would have considered going to a Chick-fil-A. Not just cuz of the Christian fundamentalism, but because it's fast food, just not my speed ya know?But I was gonna cry or faint or punch somebody, so I needed fuel for the next leg of my never ending journey and this was the quickest option right by the subway.Despite this apparently being a crazy busy place all the time (and it was when I went in), the staff were super, super friendly and upbeat. They never even broke a sweat. Apparently, this is something their employees are known for, and I don't know how I feel about it. It's great that people are being nice to me, I guess, but I'm skeptical. What are you doing to them to make them like that? Anyway, we're here to talk about the chicken and it's damn good. Really really good. I got the spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries, and have been back a few times to this and other locations in different states since. The chicken is crispy and juicy, not what I would call spicy but delicious. The lettuce and tomato taste good. The waffle fries are frozen and usually under cooked, so they're worth skipping (saddest thing on the menu really) but whatever, chicken!So I ate my sandwich like a rabid beast while waiting for my train, I think I growled at someone who was eyeing my public private moment too hard. It all worked out. I just have complicated feelings about the politics of it all...

The service here is awful, I went around 7 on Friday and it took 30 minutes to place my order and to get my food. The line reached the door and there was only one cashier. The food is wonderful but not worth the crappy service.

I probably eat here way too much and that will not change anytime in the near future.  There's nothing you can orde here that will not be amazing!  It can get ridiculously busy in here during lunchtime whether you order in advance or not; during the week, just be prepared.  There's ample seating on the upper levels although I still have yet to check out the roof terrace.  The staff is freakishly friendly and they're happy to grab refills for you and thank you kindly for your business.  Be sure to try all of the sauces and the salads are a surprising treat as well. Eat more chicken.

So I love Chick-fil-A but my experience at this location was a lot to handle to say the least. First of all the link started outside. Once I finally made it inside it was quite confusing their were employees coming around taking orders from the customers whole other customers had to wait to get to the cashier to order. Once you finally put in your order there was barely any space to wait for your name to be called out. People were rude and didn't really if they pushed you or not. The employees were trying their best but there was an overwhelming number of customers.Buying lunch from this place took about a total of 45 mins. Disclaimer: I didn't know this was the largest location they have and that it attracted so many people before deciding to go get lunch from here.

My family loves Chick-fil-A.  I was looking forward to visiting The World's largest Chick-fil-A.  Food is always excellent.  I knock down one star because of the way we ordered food.  I understand it is lunch time in the Financial District... however, who would imagine you had to wait to order fast food on the sidewalk?  Luckily we only waited about 5 minutes after being told by the girl at the door to wait on the sidewalk.  Once inside the mess was even worse...people waiting for food, both dining patrons and mobile order patrons.  The waiting area is really not big enough to accommodate all the people.  Other than that, the rooftop is really nice...it was just too hot today to eat outside.  We will be back when the weather is cooler to eat on the roof, with World Trade Center in the background.

This is probably a good choice after hours and ona weekend, but to go to this location at 12pm is not smart. The line was out the door and round the corner. No it was not the opening day, so I was really confused. The manager had to come out to ask patrons to move all the way over because you block ppl on the sidewalk. The take out order libe is to the left and pick up orders online to the right. It was a bigger mess inside because you had to check in at a kiosk to get your food. Someone on the take out lone has a hand kiosk so your order is placed fairly quickly. Better yet your food is not sitting there waiting for your arrival. The quality of the chicken sandwich with fries including the sauce was wonderful. That's why I've given them 3  s instead of 2  s. Maybe coming on a weekend after lunch would definitely be best.

This has been a great experience, the grilled chicken was great and they messed up my order by giving my fried chicken. The women immediately came to me and gave me a grilled chicken nuggets and let me keep the friend ones for free. They also let my whole group of friends bring our bikes in the store. I reccomend this place

My wife and I always come here for the same three reasons each time: their delicious/nutritious Grilled Market Salad, exceptional Frosted Coffee, and last but not least, their wonderfully friendly staff!

I love chik fil a , but was surprised by the condition of the Fulton street location. It was not clean and there was a bizarre leak from the ceiling right in front of the cashier area (perhaps something went wrong on the second floor)? I ate on the third floor, but that was not very clean either and there were a ton of flies all around. Usually a chik fil A is always spotless, even when insanely busy. My sandwich was fine (but the tomato was a little anemic looking and the bun was not toasted) and the staff were very friendly.  Perhaps it was just an off day.
The spicy chicken deluxe & waffle fries were delicious. Service was great and the rooftop at this location is a major plus. Can't wait to come back!

I really enjoyed coming to this location and I really prefer this one. It's huge and the seating is ample. The line goes out the door sometimes but the workers are extremely efficient at taking orders as doling them out. The trash cans are electronic so you don't have to touch them and the bathrooms are big and for the most part, clean considering it's a fast food restaurant. I ordered the spicy bucket sandwich, waffle fried and a cookies and cream milkshake and I really enjoyed the milkshake. They were so nice and gave us one of each sauce to try to see which one we preferred.

I already loved Chic Fil A. Best fast food restaurant ever..I don't eat beef so the fact that they only offer chicken doesn't bother me. I love their Spicy Deluxe sandwich that comes with pepperjack cheese, lettuce, tomato & pickles. I slather it in buffalo sauce. Their tenders and nuggets are also really good. Their chicken is actual chicken & not pumped with fillers. Their fries are delicious especially when they're super hot with ketchup. I am also a fan of their milkshakes & frozen coffee. This particular location is usually super packed but it's 5 floors so there is always somewhere to sit. It's actually one of the coolest fast food restaurants for that particular reason. Employees are quick, efficient & even when they are working hard to keep up with orders manage to stay friendly and with smiles.

Although the line seems intimidating they get people in fast. Within 3 minutes of ordering my food I had payed & received it. Beautiful interior design with a nice rooftop access to dine in. Definitely coming back.
Dont use the mobile app for this location.. For the 3rd time this chick fil a app has taken my money and then said there is a problem with my order.. Thanks alot no food.. And im out of money..
Love the chicken sandwich .The sauces makes this so much better.We had this in DC and in New York !The Best sandwiches.

I'm not sure what happened, I've been completely sick all day after eating this at 1. I just got the strength to write this. I will be avoiding this place from here on, I heard such wonderful things but there was something not right with my order. Service was great hence the 2 stars, wish I didn't get a stomach virus. Much success to the franchise.
Great place and the grilled chicken nuggets were actually pretty healthy highly recommended roof deck at Top Notch

I wish I can give 6 stars!! The food and the service of this place really amazes me. ALL the staff were so friendly and helpful and they all seem to go over the top to serve others with a big smile and positive attitude. I can't wait to go back again. Oh and the chicken sandwich, waffle fries and shake?! Delicious!!!
The service is spectacular... I was amaze of the nice service they offer. I especially love the rooftop seating too.

Wanted to give a shout out to the manager of this store, Tom. He went out of his way to deliver sauces to my door when Postmates failed to correctly order them. Not only did he deliver sauces, he also delivered new food since mine started to get cold. That man deserves a raise in both status and pay. Chick Fil A is already known for their nice customer service but he went above and beyond. Thank you again, Tom!

I wanted to give a shout out to Dominique who was at the register today. My order was wrong when it was taken while i was waiting in line and he was super nice and polite about fixing it. I'm new to the establishment, having only had Chick-fil-A twice before today but I have to say if customer service is consistently this good and friendly and the food this delicious, I will definitely be returning more often!Good service, good attitude, good food, good prices. Super efficient!

This place is nuts during lunch on the weekdays! It was so crowded that the restaurant had to get out a queueing strap to form a line outside, and have an employee stand at the door to limit how many customers enter the restaurant at a time. It's so busy that if you make any modifications to your order, you should probably expect them to get it wrong. I ordered extra pickles on my sandwich, and instead received no pickles. Not a big deal, and I just chose to eat the sandwich as I received it.This chick fil a is 3 stories tall and there's a soda fountain on the second floor, so you never have to go back up to the counter to refill soda. Probably a good move on their part to prevent even more chaos.

Of course the world's largest Chick-fil-A would be located in NYC's FIDI. But I ain't complaining. I absolutely the building. The aesthetics are totally on point with a very modern color scheme. This Chick-fil-A is made up of five floors and there's even a rooftop! It'd be kind of hard to run out of seats here, huh?I went on a Friday evening and the line moved very fast. After having a below average experience at another Chick-fil-A in the city, I was just pleased that my food was warm and not cold. The taste is like your average Chick-fil-A. I got the Spicy Chicken sandwich, chicken strips, and waffle fries. Just make sure you get the Chick-fil-A sauce.When I sat down at a table, a worker came over and wiped it down. And when I was on my way to throw out my trash, another worker offered to do it for me instead. What an amazing group of staff!

No one was happier than me when I started seeing Chick-fil-A restaurants popping up in NYC. After spending 26 years in Maryland I got hooked on the chicken minis and waffle fries. This location is the newest addition to the New York line up and as always service and quality has not taken a step back in NY. I love this place and I'm so happy they're here!!!

I was the happiest when I saw this place being set up considering I just moved from FL and I now work across the street. The team at this location works really fast and they are all friendly. I love how its 3 floors, and how they have the sauces in the stationary area by the trash. Keep up the good work everyone!

It never fails. No matter which Chick-Fil-A you go to within the NYC area there will be a line...lol. But rightfully so cause their food is so damn good. This newly location of Chick-Fil-A in the financial district could be hard to find at first being in the heavily congested and narrow streets of Fulton in lower Manhattan not far from the World Trade Center. They have rooftop seating but from when I went there last week I think you need to place reservations to be a VIP to eat on the rooftop....yes...reservations...for Chick-Fil-A. A tad bit over the top but I guess I can somewhat understand that for business meetings and all for those that work in the area. Had my usual of the Deluxe Chicken sandwich and medium waffle fries along with a chocolate shake and of course Chick-Fil-A didn't disappoint. Nice outside view from inside the restaurant of Fulton Street, while enjoying your meal and can even charge your phone or electronic devices as well. Not sure if I will plan on ever making reservations to be a VIP here lol, but this is a good added addition to area being that Chick-Fil-A has become very popular in NYC.

I don't know what the fuck happened, maybe it was rush hour lunch or something but some idiot didn't even try making my sandwich today. The spicy deluxe with no cheese, was made with the lettuce outside of the bun, and double stacked my tomatoes. I eat here everyday, or try to but today was the first and possible my last... love the food but dam... who in the right mind let this happen?

Slow, slow, slow on a moderately crowded Thursday night about an hour before closing.  Hope they handle the lunch rush in a more efficient manner.My chicken was puny.  It's almost like they were using the breakfast filets on the regular sandwiches.  Who knows.The place is nicely designed but doesn't have the standard Chick-fil-A customer service.  A loud, derogatory "Hello?" isn't exactly the best way to summon your clients to the register.

I've been to this place on two wholly unenjoyable visits. It's a complete and total mad house, loud and unnerving. Organized chaos at best. Ordered the same kids meal two times. Both times it was given to me incomplete and quite frankly rather smugly given the outcome. First time didn't get the juice. But at least I caught the mistake outside the store and came back in. So I gave it a second chance. The second time I didn't get the toy and I had to hear about from the 8 year old when I got home. To which I replied, "won't be a 3rd strike." Just that simple.

This Chick Fil A has never failed me. Their food is always delicious and their staff is so kind and accommodating! Even when the line gets long, and when I say long I mean looooonnnnggggggg, they keep it moving quickly and efficiently! Their chicken minis on their biscuits for breakfast are sooo good! I could also bathe in their chick fil a sauce.

Omg the spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries were everything. And the gentleman who took my order was super sweet and patient with all of my questions , recommended me  his favorite sauces,asked me where i am coming from and wished me safe travels at the end not a typical fast food restaurant service at all , thank you
It's very slippery out front. The grease covers the sidewalk and fills the gutters. Greasy footprints are being tracked into the new Fulton station.

The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is due to the wait time. Since it is newly opened the lines are pretty long but it is worth it! The staff is courteous and you feel welcomed coming in. The physical plant is clean, I would definitely recommend when you are in lower Manhattan.

WOW this Chick-fil-A is THE best. They get it RIGHT every time. I have been no less than THIRTY times since they opened two months ago. The BEST staff. The BEST service. If you don't do anything else in the financial district, GO TO THIS CHICK FIL A!!!!!!!!!! 105/10 recommend

$1000 mínimum for a catering order to be delivered?!?!?! You have to be kidding me!!I called to place an order for a lunch meeting and the lovely person ( no snark, she was very nice) on the phone said that the minimum to order for delivery is $1000. Not $100.

This location is probably the most spacious with multiple floors and even an outdoor rooftop deck. It gets extremely busy during lunch so highly recommend you use the mobile app to order. This location is still fairly new so they are still very friendly and they greet you with smiles. One cashier told me they were trained to do so.

After my sisters suggest I go here I decided to go...two whole years later. Chick Fil A wasn't big in NYC as of yet so I brushed the notion off. But I saw that a new one opened in the Financial District--just a few stops away from where I live. Why not?I got to the location and the line was extremely long but it moved very quickly. A very nice young lady took my order and in no time I was at the register paying for my order. The cashier was so nice! I gotta give it up to the staff for being so patient and kind. I've never seen customer service like this at a fast food restaurant. I sat on the roof top which is located above the third floor. It's small, very modern looking, and has red tables + chairs as well as a bench and some flower pots. I had my meal and got to look straight into the extremely tall buildings that hover over the Financial District. Plus it was lunch time, so the air was filled with chatter from ppl who work nearby. No smoking is allowed though thank god.I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich with fries, a lemonade, and the very hyped Polynesian sauce. It was okay lol. I expected more but the simplicity of the meal was cool. The menu is overwhelming though. Tbh I wouldn't go out of my way to return because the food is average. Enjoyed my first time eating there though. I think I'll come back to try their milkshakes.

Fantastic Chick-fil-A:* Rooftop deck that's very nice and gives a good view of the downtown skyline.* Fresh flowers on the table.* Multiple levels.* Incredibly kind staff: wonderfully nice people who came around, offered refills, alerted us to where our children had run off to, and went above and beyond when I forgot to get one item from my order.5 stars for the food, ambiance, etc., and 20 stars for the staff.  They'd melt the hearts of even the most hostile New Yorkers.

Used to going to Chick-fil-A's in NJ; for busy Manhattan, I was surprised with the speed of the order. Employees were a pleasure. Be prepared to wait a bit, since it is so popular, but worth it. Also, plenty of seating on the floors above.

Chick-fil-A you never disappoint. This is one of a handful of new stores cropping up in the NYC area. You order at the counter, get your drink/dipping sauces and move to the side to wait. I've been twice, and the line hasn't been long for breakfast or dinner. Service is friendly, and they even have rooftop seating! On this particular visit, my nuggets could have been slightly warmer, but the waffle fries, lemonade and vanilla cone were up to par. You better believe I'll be back - I only hope not too often.
Not only did they get my order wrong the first time, but TWO more times after that they continued to get me the wrong thing

Five stars for a Chick-fil-A. I ordered ahead using their app, having been warned about the lines, which by the way are insane. We waited maybe five minutes and someone delivered our piping hot food. We went upstairs to one of the long tables. It's totally upscale and I couldn't believe I was in a fast food joint. I wish this stuff wasn't so unhealthy because I'd be back regularly. I'll have to head back when the weather gets better though to check out the roof deck. No complaints about the food. I haven't had a Chick-fil-A in about 30 years since I left the South and it was so good.

I got there and there seemed to be a long line, granted it was probably a lunch rush. My friend and I just trekked it in 90 degree to get some sweet sweet Chick fil A, a tiny slice of home. I thought all hope was lost looking at this line. Then, my sensible friend says we should just stay and see how the line is moving. And wow I'm glad we did. The line moved really fast and there were staff taking orders digitally in line.

I like this location so much more than the one near 47th street!! Though it is busy, the amount of seats honestly makes up for it. It's super spacious so I don't have to get my food and rush out. The staff is pretty nice and the food is obviously great. So much better than the fake stuff you get at McDonald's or Wendy's. I always get the spicy chicken sandwich with small fries and a drink. The sandwich is always really juicy and the fries along with the sauces are great. Always get the chick fil a sauce. It's bomb with the fries AND sandwich. The other sauces are great too though, especially the Polynesian and sweet & spicy siracha. Come here if you need a fast food fix, you honestly won't regret it.

I love chick-fil-a and I'm not ashamed. I was so excited when I heard the biggest chick-fil-a in the world was opening right next to my office. I highly recommend using their mobile ordering app as their lines are still crazy long. With the app you order you food and when you get there you enter your code into the kiosk and then they start preparing your food. I like that it's not a pre-order system and they don't make it and leave it sitting, it just lets you skip the cash register/ordering line.  I prefer coming for breakfast because it's not crowded in the mornings. Having breakfast on the rooftop is going to be my favorite thing this summer.

This is a very busy location I suppose due to its proximity to a major train station and hub. This system for ordering seems to move pretty smoothly for getting everyone's food on time. I will say it is a bit chaotic but there seems to be a method to their madness. The employees are cheery just like any other location of chick-fil-a. My frosted sunrise came out 1st and it was delicious as usual. As for the nuggets they were a bit dry and I think a little old. The fries were piping hot and delicious probably better than any of the other locations I've been to in New York City. All in all it was a good visit in if I'm over by school with a hankering, I will be going by.
for only $12 man this was good i went in right before the long crowd of line occurs and my food was great fast and the amount of seating is crazy alonf with the atmosphere great place

I'm so disappointed.  I love chick-fil-a. However the experience here was off, off,off.  Today was a nice day so I decided to finally make the trek to the Fulton location. It is disorderly and chaotic are the best descriptions I can give. The girls with the "its seen better days" lamented menu items in had and mini order pads require better training and customer service skills. I download the mobile app - ordered and paid for my meal that way.  As I wait, wait, and wait some more I notice that I'm not hearing my name called. A customer walking out with food passed me, so I stopped him to ask where he received his food. I head in that direction and still no name. I walk up to the register and I explain I had a mobile order and didn't hear my name. The chap at the register was charming - wore a smile and made an effort to find my order. He asked if I was certain it went through. I responded yes. The order was not on the screen above.  A manger entered and help. Found the order, and said it was misplaced, apologized, and Bob's your uncle.  However, hand off girl with the red hair takes the chicken stripes places in bag, with 2 napkins and hands to me. Um, can I ask where is the sauce I requested via the app?  Please at least do your job and read. This is not the Chick-fil-a I know. Keep riding the wave, but the very backbone which have followed your brand from the Midwest desire continuity.  Chick-fil-a in CT represents your brand, not this joke. This was not a Chick-Fil-A experience.

There was a giant rat outside, with people talking about "exploited workers." They had the audacity to make us wait outside while protesters were blowing whistles in our ears. Then, after we make it through the crowd of angry protesters, we're served cold chicken. Nasty. Bad.By the way, it's never a good sign when people are protesting your establishment. Disgusting--I'm never going back.
Best Chick Fil A in town.  The chicken is so juicy.  The staff is also full of the sweetest baby angels!Thanks Chick Fil A

I absolutely love the layout of this location! Sitting inside on the top floor & it's so quiet and relaxing, truly makes me feel like I'm back home in the South! Food is great quality as expected with every Chickfila, and the employees are just as kind. Plenty of seating here, and you could definitely have a casual meeting here with a friend/coworker or get some studying done for sure. Very convenient location for those who live their lives downtown, instead of having to go all the way up to Herald Square. Love the rooftop! Keep up the good work!
My favorite Chick-fil-A in the city! The food is really good and the service is always wonderful. Tyrek was covering the rooftop when I ate there last and he was super friendly and attentive.

As always, Chick-fil-a didn't disappoint. This 3 story (with an awesome rooftop) brand new location is incredible!! The food was just as delicious as it always is. The service was great too- very friendly! Go grab a chicken sandwich and head up to the rooftop for a great view while you eat!! We will be back!

I love Chick-fil-A, I love rooftops, and I love sweet tea.  This location has everything you could want out of a Chick-fil-A and a little more, but it's a bit slower than you're probably used to. We went around 10am on a Saturday and this place was packed -- not surprising because it's a PRIME location right near One World Trade, just off the Fulton stop. Normally, even when it's packed, most Chick-fil-A's will get you in and out insanely quick, but we waited probably close to 15 minutes for our food (three biscuits & 1 hashbrown). We weren't in a rush so it was fine, but it was noticeable especially since there were so many others waiting for their food as well.Beyond that, this location is awesome. Four floors -- floor 1 is where you order, floors 2 and 3 are full of seating, bathrooms, soda stations, etc., and floor 4 is the rooftop. I can't say enough about how excited I am for this rooftop!! Opened just in time for warmer weather. There is a decent amount of seating and a long bench along one of the walls so they really take advantage of the space. The food was amazing as always, the sweet tea was sweet - just how I like it, and the customer service is top notch. Will absolutely be back.
Really impressed by the food, customer service, and the building. They have a roof deck where you can eat.

Much love for Chick-fil-A. As my born and raised New Yorker friend told me, "twice in one week? You people are crazy about your Chick-fil-A." You people meaning those of us that were lucky enough to grow up eating more Chick-fil-A chicken. 4 Stars because with all the hype I expected an incredibly large and fancy pants building. Didn't quite live up to the hype and my imagination. It's tall, it's nice, but it falls in line with other Chick-fil-A's I've seen as far as quality of building, mints and food. 5 Stars because of the location. I HATE trekking to midtown, so I really only got to go when I was already in the area for whatever God-forsaken reason. Now I can actually go when I want because it is far closer to my neighborhood AND located in a lesser circle of hell. Together that makes 4.5 Stars that rounds to 5.

For all of you who have questions regarding what's on the 4th floor.It is all refrigerated coolers. Got this info from another CFA owner operator.This CFA looks amazing.The friendliness of every employee is genuine and will stay consistently that way.If you don't care for the waffle fries, ask for a bag of kettle fried lattice chips. Very tasty. Very crispy.May add some cost.

As a Florida native, having a chick-fil-a down the street now is great! I love their chicken with their special sauce. It's so crispy and tasty. But my favorite thing on their menu is their ice cream. It is seriously one of the best vanilla soft serve I've ever had. It's unbeatable. Not to mention the cashiers here are really nice!

It's so cute to see NYC get introduced to Chick-fil-A :) My husband and I checked out "the largest Chick-fil-A in the world" a few days after the grand opening.  It was a cool item to add and check off of our bucket list!Like all Chick-fil-A's, the staff (in training) are extremely friendly. You can tell that the staff was in training because let's be real, NO ONE is as friendly in real life as the staff at Chick-fil-A lol.Let's talk about the size - now, if you know Chick-fil-A, you know that they are pretty small. So, it's an easy feat to be the largest Chick-fil-A in the world. The size of the building wasn't impressive but it is in a nice location. The food did not disappoint! Same good ol Chick-fil-A! If you are new to this amazing fast food joint, try the Cookies and Cream milkshake. Just do it. It will change your life! I have dreams about this milkshake.. (fatty at heart). I usually get the 8ct nuggets but I also like the Grilled Chicken Club sandwich with the waffle fries of course and ALWAYS Chick-fil-A Sauce. I am obsessed with this sauce. I always like to get a little extra for my house... Yes, I'm addicted lol We'll be back when we need our Chick-fil-A fix. I just wish it was closer to my house so that I can stop in for breakfast for a Chicken Biscuit. It's honestly one of the best chicken biscuits out there!

Right now don't come at lunch time, the line extends all the way down the block to Broadway. Breakfast  time is still an option.  This hole in the wall location  is swamped  with people  trying to eat here for the first time and 100's of people  trying  to redeem  their free chicken  sandwich coupon which  was given out months ago as a promotion. Fries weren't  anything  too special,  they should be cooked  longer. The fried chicken sandwich was juicy, hot and on a soft  bun. Menu is limited to chicken with something  else. Frozen lemonade drink is a winner. Owner is a great guy going out of his way trying  to please everybody. I hope that they do catering.

Staff is awesome confirmed. Even remembers to ask you if you wanted any condiments because I've been that person who forgot to ask for sauce and had to eat nuggets dry. The atmosphere is fun clean and new. Seating upstairs and their lobby is relatively well organized. They have an automatic trash bin which is pretty cool.Took off stars because I came by for breakfast and was expecting a soft warm and chewy English muffin but instead got a dry crumbly one. So... It's going to be a no for breakfast. It's so bad. :T At the end of the day, I can deal with bad service but why bother coming if the food is terrible too?

I don't know if all chik-fil-a's are like this but the staff are super awesome. I just scarfed down a #1 meal and this kind gentleman asks if he can take my trash. This is fast food with class. It usually takes me a bit of time to get around to review s, but dude who just provided exceptional service to me on the first seating floor a few minutes ago; you deserve 5 stars. Now the food; chicken is juicy, biscuit is fluffy and very buttery, with the right amount of crumbly. I like my biscuits a little taller with a bit of crunch on the outside, but these were still great for the price. The hash browns are neatly stacked in a tiny box, bite sized crunchy and not dripping oil. I got a large coffee instead of oj (probably should have gotten the oj). Coffee is fine as well.Overall, great meal for$7.52 (including tax)

I have been to a ton of Chick Fil A restaurants and this may be one of the coolest locations (it's 4 stories) I've been to but I was really disappointed with the quality of the food here.Have you ever had a chicken sandwich that didn't have toasted, buttered bread?  Well, I did for the first time and was not a fan. Typically when a chicken sandwich is made the bread is supposed to be toasted and buttered, and my bread was neither of these things. It actually was a little hard. The fries tasted like typical fries but they only filled the cup halfway (so maybe order up if you are starved). Mobile ordering doesn't really help get your food quicker either. This is because your order doesn't get processed until you arrive and have entered in your code into the kiosk. Every other Chick Fil A I have been took allows you to choose "I'm here" so that when you walk in they have your food prepared. Overall nice Chick Fil A but I wouldn't make it a priority to visit next time I'm in town.

This is probably my favorite fast food restaurant (after In-N-Out, obviously) Unlike traditional fast food restaurants, Chick fil a stays true to super fast, yet fresh food. I usually get the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich meal which comes with your choice of drink and a side. The sandwich is so amazing. The chicken is perfectly breaded and has just the right amount of spicy kick to it. Even if you get the sandwich for takeout, the breading stays pretty crispy, which is a plus. The only reason I took a star off is because their fries are pretty inconsistent. Sometimes they're perfectly fried and crispy, but sometimes they do get a little soggy even if I eat the fries right away. :(By overall, the people who work there are super sweet and accommodating which I think is great especially for tourists coming to visit this location. FYI!!!! During lunch time, it may be faster to just wait in line instead of ordering on the app! (BEHAVIORAL FINANCE, PEOPLE!!) But if you're coming after the lunch rush hour, I'd definitely recommend ordering through their app, especially because you could stack up points and getting free food for it

After becoming a fan of Chick-fil-A, I decided to trek to their newest and largest location.  In a city where space is premium, they picked a location where is very narrow and just built it up 4 stories. (I'm counting roof where there's almost 40 seats).  The view from the roof is quite impressive.  It's located very close to One WTC, Oculus and right next door to Fulton Center.In my quest to try many different things in Chick-fil-A, I got the regular nuggets and grill nuggets and the last two sauces I haven't tried.  The nuggets looked good, but unfortunately I'm not a fan of either.  Of the two,  I liked the grilled one a bit more.  The regular was tiny pieces and was crispy and also was a bit salty for me.  The filet form factor seem to be my preference.Seems like Chick-fil-A will be very successful in the big city.  Their HR dept sure knows how to hired the right people that genuinely looks like they want to help and make your day better.  All the other fast food companies have a lot to learn from them.

The spicy chicken sandwich deluxe is pretty good. The nuggets are made of real chicken meat. The line is a bit long but moves fast. Lots of seating upstairs which is nice. And a lovely lady came and grabbed out garbage. Service is 5+. The food is good but would not say I need to have this anytime soon.
Use the app to pre order.. that line is redic ! Service was fast for the line that was there.

The service here is truly awesome. This is the only fast-food joint that I ever get chicken at because I can tell that Im eating real chicken, you know? This new Chick fil a is soooo nice, clean & modern (5 flights with a rooftop). The staff is super kind & professional, as in all their other restaurants. I even got a free coffee shake it seems they made on accident!!

Texas may have claim for everything being bigger, but no one knows how to literally one up that claim but New York City. While the city was initially apprehensive about welcoming in someone from south of the Mason-Dixon line, after getting our teeth into their chicken, the city has welcomed it in with open arms. Capitalizing on the trend of building up, not out, the store boasts the largest footprint ever built, and features 3 floors of seating, including a rooftop porch, with views of 1 World Trade Center. Having shown up on the first weekend, I had expected a few fumbles or growing pains, but the line moved quickly, my order came out hot and fresh and everyone gave me the Chic-fil-A southern charm. Given the limited floor space the store actually has on the ground floor, the line can definitely grow out the door, and waiting may be a bit of an issue. My advice would be to order ahead, so you can pop in, grab that delicious chicken and go about your day.

This shit is da bomb. I haven't actually been to this location but I have been to Chick-fil-A before and tbh wanted to be one of the first reviews. Sue me. Also, who gave it not a 5 star???? R u one of the cows in disguise? Please show yourself, do not be a COWard ha haha. Hahahah thnx for your time

I can only assume that Chick-fil-A flew in folks from their Atlanta locations for the launch of this flagship downtown location because danggggggg people were super nice. I felt like whoever the founder of Chick-fil-A is must've been taking pages from Ray Dalio's 'Principles'...or maybe it's the other way around? There was a cult-ish fascination in which the greeters greeted you...but then this cloying friendless flowed through to your encounters with the cashiers upfront, their supervisors hovering behind them, the floor managers aimlessly wandering around and the custodians letting you up to the rooftop. This place is fine. It's efficient, it's friendly, and it's incredibly bad for you.
They are Fast and friendly. Good chicken sandwiches for someone in a rush. Place is clean and plentiful seating. Recommend a number 1 and 2.

Today was opening day and it surely did not disappoint. It was indeed a grand opening. I did not get there early but around 1-2pm and the line was down the corner so I decided it wasn't worth the wait since there was no deals, no giveaways (at my time of visit) and all was at regular price with the staff handing out paper menus. I came back 30 minutes later and the line was shorter. Many staff members on hand on every floor to greet and keep things in check. Everyone I met on each floor were very friendly and greeted me with a smile.Ordered a "Hand-Spun" milkshake and a Chick-fil-A Chicken. Crisp and as good as the other Chick-fil-A I have had on 6th Ave and 37-38th Street, Manhattan. The milkshake I can say is better and can only compare to the other fast food places like McDonald's and Burger King or Shake Shack as also pretty good.The first level has no seating, it's just where you order. It is said to have five levels, possible. But the elevator only takes you to first, second and third floor then the roof. Hmmm, is there a secret to the fourth or did I overlook it. Each of the second and third floor has a seating area to the left and to the right and soda fountains+a condiment stand. I didn't look for the restroom because I did not need. Not sure if they have. The roof is a small area with waterproof like tables and chairs with a view down across the street and a view of the top of the Freedom Tower. It's a great casual dine area when warm but when in extreme temperatures/cold/rain, etc... sort of like today when it's a little chili; I did not want to sit there and eat long, so I took mt food to a lower level.So what made this visit besides the food was the grandness of opening day in sharing EatMoreChicken with other Chick-fil-As and the view from the roof.
Grand opening in financial district today!  Everything was fresh and as tasty as other locations, free cow giveaways today too! Mobile order ahead to skip the long lines

On my way to work this morning and I pass someone with a Chick-Fil-A bag. He could have come from uptown but on chance I asked where he got the food and he pointed and said, "next door".Soo...next door to Fulton Center in Fulton Street is the BIGGEST Chick Chick-Fil-A EVER. Four dining floors. An elevator. A roof deck (a roof deck? Whoah.).And the friendly well trained staff that you appreciate with your dining experience.And that chicken. Yummo.All things chicken from arguably the original fast food chain featuring an all chicken menu.Welcome to downtown Chick-Fil-A.Looking forward to many more encounters.
comment

If you want Mcdonalds customer service at a Chick-Fil-a;This is the location to come to.Horribly ran! They going to blame it on being busy, when then shouldn't.Worst Chick-fil-a location I've encounteres in the nation.
Would give zero stars. Horrible food. Horrible location. Horrible drive true. Horrible outside line. What a waste of time and money. Food taste like it was microwaved.

There wasn't much to get wrong tonight tbh. We only ordered two drinks and a cone and was charged $10. You'd think we would at least get ice in the lemonade and two straws? The second drink wasn't even filled up all the way.

Went through the drive through twice and received the wrong order. The manager, MElina is terrible and careless. As I explained what took both times she brushed it off and told me to call the 800 number, I explained I just wanted the right order, she told me the kitchen had closed and it was 10:26. Very unfortunate considering the representation of chik fil a customer service . This location is terrible
Worst costumer service ever!! No manners. Gave me attitude, gave  me the wrong Order. Took too long. Worst chick fil a ever!! Never coming back to this location
The staff seems strung out. Nobody took our order. Fighting and arguing at the window with each other.
Love everything from the cookies, to the Polynesian sauce. Staff is always courteous and exceeds expectations. Fan for life!

I have only been to chick-fil-a 2x since I arrived to LA. In all honesty I do not know what the hype is all about. I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich combo was it good yes, but not mind blowing good that I need to go once every 2 weeks. Service and food was good.
This place needs serious help. Like always the longest wait. Not enough staff at the window. Dirty outside. Baddddd food quality. Just all around STRUGGLE !!! It is not my pleasure ...

I'm tired of coming to this location for consistent bullshit I keep paying for my food  asking for specific directions in which it seems nobody can follow ... they lady at the window asked me double well done  to insure the job gets done and what do I get ../ still some half fried Bullshit I'm done giving my money to this location . I'd rather give it to the homeless man at the end of the drive thru begging for change .  I didn't get my nuggets double well done , I didn't get the sauce I asked for better off tossing thus shit in the garbage thanks anyway  I will not be eating here again .. SB if people cannot follow simple directions ... maybe you should see if they even have a high school diploma or maybe they are illiterate and cannot read the signs that instruct them how to prepare the food .

Very long wait (35 minutes in the drive thru), order wasn't ready when I got there, bun was stale, fries were cold, ordered extra extra pickles and there weren't any, no strawEveryone was pretty nice, but overall quite disappointed...I feel bad, but this is one of the most negative reviews I've left a place.

This is not only the slowest and least efficient Chick-Fil-A I've ever been to but also probably has the worst (drive-thru) service I've experienced at a Chick-fil-A location. The drive thru attendants I've been helped by have often been unenthused and honestly seemed bothered by my presence. One of them made a smart remark into his headset to a colleague as I pulled forward in the line. After waiting my entire lunch break to get my one sandwich, I was reluctant to find that every bite of my sausage biscuit had at least one bit of rock-hard, sharp material/substance that made the sandwich pretty unpleasant to suffer through. Definitely will not be returning.

While the food is always hot, fresh, and delicious, I do wish they wouldn't make their employees stand outside to take orders. There is only a short window of time, especially in Fargo, when it's either not to hot or not to cold and making them stand outside to take orders when it's cold and blustery outside is awful. I know that you want to get customers through the lines quickly and you want a more personal experience, however, I believe using the drive up speaker and having a pleasant employee at the window would work just as well.

By far the WORST Chick-fil-A location I've ever been to. First, their layout for the drive through is TERRIBLE and the line is always around the corner and blocking the street. Once you get in line it seems like it does move and there are always workers taking order in line so that's not an issue.However, more than once I've come here and received my food, delivered out by worker, while I was still stuck in line behind 6+ cars with no way to leave without waiting for them to get passed the window. Most would think - okay great, food was delivered quickly! But that really doesn't matter when the food delivered is COLD and I still have to wait in line behind some slow af cars because I'm blocked into the drive through. Only reason they get 2 stars instead of 1 is because both times they forgot my sauce which I specifically ordered and the slow wait time in the drive thru gave me a chance to ask for the sauce at the window.  I've struggled for a while whether to even support Chick-fil-A because of their anti LGBT views and would justify it because well their service is so good! Not at this one! Since this is the closest to me and their service is absolute GARBAGE I guess it's finally the excuse I need to cut them out for good.

Every time I go here i end up waiting longer for door dash pick up, simply because the window workers fail to communicate with each other.I walk upMe: Hi. Order for _____Window Worker #1 : it'll be up in a couple minute Window Worker #1: *walks away*Window Worker #2: * continues the job*Me after 15 minutesChecking back on OrderWindow Worker #2 : oh here ( hands me order that's been thee for 10 minutes)Seriously... how hard is it to read ALL READY ORDERS.Every time I go here I wait longer than I have to because of the space cadet window workers at Pick up.

This location is awful but they make it work. I could not believe how quickly we were in and out of there. Their team is definitely a well oiled machine and I was very impressed. Lastly, food was piping hot and tasty per usual.

This location always get my order wrong. They always rush in taking my orders and when i get my stuff, something is missing or the order is completely wrong. Just today i ordered for base salad for my husband (since he is a vegan) and gave me the one with meat in it. The other time they charge me with two salad that i only ordered for one. I come here almost everyday coz unfortunately this is the only chick-fil-a near to my place, and my husband loves their salad. I come here 3-4 times a week for the salad and 70% of the time they got my order wrong. Why did i wrote a review just now since this is a recurring issue? I actually dont know. i would think since i frequently get my food at this location they would have recognized that im a frequent customer and prompted them to not "f@ck up my order". I'll just have to convince my husband to find another place to order his salad coz its frustrating or i just have to drive to western branch. Its seems like they got their shit together.

Second time giving this location a chance and had the same experience. Both times my food was under cooked and its hard having to come back over during lunch break. Don't recommend going here during rush hours because it seems like they are rushing to get the food out instead of making sure it's all the way cooked.

I have not yet open my Mac and cheese and I see a black hair . It is hard to see because of the clear container . It's on the right corner of this picture . Very gross . This is my first time order at this restaurant Chicken Strips.
No more breakfast are you kidding me? Anything to save a dollar I guess, sellout rats

The customer service here topped and beat anything I have experienced before!!! The location by my house stopped serving breakfast last week I found out. They said the sunset location is serving breakfast. So this morning I decide to go when I get there I notice a sign that they  too In fact are not serving breakfast anymore and they will open at 10am it's was 9:50 so I decided to wait and grab a chicken sandwich and not make it a complete waste of time. It's 9:58 and you see the manager stumbling in 2 mins before the store opens. It's 10:05 and they have not opened the restaurant and they already have a massive line. At this point I can't leave I'm stuck so I call the restaurant they pick up and I ask them if they can open the lines so I can't get out of here!!!! Literally half a min later the start taking orders. I asked the if they are not serving breakfast they said no. Okay I ordered a deluxe chicken sandwich and pull forward. They allow me to pay and I leave. As soon as I left I opened the bag and something wasn't right it's a regular chicken sandwich just bread and chicken. I drive back and walk up to the window. The manager tells me they are not serving deluxe chicken sandwich and I asked why since they took my order for one. We are out of tomato and lettuce she says. So you guys just trick the customer and that's okay???? I asked for a refund and left. Horrible deceitful tactics !!!! Who doesn't inform the customer hey we are out of what you ordered would you like something else instead ??? Wow just wow!  What is going on with these locations ?? Clearly no shits are given.
Just as good as any neighborhood chick fil A. Nice employees. Good service & consistent flavors. Spicy chicken deluxe & waffle fries for ever yum nom tum tum.
They don't serve breakfast which isn't posted anywhere so I didn't find out till I was already in the drive thru and the staff in the drive thru is super dude here. I don't recommend this one.

I went to this Chick-fil-A two days ago in the morning the team member taking my order was rushing me and looked so impatient. When I got to the window the manager didn't even seem to care what I had to say and when I received my order it was absolutely horrendous the spicy sandwich was so tiny and tasted nothing like what I get at other cfas. The hash browns were undercooked they were white. Sadly I was so hungry that I had to force eat them! I hope managers who do care take care of this review!

LEAST friendly or even tolerable staff, consistently,  of any Chick Fil A that I've ever been to, and that covers 25+ years and multiple states' worth of visits. Does this location throw away the company and employee handbook when hiring?Ride, disinterested and unprofessional.Maybe 1 out if every 8 employees seems to care, and 0 act like the friendly, courteous staff the chain is known for.

When I walked up to the window to pick up my order around 4:30 8/21 the woman (she had pink hair, glasses, & her name started with an N I believe) had an absolutely terrible attitude. When I asked for my drinks I was immediately given an eye roll and attitude...which doesn't make sense considering it's my order. Then she threw 2 ranch cups at my bags and I had to ask her politely not to throw them at me. I didn't realize employees left their morals at home. This shouldn't be accepted treatment for your customers, as someone who works in customer service I know we all have our days but that was utterly disgusting behavior. Not to mention the food wasn't great either for the way I was made to feel. Disappointed to say the least, lost a loyal customer.

do not order postmates from this location. not only has my order been wrong on multiple occasions i feel like the delivery people have been in my bag. i don't like that feeling. do not order through postmates!

What is happening to their regular chicken sandwiches? It used to be a breaded chicken breast on a bun (Yum). Now it is a breaded chicken patty just like the old time fast food joints (Yuck). I hope this is not the end of the original Chick-fil-A sandwichThis review pertains to: 6240 Coit Rd, Plano, TX 75023

You'd be lucky to end up with 3/4 items you order. I will drive 20 mins across town before ever entering this location again. Out of every 10 orders they'll get one or 2 correct. This is actually the most dismal accuracy I've ever witnessed. Called to ask for a refund the last time I ever went there. They didn't give me my drink, Mac and cheese or fries and I ended up with 3 chicken strips instead of 8 nuggets. I was yelled at by the manager and told that if I wanted anything they would remake it and I would have to come back to the store, when I was already back at work. Obviously very angry about something happening but it didn't have anything to do with me. She yelled at me and told me she wouldn't do anything and then escalated to nearly threatening me to not to come. I will never return as that manager will surely tamper with food to get back at a customer. This location is an absolute mockery of the Chick-Fil-A name and mission. Stop sending me free coupons I'm not coming back lol.

This location is a complete disaster.  There are cars in line causing traffic jams all around this venue.   The store should take the responsibility of traffic jams that it is causing.  Please take social responsibility...
I found a hair in my chicken tenders from this place. When I approached them, they didn't not seem to care and I was not offered nothing from this.
This is where the poor service is!  I was not given what I ordered, I lost time and nerves ...
Food is good, but it's ridiculous how there is ALWAYS missing items on delivery service orders. It's really not that hard

I live up the street and always came here but recently it's gotten terrible. The fries are ALWAYS soggy and limp and they always forget my salad dressing. It's kinda weird I don't know what happened. New staff?

Worst chick fil a !!! Do not go there !!!! That place needs to shut down!Worst customer service and food is undercooked. To top it off they overcharged me 40 dollars when it was supposed to be 22 and change. I'm sick and tired of their lazy work . They get my order wrong constantly . I give them the benefit of the doubt because you think the next time they will get it right but no . I just think to myself they used to be on point a while back . There has been a few times that the people taking my order have an attitude. Excuse me am I pissing you off because you hate your job ??What pisses me off is that I tell them that I've had many bad experiences and all they say is I'm sorry . Really ?? Starbucks gave me 2 gift cards because they made my drink wrong and I was like wow they know how to keep customers . Chick fil can give 2 flying f**** if you had multiple bad experiences. I can't believe I'm this mad about a restaurant thats supposed to be the freshest and nicest people . Horrible ! Horrible ! Horrible ! I hate this place now. If they offered anything to compensate for all those horrible experiences I wouldn't be writing this review . Do your job correctly and don't piss off people chick fil a .

The service isn't the best at this location. I specifically asked for just the sandwich but was charged for a combo. I asked for a drink but they didn't have it. Instead of offering to refund me for the drink I paid for that they didn't have they offered substitution drinks. So I got a sandwich but had to pay for a drink and fries as well.

Customer service was disappointing, server seemed bothered by our very presence and even more so when asked about dressing options that were clearly not on the menu. He even looked at the menu as of to want to show me were I should be looking but quickly realized the options weren't listed. Thank goodness the food didn't match the service

Love being instructed by an employee to move from the lane we were in to another, only to have 7 other cars proceed to get their food ahead of us... Most frustrating thing of my life to sit in a lane I was made to go into and watch customer after customer come and go!!!!

Why this sandwich is soooo good, I have not figured out yet.Is it the marination?is it the reputation?The dill cucumbers awash in acidity?The clean, fresh faced kids praising Chick-fil-A for the pay?The buns?My guess, a combination of all.Excellent sandwich, minimal wait, very clean exterior.Who would want anything more than a Chick-fil-A today?

I am very disappointed with the food order. My wife asked specifically for two dressings for the salad at the order station because last time, she did not get any, and it happened again this time. I pulled up to the window, and the lady gave us the food without salad dressing again. I reside less than 2 minutes drive from Chick-fil-a. When I got home and opened the order, the fries were cold and tasted like wood. The sandwich was cold, and the chicken dried up. I honestly don't know why my son loves this place so much. On rare occasions, I buy food from fast food places. This time was exceptional, and my last visit to Chick-fil-a. Hiring teenagers to do an adult job is a mistake. It kills business and literally leaves a bad taste in the mouth.

During the pandemic,  they started to make you order everything via the app to minimize contact. Fine. This should have resulted in greater accuracy. Not this location!   I think they get my order right maybe half the time.  Not exaggerating. I've gotten Coke instead of diet coke; a chicken sandwich when I ordered an egg biscuit; a sausage patty for no reason at all -- it's all over the place.  And when I take it back to the window for correction, they have a lousy attitude about it. And unlike most menu apps, there's no follow-up, so you're never asked to rate your experience or give feedback.  Maybe this is why the AWFUL customer service persists at this location. Still, it's Chick-fil-A, so you love it or you go somewhere else.

Didn't feel safe in the drive thru; workers stand WAY to close to my door... I am wearing a mask, face shield AND safety glasses yet still in fear of how close they were to my car. Take a hint from In N Out across the street; they stand FAR AWAY from your car when they take your order. There are AIRBORNE VARIANTS of covid and you want to stand so close to my car FOR WHAT? It should be ALL via speakers done btw... It's not safe to have employees standing so close to my car, I legit felt in fear the entire time. On top of that, if they take your order when you drive in, how does that give you the opportunity to view the menu? And I don't want to ASK them or SPEAK because that is how viruses are transmitted. It's important to LIMIT the amount you speak with customers etc because its not safe. Didn't ask me if i wanted sauce with nuggets and i didn't want to ask for it at the window as i saw an employee standing there with the mask pulled on. Work on KEEPING A FAR DISTANCE FROM THE CUSTOMERS. SO UNSAFE AND UNCOMFORTABLE. At In N Out they stand a few feet away... Here they stand right next to your door. I DIDNT FEEL SAFE AT ALL.

I went to this location, I ordered a deluxe chicken sandwich with bacon. Got my sandwich on my 30 min break. Open my sandwich to no bacon. I understand it's a busy day but at least have my order correct if I'm paying an additional 1.50 + for bacon

Worst curbside service I've ever experienced. They forgot about us all. I used to come here years ago & th drive thru was always fine. Did a mobile order tonight, got there, had to wait another 25 mins before I finally got fed up & walked over to the window. They gave me my food, but that is NOT curbside service. No acknowledgement of their poor service, no apology for making me wait way longer than I needed to. I won't be coming back.

I went to chick-fil-a on sunset tonight around 10 pm and they had at least 20 cars. They had cars backed out onto the road and the wait wasn't that bad at all. They were operating two lines through the drive thru at a time. The girl taking my order was very kind and efficient; as well as both staff members at the drive thru window. Even though they were clearly very busy they moved things along quickly, had great attitudes, and got my order correct and warm.I love chick fil a especially their Mac and cheese and chicken nuggets! (Especially with the chick fil a sauce to dip them in) had to add a little bowl of fruit to be healthy and of course I had a lemonade as my drink. Definitely one of my favorite chick fil a locations I've visited!!:)

Coming home from work one day, I was craving something I've never gotten after a shift. It was a Saturday, too, so I knew it'd be open. This place was just the right remedy since I only had a light lunch. It was somewhat packed in the drive-through lanes, but they moved fairly quickly.I ordered a Spicy Chicken Sandwich and a Chick-fil-A Deluxe Sandwich. I tend to eat the spicy selections with a side of ranch so I got a couple of those as well as several packets of the Chick-fil-A sauce, which is hands down the best sauce of them all.I thought I'd save a sandwich for another day but I ended up eating my lunch and dinner in one sitting. Starting off with the Spicy Chicken and drenching every piece with ranch provided that soothing kick before every chomp.When I moved on to the Deluxe, I was feeling adventurous and alternated portions with each of the sauces and every combination was a different experience. I didn't eat the rest of the night and I didn't feel like I needed to run laps around my neighborhood right after either. What an experience.
Worst Chick-fil-A ever.... they always mess up my order. Line is always long, but somehow the food is always cold? Also they wouldn't value the coupon that is on their actual Yelp page?

DAAAAAAAANG. This how y'all coming ? I find it outrageous that I spent $12 on the #7 combo to end up with 9 fries in my medium size fry box likeeeeee YALL don't have enough potatoes or what? Jeremiah Cillpam what is this ?????  I'm wildly offended.

DON"T EAT HERE!!!!I NOT ***FAST FOOD was in line for more than 20 minutes (typically 15-30)  when I got my food I was charged $27.00 more than it should have been. When I wanted a refund none was available and I was given meal cards that were only good for 2 options of lower quality food items not a gift card as I asked. They told me it would be good for ANY food item I wanted not to worry, up to $9.00 for each of the cards. BIG LIE!!!! Even though several of us are glueten intolerant there was no exception made. I was expected to have my receipt, from weeks earlier or know the exact date and amount of the total bill and how I paid.. Life has been extremely stressful as we both work from home have travel for business and homeschool and childcare provide for my daughters children, in addition we are going through renovataions so the dumb receipt in this wacky Covid world wasn't exactly a high priority. I felt like I was being called a liar and that I had to go through alll my credit card statements to see if I paid cash or card. I have NEVER EVER been treated like this! How would I have gotten the cards and why wouldn't they simply give me value for value of what they overcharged me? After trying to redeem the wonky worthless cards sitting in line FOREVER and mutiple phone calls. NO ONE CARES! So as a fellow Christian Chick Fil A I will choose to take my money an TIME to IN N OUT, another Christian Co that actually believes their custmers without exhaustive proof. Oh, make sure you have an hour for lunch or dinner or don't bother!!!!! Eat more COW less CHICKEN!!!!!!! One Star is too high but it's as low as I can go! *You can no longer or the waffle fries or the chicken well done, which means they are 90% of the time mushy not crispy so we have to cook them more if we want crispy food. If you do want Chicken, the folks at Popeyes, KFC, and El Pollo Loco are MUCH NICER and actually value their customers!!!!!!!!!!! I spent hours on there mistake, clearly my time and patronage mean 0000000000!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Unhygienic in every sense of the word. I literally saw someone take their mask off to sneeze while holding food. Not cool.
The least friendly Chick fila I've ever been to in terms of employees and customer service.

I don't like giving bad reviews, but this Chick-fil-A deserves it. I ordered a Cobb salad with no cheese, and no bacon. However I got a salad with cheese and no corn in it. I am allergic to cheese. Upon asking them to remake. They added beans on a Cobb salad and when I told them that I've never gone to a Chick-fil-A that adds beans to the Cobb salad they said that they always add them and they couldn't take them off. They also forgot my fries.

We attempted to order for delivery from this location two different times approximately two months ago and still had a bad experience both times. As usual, they failed to fill our bowl of soup all the way to the top, or at least near the top. In return, we received a small cup of soup instead of a bowl. As so many others stated, there is always something missing from the order. So many times when we ordered the Southwestern Salad, they would fail to include the tortilla strips and Chili Lime Pepitas. Other times, they would place almonds instead! The Southwestern Salad does not come with almonds; the market salad does! Following the last two experiences nearly two months ago, we decided to never order from this location again. We now order from the location at Western and Santa Monica via online delivery services and we never have issues with our orders! We have ordered from the other location at least twenty times within the last two months and not once did we experience issues as we have at this location. Yeah, we pay a little extra for the delivery due to the distance, but it's well worth it since we end-up having no issues with the order and always get what we order! It's nice to know there's a better option available than this location.

Located in the heart of Hollywood, California on Sunset and Highland, this location offers driver thru and a few outdoor tables without any indoor seating.The food here is as expected, very good. Tough to get a bad meal, or bad service here. The only issue is the size of the location, though it is never that busy.This location has walk up windows only. Hours vary but they seem to be open until 12 midnight on Fridays and Saturdays.

TERRIBLE service!!! Every SINGLE TIMEEE I come here they  get my order wrong and never fail to forget to give me straws or napkins on top of that. It's always an inconvenience every time. I'm tired of it. Don't come here. Save yourself the trouble and go to a different location

Horrible service from the person taking my order he walked right past me i had to open my window and flag him down the he tried to act like he couldn't hear fucking horrible. If you don't like your job do not work there.
