The only drawback is that their sandwiches are a little on the smaller side, guys may need more than 1 -- just like my DH. I don't think I'll ever get tired of eating chik fil a sandwiches.
Meh. It's Chik-fil-a. A decent one except nobody offers to refill your drink like they do at other locations I've been to.

Sent my post area guy to grab me dinner for the teenagers at my camp!! Oh my gosh, Chick-fil-a Catering came in CLUTCH!!!! Got my utensils all set up, the sauces in their large containers!! Simply in love

I've eaten here a few times after learning each location is a franchise that doesn't necessarily subscribe to corporate political views.  It is the most well organized, streamlined fast-food drive through I've ever encountered. There are two drive-through lines and live, friendly people standing outside with mobile credit card readers ready to take your orders and payment, and even answer questions. It seems like they have an endless choice of sauces that you are welcome to get several types of without any hassles. And the # 1 reason to try it: the chicken is actually chicken! I haven't had better fast food chicken anywhere. I highly recommend the spicy chicken sandwich. Minus one star for value. The portion of chicken is rather small for the prices charged.

This location has no inside seating but the service is good and Really fast. Rating it a 3 just because personally I don't think the food was that great. Vanilla coffee had no vanilla taste to it, fries are very simple plain tasting fries, and chicken was good but not the best.

This place is outside only with limited amount of parking inside their lot. They do have drive through which is a big plus. Just make sure to read posted signs if you park on street as there is no parking on Sunset Blvd between 4-7 pm so make sure not to get towed while you are eating.

The food is usually good here even though the service is seriously lacking. I think this is a training store. Everyone is usually very nice even if disorganized. Give yourself a few extra minutes for the service.

Drive thru line was extremely long. I decided to go inside instead, which I almost never do. I was pleasantly surprised that there was no one waiting. The cashier greeted us as we approached the counter. Once we placed our order, they told us that once our food was ready it would be taken to our table. Most chickfila restaurants that I have dined in did not offer that service. Within 5 mins or less our food was bought to the table. Fresh and hot as usual. I love the spicy chicken sandwich. It's my favorite thing from the menu and it never disappoints. I also ordered the grilled market salad minus the blueberries and blue cheese for my mom. Usually she's hooked on the salads Wendy's has to offer. But today after 2 bites of this said she said, "This is better than Wendy's!" I wish I had before pictures, but it was too delicious.

Food is good, the woman Tori who hands us our meal looks and acts thoroughly put out, both times we've visited. Every other location has given incredible service.No indoor seating, bathrooms are available. Water misters are on during the hot days to cool you while eating.

Great location, the cashiers are always very nice. I have been here at least 6 times and received great customer service. The food is always as advertised and pretty fresh, and they simply give you what you want in regards to sauce and other condiments without charging a arm and a leg. The one star deduction comes not from bad customer service, but rather I pulled up to order drive thru (which I usually never do) and the two young men joked and conversed for a good 45 seconds, I had to ask "so how do I order" and they apologized and took my order. But once I got to the window my order was wrong and although they were not going to charge me I insisted and made them charge me the difference, it was unusual that they had made a mistake so I am sure it was because the order taker was not listening.

I love Chick Fil A. Seriously. One of the best chicken sandwiches on this planet.Regarding this location. It can be very busy. But today I got lucky and there was no long wait at the drive thru!One thing that's a big bummer, only outdoor seating. It would be nice if they had some indoor seats to get away from the blazing heat and pigeons. The chicken sandwich has always been perfect. Warm and fresh. The lemonade is my go to drink here. The fries.... Mouthwatering. Must try with Chick Fil A sauce. They have a few parking spots, that's always a great thing in Hollywood. Free refills on most drinks I believe. Um, yes thank you!

The recent Chick-fil-A app successfully brought me back as a customer by reminding me that this is where the good chicken is.Recently the new Chick-fil-A mobile app was brought to my attention and I couldn't pass by a free offer of its delicious spicy chicken sandwich. The sandwich is every bite as juicy and spicy hot as I remembered. The pickle and the tomato are nice accessories but the chicken definitely stole the spotlight!The food is amazing but I had to take a star off for its location. There is no indoor seating and just not enough outdoor seating for the waves of crowd.Expand the location please! Chicken is still amazing!
Fast, friendly, great food and service.  And in Hollywood I was able to park easily all the times I have been there.

Chic-fil-A Hollywood!This place is always busy and is on a super busy intersection of Highland ans Sunset which makes the tiny parking lot hectic. However during the lunch hour rush they have multiple people in the drive thru lines taking orders from your car before the menu board to speed things up. They did a great job at that. Lines of cars were spilling out to the side street but the cars steadily moved thru with orders ready and paid for by the time you pulled up. Nice!Food is what you would expect. Get that Polynesian Sauce!! Yum.  Chicken tenders are nice but I wish they were a little crispier. I tried the strawberry shake too and it was really good. Tasted like it was real ice cream. Anyways they are always crowded so they are doing something right, just be careful of the driving madness on the streets.

Love this Chik fil A, excellent customer service. The whole team was polite, patient and friendly. I enjoy coming here because even though they're always busy, they put customers first and genuinely speak to you, and the service is excellent. Thank you! Happy customer*

Jonathan made our experience at this location wonderful! Great customer service! I'm definitely coming back because of how genuine he is with all of the customers, making sure everyone has been taken care of!

Who doesn't love real chicken? I like their nuggets with the chic fil a sauce. Their salads ate also good. Oh and their lemonade. I always get lemonade or an Arnold Palmer. I haven't had their breakfast but it's on my to try list.

I never have a bad experience at any CF I go to. The food is always fast and delicious. The employees are nice and sometimes I'll come across a bad one but I don't really care because their food is always so good.
What can I say?  It's Chik Fil A.  It's its own food group.

While staying in the area during the holiday season, having such a place close by was a blessing on nights when you just want something good and affordable to eat. The first time I actually came across this franchise was down in South Carolina. At that time I had arrived too late and they were closed. And i did not have an opportunity to go back. So I was very excited to have the opportunity to try the food out. From what it looked like there was no seating area in the inside. There is slather area outside with tables set up.  Customers make the orders through a few windows and then walk around to pick up the food when your name is called. I had visited the place twice in a week due to the location. Both times the staff was very friendly and customer oriented. The cashier that night was very cheery and personable. Not surprising that she was from San Francisco.  One somewhat comical moment sticks out in my mind. A bunch of customers were waiting near the pick up window and I definitely heard my name called. Now when I got to the window my food was not yet ready and I am very reasonably patient. At the window was probably a female supervisor who was just cleaning around the area and her body literally up against the window. Needless to say some or most of us were probably staring too long but I was there because my name was called. She addressed my by my first name and told me that my order was not ready yet. I was in Los Angeles around Christmas time. It can be crowded but everyone knows where the line is and I did not see any unruly people or line cutters which surprised me. This location is right near a busy and always packed In-N-Out burger. The food is very good and this place did not disappoint.   The humorous incident that I described above was most likely and isolated incident so should not be exists with every visit. But the good service and food seem to be a constant.

I haven't had fast food in 2 years but my girlfriend loves this place. (she really needs to stop eating junk) was in such a hurry today I decided to fall off the wagon. Did I just have fun in the drive through? Why yes I did. Just got the chicken salad sandwich which was pretty damn good. It almost didn't feel like I cheated.

The service here can be inconsistent, but the grilled chicken nuggets and a side salad are an awesome meal for a fast food joint.Sometimes the wait to order and get the food is long, other times it's nearly instantaneous. You'd think they would staff for more for busy times and less for slow times, but maybe it's too unpredictable to know. The grilled chicken has been an absolute diet savor when I'm craving fast food though and it's fresh and delicious every time.
Yummy chicken breast sandwich Not bad for a fast food restaurant But the portions are small

On May ,12th 10:20am I waited in line for for 20mins because they decided to open only one widow with 15 people waiting out side, the cashier was slow. When it was finally my time to order, the cashier mess up my order 5 times before he could finally get it right. When I got my order they give me the wrong sauce. Thanks Chick-Fil-A have a nice day

Some of the best and healthiest fast food ever...Their service is for sure the best.  It doesn't matter how long the line is you'll get through quick and they will make dinner for breakfast!  What is better...
Really enjoyed breakfast burrito!!Way better than MCDonald breakfast burrito!!!Pretty impressive when they delivered the items to the table we sat!Two thumbs up!Must visit!!

Fed up with this place. If you ask me what sauces I want then you should probably get that right. I have never gotten the correct order when asked so I have to sit and check every time, holding up the line because I can't put any confidence in the workers. Also, for the second time in less than two months today they forgot an entire order out of two orders because the employees were too busy concerning themselves with gossip about a small fender bender that didn't even hardly leave a dent in either car. Yeah, I should check my order, but once again I don't want to hold a long line up because I can't put my confidence in the employees to put two of two orders in a bag. I'm writing corporate about this location.

I think I'm addicted to this place! It's my go to spot. Whenever I'm hungry and need food quick it's just so convenient. At this location the workers are also really nice. Here's a tip: try anything on the breakfast menu and you'll be happy!
Bridget was a total babe and sweetheart. The most polite electronic voice box I have ever heard!

The Chicken Nuggets are my favorite on the menu.  Try the Chick Fil A Sauce, you'll love it.  Friendly staff, usually a quick drive thru experience.   Still hoping one day they will make  Spicy Chicken Nuggets....

Absolutely HORRIBLE! I love LOVE this gain but today was the first time I had time to sit in the drive thru for lunch. I ordered a chicken sandwich meal and when I say that the by was SO buttery it was falling apart and soggy that is exactly what I meal. I pressed my finger into the bun and the butter pooled. It was disgusting and such a disappointment. Maybe they should slow down a little and get a handle on the good food service that I came to expect but has sense lost. Ridiculous.

Don't recommend their cattering!  If you''re planning on placing a big order (more then 5), please make sure you give specific instructions on what you're ordering (food, sauces, xtra sauces, sauce on the catering trays). Twice i placed an order for 20 people.  The first time, they provided no sauces (what's chick-fill-a without the sause).  I was offererred a "complimentary tray (Nuggets/Stips) from the Hollywood location and somehow my order got transfered to the UCLA location and got a 7% discount (which i'm grateful for), but it's not worth the complimentary tray ($60) that i was offered on 1/27.  I'm hoping that this food doesn't get requested to be ordered again, but if it does, i'm ordering elsewhere.  The second (and last) time, they didn't include the sauce in our lunch boxes, and provided 30 assorted sauces (yes that would be one for each sandwich), plus no sauce on additional tray of 60 pcs chicken strips... and all i got was that i got 30 individually sauces (my order: 30 sandwiches, 60 pieces of chicken stips).  AGAIN left without the sauce and dissapointed a second time! The sauce is what makes their sandwiches taste better....they should provide xtra (if requested) or stop selling the chicken.

They gave me free ice cream with my fries the other night and it was kind of the most amazing thing ever. I even yelled out, "You guys just made me so happy!!" Chick-fil-a is probably my favorite chain ever, but the Hollywood store is the worst location ever. Long, confusing double lines and crazy waits. But I'd still wait in it any day. How else would I get my crisscut fries with Polynesian/Honey Roasted BBQ sauce??

I love this chic Fil a! The service is always great here. Even though the line is always long, it's super fast. The employees are super efficient. Of all the chic Fil a restaurants I have been to around the USA this one has the most flavorful food. If you ever have any issues the staff will fix it. My order has never been wrong at this location. Highly recommended. If you have time sit outside. There is outdoor seating.

Huge fan of Chick-fil-A so when I heard they were coming to Downey I was super excited. I work less than half a mile away so me and my co-workers order from here about once a week.  The restaurant is always very clean and the staff is very friendly. My only gripe with this location (and it's a big one) is that they tend to botch large orders. I notice this mostly through drive through but it has occurred to me when I walk in as well. I'm to the point now where I will take everything out and count it where as before I felt bad doing so because I'd be holding up the line. This has happened to me about 4 times on an order of 5-8 meals. Missing fries, wrong sandwiches...a little of everything. My usual spot was the Cerritos location (but it's too far just to pick up lunch) and they always have excellent service. After going there for years and years I've never once had this happen so I know it is possible. Over all this is a good place to visit but just make sure you check your order before you leave.

Just because you make your employees say "My pleasure" instead of your welcome doesn't mean that's good customer service. I almost never receive eye contact from any employee and they always act as though they'd rather be anywhere but at work. The food is fine besides the fact that it's usually cold. I was given an expired bag of granola for my parfait... Why do I still come here? Location.

Okay... I live right by this Chick-fil-a and I really wanted to write a 1 star review because tonight they messed up my order  on my day off fueling the fire of frustration (I asked for a chicken club meal and they didn't put any bacon.. THE MOST IMPORTANT PART!!! AND I GET CHARGED EXTRA!!!!), but after going home and taking a couple of deep breaths I realized that I have also had some good memories here. This place has great quality food, and that's why they get a 3 star review. The chicken seems of superb quality, tender and juicy. But the manager needs to do a better at hiring employees. They have absolutely no manners whatsoever and this is not the only time they've messed up my order, it's been at least 5 times out of the 20 I've been here... At least in my case (am I unlucky?) probably not. To give some kind of credit to this place I did walk my dog there and they gave him free grilled chicken nuggets.
I just love this place! The chicken sandwich was just as advertised! And my food was ready as soon as I pulled up to the window! And the staff was really friendly!

You can't eat inside here! It was cold and there was no option for indoor seating. Also, the tables were dirty with nobody to clean them. When we were ordering, the employees were rude and didn't take the time to make my experience pleasant. I felt rushed and unimportant. They also weren't expedient with our food preparation. We waited like 10 minutes for this "fast food." They don't have anywhere to get extra napkins for yourself, if you want any you need to wait in line and ask at the window. Also, no bathroom option to wash your hands! When I went to clean up my food, the trash can was overflowing too. Food was good though!

I need to make a seriously important announcement:If you have never tried Chickfila's chocolate chip cookie...YOU MUST DO IT NOW. DROP EVERYTHING AND DRIVE ON OVER. In general I'd rather have cake/pie than a cookie BUT THIS CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE IS BOMB DOT COM I WOULD TRADE IT FOR MY FIRST BORN ANY DAY. I know it's important to support local cafes and stuff but CHECK DEEZ CHOCOLATE CHIP BABIES OUT ASAP. YOU WILL THANK ME. Super crunchy but also very chewy and tons of choc chips.If the next time you see me I am 50lbs heavier and in debt it's because I've spent my life savings on Chickfila cookies.Okay other random things to note about this place:-Drive thru/To-Go ONLY. No inside seating. Plenty of seating outside though!- Drive thru is kiiiind of always super SUPER busy but waddaya guna do?- GET THAT FRIGGIN COOKIE ALREADY.
dreams come true here! Staff is always the nicest in town. Best food. Awesome atmosphere

My name is Philip. I really enjoyed my visit here today. A worker named Bella helped me with my order. She was very nice and cute. I admired how her uniform complimented her body. They were also generous with the sauce. But you can't be too generous because you can get lost in the sauce.

+ Parking+ Food consistency- closed Sunday's (when you want it most)True to Chik-fila them young crew members are polite The fried chicken comes from the clouds of Heaven. Only reason I won't give it 5 stars is because of the long drive thru waits.And they're not stingy with the delicious sauce.Check out my Comedic Relationship Podcast: Cake And Sausage on iTunes, Stitcher & Soundcloud

Spicy chicken sandwich $3.69- only had chicken and pickles.The chicken was fresh and tastes different from other fast foods but for the price, it's not cheap. For a dollar and something more $4 ish, then you get a Tomatoe, lettuce, and cheese. That's ridiculous in my opinion. An entire meal with a drink is $6/$7, *duckface* Sure its different from jack in the box. The quality of the chicken is better but the bread bun was alright. The fries is only good when fresh. I ordered the fries and sandwiches to take home and an hour later, my sibling was complaining it's soggy. She was like how come no Tomatoe and no lettuce. Lol oops it was a dollar something more. She did like the thickness of the chicken and that it was like real chicken breast though.I liked the chik FIL a sauce better than honey mustard. Just get the chik FIL a sauce and dip the fries and burger in. Those are the only thing chik FIL a is good for chicken and their famous chik Fil a dip!

The absolute worst location in America. Went to the walk up window. Rose got my order wrong three times. Went there for breakfast. Ordered a chicken biscuit, bacon egg and cheese biscuit and chicken minis. Instead of a chicken biscuit we got a bacon biscuit. Who the hell would ever want just bacon on a biscuit? Anyway, stood in line again to correct the issue. She came back with a biscuit with chicken egg and bacon. Wrong again. She told me she was sorry and I could have anything I want. I told her I wanted a chicken biscuit. She charged me for it again! At that point I didn't care I just wanted the damn biscuit for my hangry boyfriend. They just mess around and talk in the back instead of giving good service. Nobody even said my pleasure once.

Just stopped by to check this fast food place, because I always see quite a lot of people eating there around 7pm.The place is cheap, $6-7 for a menu.I've got the Deluxe chicken sandwich with fries.The chicken was nice and crispy, a bit too salty though. The fries were too tick and dry, you definitely should get some sauce for them.Overall the service is fast and cheap so for a fast food place its OK.

OMG a must when I visit Cali, grew up here and always loved there chicken breast sandwich. I hope they open soon some locations in Vegas. I enjoy there waffle fries usually upsize my meal to get more..lol I enjoy adding mayo my sandwich to raise the deliciousness, you can get packets to add to ur level of want. There chicken nuggets are also great, love BBQ and Polynesian dipping sauces. I recently tried there breakfast biscuit mini sandwich OMG a new added fav if I get up early enough and near a location when visiting family.

I've always been pleased with Chick-fil-A 's customer service but the location on sunset in Hollywood blew my mind. They had someone taking orders outside in the drive thru like In-N-Out  does to help get the line moving faster and they also accept card payments outside!!! I didn't even reach the pickup window and someone had came outside and handed me my order.  I couldn't believe how fast I was in and out of the drive through.  I loved that the employee outside greeted me with a nice big smile. I know In-N-Out has employees taking orders outside in the drive thru lines but for some reason it still takes forever to get your food unlike Chick-fil-A.I also loved the recommendation she gave me on the chicken tortilla soup. I've always enjoyed their spicy chicken sandwich.  As you can tell great customer service goes a long way for me!!!! Keep up the awesome job guys!!!!

There's absolutely nothing special about this place, if you like this kind of food then just go to McDonald's or any other crappy fast food, I really don't understand why people actually wait in line to eat their sandwiches. There is an inn&out two blocks from there! It is 10 times better and cheaper.
I won't support an establishment that supports mean spirited politics and inequality.  Stick to making bad fast food, and stay out of making ignorant comments.

I know that people go crazy for Chick-fil-A (some of them are my friends) and in the context of fast food, I get it.  But let's not go crazy and say that Chick-fil-A is anything more than really good fast food, definitely of a higher quality and on a different level than the basic chains like McDonalds or Burger King.What I really like about this location: two drive through lanes, a person that takes your order and sends it in via ipad and can even take payment by credit card - super efficient, and you don't have to talk into the "box".As for the food, the spicy chicken sandwich is pretty delicious.  It's pretty basic (chicken and a bun), but it's a nice, thick, white meat cut of chicken that's very tasty.  For $4 (no meal), I'm not complaining. Chick-fil-A is definitely a good contender for satisfying any craving for a fried chicken sandwich.My only complaint is the waffle fries. These are usually my favorite, but the ones here were undercooked and tasteless.  They should cook them for longer and consider some sort of seasoning.

ChickFilA food is always amazing. This location the person stands outside to take my order, when I get to the window everything is there. No waiting! Fast and easy! I normally get the Grilled chicken club. The best hands down!

I love this Chick Fil A. I love the food and in terms of service they do a great job in person checking in on you. I do wish with the drive through they would pay more attention to requests for sauces. The outdoor seating is a lot of fun here although parking can be a little intimidating.
Msg and chemicals in their chicken and bread. Massive headache led me to contacting customer service and finding out the ingredients. Never again.

I like chick fil abut I don't see what the big hype is about. The food is pretty good but not to be camped out for it. Nor to be waiting in a long as line for it. The chicken nuggets are like the size of a nickel and look at how much I get for the price. Not worth it in my book

Its the standard Chick-fil-A.  The food is their regular menu nothing special.  They have cool mist sprayers for the customers to get some relief from the heat.  I guess if you are a huge Chick-Fil-A fan then its nice to have this location.  Personally I think its a little pricey and not worth it.

Food -  3/5Service - 4/5Atmosphere 2/5Parking 1/5Cleanliness- 2/5Chicken sandwich is okay but the fries were a bit undercooked. If they fried it a bit longer it would have been better. Service was quick and friendly.but not perfect. At night, it's pretty dark and there is a diverse amount of people that loiter and eat here. Street are busy and it's pretty hard to find parking during the night. Place is okay but needs cleaning. Overall it's alright.

Would give 5-stars but they recently just started limiting the amount of sauces you can get with your order. I would like more than 2 honey roasted now sauce please. Other than that the food is consistently good and they handle their line very efficiently, especially given their location.

I crave Chick-Fil-A and this is the location closest to me. It is always SUCH A SCENE! The line for the drive thru is constantly backing up traffic and it is near impossible to find a parking spot in their small lot. Even given all of this, I go when I'm craving their chicken sandwich. Last night I went to grab dinner. Again, scene at the drive thru, to be expected. They have 2 drive thru lines, which you think would help but doesn't. It just creates more confusion at the window. This time, I saw them give my food to the car in front of me. They literally handed her my bag of food and drink. When they went to give her my shake, she clearly realized it wasn't her order. She handed the food back out of her car and into the window. This REALLY grossed me out. Then they had to fix her payment since they charged her for mine. This whole ordeal took about 10 minutes. When I went up to the window they gave me the same bag of food they gave her originally, YUCK and when she handed me my shake, the lid was off! From all of the back and forth, the shake was a runny mess, no longer fresh and creamy and the lid being off caused it to spill all over my car. I was SO pissed and instead of offering napkins, the rude girl at the window gave me a "Get moving" look. Normally the service at Chick-Fil-A is great, NOT at the Hollywood location! Also the fries are always mushy and need more salt. I will not be returning, will have to hunt one down that's close to work or on my way home or something.

I'm one of those wacky people that absolutely loves CFA's chicken sandwiches and waffle fries. Whenever I find myself in a city that has one, I go out of my way to grab some. Sometimes wayyyy out of my way. This trip was certainly no exception. This location is situated on Sunset Blvd.and in the midst of the very touristy area of Hollywood. They do have a walk up window and an outdoor seating area with tables, chairs , and umbrellas for shade. I'm sure the people watching at this location must be fantastic!We were in a rush and had to use the drive thru, however. They do have 2 lanes to help expedite things, which I certainly can appreciate. Even though we arrived during the lunch rush hour on Monday, they were still friendly and efficient. We ordered 8 sandwiches with some yummy waffle fries and drinks. I was shocked at how fast(and accurate) or order was prepared for us!....and of course it goes without saying that they are still scrumptious as ever!! I have 2 more left in the fridge as I write this review and I am already wishing I had ordered more!Yay! I'm a fan!4 stars.
Being from the south, I've learned to love this place.   Waffle fries and fried chicken-what could possibly be better?   It can be a little crowded here on Sunset  Bl but worth the wait!

Just went for the first time this weekend because my friend loooves this place and he pretty much made us come because it's never gotten my attention. I have to say they're 'ok'.I didn't get their famous chicken sandwich, instead I got their grilled chicken sandwich. I thought it was good for a fast food type of restaurant. I heard some people get hooked after their first try and I have to say I'm definitely not one of those lol. But hey if I'm lured in to come again if there's nothing else to eat then I guess i'll go again lol.

So finally got talked into coming to chill fil a and sorry but it's just "ok". I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it was ok. Someone told me I had to try the number one (fried chicken sandwich) and so I did and just wasn't impressed. The best for me was their Arnold Palmer drink which is a mix of lemonade and unsweetened iced tea. The drive thru is a nightmare and parking rare but if your a fast food person than you may enjoy more than what I did.

I'd like to start off by saying I'm someone who has heard a lot about CFA and respect the company ideals. I've heard about how CFA supports the community and believes in giving back. Aside from that, I've heard the food is simple phenomenal. I finally found time to visit the Hollywood CFA and was delighted by the service and blown away by the food. I ordered nuggets and enjoyed the frosty Lemonade. The first bite of those nuggets was love at first bite. I knew I had finally found my go-to place for the best chicken! A few days later I decided to go back because I got my intense craving for those nuggets and was sorely disappointed. There was a woman who looked like she was in charge who kept glaring at me as if I wasn't allowed on the property. I felt harassed and violated by how hatefully she stared at me. I have never met this woman in my life yet she had a problem with me. I proceeded to ask for her name but there was no need once I saw her name. NATALIE. I don't know what I had done to upset this woman but I can definitely say because of this experience I will NEVER return to this restaurant. Not only did she visually harass me, she was on her phone which is very unsanitary when you're dealing with food. I work in the food industry so I understand what IS and what ISNT acceptable. To my complete HORROR she dropped fries and proceeded to put them in a bag and serve them to a customer. I am disgusted and appalled by everything I saw. On top of that I saw her smart mouthing her own employees...what kind of leader does something like this? I am heartbroken because the deep respect I felt for the company has been torn apart by a simply horrible experience. Hopefully I can find another CFA that will uphold the standards I've heard so much about and maybe there I can be treated like a paying customer.

Coming from the east coast where there's usually a a Chick fil a every few miles, I was disappointed not to find many in LA. Compared to the east coast locations I've been to the food is on par. This location is difficult to get into. The line for the drive through is always ridiculously long and slow moving. There's no separate entrance to the parking lot, so you have to wait in the drive through line to get into the parking lot which is kind of annoying. That said, it's in the middle of Hollywood, and the fact that they offer free parking at all is wonderful.I'm disappointed that there's no eat-in area, but there is outdoor seating with umbrellas for most nice days. If you haven't had their food before, in general it's on par with Wendy's quality except the chicken is much more natural looking and thick.
The service and chicken sandwiches are always amazing here! Pretty fast drive-through and the fries are always nice and crispy. The shakes are pretty awesome too!

This place is trash , they hire ghetto employees  that serve you with attitude and tamper with your food. I just recently went there and they were so rude to me while I was ordering my food also they mixed high c into my dr pepper deliberately , my waffle fries were brunt! And the management doesn't care because I called serval  times and they still haven't done anything about it !!

Worst service worst attitude. I think everyone can tell the difference between a chicken sandwich and chicken nuggets. I ordered three sandwiches and they gave me three chicken nuggets. Nobody answers the phone when I call I do not recommend this place at all !!!! I will get this to corporate for the lack of knowledge and customer service!!! DO YOURSELF A FAVOR GO TO A DIFF CHICK FIL A
Perfect every time. Always nice. Always delicious. I hate the parking at this one. But it's always worth the battle.

I like this chic fil a a lot. Chic fil a is always amazing. The chicken is the best fast food chicken around and their sauces are to die for. I wish I could steal a box of Polynesian sauce. The staff are friendly, helpful and fast. But my boyfriend ordered the 8 nuggets and one of them was tiny (watch out for that chic fil a). Only outdoor seating snd you have to ask to use the bathroom.Also be aware they are closed Sunday's (the day I usually crave chic fil a).

I like Chick-fil-A, but this locations is bonkers to get in and of the parking lot. It's a hot mess. Traffic overflows into the street. It's really bad, even by L.A. standards. Can't believe the city allows it. It totally blocks traffic and creates a danger. If you don't use the drive through, there is no indoor dining. Everything is outdoors on the patio. I was there on a rare rainy day, and the everything was soaking wet. No outdoor seating.You also order your food outside, kinda' like Tommy's. Kinda'. Anyway, like I say, I like their product, just not this location. Like I said,  hot mess. Yah. Like that.

Awesome customer service ! Michael the manager is great! This is literally one of the only fast food places where the manager actually came out and spoke to us make sure everything was OK and actually got us refills this place is great and I will give it two thumbs up anytime!

Very busy location but the workers did a great job. The cashier even remembered me from a previous visit. Overall, they did an awesome job and the food was fresh! Way to go! Parking and traffic around the restaurant can be a nightmare though.

The food at Chick-Fil-A is great, and this location is very convenient since it's on Sunset Blvd. When I'm in the area and craving a chicken sandwich, this is the place I come to. This location has a drive thru that's very efficient, and they have outdoor seating as well. They have restrooms that are customer only, which I really appreciate because businesses that don't implement this rule have less-than-stellar facilities.You'll see a mix of different vibes here, which is expected because one city block in either direction will give you a different scene. All in all, it's a good spot to grab a quick bite to eat.I got my usual: the deluxe grilled chicken sandwich and a large original iced coffee. My friend got the 4-piece chicken strip meal. The food was great, my iced coffee was not.

Every Chick-fil-A I've ever been to is awesome and this establishment is no exception. We were seated outside and I appreciated the lady coming out to refill our drinks because it was totally unexpected.The sandwiches were well made. The only thing I don't like is how I finish my sandwich in under 30 seconds. I wish the enjoyment would last longer.This is a great spot to hit up for your late night munchies.

So I come here often since its on my way home from work. Customer service has always been good, it is chick fil-a and they do strive for good customer service. Foods always good. Today in the drive through, I guess the owner stopped by and drove up in front of me. Only know this because by the time I pulled up to the window, the sweet young man told me the owner had said I could have my meal free! Quiet unexpected. NEVER have had that happen! Anywhere! Deff speaks tons of the company! One of few food chains who actually appreciate customers! All in all, it's a really good spot. The lemonade is to die for.
Customer service is crazy friendly! Love it, and love chick-fil-a. Their coleslaw is to die for.

The employees at this Chick-fil-A location have an uphill battle.  Between the crazy bums disturbing people, the high volume of traffic it gets, and the constant littering by idiots, they manage to strive through all this adversity and bring the chickie.Oh, this location is open until 1am, so if you eat here after 12 midnight on saturday, you're technically eating Chick-fil-A on a sunday.

I just got done ordering and I got my food and then I realized I was never given my change and so I go back and the cashier says to me with attitude yes I did I remember giving you your change. But there was no change in my pocket.... And here he is talking back to me saying I'm being hostile and I was an upset customer and he made it worse by telling me I'm wrong.... When all I said was that you didn't give me my change you could even check my pockets. The worst customer service ever! Worst part I live in the apt building where their office is located.

I'm from tx and went to school in ar so chickfila is my jam haha. drove 20min to get my fix in Hollywood and it was great-cool outdoor setting but still has a (double) drive thru. Not the best chickfila I've ever had (they forgot my order and didn't say my pleasure haha) but I will surely be back anyways
I have this location on speed dial! I use them every week to carter to different places and have never had any problems! Yet to get an order wrong!

I am going to give three stars only because I love their food. The chicken sandwiches are simply superb. With this in mind though, my order has been taken by other customers numerous times and today when I ordered a #1 I was given some other meal that was not what I had ordered and did not notice until I had gotten back to my office.

Breakfast chick minis are awesome. I do not like biscuits and these are in a softer bread. Went here twice in one day and no chick fil a sauce for my nuggets and fries  although it says I ordered it on my receipt ... Very disappointed when I got to my hotel .

I LOVE CHICK FIL A! I've definitely ate more CHIKN since I tried it. My favorite sauce has to be the Chick fil a sauce with the fries! I've came to this location a number of times and the  customer service is always great! The food doesn't take too long and the employees are very generous with the sauces.

Never ever dissatisfied with Chick-Fil-A. The food is great and doesn't leave you feeling like crap afterwards. The customer service is always amazing. I don't mine the 15 minute drive just for those chicken nuggets and waffle fries!
You guys shod hire some stuff with some brains. Everyone that works there is retarded. They mess up my order everytime
I really like this location it's always clean and fast and the people are always in a good mood. The hours are pretty good too for a Chick-fil-A.

Never thought i'd be reviewing a Chick-fil-A, but this place had great customer service! Went through the drive-thru with a friend and a line that seemed would take forever moved by super quick. When it was our turn to place our order the girl working was so sweet and patient. There was some miscommunication with our order so we didn't get one of the sandwiches we wanted but everything else was great.Quick, friendly and delicious!

I grew up on Chick-Fil-A and it's my absolute FAVORITE fast food. I always get the #1 combo and tell them to hold the butter on the bun and put extra pickles on the sandwhich. So delicious. I went through the drive-thru and had 6 orders to place, and unfortunately, they forgot one of the fries. This semi-small lunch order was for a group of Execs that I work for, so guess who had to forfeit their fries? Waaa waaaaaa. Me. I called and left a message on thier customer service line (at the Hollywood location) and the manager called me back and offered to replace the entire order!!!! I was shocked. That was totally unexpected. Wow, they get an A+ on customer service. Really appreciate it, Hollywood Chick-Fil-A. Love you guys to the moon and back.

This spot is open late which is great but the locationIs terrible. It's in a busy trafficy intersection in the middle a not so great part of hollywood. But it's worth it for thoseWaffle fries n chickens

Came to this location for the first time. I was really worried about parking on a Friday afternoon around 1230 but I did find three spots open. I also found that it was easier to enter the parking lot where people exit the drive-through instead of trying to go where people enter the drive-through which is basically impossible. You'll be okay if you look out for cars because people are mostly waiting at the cashier window versus tons of cars streaming out where they exit. I really like this location because even though it's outdoors they have tons of water misters and surprisingly you get free beverage refills because a staff person will walk around and ask if you want more drinks. So they ask that you remove your lid and straw and she'll take your cup and refill it was whatever beverage that you had. The line here moves really quickly and the service is great. The food is good too. Today I had the eight piece classic chicken nuggets sweet tea and fries. I also got the ranch dressing but it also comes with some sort of chicken sauce as well for dipping. I didn't open the chicken dipping sauce and will just try it later at home with my own chicken. I've only eaten at Chick-fil-A a handful of times but it's nice to know that this place it is open until 3 AM. I really wish that they were open on Sundays though. There are plenty of umbrellas and tables and counter seating. I don't know if there's a bathroom here. It doesn't look like it. Do not park across the street at right aid because there is like a security guard watching to make sure that you don't park there and go elsewhere. Overall a fun location to go to because it looks so different and it's outdoors. I've been to the one in Westwood and there's a new one in Culver City pie of the store off of Jefferson which I need to go to at some point as well.

Not a bad place to eat. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with a smile and the food came really fast. I had the spicy chicken sandwich and fries with a small drink. If you are looking for a great place to eat that is quick I do suggest eating at Chick Fil A. The Restaurant has a very nice seating arrangment outside which makes for a relaxing place to eat your food. Five stars for Chik Fil A !!

Not bad not bad. Good place for chicken sandwiches. Their menu is basic but they offer breakfast, lunch and dinner. This Chick fil a's line gets insane during lunch time. Best time is around 130-330 pm. Sometimes the line is outside their parking lot!So far I have tried the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich, chicken deluxe, chicken strips, and their amazing fries.  I suggest you try this place. If going through a drive thru is your thang. They also have other healthier options if fried chicken is too much for you.

The staff have always been incredibly helpful at this venue. The food is fresh and tasty. The water spray around the building is awesome to keep you cool on a hot day. 100% recommend this as a fast reliable quality assured establishment. Refillable drinks too.. Just keep your cup and go back to the window.

Best chicken sandwich in Hollywood.  Yes I know its a chain, but that doesnt change quality. Patio outside is nice but I wish I had the option for indoor seating so the the occasional homeless person doesnt come up. Best customer service.
It's chik fil a man what else is there to say....duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh duh lollll

I love chick fil a. This chick fil a in particular is really good, service is great! Staff is very friendly. I usually get an original chicken sandwich with the original sauce, medium fries and unsweetened tea. My husband and I usually drive from eagle rock to come here when we crave chick fil a at night(they close at 1am). The only bad thing is they are closed on Sunday's, other than that it's great:)
This place has the best chicken strips and sandwiches ever.  I enjoy coming here and getting a late night meal after I'm done Ubering for the evening.

CHECK YOUR DRIVE THRU ORDER BEFORE YOU LEAVE.Went through a 25 min drive thru to arrive home to find a sandwich was missing from our order. On principle I would normally drive back and get my missing sandwich, but after a weeklong business trip and long flight home, that's the last thing I wanted to do. I sipped my sweet tea and ate some of my friend's donated chicken nuggets and went to bed grumpy.Sadly this isn't the first time chick fila has missed an item in my order.
Great sandwiches and super friendly employees.Wish it wasn't fried food, otherwise I would eat it every day.

The customer service at this chik fil a is impeccable. What really impresses me is Lisa, this lovely woman with a thick Chatanooga, TN accent, is always walking around cleaning up, shooing the pigeons away, and always making sure customers are being taken care of with their beverages and food. She is a star employee and pushes this business that much further.

Chick-Fil-A's Staff is amazing! The food is always fantastic, I usually order a Chick-Fil-A Deluxe Sandwich. The Sandwich is always fresh, as well as the frys!. The staff has always helped me with complicated orders with no hesitation or attitude. The cleanliness of the dining area could be better, but it's pretty clean for being close to the center of Hollywood, I personally have never been harassed by homeless people or drug addicts, although I have heard stories from close friends.This is a little bit late but they had a promotion for free Iced coffee all of February.

Chick-fil-A is consistently outstanding, and this location is no exception.  It's on the South East corner of Sunset and Highland.  Service is awesome. One of the staff members came out and asked if I needed a refill on my soda.  The food is exceptionally good at Chick-fil-A.  I would definitely return.
parking on-site, line moved very quickly. service was great- manager even came around and checked on us like we were at an actual restaurant. definitely best service I've gotten at a chick-fil-a!

I love chick fil a. The chicken tastes good, the people are friendly, and the sauces are nice. The only thing about this particular location, is that the parking lot is tiny. And this location is popular. You'd almost be better parking down the street and walking bs waiting in that drive thru line. This also often times causes your order to be incorrect, and there are many times I've been missing food, or even receive the wrong meal. I also bought the 2015 calendar card, and the staff seems to not know what to do with it, I have yet to use it without a hiccup. If you haven't had chick fil a before, go! But don't seek out this particular location.

I was brought here by Chef David Chang, who instagramed a picture of his chicken sandwich. In his post he mentioned that it was so delicious, it made him overlook the company's questionable business practices.I would recommend if you haven't tried. Asking for extra pickles is a good idea. Polynesia sauce was ok, similar to bbq sauce,  but the real star was the house sauce, which compliments the sandwich well.Service was good. Free cold brew coffee during the month of February. I'm not sure what these questionable business practices are that Chang refers to, but until I go back and enjoy this sandwich a few more times, I don't want to know. Ignorance is bliss.

3 stars for service however if I could I would give it 1 star for wait time I would. I have been in line waiting 30 minutes to get a kids meal. Be prepared to wait for an half an hour if you stop by during their rush period. So frustrating. Not to mention you are stuck in the drive tru even if you wanted to escape. Arrrrgggghhhh.

For some reason this location is just not getting it together. Been here 3 times and every time I wanted coffee an hour before closing there was none. Lines out the tail end of this place. Where can I get a decent fries chicken sandwich with my coffee?!?!?!

My 2nd or 3rd time visiting this establishment and I have to say I am not disappointed at all. They're nuggets are the best compared to any other out there! And they're chicken sandwiches are pretty good (I prefer the spicy sandwich over the regular one). Their service is great too, even in times of heavy traffic if you're just going through drive-thru. This place is definitely worth a try if you've never had Chick-fil-A!

I think their chicken biscuits have become slightly smaller over the years but they are still just as tasty.  And their milkshakes are top-notch.  One of the few fast food restaurants that I still frequent.
The best chicken burgers in town French fries are so good very friendly I always come here super friendly.
Consistently great! Enjoying a cookies n cream shake today with a smile! The employees always have a genuine smile and lots of common courtesy.

I love chick-fil-a, but this one has horrible service. What's worse is that most of it's from the rude manager. They got my meal wrong three times at the drive through, eventually making me park & said they'd bring it out to me.The manager comes out finally with a half correct order but forgets the drink and makes me get out of my car to talk to the people at the window to correct the order. I then get back into the car to realize they forgot to add the cheese I asked them to add at the drive through and told the manager as he was still outside. Instead of apologizing and offering to add it for free (at this point they had wasted nearly 20 minutes of my time), he snottily tells me I have to GO BACK to the window and pay for it if I want it added.
Best chicken sandwich. OMG. The chick-fil-a sauce is crack. The waffle fries are so yummy. My new favorite on the go restaurant.

This is the worst Chick-fil-A in the universe. Not only is the food here bland, the place is an absolute circus act as far as drive thru/parking. The drive thru line backs up from McCadden Pl. to Sunse t Blvd. So drive thru patrons sit in the far right lane of Sunset Blvd, while people actually trying to drive down Sunset swerve and lay on their horns. I also really condemn this location as they leave the surrounding area littered with food wrappers and take out bags. Their parking lot, all litter, continues into the street, Chick-fil-A garbage decorates the Rite Aid parking lot across the street, and I always see a sad looking Rite Aid employee having to sweep up the aftermath caused by Chick-fil-a. The milkshake machine is always "broken" late night. Weird.

To me this place is not what it pretends to be. I have tried a few different chicken sandwiches from Chick-Fil-A and I really didn't see the major difference in any of it. All the sandwiches are basically the same just with a minor swap of cheese or a different sauce or a simple add on. Really that counts as choices?? Not in my book. Waffle fries are nice, tasty and different than the ordinary fries everyone serves up.Nice part is that there are two drive thru faster service and faster drive thru.

Have ALWAYS had a wonderful experience with chik-fil-a.  Without a doubt the best drive-thru customer service I have ever had... consistently! I truly wish that all drive-thrus had as good customer service as this place. They are always energetic and sincere and understand my order the FIRST time I say it. I don't need to repeat myself 5 times and then get the wrong order like I do at other drive thrus. My gf lives down the street so I occasionally come here when we just want to grab something quick late-night. Definitely a little healthier than most fast food restaurants. Food is not the BEST I have ever had, but it is decent for the convenience and price.Overall -  Excellent consistent customer service! Exactly what every drive-thru restaurant should be like. Subtracted 1 star simply because food is just decent. Nothing spectacular though. However, good overall value and incredible service!

I was around the area and decided to see what the hype was all about.  I ordered the deluxe chicken sandwich and.....it was OK!!!!!!   I don't think Ill go back again.  Maybe ill try another location next time.

Spicy chicken deluxe with fries?! I'm game!I love their service for fast food, I've had their lemonade and it's really tasty & the chocolate chip cookie! It's amazing to me that at a fast food place like chick fil-a the staff treats you better than some other places around LA with a $$$! Great location- good food- 5star service!

Emphatic MEH!Mushy tomato, limp lettuce, and a lukewarm chicken filet: Don't bother me - I'm going to Wendy's.Seriously, though - this was my experience the last 2 times I ate here. And I've only eaten here 3 times. Wtf? Chicken sandwiches are *what you do.* Thing is, I only came here because the line was too long at Wendy's.There's a reason the line is long at Wendy's.2 strikes and you're out.

I Come here almost everyday for lunch. The customer service is amazing. The food is always hot when you get it and they hand it to you with a smile. I don't mind the wait when there is a line because I know when it's my turn I am going to get great service. Good job guys.
This is one of the best Chick Fil A's I've been to!! I absolutely love the service!! Tom is one of the most genuine workers you'll ever meet!

I loooooooooooove me some Chic-Fil-AI was so booooooosted (elated) when I heard LA was adding this lovely establishment to Highland and Sunset. What a perfect location!I was here for opening day about three years ago and surprisingly there were a lot more people that shared my same sentiment. I was surprised how quickly LA gravitated towards this place but embrace it they did.The staff here is beyond friendly and helpful. The way the staff treats you makes me feel as if I'm dining at 5-star restaurant (no pun intended). Yes, it is a restaurant but not the type you need a reservation for.I like the fact they have two lines for drive-thru and they don't charge ridiculous fees for condiments. That's right you can have an unlimited amount of condiments and it doesn't cost a thing, like J.Lo's love.It's tradition that all locations are closed on Sunday, so don't try them on a Sunday it won't work for you, TRUST.This location also has a spacious outside patio for eating if you choose to dine there.Actually, you can't dine inside here, there is ONLY outside seating.But it's LA, so it's usually not a problem, you dig?

Despite the public controversy, this place makes a superlative fast food chicken sandwich.  Very attentive service for a fast food place with free refills offered at the table.  Parking is a major PITA at this location.

Chick Fil A allegedly hates gay people. That's so NOT cool. It pains me, however, to say that the chicken is so good, I broke the boycott. Now, in my defense, when all that was going on, my gay friends couldn't stay away either, so I felt less guilty.The waffle fries are so amazing and fluffy inside while crisp and crunchy outside.  I. Often get the kids meal which is chicken nuggets, waffle fries and a drink for about $5. It's a nice little snack that hits the spot every time.

Hold THE PHONE! A fast food joint with generally happy and accommodating employees, exists?? Well unless it's a facade Chick-Fil-A puts on whenever I roll up to the drive throu counter (much like how the cow wears the chicken costume in this dining establishment's ads), then yes- such a fast food establishment exists!! If you're looking for a FAST BITE but think Whole Foods is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE and are too lazy to get off your butt, then Chick-Fil-A could be your staple... That being said, try and not make it a REGULAR THING as it is STILL fast food!! There are still chemicals, additives and sugars in all of their foods, even their grilled menu items. However, this place is far better/healthier than any other fast food joint I've seen.... And at least when you do receive your food, the employee smiles at you so genuinely that any guilt you felt about purchasing said meal will evaporate in 2 seconds. PS: if you wind up eating at Chick-Fil-A, employees actually come around and ask you if you need anything else (like a free refill)! When I saw this in action, I knew I had to write a little review!
The chicken sandwich I had was good, waffle fries are a nice change of pace but the hype is all this place is about and it gets fucking packed!

This place I haven't  been to in awhile and can see why....I ordered a spicy chicken egg and cheese biscuit and was asked 3 times by the operator in the drive thru I said "yes..a spicy chicken egg and cheese buscuit"...I got my order got to work of course it was wrong and I got a spicy chicken buscuit...I have been trying to call and get a hold of someone for 20 mins  now because I don't want to eat something  I did not order...their phone system is all a recording  and says leave a message for the manager to call back....I paid for a specific item and I did not get it...I have waited almost now 30 mins no call back etc...so I will have to eat it and document my efforts on yelp before I am told I never tried to contact them...Order placed at 824amCalled at 9am thru 923am no answer only recording and no one has called back

In short, parking here sucks, come for drive-thru only. There is outdoor seating, a bit dirty, and the cashiers or not friendly nor rude at this location. When you think of Chick-Fil-A you think of great chicken sandwiches, nuggest, sweet tea, and incredible customer service - topping the fast food industry along with In-N-Out. Nope, not this one .... Best thing, they are open late!
Tied for favorite fast food chain with in N' Out and Jimmy John's.  Quick service, delicious food, location can be a bit of a hassle.  Chick Fil A though is so good that it doesn't matter.

The spicy chicken sandwich is the way to go. Their honey mustard is very tasty and sometimes I mix it with there polynesian sauce: tangy, sweet,  sour... you've reached Flavortown (as G.F. would say). Sometimes I will order an extra grilled chicken breast, slide it over my fried chicken breast, and then you have one mondo sandwich. Great for a post-workout and not terribly unhealthy. Here's another tip, pass on the ice cream. Looks great, but tastes like ice-vegetable stock. However, while you're not eating ice cream, help yourself to a chocolate chip cookie. They are uniquely delicious with a little touch of an oatmeal-chocolate chip flavor. This chick fil-a is particularly well run. Everyone has always been very nice and accommodating at this location. My favorite midnight snack.

I;m not sure what all the fuss is about.  I guess I had In-N-Out-level expectations for this place based on the hype and controvery.  I got there all excited for some magical culinary experience, and what I had was a very well made yet unoriginal and uninspired chicken sandwhich.  Wasn't bad, and in fact was good.  Addictive?  No.  Worthy of a food pilgrimage ala Harold and Kumar Go TO Whitecastle/  Hardly.  But would I drive a few miles here for a quick, very tasy but basic chicken sandwhich?  Yes.

Best thing to eat from midnight to 3 am after them long nights in hollywood, never had bad customer service have excellent turn around time considering there crowd. ProsOutside seatingGet to watch intersection for all those holllyweird moments (saw this guy fighting the air and ended up head butting the bus stop) Big con would be that parking lot.

Chic-fil-a is Great!  I love how fresh there food is compared to other fast food places. All of there sauces are to die for and they give you only what you need. They dont just toss 10 sauces in the bag which most fast food places like mcdonalds and dell taco do. Ive been here many times and my only complaint is they dont have a restaurant near my house!!! SO GOOD!! oh and i forgot to mention the service is excellent every time I go whether it be at 12pm or 1 am. Always fast and proficient

Love the food, but they need to work on drive-thru service. 30 minutes to get thru?! Ridiculous. If I could of jumped out of line I would have. Either our meals should have been comped or they should of had cashiers outside helping move things along. After coming to the window, No apologies or mention about the long wait either. Not cool.
Best fries in town. I never had  fries that was that yummy and other hand they didn't charge any extra for the honey bbq sauce that's a big plus. I recommend everyone to try this place.
Was helped by a young man named Sterling. Had a great friendly attitude even though he was working outside in the heat with a line of cars down the street. Loved my experience.
I always come here and normally enjoy it very much here. I was unable to enjoy my food last time because there were multiple roaches all over the place. I was quite disgusted.

I'm not a big fast food fan, so I actually had never tried Chick-Fil-A before today. First thing to know about this location is that there is no indoor seating. Everything is outside, including the service windows. Luckily they have misters spraying on hot days, so it wasn't so bad to be outdoors on the day I visited.I let the gentleman taking my order know that I had never eaten at this chain before, and he was happy to suggest some of their popular items, and answer any questions I had. I ended up selecting the Spicy Chicken Sandwich meal, and it was ready in less then 5 minutes of ordering.If you haven't tried it, you should know that their classic sandwiches are served dry - meaning there is no sauce added to them. Honestly, the sandwich doesn't really need it since it tastes good on its own, but it is cool that they offer so many different sauce flavors on the side. This gives you the option to add what you want to your sandwich. I liked having the ranch with my Spicy Chicken.And I want to give a kudos to the service staff here. During my short lunch, I witnessed one employee handle cleaning tables as well as offer drink refills (since there is no soda fountain outside for customers to do this themselves). Even the manager came by to make sure I was enjoying my meal and had everything I needed. My overall verdict of Chick-Fil-A is that it seems to be a quality fast food chain on par with Jack In The Box, which to me is better than McDonalds or Burger King any day.

I've noticed similar comments in the recent reviews: the service here started out awesome when it opened, but it is just getting worse and worse.I went here at 5:30 today. There was only one pickup order window open. Alright. There was just one customer at that window. Alright. Cut to almost ten minutes later in 90 degree heat and me noticing that they're having an ongoing conversation about something that isn't even related to his order-- NOT alright. After ten minutes they finally finished with that one guy then I stepped up to the window. After three minutes of no one even glancing in my direction despite the fact the fact there were 6 of them in the building I left. I will return to this location eventually, but not anytime soon.

This place was a great replacement for the Carl's Jr that was there previously.  I had never even heard of Chick-Fil-A before they opened here and I gave it a chance; been coming back ever since.  It is a busy location and as people have mentioned parking can be difficult, but in my opinion it's worth it.  The quality of the food is much better than your average burger franchise, but you will pay a bit more.  Service is usually pretty good but I have to say that in reading local Yelp reviews over the years many have what are in my opinion unrealistic expectations of the service, and I'm not just talking about restaurants.  This type of attitude is bound to leave you disappointed, no matter where you go.  If you buy the annual calendar(s) for like $6 you can try most of their menu items in a calendar year (one per month) at no cost with the card that comes with the calendar.

First the all most of the customer service here in Los Angeles, Hollywwod, or CA . Sucks really bad if you're black unless the people behind the counter are black. Then it depends on the person.  So I just want to say that fact that this has diversity and doesn't look like the rest of the city is breath of fresh air.  Everytime I go to this location I'm greeted with a smile and some of the best customer service I've ever gotten in the horrible city.  So if you want great food and good customer service this is the place to go. And it doesn't hurt that this place likes real american.

my summary of chic fil a1. I asked for crispy chicken u gave me grilled2. r u fkn stupid who do u think I am I do not eat grilled chicken ugh3. Then proceeded to disappoint by giving me BBQ sauce when I asked for ranch4. Asked for crispy fries and my fries were so limp I almost puked wow 5.Y'all real stupid I am truly upset6.ALSO I told u my name was luna but you saved my name as lube .. Do u think this is a sick joke chick fil a my name is not lube wthEnd result-Chic fil a real stupid real dumb chic fil a u fail also u against gay marriage so why did I even try to support u ew

Review based solely on the shake. I ordered a cookies & cream shake. It was amazing. Seriously one of the best milkshakes I have ever had the privilege of buying. (~4$ small) The price is on point with the texture & taste. Creamy and ridiculously thick. It's actually too thick, it shouldn't even be considered a shake it should be ice cream. The employees are extremely nice & friendly. Decent speed. I took off a star because it's so thick I gave up trying to enjoy it through the straw. I would recommend a spoon to seriously enjoy these shake.
Food is good, for fast food.Real iced tea: that's good.Shakes are good.Staff is very young, and not very well trained. They all seem freaked out at all times.
I grew-up on this food and it is good, however, this location is awful. Their sandwiches are beyond greasy and the food quality is poor. Do not eat here.

Coming from the Mann's Chinese theater seeing the sneak preview of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the movie was really good and funny and also has some good action scenes.   We came down to Chick-fil-A on Sunset get something to eat, I got the grill chicken club combo and my wife got their classic chicken sandwich combo..  The grill chicken club was really good and great flavor including the grill chicken and bacon and Colby  cheese make great chicken sandwich.  Don't forget cris cross fries and including the dipping sauces to choice from bbq, honey Mustard,etc..

They do a great job here with your chicken.they r friendly and your order is done  quickly .we sat on there patio and ate. This is hollywood always something to c. While we were eating a employee came by and asked if needed anything and if everything was good(that was nice customer service) we will be back and the shakes r yummy

I went today for the first time. The chicken sandwiches are delicious. Wished it was inside a restaurant especially on a hot day like today. Also I wish it was little closer to Hollywood and Vine; closer to Mann Chinese Theater/Kodak theater. Hopefully they will open more locations in LA, San Gabriel Valley, Lake Forrest and Vegas.

This is one of the rare SoCal Chick-fil-A locations. Definitely a fast food staple of the East Coast and a must try if you have never eaten here. Definitely try the limited edition hand spun peach milkshake, waffle fries, chicken strips, chicken salad and if you are up early enough, breakfast!! Favorite drink is the Arnold Palmer which is lemonade and sweet tea mixed! Also don't forget the sauce- Chick-fil-a and Polynesian are the BEST!
My favorite fast food spot. Thank you for opening up locations in Cali. It made my move from the South much easier!Spicy chicken sandwich. Polynesian sauce. Waffle fries. Sweet ice tea. Thank you.

The Good: Awesome service, Awesome food.  EAT MOR CHIKIN moo~~The Bad: Parking really is just... miserableSo, we were out shopping around the area and decided we'll stop by and get a quick bite to eat.  We were set on getting some delicious chik-fil-a sammiches so we stopped by.  This place would be 5 stars if it weren't for the parking situation.  The parking is just so crazy.  I think there's an entrance from the big street but it must have been easy to miss because we both didn't see it.  However there is an entrance around the back from the small side streets.  It's a small lot that has one entrance that leads to the drive through as well as the parking lot, so there's quite a bit of a line stretched out on to the street all trying to get in.  Once we passed the long line of people trying to get through to the drive through, we drove into the parking lot, spotted a car leaving, so we quickly pulled in and parked. Score!  I've never been to this location and didn't realize that it's not a dine-in restaurant.  You order at the window, find a seat outside, grab your food when they call your name, and eat outside.  There were a lot of people eating but there were still plenty seats to go around.  We had combo meals #1 and #2.  I had the regular chicken sandwich and my friend had the deluxe one with bacon and what not. With a side of lemonade, it was just so delicious.  Really love the food but not sure if I'd go back too often considering the horrendous parking situation over there.  I probably will try it out again another day and will just have to hope that it's not that busy I guess.
I love chick fil a!!!  I wish there were ones closer.  Drive through is horrific here though.  Just park and sit in the outdoor patio.
Worst fast food ever. Spice in the spicy chicken? NO! Soggy fries. Just plain shitty food.

To start with they have a diverse menu. Not only chicken pieces. They have salads and shakes and other "goodies". The prices are very reasonable for your choices. There's alot of healthy choices to be had. It's mainly outdoor dining and there's limited parking in their small parking lot. I recommend coming on a motorcycle or parking on the side street located on the east side of the restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised. I've been to their Rancho Cucamonga restaurant and you can dine indoors there. It was great. Too bad this place only has outdoor dining. Maybe because of the potential vagrants and squatters? Stop in if in the area.
Drive thru seems to get slower and more inefficient each time I come here. Not sure why it has gone downhill, but the food is still good. Just hope it gets better before it gets even worse.
The absolute best chicken place in LA. I absolutely LOVE it! I am bias cause eI am a big Chik-Fil_A fan. But the one on Sunset is fast and efficient.

The only two fast food restaurants I'd eat are: Chick-Fil-A and In n Out. One for my chicken cravings, one for my beef cravings. That's it. Love the chicken strips above all things on the menu. Damn that sweet savory batter. Gotta love it. There's always just one or two open parking spots at the lot, and the drive thru always has cars. Love this location. Been here twice so far. Nuff said. Paid about $21 for 4 people.
Chickfila is a smarter fast food choice obviously...but this one is open late!!! A plus after a night out in LA.

Not much to say about chain restaurants. It's fast food, but they have the best "real chicken breast" nuggets and you can't beat their chicken sandwiches!Oh and their lemonade is actually pretty good as well. This was first one in LA and the "it just opened" crowd has died down some.

As far as fast food restauants go, I think Chick-Fil-A is one of the best.  I was very unhappy with this particular location, however.  I ordered a couple party trays and two gallons of lemonade for a small gathering.  Ordering was easy enough, and they did not require a credit card.  I showed up at 5pm to pick up my order, and there was a young man working alone at the "Order Here" window.  Nobody was working at the "Pick Up" window.  He quickly asked if I needed assistance, which was nice, and when I told him that I was picking up party trays, he told me to just wait where I was and that "she" would be right with me.  So I waited, and waited...and waited... in the sun with my three-year-old child.  I could tell that he was getting anxious about the fact that I was being ignored because he kept asking for somebody to come and assist me.  He was trying, and it was obvious that he hadn't been working there for very long.  Finally, a young woman by the name of Shana came over and told me that since there was no register at the "Pick Up" window, that I would have to go wait in line and pay for my order at the "Order Here" window where the young man who I had spoken to in the first place was working!  There were at least four people ahead of me in line.  I would have been happy to wait in the first place, but after waiting 10 minutes for somebody to assist me, I was quite unhappy.  I told her that he should have told me to wait there in the first place, and asked if she would just let me pay without having to wait.  She smiled sarcastically and told me again how there was no register at that window and there was nothing she could do.  That's great, Shana.  That's about the most piss poor service I could have received, and based on what I observed, it seemed that she was in some position to supervise the other employees there.  Chick-Fil-A Management:  Train your employees on service recovery.  The kid who I spoke with initially did not know that he was supposed to ring me up.  It was an honest mistake that Shana could have easily remedied by making the slightest effort to be helpful and offer customer service.  The two stars are for the product.  I love the diet lemonade and the chicken nuggets.  I will stick with the USC location from now on, though.

Chick fil a has the best spicy chicken sandwich deluxe sandwich, chicken strips and nuggets out of any fast food place. This location doesn't have an indoor lobby, so don't go if you are looking for an indoor lobby. Their chick fil a sauce is great. FYI, they are closed every Sunday.

Chick-fil-A is always a 5-star in my book---but this location has to get 4 stars just because of it's nightmarish parking/drive-thru situation. My staple at CFA---the original chicken sandwich (sans pickles), the waffle fries, plenty of CFA sauce (I could eat this stuff with a spoon), with a diet lemonade to wash it down. I finish it off with a small ice dream cone---usually pay for it up front and then go back and get it when I finish eating. This is always my treat when I have to go to crappy doctors appointments at Cedars.

I can't believe I'm actually admitting it but there are a few things I miss about the south; Chic fil A is definitely one of them.  And what I love about Chic fil A even more than their super yummy chicken and sweet tea is the outstanding customer service they provide! Those of you who read my reviews know that I'm a real stickler for good customer service and hospitality. So when I had to wait 5 minutes on my grilled nuggets it was totally ok because I was pleasantly surprised with a free meal! Yep, that's right, a free meal for me and the hottie hubs for waiting a few extra minutes for our piping hot grilled nuggets. Now that's what I call outstanding customer service!
Good food I usually come here and get the 12 count.... I think the sauce selection is the best part of the whole thing..:good prices tho.....

They get 3-4 stars, food can be great, or cold, old and wrong. It's hard to know what you're going to get. Other places (in the south where they are more common), the food is consistently fab. One sad thing, every year they have a holiday shake, which is so good, this year- December 26th, it was gone! Whaaat? So sad!

Drive through or walk up window...This place is tiny for parking and gets pretty packed with people going for drive through. Luckily the staff is on point with the orders and quick with the service of the food. I literally ordered my meal, looked for a table and sat down and my name was then called...how is that even possible. The food is nothing less than greatness..Order the chicken sammie minus the pickles and ask for the chick-fil-a sauce. Ask for tons of it, even though its 140 calories per packet..but its freaken good, you won't be disappointed

Political opinions aside, this fast food joint still manages to be unimpressive. I will admit their chicken is pretty tasty, but it is overpriced and the portion sizes leave me hungry every time. This particular location has no indoor seating, which isn't necessarily bad if the weather is nice (which it always is in southern California) but there aren't many seats and the parking lot is small. Whatever chemical cocktail makes up their honey mustard should be illegal though, because it's more addicting than crack.
Great Place!!!I always eat there when i'm working near hollywood.Fast drive thru service.Good Food.And people are always in a good mood there.

I've never had Chick-Fil-A before this Hollywood location opened.  At first I was very hesitant because of all the negative news about them and the LBGT community.  I didn't want to be seen as somebody who supported whatever Chick-Fil-A was supporting, but after I saw a brief pocket of peace within the news, I decided to swoop in and give it a shot.  Oh boy,  I'm sure glad I did.  For fast food, I think their chicken sandwiches are the best I've had.  For reals.  Their sides are tasty as well but their chicken is no effing joke.  Makes me miss the deep south even though I've never been there.  They probably not even from that region...who knows.  I'll google it after this.Despite the sucky parking lot and the intimidating image of so many people surrounding the area, the line goes fairly quick and the food comes out at around the same pace.  While dining there, you can enjoy your meal while people watching on one of the most busiest intersections of Hollywood.  And believe me - we got some very interesting folks to observe.I'm getting hungry just writing this.

So when I went here the other day the menus posted had one price but they were charging more expensive prices.I ordered the #7 and the price on the menu was $7.05 but it rang up at $7.95 I asked why the price was different and the guy working the register mumbled and then said, "well they put more expensive cheese on that sandwich now".
