LOLI know it's .90 difference but I asked to speak to the manager. After all how any people have been paying a higher price when the menu shows a lower price? It adds up! The manager at the registers came over and pulled a menu out of the glass container that covers the menu and revealed a menu underneath with the "new" prices, and said oops. He didn't really apologize or even offer to give the meal to us for the posted price and just walked away. I don't normally go to this place, but had a craving. The food was okay, and the service was shockingly terrible. I never expected to get blank stares from employees but especially managers when asking them a simple question about price inaccuracies.

Stopped by for a sandwich today.Great location for a lunch. Right on the corner of one of the most noisy crossings.I love watching people running back and forth, cars beeping, Intensive traffic. Keeps your brain feeling awake while you there.Standard menu of what a fast-food restaurant could offer. Sandwiches, nuggets, shakes. Average price. Though the way they serve it is nice: your name is called over the loudspeaker so that you could come to the window to pickup your order (so if you are eating incognito - keep that in mind, of make up a name ;).Seats are solid metal - so don't freeze your behind in the evening. There's a lot of umbrellas over the tables, so you won't burn.Drive through are is always crowded (makes me think the place is popular) and is has several menu set on your way so that you could overlook or change your mind before you get to ordering.Frankly, not a place to go all the time, but in case of need - you may be sure, their food will not disappoint you.Visit? Yes!

This food is incredibly amazing! The staff is very friendly and if you want a refill they get it for you very fast. I always like to get extra sauces and they don't make me feel bad for asking for a couple more extra. Great location even though it's outside. Bring a sweatshirt at night. Plenty of parking out back. Love it!

The way the drive thru & parking was built or planned wasn't very thoughtful. Cool that they use a side street to enter & exit though. But long lines that block the entrance to just park and get off, and even then there is limited parking.Always nice customer service & good food.Had the chick-fil-a deluxe sandwich and asked for a small water and received a ice tea. Thank You! Very Thoughtful.Will come back again since it's one of two chicks that are close to me.

* If the drive-thru line goes into the street and starts blocking traffic, you must be doing something right! *So... my buddy and I parked across the street to get some outdoor seats here and were lucky to have 60 degree late night weather, as there was only outdoor seating.I got the chicken strips and fries and an Arnold Palmer to drink.  Order came out exactly right.  Sauce containers are a little too shallow, but other than that... 5 stars!Surprisingly, they made a vanilla shake by accident and Cartavian (hope I got his name right) brought it out to us for free, then checked on us again later to make sure all was well and get drink refills.I didn't expect this, and if all fast food restaurants did this for their customers, "fast" and "food" would no longer feel like dirty 4-letter F words!Thanks!!!

I'm not a fan of this location because the parking lot isn't too big, there's lots of traffic in this area, and there is no indoor seating! (As a result, super stingy with the sauces...)Today pretty much cemented the fact that I don't like this location. Most anytime I go for breakfast, I order a chicken biscuit, but ask for waffle fries instead of the hash browns. They've done this every time for me at other locations AND even several times at this location. Who can resist the waffle fries?BUT, What happens today? "Sorry, that's a lunch time item and it's breakfast time now so we don't have waffle fries." What?!?!! Why don't you go ahead and change your sign to be the same as the other breakfast Nazis--Mickey D's...On top of that, their entire computer system was down today, so the drive thru wasn't working and the line of cars was super backed up and we had to wait a long ass time to hear this mistaken information.You want me to Eat Mor Chikin? Why don't you Get Yor Ack Tugethr!
The food is consistently amazing.  The only problem I have with this place is the hard-to-navigate parking lot and drive-thru line.  It seems like they just crammed the place into too small of a lot.

Chick-Fil-A I LOVE you! I can not seem to stay away from this place. Ever since the grand opening of this place I knew it would be a problem (because of the way my diet is set up). Just a little history on my love for chick fil a. Back when I was in high school (2006), they used to sell chick fil a everyday for lunch. The very first time I tried it, I knew I was never going to quit. I have been eating it ever since and don't even plan on stopping. I have tried most of the so-cal locations, and when they have a grand opening I am usually there too. The Hollywood location was only right! I work near this location so Im here almost 7 days a week. I have tried all of the breakfast items, all of the lunch items, and some of the limited item such as the chicken tortilla soup which is really good. My favorite items for breakfast is the chicken breakfast burrito and hash browns, and for lunch the spicy chicken sandwich. I try not to get the fries with it only because I feel like Im in a food coma after eating everything, but the fries are amaze-balls too. My #1 favorite is (drumroll) THE MILKSHAKES. Now don't judge me but I DO love a good milkshake, and chick fil a has crazy good milkshakes.It taste like they took my favorite ice cream, my favorite chocolate, and everything good, and came up with this milkshake. I know it should like a lot with the chicken sandwich, fries, and milkshake, AND YOUR RIGHT! It IS a lot, and I probably shouldn't eat all of this at one time, but I don't judge you...so again...don't judge me!! JK Oh and the service is amazing like ALL other chick fil a location. "It's a great day here at chick fil a my name is_____ how can I serve you today". That never gets old.

If you like stuffing your face with delicious saucy chicken but wish you could do it perched on the corner of Sunset and Highland for all the pricks and loons and Benzes of Hollywood to gawk at, this place's got you covered. Mind the pigeons.

If  this was your first ever Chick-Fil-A location to experience, you would be robbed of an awesome experience. I am from the South so I grew up on Chick-Fil-A. I was so stoked when they opened this location in Hollywood. The food is the same as any Chick-Fil-A location obviously (although they seem to burn the fries quite a bit here), but the customer service is no good. When you go to a Chick-Fil-A, everyone knows how friendly the workers are and how they always say "my pleasure". Well, here, it just seems like they hired a lot of the kids who may go to Hollywood High School across the street and they are just working to have an "after school job." The customer service is hit or miss. I have had multiple issues with having the wrong order given to me or part of my order missing etc. So now, I only come to this location if I am hungry last minute and in the Hollywood area. Otherwise, I just wait until I take a trip to Camarillo for shopping to go to the Chick-Fil-A in that area (check out my yelp review for that location. They are amazing.). If you're in Hollywood and you're hungry definitely drop in and get a bite. Let it be surprising if they are nice and if they get your order correct.I hope this review helps you decide on where to have a bite to eat while enjoying Hollywood. :)

It's an awesome chick fil a. Quick and friendly service. Get to enjoy sunset blvd while eating the best chicken sandwich ever created! Don't forget the Polynesian sauce! Just need more locations throughout LA. And to the people saying they want an indoor seating area....We live in Southern California, with weather like this why would you want to be inside?

Very awkward parking lot with no inside area seating, but have no worries they have the same consistent fried chicken sandwiches and waffles fries home grown out of the state of Georgia...My wife and kids have this strange addition this chain and when you let them go a week or two without it they start going through withdrawals... All kidding aside they have a consistent product that is a really tasty sandwich, nuggets or strips and if you make it here in the morning the biscuits are amazing!  Staff is top notch and always makes sure that you have everything you need.

This may be one of the only Chick-Fil-A's without an inside dining area?  There is NO inside seating.Everyone orders outside and sits outside, and there are no heat lamps.We got lucky and it was a warmer night, otherwise we may have skipped this place or had to take it to go.Prep quality was just about as consistent as larger CFA's.  Service was fast, helpful and cordial.Parking lot is small.

The only reason why I am not giving this place 5 stars is because it's too far from where I live. CAN YOU GUYS OPEN ONE UP IN GLENDALE PLEASE? because the food here is amazingggg. I love everything on the menu and the chicken seriously tastes so good along with the fries and coke. Anytime I'm in the area I have to stop by  not only for the food but the service is also great. Every worker is so nice and if you dine in (sit outside) they come around asking for refills or if you need extra sauce. Chick-fil-A for the win!

Drive through only, so outdoor seating- complete with pigeons pestering persistently for food... Parking is free should you choose to eat there.I think it's lame that they're open until 8pm on Christmas Eve. Too late.Let employees go home earlier

THE SERVICE HERE IS OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!I am a consumer who can appreciate good service. Everyone here seems sooooo happy to see me when I'm at the drive-in window. I don't even know these people but they treat me like I'm their best friend. This happens every time I come to Chick-Fil-A, and I come here quite a bit. The drive-thru is QUICK!I love the strips and I love the fries. That's what I normally get, with a ice-cream cone.

I was here last week for my first time ever eating chick fil a and I had a chicken deluxe and it was fabules there was nothing that I could say that was not good on there chicken. I fell in love with there sandwiches. I came back this week and tried the spicy chicken and it was ok but I like the deluxe way more. The service is great as well, the servers are very polite and call you sir/mam and are very respectful

My favorite fast food establishment. Chicken tenders are second to none. French fries in the upper echelon of fast food spots. Better Oreo milk shakes than any other drive thru. And above all else, superior sauce assortment. Service at this particular location is pretty fast. Too bad they aren't open Sundays.

Great food, good service. Their salads are fresh and my favorite it the tortilla soup. Although the drive thru lines look long, they actually move fairly fast. I usually get the strips with the honey-mustard sauce - Yummy!

I'm here right now. Took a protein/bathroom break whilst taking part in this year's The Great Los Angeles Walk. (Echo Park to Santa Monica - no small feat!)Anyway, besides always having delicious chicken nuggets and the SPECIAL SAUCE (so good it deserves a medal for making my taste buds purr with joy, no joke)... one of the servers, Lisa (caught the nametag!), came by and offered to get me a refill. Now, I know free refills are standard at Chick-Fil-A, but it was such a nice gesture - especially out here in Hollywood - that I felt it deserved notice anyway. Thanks guys!

Don't get politics involve! Food is food and a restaurant is a restaurant whether is a anti-gay or pro-gay restaurant, a Chinese or Mexican place, a kids place or an adult (bar) place. Just don't get politics involve. I like my good food and I love my great grub! I'm a Christian and I go to restaurants that openly support the gay movement. I go to restaurants that clearly idolize Buddha! Heck! I love my heavy metal food trucks! I love my food. But that's my opinion. Chic-fil-a hits the spot. Chicken sandwiches are tasty, juicy and flavorful. Can't ever go wrong with the sandwiches here. Waffle fries on the other hand are a hit and miss, it really depends whether they were just fried and you get those. Sauces are awesome. I always hey my mustard honey sauce. And the shakes... Oh the shakes are epic. I always get the Oreo cookies shake. Amazing. So... Leave politics aside and enjoy food not only here but everywhere.
They have a fairly good corporate chicken sandwich that has just a hint of anti-gay.
They have the worlds best french fries. And this location has outdoor misters. I don't need to say more.

Roscoe WISHES he could fry chicken like this!And to all the 8=hate lunatics: GET A LIFE!  Chik fil a is so serious they really do close on Sunday, so of course they aren't going to cater your gay wedding. If they were Muslim you'd be falling all over yourselves talking about acceptance and tolerance. What hypocrites!

Okay, so I was greatly disappointed. I've had much better food at McDonald's for a lot cheaper than here.How can you justify a tiny chicken wraps for nine something dollars? You can get organic large chicken wraps at Whole Foods for less than that.The dipping sauces were lacking to say the least.The chicken itself felt slimy once you broke through the breaded deep fried coat. The milk shake (cheapest milk shake I've seen in a while) was okay. I wouldn't go back there. There's too many other places to go. You would see me at Denny's before you see me here again.

As good as it gets for a fast food restaurant.  Super friendly staff and quick service!  This location is fun because of the outdoor seating.  It is the perfect spot for people watching.  And of course, chick-fil-a's food is delicious!

I went for the first time today and the one thing I can say is that I loved their customer service. Very friendly staff! I got their chicken sandwich and waffle fries. They were nice enough to jut throw in 6 types of sauces in the bag without even asking... I just wanted ranch buy I got an additional 5! All sauces were good. I wasn't thaaaat in-love with the food but it was good nonetheless.
Chick Fil a... You can't go wrong. Have yet to try the whole menu. So far nothing disappoints! Spicy chicken sandwich! Yes this is where the strike was before.
Gotta say, John, is the coolest and nicest guy at Chick-fil-A! Took time to explain to my mom about the menu n gave us variety of dips to try. Nice guy!
I really like everything about this place except for how small the menu is. Should be a little more ingenuity and thought put into the menu to attract a broader audience.

Had their Spicy Deluxe with some waffle fries.  It was very good.  A little more juicy than I expected since they pressure fry their chicken in peanut oil.  Sadly, I wanted more of a kick for spice but that's what happens when you grow up eating kimchi (not any more though).  I wanna see if CFA will have a limited time offer of SWEET POTATO WAFFLE FRIES!  If you think its a good idea tell them & lets see this come to fruition!  Many blessings.

For a place that specializes in chicken, they sure know how to F#*&@ it up! Salty, dry, and overfried. On top of that they make you sit outside and dodge turd-bombs from flying rats and panhandlers. I'll stick to Jack in the Box's spicy crispy chicken sandwich any day.

I was a Chic-Fil-A virgin until the other night, and I gotta say - I've had better.$5.23 will buy you a chicken sandwich (#1 on the menu and most popular) and medium sized potato wedges.  I was hoping to be wowed by the chicken sandwich, but it's really quite plan.  No sauce, no lettuce.  It's literally 2 buns and a piece of fried chicken.  I thought it was no different to a McD's 99 cent chicken sandwich, except McD's actually comes with sauce and other toppings.  The drive thru is pretty quick at this location, and there's a small parking lot too.

Whenever I get a chance, I would go back to this place if ever I miss Georgia. The sweet tea is not as sweet back in the south but  I still like it. As always, very courteous and friendly staff and the food is really good for a fast food. I always get the spicy chicken sandwich since it  has enough kick together w/ the chick fil a sauce. The waffle fries are also really good.If you sign up for emails, you can get a free breakfast on them on certain times.

I love Chick-Fil-A regardless of any negative comments.  I do have to say their chicken sandwiches patty aren't always the right size.  The last time I got a sandwich, the chick was half the size of the buns! For a $10 meal, just put the right size chicken patty! LOL, i had an add on of the small strawberry milk shake.  I do have to say it tastes way bette than the In-n-out and I thought that was the best thing ever!

I really want to give this place a 3.5, but I'll be nice and give it a 4. For a fast food place, this is doesn't scream fast food. The spicy chicken seems like it's made from real chicken and for someone who can't really handle spicy food, it's spicy. Waffle fries are alright, but with the Chick-fil-a sauce, it makes both the sandwich and fries taste better.I don't like how there's only outdoor seatings. Flies and bees were pretty much attacking me while I was trying to enjoy my meal. My bf and I finally gave up when a bee landed on his sandwich packaging and claimed it's territory.
Delicious food.  Fast service and friendly staff.  As good as it gets at a Chick-Fil-A!

Im going to keep it short and helpful.If you love chicken, this place is to die for. The chicken sandwiches are killers and they never stuff you and make you feel lazy. I love how they have Powerade option for a drink since i dont drink any sort of sodas. The staff was so friendly that when we were sitting down he came and asked us for any refills or sauces that we needed. The best is their grilled chicken Sandwich. And their waffle fries are pretty good too!Bunch of seats outside, and some facing the city as well. Drive thru for the lazy people too! Highly recommended if your in the area!

Love Chick-fil-A.  Would have been a lot harder to move to California from Florida if Chick-fil-A hadn't gotten here first.  The Hollywood location serves up the same menu as every other location (besides the Dwarf Houses in GA), but there's no dining room, just some tables outside.  You walk up to a window and place your order.  So you get to have Chick-fil-A while hanging out on Sunset Boulevard.  Which is pretty cool.  The homeless/addicts/whatever-the-heck-that-is add a little something special to the ambience that you can't get down South.  This Chick-fil-A has its own security, so that helps.  This is seriously a fun location and worth a visit.

Great customer service.  The host, Michael, is uncommonly helpful - introduced us to the chick-fil-a sauce and brought us a couple of packets, offered to take our trash, and was all around positive.  Thanks for the wonderful experience
It is different and a refreshing change for a burger but it is kinda oily and always makes me feel bad after I eat it. Something like: I shouldn't have eaten that, I will never be back.
I used to love this pace.  I used to always want to grab something from here.  I dig the closed on Sundays but I don't dig the MSG.   It's 2013, why is there MSG in your fries and chicken !?
This place is awesome. What else is there to say. Genius. (Although the corporation is a bit whacky). Whatever, it's not like they're using slave labor. Delish!

When the only thing I can complain about is the fact that they are always busy, that says to me they are doing something right.I eat here WAY too often. Love the breakfast, love the spicy chicken sandwich, and service is on point.Eat here. Live here. Love here. Chick-Fil-A can be your everything.

Came here after the Dodger Game...i always park and walk up to eat...the service is always nice...they had ample tables last night and the place even shoots a mist out if its hot.This is a 5 star for me cuz its ALWAYS GOOD..no matter when, where, what time..never have had a bad experience...plus the dipping sauces are awesome...get 1 of each and make yourself a dipping sauce variety tray! Its worth it!

Fast food should not taste this good. But when it's rush hour and I'm paying more than $10 at the drive through then it better.Why the hefty price for a quick (or slow in this case) meal, you ask?The strawberry milkshakes have real ice cream and strawberry puree blended into them - so good and so fatty. Also, the Polynesian sauce is pretty much it's biggest draw for me.. I just can't help getting the biggest pack of nuggets, crispy waffle fries, and some Polynesian sauce.But there's a lot of hype around the chicken sandwich, and honestly, did a side by side and the McDonald's Spicy McChicken tastes about the same and costs a fifth of the price. Love the nuggets, minus two stars for ridiculously long lines, price, and outdoor-only seating (where is the glamor in that, Hollywood?).

Finally stopped by Chick-Fil-A...wanted to see what all the hype was about since I had heard good things from friends in the past. It was OK...definitely not real impressed. Had the regular spicy chicken sandwich combo. The sandwich itself was average...it did have a fair amount of spice (which I liked since I enjoy spicer foods). The patty was breaded in the spicy batter...not super crispy but not too soggy either. The bun was spongy and there were a few dill pickle slices inside the sandwich. Waffle fries were plain but LOVED their diet lemonade w/ Splenda! Tasted like homemade lemonade w/ real lemons...hard to believe it was sugar-free. I'll definitely drive-thru for a XL Lemonade on a warm day if I'm in the area.

Chicken sandwich and waffle fries are good by "fast food" standards. I like the service here. I went through the drive thru (they have two!) and I was being indecisive. The voice at the other end was really patient and offered to answer any questions I had about the menu.
Love this place.  Drive-through is easy and the chicken sandwiches are delicious.  Also recently tried one of their milkshakes which was also great.

been back here a few times since my last review.  i actually decided not to come here given the controversy (i mean i can certainly find somewhere else to eat!), but i was riding shotgun when friends drove through and they got me a sandwhich even though i told them not to and they started yelling stop getting all up in arms about a sandwich!i have to say the last two time i ate here here, it was much much saltier than i remember.  i mean mouth snapping salty.  don't know if there's some new recipe or some new really tart pickles or something.   but i didn't enjoy it nearly as much as when i've had it before.anyway i used to kinda like the place, then i didn't like the controversy, and now i think it's salty anyway so, i just don't really feel compelled to come here.  even though i know it's just a sandwhich!  i can't say the controversy hasn't colored me.

So I popped my Chick-Fil-A cherry last night and it was worth the wait! We had the chicken nuggets and the chicken tenders with the fries and a Cherry Coke. The chicken was nice and crispy on the outside with just enough juicy tenderness on the inside. The criss cross fries were good too. I am not a fan of the Chick-Fil--A dipping sauce though. Serious question though: why don't all major fast food joints have ketchup packets like Chick-Fil-A? It's ingenious.
Best fast food in hollywood! Chicken sandwiches and waffle fries are incredible. Try the chick film a sauce, it's the best.

Love this place because it's open late on weekends--so technically, I think you could say that this CFA is "open" on Sundays, since it closes early in the AM.The outdoor seating can get full, and there is no indoor seating, but that's part of what I like about this place.  It's in the middle of the hustle of Hollywood.  It is super busy here, so the staff have efficiency down to a T, and if you are unsatisfied, they are accommodating (it is a CFA after all).

my friend was visiting from alabama and we drove by a chik-fil-a and she said, "mmmmm...chik-fil-a" and i said i had never eaten there and she made me turn around right then and there saying, "you have GOT to try their spicy chicken deluxe" or something like that. so we went and i had one and it was okay.....but later that night, both of us were excruciatingly sick with salmonella poisoning. needless to say, my first visit to chick-fil-a was my last.

Love this place! The only disappointment is that this location doesn't have inside seating, it's nice sitting out but too many pigeons, my daughter wanted to play with them rather than eating her nuggets, had to eat in the car!

Love the chicken sandwich! ANytime i am going over to hollywood all my neighbors ask me to bring back chic fil a for them.   i love how the drivethru has a little video system (its like back to the future 2) and they know my name when i drive through.  The window peeps are always super duper nice.  Amazingly polite.  I just read another review about their sweet tea.  didnt even know they had it, but will definitely try next time.  My only beef is that its so far from where i live.  CHIC FIL A MANAGEMENT PLEASE READ....YOU NEED A CHIC FIL A IN WESTWOOD.   i would hope there is room for a drivethru because thats something West LA in general sorely lacks.  But there is empty space near the hammer museum and they still havent filled the old Chili's spot.  im getting tired of Subway and Jersey mikes for when I just need a quick bite.  And in-n-out, although wonderful, takes too long.
Finally, a bit of the South in southern Cal. Try anything and you won't be disappointed. Combo #1 with sweet tea, nuggets, to start.
Not what it was ten years ago - seasonings different,  doesn't hold together with the batter very well, and then Porky battered and too wet!

Bravo Chick-Fil-A, Bravo! I was hesitant to try it for the first time & I have no idea why, but boy am I glad I did. Tried it for the first time in Virginia actually when my bf and I were visiting his parents. I got their Spicy Chicken Deluxe Sandwich and totally enjoyed it! Their fries are different, I feel like they should have some sort of seasoning on them though, but they were't bad. Also, I wish they had a bigger menu! But really, all in all I was very satisfied eating here! Their sandwich was super duper tasty!

Personally not my favorite chicken sandwich place but it's okay. My flavorful husband loves chic fil a and would give it a 5 but since this is my yelp account, I'm sticking with 3 stars. Whenever I eat here I constantly have to dip my sandwich in sauce in order for it to have more flavor and be easier to eat. Their coleslaw is very good, one of my favorite fast food coleslaws.
Excellent service, loved the atmosphere and scenery. Traffic was loud but it didn't get too bad. Great overall

I went for the Chick N Minis but I fell in love with the Spicy Chicken biscuit.  The flaky, yummy biscuit was so wonderful that we stood in line for round 2.  Unfortunately, the last biscuits of the day were sold to the two girls in front of us.  What a disappointment.

First off I want to start by saying I'm so glad they put a Chick-Fil-A in Hollywood!It's your typical Chick-Fil-A, great, fresh food and very friendly employees (hey, having a "typical" as being a five star isn't too bad, right??) Only problem is there is no dining room, it is all outdoor seating and that is limited. I usually get it to go. The drive through has a line of 10+ cars regularly but the wait isn't usually that long. Ohh and there's maybe 10 (not sure) parking spots. But it's Hollywood, what do you expect?? Don't forget they're closed on Sundays.Regardless I have no question giving it a five out of five.

I never thought I'd be one to review Chik-FIl-A, but I absolutely love this location I just had to share. I love how you're always greeted with a smile, seriously ! Has anyone else noticed how they go above and beyond to be nice?! Everytime I've come here and ordered, while picking up at the pick up window it's HI AURORA! * SMILE* Here's your order, thank you for coming and hve a nice day! And the smile remains the whole time, how cute is that? One time I was walking home from a mini concert at Jimmy Kimmel, and while walking by this adorable guy comes walking out of the chick fil A employees only door and says to me " hey ! I'm not sure if you like icecream but we made an extra one by mistake, would you like to have it? " Totally made my day ! Thanks Mr Adorable! I can't speak for other chick fil a's as this is the only one I've ever been to but i love love love!

Good sandwich, great price, better yet, I saw a gay couple (two guys) eating their food and staring passionately in each other eyes, holding hands and caressing each other's hands... It was plain funny. I'm not sure if they were doing it on purpose because of all that gay controversy, but that picture was the epitome of most effective non-violent protest I have ever seen! Thumbs up for the gay guys. I occurred to me that all gay people should storm the store daily buying from them and make gay money be that chain's main source of income! Perhaps they would buy in or close down the store if they don't want to agree with the lifestyle... Again thumbs up for that gay couple and 5 star to chick-fil-a for allowing that to go on...
A glob of grease on a bun with a slimy pickle.  Mmmm mmmmm.

I'd be a fool to move to Los Angeles from the Bay area without reviewing Chick-Fil-A. They had one in the Sunnyvale Mall that ended up closing down when I was a kid and I swear to you, the taste of the last chicken nugget sample I had from that familiar toothpick, lingered 20 years until I recently had it again.  But now I'm over it.  I've gone here maybe three times since moving here and it's consistent but not motivating. As in, I could talk myself into eating anywhere else. Plus I've found some spot on copycat recipes online for their chicken coating. The waffle fries are worth a mention though. Also worth a mention: The creepy customer service. Maybe I think it's creepy for political reasons but it is oddly great. Too great sometimes. I'm not accustomed to Perma-smile with solid eye contact when I'm shamefully snatching my bag of food from the pick-up window. The location is fantastic for people watching however. Plus they have those Mist things for when it gets hot. Overall, I would have been happy  still reflecting on my memories of Yester-nugget. For nostalgia's sake though, it's a good bite.

The Hollywood location is my go to spot for a late night bite to eat after a little play time. Came here recently after some holiday beverages and got the spicy chicken sammy meal. I will say, Chick-Fil-A is super quick in service...I didn't even sit down and my food was ready! Also, I always end up asking for all the sauces and they are not stingy at all. The parking lot is small and there is outdoor seating. Love the spicy chicken and the waffle fries!

Okay, I'm a closet Chick-Fil-A fan. I can't help but love the 8-count nuggets meal with the waffle fries and sweet tea. The employees are overly polite and the drive-through line always moves pretty quickly.

The supposed healthy alternative to a Burger. However, I wasn't "Wowed" or blown away by the taste. I though Chick-Fil-A was just alright with it's taste and 5 guys prices. It was my first time here and hopefully my last. Also, not a huge fan of their views towards homosexuality. Ordered a set combo of Spicy Chicken Sandwich with their criss cut fries and a drink. Around 14 dollars for 2? That's ridiculous. At In-n-out I can get a set meal for around 10 dollars if not cheaper. As the two star rating suggests.... I've had much much better.
Even though this place is always busy, I've never waited a long time.  Also, the employees are also very friendly.  And, of course, the food is great just like at every Chick-Fil-A!

Five stars for their food and service--which really is top notch. I never knew chicken could taste so fresh or so good. Even their fries are amazing! One star for their crappy politics which the owners should have kept to themselves, although I can't say that there is any sign of that bigotry in the service--which is all with-a-smile, 1950's style.

Great place for a good chicken sandwich. I'm actually a beef lover so I was saddened when they took the Carl's out of this location but I must say that this spot is pretty good. I like the outdoor setup, I like that they have guards during business hours to keep the local homeless and panhandlers away while you eat. I don't know how they've manage to keep it graffiti free but kudos to them for that too! Hard to find a clean spot to eat in Hollywood so this place definitely gets a thumbs up. The employees go out of there way to make sure you're taken care of. Would never believe this is a fast-food joint. A+ all the way around!!!

It was at this address that the Top Hat Cafe was located, and it was at the Top Hat that Lana Turner, age 16, was "discovered" in 1937.  As a sixteen-year-old student at Hollywood High School, Turner skipped a typing class and bought a Coke at the Top Hat Cafe located on the southeast corner of Sunset Boulevard and McCadden Place.By 1947 Turner achieved the milestone of her film career, and was not only MGM's most popular star, but also one of the ten best paid women in the United States.A little reverence, please, as you enter the current establishment.

I do like Chick-Fil-A in general and feel like their chicken is somehow a little healthier than other fried chicken options.  However, this is different as it's a walk-up fast food joint with outdoor seating.  That would be okay if it was clean but it's hard to maintain and you can't do much about the general population as well.
I'm upping my rating to four stars cause I have to admit, I can't resist this $#!*

HIGHLIGHTS:WAFFLE FRIESOK:Chicken burgers Politics aside, this Chick-Fil-A is steadily packed.  I like that they have two drive thrus.  Love the waffle fries, but don't really get the craze for anything else.  The chicken isn't that great, and I've tried a couple different burgers.  What am I missing?  I'd rather spend my calories at In-N-Out. For quick chicken, and a whole lot healthier, go to California Chicken Cafe.

Wow, I really got bad food poisoning from this place and it looks like i'm not the only one!  My girlfriend and I came here Saturday night 11/03/2012.  3-4 hours later my stomach started having cramps (really bad) then the rest is history (chills, fever, etc.)I got a spicy chicken sandwich, I returned the first sandwich because it had some weird stuff on the bottom of the bread I only took one bite from it.  They gave me a whole new sandwich.  I am assuming since i've been out for only 2 days (second day wasn't too bad - at least ok enough to write this review) it came from that one bad bite of the sandwich.  The health inspectors really need to re-evaluate their health grade rating on this place or management needs to make sure prep/kitchen is clean, etc.  Oh well, at least I got a sick day out of it.

This Chick-Fil-A is probably the busiest one I've ever been to, but it's still pretty fast.I usually walk up to this location, since their parking lot is small and plus it's Hollywood.  You're supposed to walk everywhere.Anywho, I recommend the spicy chicken sandwich.  Yes, it has a little kick, but only just enough to open your taste buds to the tender chicken and the crispy breading.  YUM!  Remember..... most of the sandwiches are minamalist, meaning bun, pickles and meat.  So, order whatever sandwich you choose with the Chick-Fil-A sauce.  It's almost like a sweet, honey mustard tasting sauce.  The sauce was made for the chicken. If you want the whole shabang, meaning...lettuce, tomatoes and cheese, just order whichever sandwich you choose as "deluxe."Other notable items are the regular chicken sandwich and the chicken strips if you want to ditch the bread.  If you want to eat healthy here, it IS possible.  It's not as tasty as the sandwich, but good enough......just get the grilled chicken strips or the grilled nuggets.  It's sure to satisfy your chicken craving without killing your diet.Lastly, Chick-Fil-A is not open on Sunday's, so catch them when you can on the weekdays and Saturday :)

What can I say?....Chick-Fil-A holds a special place in my heart. There is nothing better to me than a Chick-Fil-A Chicken Biscuit in the morning with a Med Lemonade. Mmmmm. Not many places make me feel like I'm in the south again, but this is one place that does. Thank you Chick-Fil-A for finally opening a spot in Hollywood!!!
I mean... It's Chick-Fil-A. Like come on bro. Best chicken I ever had.
i love this company, great food and great service. You even get free refills on the yummy diet lemonade! I highly recommend this spot for yummy lunch even the bathrooms are clean. Thanks Chick-Fil-A!

Ewwww!! Nothing worse than finding HAIR in your food! Yep. My sandwich had a big long HAIR in it. My 2nd and last time I will ever go to this place. Too bad cause it looks clean but I guess looks can be deceiving.

Friendly-service, video drive-thru, and the tables are actually very clean for outdoor fast-food dining.  There is a person standing around to make sure things run smoothly outside.I rarely come here, since there aren't any around me, but when I do, the waffle fries with the different sauces are my go-to (Chick-Fil-A Sauce and Buttermilk Ranch being my favorites).  My fiance got some coleslaw with his combo, but it was so chopped up that I told him that it looked like cat vomit, ha ha.

Chicken! I've recently just had the chance to have my first Chick-Fil-A sandwich! I've been hooked ever since! This location only has outside seating, so be ready to work on that tan. I can't believe how fast I get my food during lunch hour! They have a decent size parking lot, but I've never had a problem finding street parking. This last time I went I had an employee come around and ask me if I wanted a refill! That's awesome!

This one star review is mainly to be a flag to whoever owns this location.Chik Fil A has always been about service.  At every Chik Fil A I go to, everyone greets you and when you ask them for something they always respond with "My pleasure".  There isn't much service at this one since you sit outside and eat, but the Rachel girl working at the cash register is one out of two people I dealt with for this visit.She seemed like she had a major attitude problem, and noticed other customers complaining to the manager (about her?)  She took my order as if she didn't even want to be employed there, and when she asked if I want any sauces for my combo, I was a bit confused since I didn't get any chicken nuggets, and I would assume that most normal people like to dip their fries in ketchup instead of honey mustard (I say normal because I am the kind of person that dips their fries in anything).  I asked for clarification and she rolled her eyes at me and pointed weakly with her arm still bent at a 90 degree angle at some sauces that I was supposed to see right away.Not once did she make me feel like a paying customer.  She must have thought that I was the one taking her order.  Maybe I'm making a huge deal out of this, but for a location like this where the customer only interacts with one or two employees, you need to put your happiest, most flamboyant employee at the front.  I felt like a father dealing with a rebellious teenage daughter.  Makes me never want to have kids.Food didn't wow me like other Chik Fil A locations, but it wasn't bad.  Like someone else mentioned, it could have POSSIBLY given me food poisoning, but I also ate a few other things that day that could have been suspect, but given the timing of the call of nature I wouldn't point my finger at Chik Fil A.The guy at the window calling out names passing out orders was very polite, and even apologized for the wait even though it was non-existent.

Steer clear. I've loved this place my entire life--until I got the worst food poisoning that I've ever experienced.One would think that as much frying as those chickens get, it'd fry the salmonella right out of it. Obviously that's not the case. I was down and out for nearly a week; my life flashing before my eyes more than once. Anyway, I'm better now, but it will be a LONG time before I visit Chik-Fil-A again, if ever.

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.A Chick-fil-a in Los Angeles. The stars have aligned, and this girl gets to have quality fast food chicken and thirst quenching lemonade. Life is good.I usually go through the drive thru, then park at the Rite Aid parking lot right across, and enjoy the radio and my food. Otherwise, this place is exploding with hungry foodies and high school kids, but I mean check out the prime location!

I love chick fil a and have since I was little. I'm from NC and recently moved here's was glad to see one in town. People need to understand this is an ATLANTA BASED COMPANY, so of course, there are going to be issues. Notice how they aren't open on Sundays? It's the south people and they are ATLANTA BASED. That's all.

Putting all politics aside, this business does not contribute to a healthy style of living.. This business is no different than Mc Donalds, or any any other fast food chain out there.  I cannnot see what all the rave is.  All addictive foods will only contribute to human health risks.

Crisp. Hot. Juicy.No I am not talking about the talents in figure skating - I am talking about Chick-Fil-A!!!!! The spicy chicken deluxe burger was amazeballs. I was a bit surprised to see it packed at 10pm especially because of the recent drama. I guess good food brings people together.The one issue I have is what is up with the styrofoam!?!? Come on now, Hollywood. Be green! And I ain't talkin' about the monies.

First, I'd like to say that I 100% support gay marraige.But... You know that saying, "Any press is good press"? I also believe in that. I have never been to a Chick-Fil-A in my life. I've heard the rumors of this amazing chicken sandwich, but never had an opportunity to try one. So when I discovered this  chick-fil-a pretty much just across the street from my son's school, I was intrigued. After this whole hoop-la over Chick-fil-a, how could I not try it? Plus, I was starving! The Chicken sandwich was very good. Better than any other fast food chicken sandwich I have ever had. I chose the spicy chicken deluxe (I think it was called). The chicken was fat and juicy and perfectly spicy.  It really was the star of the show. Everything else was whatever. The bread and veggies, were normal. The waffle fries were pretty bland and flavorless. My Arnold Palmer... To much Arnold, not enough Palmer. But that chicken, was really, really good. It's a great chicken sandwich. Would I go out of my way for one? No. But honestly, if I stopped patronizing all establishments that I disagreed with,personally, politically, religiously or otherwise, I'm sure I wouldn't shop, ever, period.

This one was good, the customer service isn't as good as the one in Northridge. The girl taking my order was kind of rushing me and when I pulled up to the window she was just chit chatting with a co-worker. Annoyed me but not enough to make a big stink out of it.
nothing special. staff seemed sad and as for the food it was blah. the chicken was good but way too greasy and the fries were soggy. overall, i've had much better even at mcdonald's.

Yes, Chick-fil-a hates the gays... With all that aside the chicken is not very good or worth the wait. The fries are soggy not crispy and the chicken is rubbery and dry.  I did once eat at one in Atlanta that I liked more because he food was cooked better... Or maybe food just tastes better not knowing it's being served by religious crazies. Anyway, not gonna go here again good thing almost every other place in Hollywood that serves chicken does a better job.

For this being a fast food chain. They have the best service I have experienced in Hollywood. They actually smile when they talk, and they are actually helpful when you ask questions. The food here is amazing!!! The chicken tastes like chicken. I know it's weird to say. But compare McDonald's chicken and chick fil a and you'll see what I mean.
The greatest thing to happen to hollywood in a long time.  I saw protestors with chicken sandwiches in their mouths :)
yuck. no thanks, i still have my taste buds intact. too salty and laced with hate.

Never been to any other Chik-Fil-A ever... but I loved it! I really loved this place from its customer service to the ambiance to its food. When I went up to order, two windows, I thought I was going to take forever waiting, but the service was pretty fast for a Saturday night around 8pm. The line wasn't that long and there was not a lot of traffic in the drive thr. When I approached the window the gentleman taking my order was very happy and friendly and started chatting it up. I expected good customer service, but not an actual conversation so I enjoyed that interaction highly. He was at tentative to my order and repeated my order to verify if he had taken it correctly.   The wait was not much I'd say it took around no less than 15 minutes. When I got my food it was neatly packed and distributed. The burger was small, I expected bigger seeing how most fast food restaurants do this, but it packed in flavor. I would say the burger tasted like a combination of a rally's burger and a Wendy's burger together. That's the best I can describe the flavor of it. I got a number 2 I believe, I do remember ordering one of their classics. The fries were oh so good! Those can be described as a McDonalds/In & Out taste, but without the grease. I got full seeing I was enjoying the taste. The seatings were outside and right infront of the street. I think out of the food and the customer service that was the best part.  I can understand if the service has gone down for some people and they have seen better times. I just think they should balance out there reviews instead of giving them one star, if they do consider that to be one star they should provice some reason as to why instead of stating something that every common review provides. Honestly be fair to the restaurant and yourselves. Just like every other restaurant they have low points and high points.  I don't care about these companies political standpoints, if I were offended to some extent of the founders words, I would first analyze what he said instead of making a statement. The man said he did not approve of gay marriage and he funds money to organizations that are against it. He did not say to murder, or raid gay couples. All he did was express his freedom of speech and the company should not be condoned for it. It seems these days no one can say other do anything that provokes violence. People need to get some patience. All in all I loved my experience there and I will be returning.

I've never been to Chick-fil-A before, but this place is amazing! Despite the recent controversy, the food here is soooo good for "fast food" and the staff at this location is unbelievable - so polite and hospitable. Located in the heart of Hollywood, this place has a great outdoor patio and very clean tables. The staff is always cleaning and asking you if they can get you anything. Free refills are great and you can choose as many dips as you'd like. The drive through is pretty quick too, but for under $7, you can get a great meal.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 700 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~What brings me to Chick-Fil-A is the recent controversy and the fact that I'd never eaten their food before, so I'll give my two cents on both.From the day Truett Cathy started the Company, he began applying Bible-Based principles to Managing his Business. The Chick-fil-A culture and service tradition is to treat every person with Honor, Dignity and Respect - Regardless of their belief, race, creed, sexual orientation or gender. And to this date they continue this tradition in the over 1,600 Restaurants run by independent Owner/Operators.We are all imperfect and at times we make mistakes and sin, the fact that I believe in Bible based principals and you choose not to doesn't mean HATE or H8 as a certain group of individuals like to cry out!, it just means I don't believe in your lifestyle.So for all the Homosexuals that may read this review, I don't agree with your choice of lifestyle but I have NO HATE towards you as an individual.   (1 CORINTHIANS 6:9-11)(9) What! Do YOU not know that unrighteous persons will not inherit God's kingdom? Do not be misled. Neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor men kept for unnatural purposes, NOR MEN WHO LIE WITH MEN, (10)nor thieves, nor greedy persons, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit God's kingdom. (11)And yet that is what some of YOU were. But YOU have been washed clean, but YOU have been sanctified, but YOU have been declared righteous in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ and with the spirit of our God.   ~AMEN~Breakfast Burrito-Spicy Chicken ($2.65) - yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… Chunks of Chick-fil-A Spicy Chicken gently mixed with scrambled eggs, fire-roasted onions and peppers and Monterey Jack and Cheddar Cheeses yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… burrito is on the small side but so is the price, nice large chunks of chicken, and the onion & pepper mix was nice with a  slight spiciness yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… could have used a little more cheese. 3.5-StarsSpicy Chicken Sandwich Deluxe (combo #4) $6.95 - yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… A boneless Breast of Chicken seasoned with a spicy blend of peppers, hand-breaded, pressure cooked in 100% peanut oil and served on a toasted buttered bun with dill pickle chips, Green Leaf lettuce, tomato and Pepper Jack cheese, sound good? it was yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… while I think Carl's Jr. has better chicken sandwiches, I'd prefer Chick-Fil-A over KFC and any other fast food Chicken spot!. 4-StarsWaffle Fries - yelp.com/biz_photos/9da1… Pretty good though it could have used some seasoning... just a little salt goes a  long way!. AVG: 3.75-Stars
If you like horrible service, cold fries, and to be haggled by the homeless community, this is the perfect restaurant for you.

Just trekked over to get some breakfast over the weekend...  Got their spicy chicken on a biscuit with pickles.  SO good!! the chicken was nice and spicy, biscuit was soo moist and fluffy.  I never was a biscuit person because i always found them to be dry, but now i love biscuits.  The boyfriend got the chicken minis.  Whatever that little bun it comes on will blow ur mind.  Its like a biscuit tasting/cornbread type texture bun.  WOW!  I could eat that bread by itself any day! To top it off, the employees are always so nice.  I always leave satisfied.

This is a truly American enterprise - with fantastic customer service and tasty food!I don't think there's a friendlier bunch than the good-natured folks serving up tasty chicken at Chick-fil-A.So, if you've been wondering what all the fuss has been about, come on down and check it out!  You will not be disappointed - and you'll have the added bonus of supporting good ole American values - like mom, baseball, and apple pie.Unless you're a communist, of course.  Communists will NOT like this place.
this place needs a  value menuthe quality of the food is very goodand the staff is excellent the seating is outside and you get to see a broad spectrum of hollywood culture kudos chick fil a

Not possible to continue to patronize an establishment that espouses hatred. I will never set foot in the place again. Hopefully, they will go out of business soon enough, or at least close their store here in Hollywood, where such vicious hatred is not welcome.
Chik-Fil-A is anti-American.  Hate is not a freedom it's an insecurity.

I have given up on Chick-Fil-A and ask anyone how believes in Americans having equal rights to do the same.  The last reviewers post compelled me to respond with my "review."  My friend, its not what they express... ITS ABOUT THE MONEY THEY GIVE to hate groups.  No way.  The freedom of expression defense of Chick-Fil-A is not a valid defense, sorry.  Its about the money $5 million (maybe even more) they donate to right wing groups to stop people like me from enjoying what other American's should enjoy.

All politics aside (as I like to keep my politics and fast food separate) I've been extremely disappointed with the quality of food at this location.  By far the worst Chick-Fil-A I've been to.  The service is always great and friendly, but the food has been horrible lately.The last couple times I've gone, there were large fat or cartilage chunks in my sandwich, it was way overcooked and some parts were so tough it was impossible to chew.  And the waffle fries, which are usually the best part were undercooked and soggy.  At least they couldn't mess up the Chick-Fil-A sauce.If you want Chick-Fil-A, I'd suggest trying another location.

This place is so depressing. With the abundant outdoor seating it is inviting for a lot of grungy street riff raff to hang around. and the smell of the food is aerated with some weird water vapor mist. but even if these were not a factor, I REFUSE to patronize an openly anti-gay establishment. I guess their employees must follow a "don't ask don't tell" policy there. They don't mind selling to those they despise though. Don't waste  your money there; especially when there are so many better options in the area, and beyond.

I tried the #1, regular and #3 Spicy Chicken Sandwich. Bith were really good. Moist and flavorful chicken on a bun w/ pickles. Lookslike condiments are served on the side and you have a choice of 6 sauces. The spicy was pretty caliente. Waffle fries were crisp and fresh. The ice cream cones looked large and tempting. Service was efficient, friendly and over and above. They had water misters to cut thebalzing so cal sumemr heat.

I went to Chick-Fil-A Appreciation Day and it was my first time eating there. As a foodie, now I understand why people rave about their chicken. It really IS that good. Best chicken sandwich I've had from a fast food chain. It's warm, juicy, tender, fresh, and flavorful. The buns are light and fluffy. The sauce (I got the original) complemented the whole ensemble.In terms of service, I noticed everyone working at this location was very friendly, cheerful, and helpful. There was someone patiently and politely directing the traffic. Our cashier had a big smile on her face when she greeted us and informed us that there wasn't a full menu running that night (we understood why). As I looked past her into the kitchen, there was no yelling, no fighting. Every worker efficiently, skillfully, and calmly churned out these delicious treats. They were all dedicated to their part of the job while knowing full well what's going on outside. I can imagine the pressure they had to deal with an influx of customers and nutty protesters screaming and yelling outside, yet they kept their cool. This tells me how well the company is treating their employees so that they are willing to work under such a high pressure condition that yesterday's event brought, and still perform their best with a smile on their faces. Kudos to the Hollywood Chick-Fil-A! You got yourself a new customer.
Tried the strips and more of the delish waffle fries today.  Can't wait to try the peach shake next time!Keep 'em coming Chick-Fil!

Quit bashing the poor chicken sandwich. We already knew the companies beliefs from the whole closed on sunday crap! I would love to hear in and outs views on gay marriage. Yeah lets boycott burgers now. For fast food its a GOD Damn good chicken sandwich and lets leave it at that.

First off I'm going to avoid dinging the place because the people that own it still prefer to live in the stone age rather than live in the present modern society but hey people are free to believe what they want to believe and do as they want with their business we can choose to patronize the business or not. Now with that out of the way I'm gonna review the food:I've been to a couple of chick-fil-A in Orange county and the food has always been pretty good to very good. This one unfortunately doesn't match the quality of the others. Their fries here just aren't up to par and I've had the grilled chicken sandwich and it's either average or very dry, however despite that, the food here is better than a lot of other fast food joints. If I'm in the area, I'll stop by here but its not a place you dirve out of the way for. Also the lines here usually suck.

How sad that so many weak and pathetic individuals have to use the star rating system on here in a bullying-style attempt to force other's to their political views.As far as the food, I found it outstanding.  Much better than the chicken sandwiches offered at BKs and McDs.  Then again those are burger places...not chicken sandwich places.  My order was served hot and fresh...and the service was quick and courteous.  The five star rating is for the quality of food and service...as the star ratings should be!

Very good chicken sandwich and diet lemonaid. Help friendly and answered my questions for my first visit. Recomend street parking if available.I have not used KFC in years so I can't compare, but CFA chicken is way better than MCD or EL POLO LOCO.Will definitely eat at CFA again. Wish one was closer to my 'hood."

I have been to this location twice..it is brand new and has two drive-thrus that include and two-way video screen.  I used to love this place but I won't be going to any CFAs any more due to the company's donations to anti-gay rights groups.

This restaurant has excellent food and excellent service.I also want people to know that Chick Filet is a franchise and the beliefs of a CEO in another state are not necessarily that of the independently owned Chick Filet here in Hollywood.
As much as I loved the chick-fil-a, HATE gives me gas.no more chick-fil-a

OMG - I am freaking obsessed with the spicy chicken sandwich. Being from  NY, I've only ever had Chik-Fil-A once before, years ago in Florida. It was so long ago that I don't really remember what I had but I know that it was good enough for to warrant me getting really excited and telling my husband that we HAD to go there before our trip was over. Turns out that didn't happen until the last day of our trip, but SO glad that we made it a point to stop. We had just had a huge brunch (see my review for Saddle Ranch Chop House), and had to be at the airport fairly soon, so we decided to get the food to go and eat it later. I was worried about how well the food would travel, so I tasted a waffle fry when it was hot and it was yummy.  Hours later it was pretty much your average cold fries, but still good. The chicken nuggets were bigger than I expected, and very meaty. I like that they offer so many dipping sauces, and, though I read that they have a strict max, they put 2 of each in our bag - shoot, if I had known that, I would have gotten 4 different types! The creme de la creme here for me though, was the sandwich. Everything, from the soft bread to the perfectly seasoned meat (which wasn't very spicy, despite it's name), was just.... superb. If it tasted that good cold, DAMNNNN it must have been amazing hot and fresh. I would recommend this place just on the strength of that sandwich. Everything else ain't so bad, either!

If you've ever wondered what a pickle juice and MSG soaked, deep fried chicken anus might taste like, eat at Chick-Fil-A. Question answered!Also, the owner would like all gay people to turn straight and/or disappear. What's not to love?
LOVE. Edit: July 27 2012. Over it bc they initially used prime cut chicken and the buns were amazing. After they get u hooked they downgraded the quality. It seems.

A very different Chick-fil-A style restaurant.  There is NO indoor seating.  Everything is outside!  At least they have water misters around the entire ordering location.  Great service...a couple of employees would navigate through all the seating area taking any requests (drink refills, clearing trash, etc.).  Food was fresh and accurate.

ugh, I got a kids meal the other day (because me not pig) and the toy that came with it was garbage. I guess they don't have the Jim Henson toys anymore, because the Jim Henson company called them out for being homophobes, or whatever?? either way, this toy sucked and my nuggets were dry.ugh!:(

It's interesting to see all the negative reviews regarding the recent news. I don't agree with what the President belives in but I will continue to eat at Chik-Fil-A. Honestly, I don't eat here enough in a year for my $$$ to make an impact.I still love the kids meal with 6 piece nuggets, apple juice, an ice cream cone and all the yummy fattie sauces.
This is a company of bigots pushing unhealthy products.  I haven't supported them since I found our their stance on equality issues and urge you not to either. (And the food is VERY overrated)

We tried to eat here the first time on a Sunday and it wasn't open.   I went here a week later and got a chicken sandwich, fries and coke.  I had to wait a very long time  for my meal as they had some problem with getting more chicken.   When I got it was very greasy on the outside and raw on the inside.  I sent it back and the guy was not very nice about having me ask for a new piece.  The fries were also greasy.The staff here is very slow and not friendly.  The food is just really bad.  Plus the place is dirty!I asked why they closed on Sunday (seems like a day most folks eat out) and the guy said because we are religious and you should be too!Really, you going to take my money for a bad meal and then try to tell me that I should be religious????I won't be going back here - it was really bad.

Was incredibly underwhelmed- the chicken sandwich I had was dry and too salty, and the dry, unwelcoming service made McDonalds seem like a God.  Never coming back to Chick-Fil-A, would rather go to KFC or make my own chicken sandwich at home....

Once upon a time when I lived in Atlanta, I loved Chick-Fil-A. It was truly my boo. Fast forward some years and states. This Chick-fil-a was a bit creepy. I go through the drive-thru when I'm feeling anti-social. I went twice..the second time I noticed a face. A huge face staring at me and asking my name as I order. A monitor with a face looking right at me. Feeling weird mode on. The strange part was the face taking my order was not the same face taking the money nor dishing the food. huh? ..so there's someone alone in a back room with cameras taking orders and asking names. ..ok.I like that they have the calories on the menu but oh man are those a lot of calories. My shake was bland as well as the fries and nuggets. For all of those calories, the food should taste a lot better. Maybe I should just stick with the chicken minis and call it a day.  For all the calories the menu claims, I want eating it to be worth it.

So a friend of mine FORCED me to eat this stuff, swearing it was the best chicken sandwich ever and I should just ignore the political leanings of the owners and that my money was supporting hateful causes.This would mean that the food would have to be OUTSTANDING to overcome this.I had the deluxe chicken sandwich.Do they put some type of mind control ingredient in the food that didn't work on me?  It was nothing special... KFC quality chicken sandwich.  Then throw in the discrimination policy and why on earth would you eat here?There are SO MANY really good chicken sandwiches available at so many places in LA (Honey Kettle's, Son of a Gun, I actually find the Veggie Grill sante fe chicken sandwich better... which isn't chicken!), I can't quite figure out why anyone would bother going to Chick-Fil-A?

Alright, let's just throw it out there - They hate the gays. Yup, their chicken may be tasty, but man does their PR completely suck. Look, In-n-out may have bible verses typed on the soft drinks and other food wrappers but you don't see people protesting them simply because as religious as they may be, they don't shove it down your throat like Chick-Fil-A seems to love to do. On that alone, I may never come to this location again. It's just too close to the heart of L.A's gay community. So if you're seen in line getting your sweet tea, well let's just say it's not going to get you a whole mess of friends. Then again, being in line here means you're going to be there for a while, even if they have two ordering windows. The process to get that simple chicken sandwich to your grubby hands is a long one. Seriously. While I may say that the criss cross fries are pretty damn tasty, what exactly makes them better than the waffle cut fries from Carl's Jr? Then again, Carl's Jr. is also one of those who doesn't support gay marriage. So hey, politics and fast food simply should not mix... again though, the amount that Chick-fil-a jams it down our throats is just unappealing and drops that craving for sweet tea. Anyhow, the service is slow and on a Friday... my god, this place is packed. Extremely packed. Frankly, the wendy's does an equally good sandwich and the only reason this gets to the middle ground is that it is the "healthier" option when eating fast food, but the shit you need to deal with to get it just doesn't make it all that worth it. Also, the limited dipping sauces, as if it was some treasure or rare commodity in how they look at you sideways when asking for more packets just make you feel like you peed in their bushes. Sorry, but that's the bum who was asking for change and not me.

Why can't anyone come out with a good fast food chain to compete against Church-fil-A?  The obviously do not care about your health since they put MSG in their mix for their original chicken sandwiches.  And why can't you freaking put mustard on my sandwich for me instead of me having to put it on the grilled sandwich myself.  The bare chicken tastes gross without any mustard or further seasoning.  Closed on Sundays = Lame.IF you want the best fast food chicken that is a national chain and somewhat healthier KFC has amazing GRILLED chicken breasts.The only good star they get is that they are open late and the sweet tea is nice but you can get that at Starbucks.

Politics aside, Chick-Fil-A is too good for me to pass up.  They have every right to their religious beliefs as anyone else has the right to support whatever cause they believe in.  I crave their nuggets and sandwiches well and often.  The fries I could do without.  The kid's meal is fab and they give out Little Critter and Golden Books in lieu of useless plastic toys. Super cool in my opinion.  Also, Chick-Fil-A sauce alone is God's work, haha.  Thankfully they sell it in tubs. I'll be a customer forever.

Closed on Sundays. Kickass sauces. Waffle fries are a favorite. Drive thru may look long but they have your order by the time you pay! ZOMG! They also have a walk-up window which is fast, and a tiny little parking lot, which if youre lucky you can find a spot. They even have Coke Zero as a drink option. what more could i ask for!I always get their Delux Spicy Chicken Sandwich. If you dont get delux, it's basically plain chicken and bun. The Trimmin's on the Delux are so fresh: LEAFY GREEN Lettuce, Ripe Red tomatoes, and salty pickles. and it's actually pretty spicy, unlike those other places that callit "spicy" but cant taste a thing. There are so many sauces to choose from, and if you know me, i'm a condiments connoisseur, so really appreciate this! get 1 of each, or find your favorite. Why is it always sunday nights when i crave this awesome chicken sandwich??

what can I say....chick-fil-a is pretty damn good!!!!  I ate at this location after coming from a party and it was such a memorable experience.  The sandwiches are great and taste fresh. They're actually made with real pieces of lettuce and tomatoes. The checker fries are to die for. They're so amazingly crispy and delicious especially when dipped in the buttermilk ranch...MmmmmmNever a disappointing experience at chick-fil-a!!!

I don't get it -- KFC stomps all over this place.   The chicken is ok, but nothing special.  The criss-cut fries are bland and tasteless.  The rolls they use are just plain and doughy white bread.     The only good thing at this resto is the cool video drive-up, but the inexplicable lines are always so long it's never worth it.  The whole menu is super processed, high fat, white food...  So many better restos all around to choose from.

The chicken is fine here. Average, really. I had the sandwich with lettuce, tomato (hold for me) pickles and cheese. The Deluxe, maybe? Nice touch deducting $0.15 for no tomatoes. I went with standard Chik-Fil-A sauce, which is just a very processed honey mustard. The service is friendly for fast food in LA.I suppose if I grew up with this, I would be a die hard fan. Oh wait, there has been one in the Del Amo Mall for about thirty years so I guess I did grow up with Chik-Fil-A. And yet, not a die hard fan. Like I said, average.Whoever designed this location should be fired. No entrance from Highland and only ten or so parking spaces. Not a good layout for a place with such a cult following. That's just poor planning. Also, it's annoying that a fast food place is closed on Sunday. Yeah, I know the reason, but it's still annoying.

Gettin' me Deluxe Chickin Sammich!...And it was good!My work studio moved to the area last October and we have been going here since our first day.I had Chick-Fil-A once a years back when I was in the east coast so it was awesome seeing a one here in LA.  Actually it was Awesome seeing the sign here before it opened after the Chuck Jr that was here before closed down.Usually it's pretty crowded here from the students from the near by schools, but once in a while it's fairly empty...today was one the later.I really like this place a lot.  The service is good, and the food just as good.  I like the menu items and try to get something different every time I come here.  Usually, I'll get my order to go, as I work 2 blocks away, though I have eaten there before.  The dining area is out door only, so I can't imagine it being crowded on a rainy days, but I won't hold it against them.  Also as this part of Hollywood can get sketchy at night (or during the day), there is an Armed Security guard walking the grounds.  The parking lot is fairly small, and the drive through has 2 lines that merger into one so traffic in the lot can vary during different times of day.  Sadly the intersection of Sunset & Highland is usually busy so it could be a bit difficult going in (from McCadden Pl).As I mentioned above, this location is 2 blocks away from work so I try not to come here so often, and it's more like a guilty pleasure.

This place is good. Nothing special though. The staff is nice. They knew it was my first time eating there so they suggested all the sauce I should try. I had the #2 Chicken Deluxe Burger. I would recommend this place. I just wish they would be a little bit cheaper since it's fast food and all.

Growing up in the South, I've been lucky enough to have access to Chick-Fil-A, all my life.I love their whole menu. I love their customer service. I love how I can ask for as many sauce packets, and they'll easily oblige.Good, tasty food, great service, Chick-Fil-A is a no brainer for me!Know though, this location does NOT have indoor seating, and parking is very limited.Food: 4Ambience: 3Service: 5Value: 4
Anyone who doesn't rate this place 5 stars obviously hasn't had chicken minis for breakfast. CHICKEN MINIS

I did not know a chicken sandwich could taste so good. It was juicy, and most of all it had flavor! I was going to opt for all the fixins of veggies and cheese like I would the few times I eat out at fast food restaurants, but my bf said just get the chicken patty with bun without all that other stuff. Wow, he was absolutely right. The first bite I took I could really taste the chicken and the brine it must have been in over night, as suggested by my bf. Very satisfied with the quality and freshness, not to mention a very BIG chicken patty on a simple bun, which complimented the flavors of the chicken, and I actually like the sandwich better without any of their sauces. If I had to choose a sauce I liked most it would be their Chick-fil-A sauce...My experience eating here was perfect, and I did not expect it coming from an American  fast food restaurant. I hope they NEVER change their recipe.

Delish! Customer service is Fantastic! Quality, considering it's fast food, price is right, location is accessible as far as distance, but I do cringe when going into the area, simply due to the traffic. However, the customer service makes up for that and then some.

I love Chick-Fil-A!I grew up in Georgia, eating Chick-Fil-A, so I'm happy to see them expanding in Los Angeles.Same great service and food that I am used to.  I always get a sweet tea & waffle fries but I change up the sandwiches & nuggets or chicken strips.Great location at Sunset & Highland across from Hollywood High School.  Nice, late hours and there's a drive through here.One drawback is the heavy traffic at this intersection, it makes it difficult to get in and out  :)

I had my Chich-Fil-A fix today for lunch for the first time in months (since I was in Miami) and it was so satisfying. I had the grilled chicken sandwich and some waffle fries....gosh, it was so good. The service is exceptional! The cashier and the lady/man who walks around asking you if you need a refill or additional condiments is a plus!

this isn't your usual, run-of-the-mill, orange country chick-fil-a.  before this location and the USC one were built, i'd stop at chick-fil-a whenever i was in orange county.  there you could tell the staff was extremely well trained at making you feel welcome and at home. here you can tell the staff is extremely well trained at getting you in and getting you out as quickly as possible. despite how successful (if not super friendly) the staff is, it's still not easy to do that.  the parking lot and drive-thru are a complete bitch, both fed by a single entrance which means you're gonna sit in your car for a while whether you want to drive-thru or just walk up to the window.  unlike the other locations, here they're extremely stringent about their dipping sauces. while in other chick-fil-a's the sauces are out and just begging you to stuff you pockets full of poly and BBQ sauces, here you have to tell them which kinds you want - and ask nicely if you can have more than the allotted one that comes standard with the meal.  also there's always a security guard standing by the hand-off window... i'm not sure if that makes me feel safer, or really unsafe that they even need a guard there at all.beyond all that, the food is as good as any other chick-fil-a location - soaked in some kind of chemical that probably causes cancer, but who the hell cares when it tastes this good?  if only the parking lot weren't such a clusterfuck.

If God were to come down, personally raise a chick from a round egg to a full grown adult, carefully caring for him and giving him the proper nutrition the chicken needed, making sure it got 8 hours of sleep every night, then dicing it up, bathing it in fresh spices, marinating it homemade goodness for several hours, fryi it and serve it with potato wedges and Diet Dr. Pepper, this is what it would taste like.

I pretty much love all things Chick-fil-A.  I think there are some reviewers on here with some unreasonable expectations of a $7 chicken sandwich combo. Seriously follks. They do fast food really well. It's quicker to park on the street and order at the window than it is to wait in the drive thru line.

I had high expectations.  People are always raving about this place.  Yeah, it's real chicken meat.  But flavor-wise?  Eh.  Nothing about it spells unique.  Anyone can throw a slab of chicken into a fryer, but not everyone knows how to season it well.  Don't care too much for the sauces either.  Tried six different "flavors".  Just salty and tasteless.

Why is this place still in business? Tried the spicy chicken combo with waffle fries, and the flavor was so disappointing/non-existent/forgettable. I'm truly shocked to see all these good reviews. I would take Jack in the Box's Spicy Chicken over this ANY day. Or even chicken nuggets.But the service was good. So I'll give it 1.5 stars. I'll be nice and round it up to 2 stars.

I love Chick-Fil-A, I am from Texas and they're all over the place there, when they opened this location I was ecstatic.  My boyfriend and I went and decided to endure the god awful long line that had us waiting on the street and to our surprise it moved SO QUICKLY.  This location has two lines and are the most efficient at getting through it than any business I have ever encountered.  The workers are friendly while taking your order, clear speaking and repeat everything back to you, they ask your name and they even tell the people in line a or b who should pull up behind which sedan that way you don't accidentally pull up in the wrong order.  I swear it took us 5 minutes max to get through the line and get our food.The girls at the window continued to use my name "Courtney, how are you today?"  it was just super nice and not at all like a typical fast food experience.  Our food was perfect and alas I finally found a soda in Cali that doesn't suck, the mix of carbination to syrup is perfecto.  Love it.

I'm not one to write reviews on fast food joints, but Chic-Fil-A I'll make an exception.This is one of the FEW fast food places I'll eat at (in & out being the other), and I come here mainly for the 8 piece chicken pieces & their amazing lemonade!! Their sauces are extremely rich & delicious and the waffle fries are of course a plus. I haven't had any bad experiences with the food here, but then again I always eat here during the day. I know they always have a heavy line when I do cruse by around lunch and I can only imagine how crazy it is at night.A good alternate to the typical run of the gamut fast food chains nearby.

I usually don't review fast food. But Chick Fil-A is so much more than that...My life was a dark dark place before Chick Fil-A opened the USC and Hollywood locations.As a strict chicketarian, this place is a godsend!I can tell the food is fresh and wholesome (despite being deep-fried) because unlike every other fast-food place, it does not make my tummy hurt after eating it!I LOVE Chick Fil- A.Passionately.Completely.Desperately.So much so that I am willing to overlook it's MAJOR red-flags and flaws:-Not open on Sundays-- usually when I'm near one and/or need it the most.-Owned by super conservative people that support things I'm majorly against.ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew ew.*it's ok, think of the chicken... the number 1, the spicy chicken, the chicken tenders*OK back to normal.Love the food. Hate the owners. But gimme some more of that delicious chicken!

Somehow I always seem to have a craving on a Sunday when they're closed. If they were open then, they'd get a 5. But I guess you gotta respect their values.I usually stick to chicken nuggets or sandwiches + fries and a shake. You can really taste the quality over other fast food.
