Definitely a solid upgrade over the dirty, mini Carl's Jr that used to reside. The chicken just tastes so much more tender and juicier than competitor's. Both the cookies and cream and banana pudding shakes are bomb. Taste much more "real" than other competitors as well. Doesn't really matter what time of day it is, but the drive thru line will always be out of the parking lot and into the street. Part of this has to do with the popularity of the location, open late, etc but it also has to do with the drive thru design. There are two lanes that merge into one, but the cashier/food window is at the front of the building, so there is a long exit driveway once you get your food. If you got your food at the end of the line, there probably wouldn't be so much logjam in the street. Anyways, don't let the spillover into the street deter you, it moves quick and you'll get your food faster than you can say closed on Sunday. P.S. There's cameras at the drive thru so you can see the cashier and they can see you when placing an order. Cool, or awkward?
Long time listener, first time caller.. ill be back like arnold says..

Yes, it's fast food - but oh so delicious fast food. This was my first Chick-Fil-A experience and I was hesitant to go because i really don't like fast food places. All my mid-west friends raved about it and insisted that I go. They said "Think the chicken sandwich version of In/Out Burger."I must say, I'm glad I tried it out. I can get away with just getting a chicken sandwich  - getting my junk food fix - and not feeling guilty afterwards. Also when I'm craving chicken fingers, this place fixes my craving fast. Those little nuggets are delicious!Sit outside on a nice day or give yourself time for the drive through... it takes FOREVER. Also, don't make any faces at the lady taking your order in the window. They have cameras on you and she will be quick either laugh at you or say something!

Finally L.A gets a chik-fil-A! The service at this one is pretty good. They will even  come and refill your drinks for you sometimes. I consider them the chicken version of In-N-Out. The only difference is In-N-Out fries suckkk and Chick-fil-A waffle fries are sooo good.

Should I be worried that the security guard walks around with a gun in his holster? Do people get jacked of their delicious chic fil a sandwiches? Are gang members hanging out on this corner in hollywood claiming their territory? I think you have to dodge a few crack heads once in awhile since there is only outside seating. Other than what I mentioned above... Chic fil a is so good!  Parking doesn't look very friendly and there seems always be a long drive thru line out to the side street.

Chick-Fil-A(wful) I ordered an Original Chicken Sandwich meal and this is my experience:I don't get it. They served me a soggy chicken sandwich that did not taste very good. Even their waffle french fries (which everyone raves about) were bland and boring as well. In my opinion, a disappointing fast food choice. I will not be coming here again.The only PRO is that their sauce selection is quite good. My favorite was the Buffalo Sauce (it was the only thing that made the sandwich edible). Their Polynesian sauce is nice as well. Maybe I need to try the sandwich directly after ordering it, but from my experience, Chick-Fil-A is "for the birds"... not for me.Pleasant eating everyone... probably somewhere else.

Chick-Fil-A(ppauling!)I was extremely excited to try Chick-Fil-A for my first time ever, and after that I will NEVER go back again. While I was ordering, I saw a bun fall on the floor and a staff member pick it back up and place it on an order without even thinking twice. I said something to the cashier and was told that I must have been mistaken. I almost walked away right then, but my friend assured me the food was great and I should forget about it. My food came and I hunkered down to devour it, trying to forget the bun dramz. Not only did I find a piece of long hair in my fries, that clearly wasn't mine, but I brought the issue up with another cashier and was told "it could've been yours, sir". Ummmm last time I checked I wasn't wearing a weave, wig and anything that resembled a foot long piece of ratty hair. A full refund was in order and perhaps a toy or something.Thankfully my innards have been sparred from eating at this crap den again.I gave this DUMP 1 star for service, that sucked it harder than Monica Lewinsky, and sanitary conditions that a rat would abhor.

An Atlanta girl at heart, I had really been missing having a Chick Fil A nearby.  Therefore, I was so excited once this one opened in Hollywood :)I have been twice- the second day it opened and again a few weeks ago.  Even on opening weekend, the service was very quick and friendly.  Even better, the cookies & cream milkshakes and the waffle fries (with Polynesian suce of course) taste just as good as they do at home in GA.

FINALLY!  I'm a Georgia native and oh Chic-Fil-A how I missed you.  This is still pretty far from the Westside, but worth it when I'm around Hollywood any other day besides Sunday.  Just about anything on the menu is good here, I never personally liked their chicken salad sandwiches (don't remember if that still on the menu), but everything else is good.There's no inside dining here, so if you're here late night sometimes you'll have a sketchy person come around, but they have a security guard on duty to keep things manageable.

On this visit, I had the deluxe sandwich combo and it was great!  The sandwich was a lot bigger than I thought it would be - I have huge hands, and it took both hands to handle.  Sometimes you can handle a sandwich with one hand, but not this one.  The waffle fries are OK, may need a bit more salt and to be a little more crunchy - but, that's to taste.  At this location, there is only outdoor seating.   Also, unlike other locations, they don't have sauces out for grabbing, instead, upon ordering you are asked which of their all so yummy sauces you want.

Good chicken strips, but the seating arrangement here is not acceptable.  There are only a few tables, and no inside seating.  I feel like it's always a gamble whether there will be seating.  For lunch, I really don't want to battle other customers for a seat.

It took me two times to really appreciate this place. The last time, i got mini sliders, and i guess i just felt unimpressed. This time, i went with some buddies, and we got the chicken biscuit for breakfast. It was like i had a revelation. Straight up, the breading on both the chicken, and the texture of the biscuits were awesome. I'd recommend getting two per a person. A great tasty sandwich.

How can you go wrong with Chik-Fil-A? Everyone who works there is really nice and the food is fantastic! I always get the Spicy Chicken Deluxe Meal. I really appreciate a good spicy chicken sandwich, especially if it has swiss cheese and lettuce and tomato on it! (It's even better if you put Chik-Fil-A sauce on it, but that might just be my inner junk food addict coming out..) I really enjoy the waffle fries, too. Thank GOD there is a Chik-Fil-A in Hollywood, otherwise, I would never know the glory that is the Spicy Chicken. Check it out if the line for In-N-Out Burger is too long! :)
The people working here are so nice - all the time. The atmosphere is cool - nice outdoor seating. I love Chick-Fil-A :)

I was really surprised to find such a long drive-thru line when we went to Chick-Fil-A last night.  I mean it is good, but it's no In-n-Out.  The line was also moving at a snail's pace, which was hard for me to understand since their menu is also very limited like In-n-Out's.This was my first time eating at this particular Chick-Fil-A, and I was really disappointed with my meal compared to previous experiences.  The fries were bland and needed salt, my drink was primarily ice, and my chicken sandwich was cold when I got home to eat it.  Even with being in an aluminum wrapper, it was cold after only 15 minutes.  It just wasn't what I have grown to expect from Chick-Fil-A.I have always liked Chick-Fil-A, and I am hoping that this was just a one time experience.  I will most likely try it again to see if this location measures up to other locations.  So 'til next time Chick-Fil-A...hopefully it is better!
I love Chick-fil-a. Their sandwiches are superior to all other chicken sandwiches. The location is good too. The drive thru was quick today and the service was courteous. Good stuff

I was in between the wedding and the reception and I was starving so i knew they opened up this location.  I swung by and was in the drive through waiting for my nuggets, waffle fries and my lemonade.The only thing I didn't like a was a beggar sitting on a chair right before where you pay and he was asking for handouts. That was a total turn-off. He called me a name cause I rolled up my windows. The lemonade was da bomb and my nuggets were great. I had to pull over down the street to chomp it all down.
I always love stoping here for great chicken sandwiches when I'm on this side of LA

I looooove Chick Fil-A. When I first tried it, I wasn't really that impressed. But, it grew on me a lot and now I love it. The chicken is nice and moist and I love the crunchy end pieces from the breading, which is greasy and salty but I don't care, I'm young and I'm free.Aly is a really cute worker too and really nice! She is usually the one who is there at the drive thru. I don't usually remember the people in the fast food pickup window, but I've been there so many times that it's hard not to remember.

Chick-Fil-A was definitely a childhood staple. Their french fries are definitely the best in the fast food industry. The nuggets are what I come here for although I've heard the spicy chicken sandwich is the meal to get. The dipping sauces are also the best I've ever tried and as a condiment guy I recommend the polynesian sauce. There may not be a lot of Chick-Fil-A s around but when you run into one, I urge you to pull over and grab a bite to eat.

Meh. I decided to give Chick-Fil-A a second chance, after all when I first went to this location it was brand new and I figured they had some kinks to work out. I was wrong. The service is still friendly, but the fries are still beyond bland. Seriously, I felt like I was eating severely undercooked, bland potato. What am I ? A baby. I'm sure it'd be delicious if I was two. Alas, I have tastebuds. I'd rate Carls Jr. fries 100x better - if that's not an issue I don't know what is.

I went to this Chik-fil-A when it opened last year.  Sadly, the chicken was dry, the waffle fries were nothing special, and the service was terrible...maybe because the staff wasn't fully trained?  I visited it about a month later and it was only marginally better.  What's so hard about making chicken that isn't dry?Then I found out that they donated $2M to Anti-Gay Groups like the American "Family" Association. So not only is the food bad, but their morals stink, too.  No thanks!

Take notice L.A. proprietors: it's AMAZING how far a little kindness can go.Despite the fact that this place has the best nuggets I've ever had anywhere in my entire life, fully half the reason I frequent this place is actually because everyone there is always so NICE!In the land of holier-than-thou aloofness, too-cool-for-school indifference, and outright hatefulness, a staff that is warm, friendly, and ever-helpful is an absolute joy and relief to encounter. And enough to keep folks coming back again and again. Well, Southern folks, anyway.

GET ME A SPICY CHICKEN SANDWICH AND SOME WAFFLE FRIES...I love that I can choose as much dipping sauce as I want to go with my Waffle fries or Sandwich.... Service is very friendly, delicious chicken sandwiches and hopefully I can finally try their breakfast one of these days....Closed on Sundays.

Elusive Chick-Fil-A. I have hunted you like a unicorn or double rainbow , and desired you forever. FOREVER. But my timing is always off. It's always a Sunday when I decide I want you. But you're never available on Sundays much to my disappointment. But I completely understand, my precious unicorn, the need for a day of rest to create deliciousness every other day of the week.Nevertheless while in LA recently, friends were completely surprised that I've never been and too pity on a poor Chick-Fil-A virgin, and helped me pop this cherry. Oh god yes, it was so good. So very very good and saucy. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich deluxe and devoured the warm sandwich in a matter of minutes and then wished I ordered a second despite being terribly terribly full. And yes I would absolutely go back, hell I wanted to sing from the rooftops as to how good this was.Why aren't you in the SF bay area however? It boggles my mind.

I've only had Chick-Fil-A once and it lived up to all the hype my cousins, sister, and friends gave it. I had their nuggets with Polynesian Sauce and Chick-Fil-A sauce - YUM! Their sweet tea - REFRESHING although a little too sweet for me. And their Waffle Fries - BEST waffle fries I've ever had! Oh and the cheesecake - creamy and sweet. Not sure if my was store bought or homemade, but it was creamy enough to rave about.Another good thing about them, the servers are really nice. when I went with my sister and her boyfriend, we decided to get an order of their cheesecake before we left. The cashier asked for the name to call us when our order was ready and my sister's boyfriend said "Bazinga." Lo and behold, they called that out and the employee and fun saying it. They all had a good laugh.

Love-Hate Relationship with Chick-Fil-A. LOVE their Chicken Nuggets with some Chic Fil A sauce. I haven't moved past the nuggets and strips because I love me some of that stuff. I have to try the "original" chicken sandwichI really, really dislike, possibly HATE the fact that they use the money we give them to support anti-gay activities. Especially since this location is in Hollywood/West Hollywood area, I just think it's odd.

My darling Chick-Fil-A, why do I love you so?It could be your amazing waffle fries, yummy chicken all sorts of ways, cool ketchup packets, or a myriad of other things....Whatever the reason for my lifetime infatuation with delicious Chick-Fil-A, I am thankful that I have sweet respite way over here on the West coast.
This food is so good... Chicken Nuggets, fries, lemonade and some Chic Fil A sauce makes me oh, so happy.

It's pretty sad to say because I love chick fila so much, but this location is not that great! The drive thru lines are ridiculously long to the point where cars are waiting in the streets to even order due to the not so fast service that I am used to at previous locations. Of course the quality of food is still awesome but the customer service is not as friendly as other locations.Pros: Open late late hours, Drive Thru Service, Outdoor Dining, DELICIOUS FOODCons: Mediocre customer service, ridiculously long lines, small parking lot

I have to change my review of this place. The food is great, but the service is simply lousy. A friend gave me several of his "first 100" coupons which entitles you to a feeel meal with drink. No where on the card does is say you can get lemonade. in fact three times I was able to get lemonade with no extra charge, but they it started to change. The price has been different at least four times, even the sandwich you order has been changed a few times and each time there is no real reason why. FREE is FREE and if there are restrictions then they should be printed on the dame card. PERIOD. Furthermore the staff should know what to charge each customer. In other words read from the same freaking script.Each time I've presented the card I've been with at least four other people who are actually paying full price for their meals, so it's not like we all are getting free meals. The last time I went in I was asked to pay $1.00 for the lemonade and this is when the lady who ordered before me with the very same kind of card asked me why I had to pay extra. When I told her that lemonade does not come with the meal, she tells me she never pays anything extra and she always gets the spicy sandwich and presents the very same cards I have and not once has she been asked to pay. We both spoke to the manager and he had no explanation as to why this happened. Well first he said the person made a mistake, bu the lady shows receipts she has from other visits where she's paid NOTHING extra. He just looked at us both and said "well I'll give you the lemonade this time"Moral of the story is FREE means just that. Not FREE when we decide or FREE for certain people........AND I'm Black, so I can fry way better chicken, so screw Chick-Fil-A
Tasty original chicken sandwich. Waffle fries would taste better if they kept it in the fryer a bit longer.
I did the drive-thru to get some waffle fries. So good!

For the hype, I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich, polynesian sauce, waffle fries, and a Dr. Pepper. I liked the chicken itself quite a bit, but the bun reminded me of McDonald's, a bit on the greasy side, although tasty. The sweet polynesian sauce paired great with the spiciness of the chicken sandwich too. Although, next time though, I'll pass on the waffle fries. Not crispy or flavorful enough  for the calories, for sure.
fries are bomb bay. great dual drive through. its needed because they are packed.  good stuff!

Ehhh, it's aight.  Basically wendy's chicken meals and carl jr's potato wedges.  There is no inside seating too which sucks for cold days.  They have a security guard which is clever and funny because it is pretty hood where they are at.

The staff is very friendly and cracked us up while handing us our food.  And the food was good.  Not much I could eat (I had some coleslaw) but my boyfriend really enjoyed his sandwich and chicken nugget things.

Ok...Chick-Fil-A is Chick-Fil-A.Delicious chicken sandwich and great service (not even just for a fast food joint...great service overall!) The workers are always smiling (you can hear it in their voice!) and I've always loved how they make sure to ask what your name is. Seems so much more personal and friendly.This Chick-Fil-A is especially cool...or maybe I'm just a dork who got amused by this, but when you pull up to order, the little ordering screen shows the worker's face taking your order!We asked for extra Honey Roasted BBQ sauce and they definitely delivered. Yum yum yum. Coming back here tonight. Not good for my new year's resolution-bod, but definitely good for my tastebuds. :)

For a "drive-in" restaurant, this place surely caught me off guard.The chicken is not like other fast food joints, it's actually cooked semi-healthy and I don't feel sick or bloated after I ate the food here. The chicken nuggets are NOT like other popular fast food retailers-the chicken here is actually tasty, has yummy crisp outer skin, and it REAL chicken.The chicken sandwiches are quite tasty as well; all they consist of is the crispy chicken-patty, a few pickles, and the bread...They have different dipping sauces here called, polynesian, chick-Fil-a & of course BBq sauce- I personally mixed the polynesian and the bbq sauce---GOOD MIX!ULLTIMATE MUST TRY:1) criss-cut fries, they are cooked in peanut oil....very light &delicious, can't feel bad eating them :)Enjoy, Cheers!

Chick-Fil-A might be for LA folks, what In-n-Out is for East Coasters. It's only a chicken sandwich, but its sooooo yummy! And hell, I can now get one whenever I want without having to be on a layover in the Delta Terminal at the Atlanta airport.Fast, SUPER friendly service, and the food doesn't taste super greasy and bland. Get your chick with the Polynesian sauce, and a Lemonade. Probably the BEST lemonade I've ever had.

First time eating at  ChickFilA today. Fast service and a nice tasty chargrilled chicken sandwich arrived. Good selection of sauces and some nicely cut wedge fries w/skins on. Marinade/spice on the chicken is very good and the whole wheat bun works too. Next time I'll try the #1 meal.

Eh. The chicken has often been fatty and chewy, which leads me to believe I can't trust it. Sure, the food always comes out super fast, but is that always good? The Chick Fil A I ised to eat at in Pennsylvania was SO much better, so I am very disappointed.

I love you Chik-Fil-A!  A la Jessie Spano, "I'm so excited! I'm so excited! I'm so..so..SCARED..."Wait, scared? What?!  NO. Just excited!!!!!!!   I first tried Chik-Fil-A with some friends who live out in Torrance where they've been lucky enough to have their own Chik-Fil-A for a while now. When I heard they were building one in Hollywood I totally freaked out...and then I forgot. It took them SO long to build it! But while I was searching for new apartments last month, I drove down Highland to get to go look at some new Miracle Mile spots and when I hit Sunset I almost had a heart attack!It took me a while to get there, but last week I finally went to Chik-Fil-A...Twice. It was just as delicious as I remembered! moist, perfectly seasoned REAL chicken (not the stuff that's made of ground up who knows what and has the same texture as a sponge) . Lots of yummy sauces to choose from and the waffle cut fries. Oh. My.Word. Crisp, filled with real potato and piping hot!I could not believe how fast the service was here! Got there around 8pm on a weeknight and the place was hoppin' Still I didn't have to wait in line more than 5 minutes and my order came out less than 5 minutes after that. The whole time my friend and I were there, both lines of the drive through were packed, but always moving. I think it' the fastest moving drive through (and walk up) I've ever seen. Even faster than In-N-Out!  It was FREEZING cold outside. But my friend and I braved the weather and sat outside. Comforted by our delicious chicken and waffle cut fries. OH! And the lemonade is legit. Fresh squeezed, not that country-time --so-highlighter-yellow-it must make your insides glow-crap. I know it's a small storefront, but I would love to be able to sit inside next time.That is all.
and theres a brand new one coming up on Hawthorn in Torrance...yeay!

Chick-fil-A has the best fast food chicken sandwiches on the planet. Stick to the original sandwich or the strips with that chick-fil-a sauce... Yeeeeah!  Can't wait for the hype to die down so I don't have to wait forever and a day for these.

Great service, delicious food....you can't go wrong with c of a. Ordered nugg meal and an Oreo milkshake. They had a waitress come around and offer refills so you wouldn't have to get up....what other fast food restaurant does that?! The nuggs and waffle fries were delicious and I love all the sauces they have to dip! The milkshake was better than any milkshake I've ever had and we're comparing to Milk, Millions of Milkshakes, you name it. This was a great experience overall and I will definitely be back!

Tried them for the first time yesterday.Friends from the South always told me about Chick Fil-a but now that they've expanded to Cali, I had to try them.The chicken is very good. Had their chicken salad, and also tried their nuggets.Only thing is that they messed up a bit of the order (no sauce that I asked for), but that's minor.
Very good chicken sandwich, great service, great Company. WAFFLE FRIES!The regular and spicy sandwiches, both very good. Sauces- very good. Closed on Sundays.

I'm a bit ashamed to say I've recently been obsessed with the Hollywood Chick Fil A' -- a marvel of fast food technological achievement. You approach a daunting line of cars and think, "Oh hell, there goes my day," but the line moves like a pit stop at the Indy 500. When you get to the window, they greet you by name, throw the food in your car and practically pickpocket you to get paid so they can move onto the next customer. If you fumble with your wallet, YOU'RE the a-hole. They are closed on Sundays though, which is a violation of my freedom to eat, and the company supports politics I find repugnant, so I give it only a 3.

Took me forever to make it to a Chick-Fil-A (always seemed to find their locations on Sundays). Psyched that they're finally in LA. It's lived up to everything I've ever heard. Their spicy chicken sandwich is the juiciest, tastiest spicy chicken sandwich I've ever had . . . and I'm not just talking about fast food restaurants. I'm also a big fan of the cookies and cream milkshake. The location leaves a little to be desired: a bigger parking lot, more tables, indoor seating. Obviously they're doing something right, though, if there's nowhere to sit.

I'd been to Chick-Fil-A a few times while visiting the south, before they opened up here in LA. I have to say: I never understood what the hysteria was about this place. I mean, it was good...but to me it was kind of like Cracker Barrell...it's nice and all, but seriously what the heck - it's fried chicken.But I did the drive-thru thing the other night and I have to say I enjoyed myself. The drive thru sort of allows 2 separate lanes to speed things up and it comes complete with a futuristic video monitor so that you can see the person who's taking your order. The workers were friendly and fairly efficient. The shake (an Oreo Cookie one) was seriously the best fast-food shake I've ever had. And the chicken was reasonably yummy.At the end of the day, it's still fast food though. It's good fast food, but it's still fast food. So don't get too excited or anything. I wouldn't stop for the drive-thru if there were more than say 7 or 8 cars in line ahead of you.

I LOOOOOOOVE CHICK FIL-AThat said my last few visits have sucked b/c of service. PLEASE PLEASE CORPORATE DO SOMETHING! Save the good name of this place. I go to Chick Fil-A for the whole experience. I loved the one by my work but that's 60 miles away! Having one in my own back yard is starting to suck b/c the pool of people they are picking their workers from is awful! Pick a new recruiter. I had the most unprofessional incompetent girl at the drive thru the other day, not only did she not know about her items on the menu but she kept going off the screen to ask someone that did know what they were doing. As it's a dual drive thru FOUR cars in the other lane went before she could finish taking my order (my order was simple one chicken sandwich and 4 nuggets the end). It was like she was still distracted by what had happened moments earlier........see below.......Not only was she not paying attention BUT she and the person handing the food out at the window recognized the people in the car in front of me and they chatted and laughed and brought other people working onto the ordering screen so they could see them in the car. I mean I can see and hear your entire conservation so laughing and giggling while the car behind you is sitting and watching you guys chat and NOT order for five minutes, is a little ridiculous!!!. I was close to just driving through and away. It was sooo unprofessional. C'mon Chick-Fil-A keep up your standards of friendly family oriented customer service!!!

Chick-Fil-A is my favorite fast food restaurant; HANDS DOWN!   In fact, it was my first summer job when I was 16.  And let's get one thing on the table; the food at this CFA is awesome!  - I've never had any issues there. BUTTTT.....The employees here.. well... they're pretty terrible.  I've been here several times since it's opened and have had bad service everytime.  They don't make eye-contact with you, or smile at you, or even greet you very enthusiastically.   Oh... And going to get refills - the worst!  Each employee will tell you something different; "Oh you should go to the pick-up window to get a refill."  "Please wait in the normal line to get a refill." "Wait for somebody to come to your table to get a refill."   - Pretty annoying.  I'm not trying to be snobby - but CFA is supposed to have amazing customer service. Oh.. and it doesn't even really need to be said, but the parking/traffic situation at this location is incredibly bad.  Again let me say, the food here is terrific.  And if you've never been to Chick-Fil-A, it's worth the hype.  But... go to the one by USC or even the one in Northridge.  Try and avoid this location.

I LOVE CHIC-FIL-A. Being from Georgia and eating this frequently, you can only imagine the pure look of delight on my face when I realized they were finally open. I've been eating Chic-Fil-A since I was a child. 1) The chicken is always consistently amazing...at every location. So juicy, seasoned perfectly. Always hot. Always delicious. 2) Honey Roasted BBQ sauce. It's so delicious. This is the only sandwich that doesn't need any sauce, yet their sauces are the most delicious of any sauces and therefore, I must drown everything in it. Mmm.3) The Staff is always super friendly. Every location. I love it.I rave about this to everyone I know. (I'm good for the business!)Only 2 cons:1) This location is outside seating only. There should at least be heat lamps in the evening and I'll be a happy girl. Pssh. I'll be happy any way with Chic-Fil-A in my hand.2) Minus 1 star for Chic-Fil-A explicitly disliking same-sex couples.

so im reviewer #92 & this is my only other 3 star rating & this is why...when i heard they were gonna open a Chick-Fil-A around the corner, with all they hype ive heard about this magical chicken food joint was insane...!  the bestest chicken sam'iches ever...!  if you read my reviews, they're most fast food joints so i was willing to give it a try, seeing im more into devouring BEEF than any other meats...(bacon being the exception of course)so when they open, lines were INSANE...!  & i dont give a rats a _ _  how good this food is, i'll wait a couple of weeks...!  well i had to wait about a month, but anyway...had the "Breakfast Mini's"  thats right, i said "BREAKFAST"...  these are by far the most fk'n delicious thing on that menu & well ever...! thats right, i said EVER...!now, they're chicken sandwich, is heh...  i say that because ive had it & it was so-so... im gonna go so far as to say, Ralphs have the same exact chicken sandwich, for $1.49, if you have the Ralphs Rewards Card of course...now, for today's visit, at 9:30am, you guessed it, i got me some of those yummy a _ _ mini's & a Fruit Punch, since im trying to quit soda's...  my fruit punch was hella watered down...!  NO BUENO...!  & i got the friggin' biggest size they have, so in short, i had to dispose of it at Ralphs & get me a Mexi-Coke...! the coke is ok, since i was raging about the fruit punch...!now, i dont care about anyone & who they love...  im torn between my morals & my stomach...  i know CFA isnt into same-sex marriage, but im not a religious person so i guess thats a wash...  but i guess my question would be: why open a Chick-Fil-A in that part of town when West Hollywood is less than a mile away...?  didnt they know there is a large gay/lesbian community here...?  & if you're against their life style, is it ok to take their money...?  would that be a little hypocritical...?so, in short, this reviewer just has 2 things, err 3 things to say:#1 - make the mini's all friggin day already...!#2 - taste test your beverages & if the fruit punch tastes watered down, fix it...!#3 - dont advertise your religious p.o.v. to the world...on this one, i can say: eat the breakfast mini nuggets well my frenz...!

I'm sure I cannot say anything that hasn't been said already.....  This place is so addicting it's like crack.  Drive through line around the corner? Not a problem, I'll wait for hours for that sweet, delicious, juicy, chicken any day of the week!  My favorite is breakfast.  Have you had their biscuits? WHAT, NO?!?!?!? Wake your butt up and get down there before 10:30 am and have the chicken, egg, and cheese biscuit.... you'll thank me later ;)
A side from their bad political views...The service sucks, they get your order wrong and the food is NOT good at all.  Keep eating here and you will end up on The Biggest Loser.

I was so excited when they started building the Chick-Fil-A on the corner of Sunset and Highland.  I was tired of having to drive to Orange County just to get an opportunity to go to the darn place.  People flocked to this place making it almost impossible to go and get a quick meal when it first opened, so I waited a couple of months to visit, to let the hoopla die down.  It's pretty much a drive through place with outside seating.  They having parking right outside if you want to eat there and ample street parking if you don't want to deal with the hassle.Food is amazing as usual.  My favorite is the grilled chicken sandwich although every once in a while, I will indulge in the nuggets.  SO good!  This place is open until 3 am, which is perfect for late night cravings and the service is fast and the staff is super friendly.If you are looking for an alternative to McDonald's, this is the best place to go.  The waffle fries are yummy!

I am from Georgia and Chic Fail A has always been a big fan of mine. I am definitely  a regular here. When I moved out here a year and a half ago I realized how many people out here haven't had Chic Fail A before and it honestly surprised me. Everything on the menu is fantastic, I'm not so much a fan of there chicken strips after they changed the recipe a year ago. If its your first time you should definitely just get a number one. Its fantastic! With just 2 pickles per sandwich and just a perfectly breaded chicken sandwich is constantly perfect every time. I've been to a lot of chic fil a's and this one takes the cake on how fresh the food is each and every time. For experienced Chic Fail A people if you haven't tried the new spicy  chicken sandwich. You should get it I promise you won't be unimpressed.Thanks guys!

There was a time when Chick-fil-a only existed in the South Bay. My lil heart could not bare it since I lived 40 minutes east in Diamond Bar. So, my selfish heart made my ex-bf drive me 40 minutes to the Torrance location at least 1ce a week. I was beyond excited when I heard that they would finally open a location near my  home in L.A. I came here 3 times the opening week. I stick with my usual 12 piece nugget meal, Polynesian and Chick-fil-a sauce, large waffle fries, and lemon meringue pie. The salads and wraps are also pretty good.The service is pretty quick even though the double drive-thru line looks like the wait from hell. The staff is pretty cool too. They will actually ask if you need anything else as you dine outside.It could be for sentimental reasons lol but yes, I am giving them 5 stars and adding them to my must eats list.

How can anyone not like Chick Fil A?The food isn't so much the issue as it is the service.Firstly, the drive thru:-They need to figure something out here. I know they've only been open for a few months, but every time I try drive-thru for takeout the line is excruciatingly long and the facility is impossible to escape once I've gotten my food. As the line wraps around and cross the exit, it's difficult to exit because you have to wait for people to allow you space to leave.-On the flip-side, when I've tried to dine in there, I usually have to enter through the exit just because the drive-thru line blocks the entrance and you'd have to wait forever to go inside.Second, the sauce situation:-I understand Hollywood is a hive for the homeless and psychotic, and leaving sauce out in the open (as opposed to behind the counter) for the starving would result in pandemonium, BUT the people that work here need to be a little more lax with giving out sauce.  As we're all aware, most of the food at CFA is simply a vehicle for the sauce (i.e. CFA sauce) and skimping on the sauce is a damn mistake. Last night, I kept having to come up and ask for more sauce, and every time I asked for a couple of CFA sauces, I would only get handed one. Even when I asked for Texas Pete Hot Sauce, and asked for two, I would be handed one and forced to ask for another. I was with a very hungry friend who wasn't aware of the etiquette of sharing 8 piece nuggets (2 ppl = 4 nugs each), and when I got back he had eaten 6! I mean come on!Get it together Chick FIl A!I'll always love you but you're bringing me down!

So, I heard and read all the hoopla about Hollywood finally getting a Chick fil A , and so obviously I had high hopes..  The mixed reviews here, I found quite interesting..this chicken place, which I had never ever eaten at, was polarizing.  I told the friendly and knowledgable employee, that it was my first visit, and she explained everything to me with a smile.  I ordered a combo meal which incl.the grilled tomato & lettuce chix sandwich, waffle fries, & a lite lemonade, along w a small chix tender side.  It came to 9 bux, not too bad, yet.  The ketchup condiments were a nice big size, and an extra star for having light mayo to go, yet, wtf is this between this yummy whole wheat bun?  Beyond processed chicken patty was nasty, I am so sorry I didn't listen to the ney sayers on here, because LaLa land peeps sometimes believe the hype, way too much.  The fries were actually tastier when I heated them up later in the night, a first for fries, so that was a saving grace.  Anyways, In & Out still is the go to for me..  And if I want a processed chicken sandwich, Subway will do.  This place makes gross chicken.  What the hell kind of seasoning do they use anyway? :(

My star rating is solely based on the review of food and not what I've heard and read on where this corporation stands as far as same sex marriage, etc. with that said...I wish they served breakfast all day because I am dying to try the spicy chicken on a biscuit. I've had Chick Fil A 3x now and the first 2x it was brought back to the office for me and sooooo delicious but tonight we actually drove into Hollywood just so my sister could try it. I like the regular chicken sandwich and the spicy chicken, fries are yummy as is the lemonade. Love the buffalo, Polynesian and chick fil a sauces. I must try this place for breakfast soon. They have two drive thru lanes and I like how you can see the persons face that is taking your order. Good stuff! Good thing I live about 9 miles away or I'd be here a lot more often.

Sooo I'm from Louisiana and I LOVE Chick-Fil-A but this particular location sucks. Today is the second time they have given me the wrong order... obviously something I don't notice until I'm home. It's so sad when all I'm craving are the chicken tenders only to find something I didnt order in my bag. The food is delicious but this location needs to get their shit together
Breakfast is dope. Never thought thought chicken could be so good in eggs but their breakfast burrito is out of this world.The chicken bagel sandwich is  respectable but not quite as good.

What can I say? It reminds me of home. I love the chicken nuggets and the sandwiches. Surprisingly the chicken salad sandwich is amazing. The waffle fries are also a must. I can't wait for this location to get the sweet potato waffle fries. Yes, these do exist at other locations!!

I mean... what can you say. It's chick fil a. It's freaking delicious and reallly they didn't do a bad job of designing the drive thru to be efficient, but how the heck are you supposed to park in their lot when the drive thru ALWAYS blocks it? And another reason for only 3 stars even though I really do love some chick fil a. THEY WON'T HIRE GAY PEOPLE! What the hell? And they will never get more than 3 stars from me until they change that.

This place is alright. I wanted to see what all the hype was about. It's probably better in the east coast. The nuggets were good and the sandwich was decent. The fries were gross though. You can get better criss cut fries at Carl's Jr. Once is enough for me now that I know how ANTI-GAY they are! Never eating here again. I won't support a place that shows such hatred for the gay community. Zero stars for that if I could give them zero stars!

It's been a long time coming for this bastion of the bird to arrive in Los Angeles proper and it couldn't have come at a better time.  Like any new "hip in the moment" thing, Angelenos will crowd it to see and be seen, so expect an inordinate length of weight upon your early visits.  Remember when people used to wait hours to get donuts during the initial craze?On to the food.  As expected it is traditional Chick-Fil-A.  Chicken cooked to a perfection, nuggets as delicious of a bite as a four-star Michelin restaurant and sweet tea just like granny used to make.  To top it all off, the waffle fries, something unique to this establishment.  Unlike the pho-potatoes used at Jack in the Box, these are actual waffle cut potatoes fried to perfection.  With the nuggets comes your choice of dipping sauces.  Make sure you get the buttermilk ranch or Chick-Fil-A which is kind of a combination of the ranch and honey mustard sauce.  Both are quite enjoyable and delicious.The one down size would be the location.  Yes it is very centralized, but it lacks a lot of room which leads to massive traffic jams at the intersection of Sunset and Highland...from traffic waiting to enter the dual lined drive-thru.  There is a small parking lot that is surrounded by the drive thru line, but barely enough parking to accommodate the volume of traffic that runs through this place, so often people either park illegally at the Rite-Aid across the street and risk towing or they park further away and hoof it by foot into line.  Also, be aware that all seating is outdoors, which isn't that big of a deal in a city that doesn't get rain that often, but it could lead to some sweltering meals during the blazing sun of the summer or the frigid temps during the winters.Overall I would say this is a good start for Chick-Fil-A to infiltrate the Los Angeles market.  As I write this review, another location has opened in Northridge, which I might check out in the near future.  Hopefully the addressed some of the concerns from customers of the first store location.

There's only 2 places I will eat for lunch everyday ... Chick-Fil-A or Chipotle ... I will always & forever LOVE Chick Fil A ... they have the most amaze food, Ever!So worth the long wait, Fresh fries, hot chicken & the shakes make you almost jizz on yourself ;)yum yum yum...

Tried this in Texas and I'm super happy it is in Los Angeles and spreading. Two words - waffle fries. Those things are so good. Not greasy or salty, just right. The chik'n sandwiches, YUM. I think I've had them all and I love every one of them. Milkshakes - whip cream and a cherry. Tie that stem into a knot, that ish is good. For a chicken fast food sandwich, this is the best.
So glad they opened one in Hollywood.  Have yet to eat something from there that wasn't delicious.  Long lines but worth the wait.  OH! The sweet tea is always a good choice.  Just Sayin!

a sweet friend of mine got me into this place. i got the 12 piece chicken nuggets with house sauce - oh.em.gee! so good! wish they had one in the valley - took us 40 min. not including parking and waiting in line but so worth it! this location is definitely crackin' early evening to late night. *there is spacious outdoor seating and they have an epic drive-thru system - the food tellers are 'chip, chip cheerio! are excited to take your order which is pleasant!

Finally made it over to this place.  I lived in Atlanta for 4 years and this was my go-to fast food restaurant.  I absolutely love it and have missed it dearly these 20 years that I've been in LA.  Of course there are locations in Southern California, but this is the first location close to my apartment.  I was so excited to have it for lunch today...Apparently so was the rest of mid-city.  It took me 20 minutes just to park the car - NO LIE.  The car line just to get close to the restaurant was ridiculous!I had the chargrilled sandwich, waffle fries and lemonade.  Ah yeah!!  Just like I remembered it.Customer service, as always at Chick-fil-A, was excellent.Hopefully the hype will die down soon and it won't be such a hassle to get to the place.By the way, they are closed on Sundays (I think it is owned by a devout Christian....).

I was skeptical at first. No beef? What is that? How can a fast food joint make it in LA without the cow?Well, they did. And it was good. Got the spicy chicken sandwich with the fries and sweet tea. The sandwich was spectacular. Juicy, spicy, everything I hoped for. Recommended.

I really don't get why people go crazy for this chicken sandwich. So far, I've had this place in Denver then recently the new Hollywood location and both visits did not impress me. This place is crazy busy and I'm not sure why. The chicken sandwich, spicy and regular, aren't anything special.  The waffles fries were not crispy and also wasn't impressive at all.

SO not impressed with this place. The way people rave about it, I was expecting it to blow my mind--it didn't.  -Not worth the Hollywood traffic; a waste of time & gas.  -I had the spicy chicken sandwich & only ate it 'cause I was starving. -Definitely not worth the price; somewhat pricey for drive-thru. -Only thing I liked were the fries. However, couldn't really enjoy those either because they were stingy with the condiments.  In a nutshell: food is blah and sooooooo not worth it.

'WHY THE FUCK WOULD I BLOW UP CHICK-FIL-A ?! CHICK-FIL-A'S FUCKING DELICIOUS!'-Sadly that is not how I felt about this place. I was all pumped and ready to get my chicken sandwich on, but nnnnnnno. Could've sworn I bit into an anciant ass dinosaur. I was pooped. It being my first time, I was not impressed. Why was the line so long ? I should've gone to In N' Out for all that nonsense. I don't know what the fuzz is about. This place sucks ass. Sorry, not coming back ever again. Oh, and one of their employees was trying to get fresh with me while I was trying to place an order. Asking what I was doing after 5:30. Ha ha! Really? Maybe if you worked at REAL restaurant I'd even give you false hopes. Get your it together. How professional right ?No but really, was that even real chicken ?

0 Star, if I could. The breakdown:Chicken Sandwich: 3/5My Food Rating = CAmbience: 3/5Service: 1/5Clean: 1/5My Experience Rating: DLocation: 1/5Wait: 1/5Hours: 3/5Parking: 1/5My Convenience Rating: FPros:- Marketing.Cons:- Expensive. - Long wait at the drive thru.- To wait for the drive thru, you have to block traffic, and get honked at.- No parking, these geniuses used up the lot for the 2-lane drive thru.- No indoor seating- You are inhaling exhaust from the second busiest intersection in LA while you eat. - Not a good place to be on a hot sunny day.- Not a good place to be on a cold freezing night.- Not a good place to be in the rain either.- Never enough seating.- Potentially have to share tables with other rude customers.- Only meat option: Chicken- Soggy fries.- Stingy on sauces, you have to beg for ketchup.Tip: They don't open Sundays.Tip: It's actually not really healthy.  1. Spicy Chicken Sandwich Deluxe has 27G of fat (8G saturated). 2. Sausage, Egg, and Cheese Biscuit has 47G of fat (19G saturated).Tip: MSG in their food. Tip: They donated almost $2M to Anti-Gay Groups in 2009. Do you really want to support that?Tip: Do not park in Rite-Aid lot. You can get towed.Tip: Neighboring businesses and residents are frustrated with them, clogging up McCadden, being loud, and leaving their trash everywhere. Bottom Line: McDonalds' Southwestern Chicken Sandwich is 1/3 the price and arguably tastes better. Why would you want to wait 30 minutes for a chicken sandwich only to support hate groups.CFA's Anti-Gay Donations: equalitymatters.org/fact…

Oh hellz yeah. Put some south in yo mouth!(Being an expat of the south, I automatically think it's awesome and harken back to the days when Chik-Fil-A was called "Truett Cathey's Dwarf House," complete with a small door for small people. I'm not joking.)I mowed that shizz down. It was neither pretty nor graceful.

This isn't a good location because it's outdoor seating and drive-thru only. How does one enjoy a meal in freezing weather or rain?Add rude and entitled LA customers to the matter makes this an unpleasant experience. They also keep all the condiments/sauces between the window so you have to ask for them.Chick-fil-a works better in the suburbs where the customers are friendlier, making the service better.

FINALLY.FINNNNAAAAALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLYYYYYYYY!!!!!!!!!!I'm happy to say I've been fast food free for 5 years now, BUT this is a very necessary exception. For 3 months, I watched this architectural ode to chicken rise from the ground. I watched a man in a cow suit knock down and bulldoze the pathetic foodery that occupied this prime real estate into a small pile of careless after thoughts. And it was small. It was a Carl's Jr. JR. (double the junior for double the who gives a sh#t!)And now sits a sleekly stylin' Chik-Fil-A with a drive thru that isn't nearly as fun as the outdoor seating overlooking the ever-busy intersection of Sunset & Highland. I've noticed that chicken from the CFA West Coast chains doesn't quite live up to my expectations, but it doesn't really matter when you have ring side seats to one of LA's busiest intersections on a Friday at 5:30pm and a bubbly girl who comes by every now again to refill your cup of lemonade. This is my zen. It's good to see you, old friend. We welcome you to the block.

I have become a fan of CFA.One cannot deny that their chicken sammies are pretty good, especially when paired with their waffle fries and sweet tea.  YUM YUM YUM..And great news - their lines aren't ridiculously long like before!I used to love experimenting with all the different sauces, but today i was informed that each order was limited to 2 sauces..Only 2??That's kind of stingy, don't you think??  Especially when they offer so many types and it's almost $7 for a meal.Yep, that's my only today..But don't worry CFA, I will return =)

**NINJA TIP**- Get the Special SauceHad to see what all the hype has been about. I ordered the basic combo #1 (chick sandwich + fries and drink). I'm a fan of the waffle fries since they aren't overly seasoned or salted..and not soo greasy. Though they are not as tasty as other fast food joints... the lack of grease won't hinder my roundhouse kicks soo much.My first bite of the chick sandwich left me less amazed... but I had this Chick-filet special sauce in my bag. So i made the genius decision of  just dipping everything in it.... Like a drunken monkey punch of goodness to the throat. yumm! I devoured everything in about 6 min flat...while driving down Sunset blvd.. but I couldn't find the napkins... maybe I dipped those too??NOW THATS NINJA3.5-Ninja stars

Chick-fil-a is starting to open up shop in the greater LA area. I've seen them in other areas, mainly OC and the greater IE area so I thought I'd give it a try by visiting the new Hollywood location. I knew what they sold and specialized in. Only chicken? They've got to be good at it right?  Not really. The spicy chicken sandwich I had was not much different than the other fast food joints that offer them. I'd say Wendy's makes the best when it comes to fast food. Price isn't justified either. It must be me, but if you're only going to serve up one form of meat for all the years you've been in business, it better be the best. Chick-Fil-A is far from it.

Oh man. I haven't had a good cluck since junior high!The spicy chicken sandwich was difficult to man handle since it comes pretty naked (unless you specify to use one of their 7 sauces) but it was a down ass chick fo sho. I know it's fast food but it really did hit the spot and then some. I wasn't a huge fan of the waffle fries because they lacked a distinct flavor (read: not drenched in grease and salt), but the fountain cherry coke made up for the dullness of the 'tates.I'm glad I finally checked out the Fil-Aster but I do admit that my lack of poultry sandwiches in the past decade or so makes this one hard to rate against other joints, however it satisfied my need for a quick and convenient meal and the service was extremely friendly and fast, so there's something to be said for that!

So far I've tried the spicy chicken sandwich and the chargrilled chicken sandwich... I really like the spicy chicken. It's actually got a real kick to it and consists of a meaty filet instead of a mouthful of fried breading (like McDonald's and other restaurants). The chicken also has a unique flavor... good seasoning? This location is obviously overpacked, and they've figured out a system to get the cars through, but the street where everyone turns onto is so narrow. Can't wait to try their shakes another time!

Great service.Amazing chicken sandwiches.Delicious shakes (cookies and cream)All around, a great place to visit if your obsession with In-n-Out (down the street) ever wanes...which, it never ever should...just sayin'

Omg, thank you for opening Chick Fil A! I work around the area and you have won my heart.At first, I was reluctant to visit this place, since it was SUPER packed. But have no fear, fast customer service is here! They usually have two drive-thru lines going at once, which makes the experience quite enjoyable. I've been coming back for their salads, burgers, parfaits, breakfast, etc.They must have something secret inside their food, because I'm ADDICTED to this place! =D

I'm from the Midwest so when this place opened in Hollywood, it made me think of home where simple, all-American comfort foods are king. Turns out though, even the opening of a Chick Fil A is a big deal in Hollywood as there were lines so long you'd think Ryan Gosling* was signing autographs.Anywho, when I finally craved a fast food chicken sandwich enough, I came here and waited in line. The staff were super speedy. We ordered and got our food all within about 15 minutes. Love the dipping sauces, they're a nice touch. Ranch and the Chick Fil A sauce were my faves, ya know, the Midwestern thing. Yup.Another nice touch was that one of the staff members came out and offered to refill our beverages. That's above and beyond your normal fast food place. You can also giggle at the person whose job it is to stand  and guard the condiments. 'Cause you know if those ketchup packets were left out in the middle of the city, they'd get pillaged and destroyed *Reference will be outdated shortly after publishing

Have been to branches in the South and loved it.  Could be in my head, but this one was not as good.  Bun and waffle fries were soggy.  Even the sweet tea seemed watered down.  Tried the chicken nuggets for the first time, and they were pretty good but salty.  Parking situation not good, and no indoor seating so you might have to share a table outside.  Drive through was packed and moving slowly.

Came here at around 2 A.M. this morning, and the place was still SUPER busy. When does it close?!Anyway, I've heard a lot of people sing praises for Chick-Fil-A, especially David Choi. When one opened up in L.A., I made a mental bookmark which finally got fulfilled on a whim!My two friends and I went to the drive-thru, which was PACKED even at that time of night. I ordered the regular chicken sandwich--I always go with the basic when trying a new place--and my friends both got the Spicy Chicken Deluxe. Oh, and an order of waffle fries!I thought my sandwich tasted delicious. It is to chicken what Filet O'Fish is to fish. There's a nice tang to the sandwich, and the chicken was super crispy. Refried? The waffle fries...I expected something more, but I can't really expect much, can I?Overall, it's a good place to eat when it's in the area, but I would say that it leans toward the expensive side for fast food. I'm not a Chick-Fil-A convert, that's for sure. But I AM a fan :D
WTF people! Seriously?What is so good about this place? Nothing.Plus I have a MSG headache from eating their chicken.

I've been to Chick-Fil-A in the DC area a couple times and it was delicious, so I was looking forward to eating at the new Hollywood location. I waited 15 minutes in line to order my food, which would've been fine if the food and service were good. I will not return to The Hollywood location, and here is why:1) The chicken nuggets were lukewarm. 2) The waffle fries were lukewarm and on the soggy side.3) Their policy on KETCHUP is ridiculous, and I consider my experience with "The Ketchup Gatekeeper" to be BAD SERVICE. Here is what happened:My name was called to pick up my food. (FYI, there is no self service area to help oneself to condiments, napkins, straws, etc. You are given these items by the staff.) Upon getting my meal, I asked for ketchup for my (large) fries. I was given 2 packets. Then:Me: "Could I please have a lot more ketchup?"Chick Fil A girl: "Our packets of ketchup are much bigger than regular ketchup packets."Me: "Yes, I can see that, but I like a lot of ketchup on my fries. Can I have a few more?"Chick Fil A girl: "Well, that is all I can give you.They may look small, but they hold 3 times the amount of ketchup than regular ketchup packets."Me: "So you won't give me more? Really?"Then, without saying a word, she walks away and I see her talking to a co-worker, I assume it's her manager or supervisor, then she comes back to me empty-handed and confirms:Chick Fil A girl: "I am sorry, that is all you can have. We have to be really careful with the sauces."So I took my food and went to my table to eat it. I mean REALLY, I am not gonna stand there BEGGING for more ketchup, when it is clearly kept under lock and key. I felt like I was in a "Seinfeld" episode titled "Rejected by the Ketchup Gatekeeper." And I am sure this poor girl who has to enforce the ketchup rations has been trained to never go over the ketchup quota, or else!Ironically, a few minutes later another customer comes up to me and hands me a packet of ketchup. Apparently, she was standing behind me while I picked up my food; she heard the conversation, thought it was RIDICULOUS, and asked for ketchup FOR ME, since she doesn't use it on her fries! SO, CHICK FIL A, if you ever read this, I enjoyed 3 packets of ketchup with my large fries, and while that may be a heavy ketchup to fry ratio, some people LIKE A LOT OF KETCHUP. And we should not be made to feel inappropriate for asking for more.Don't worry, your ketchup supply is safe, as I won't be back : )

Oh how I've missed this chain. Originally being from Florida, I familiar with this chain from when I was a child and when I go back home.  Since they opened, I've made several trips there. I love their food, but what really makes this place is the people.  Never have I been to a fast food restaurant where the people are so friendly, courteous, and cheerful.  Something that is seldom encountered these days in fast food places.  I can't wait until they expand more so hopefully there will be one more convenient to me.

If you didn't grow up with Chick Fil A like me you might find all the 5 star ratings over the top.  Like anything you grew up with, it's a nostalgic taste.  However, the food is higher quality by far than KFC.  For fast food in Hollywood or whatever branch, it's a better option than most.  Plus it's a fantastic company, college scholarships for employees a lot of really good benefits.  Not your average fast food slave ship (Taco Hell, etc.).  Their lemonade is always fresh squeezed and really good.  Hope this balances out some of the other reviews for you.

So I'm an East coast girl who somehow ended up out on the West coast. I LOVE being out West but I missed my Chick-fil-A and Southern-styled sweet tea.With that being said, I had super high hopes for this Chick-fil-A and found myself counting down the days to it's open. I loved that the drive-thru was efficient enough and had two lanes--it kept the flow going rather quickly. The order-taker was incredibly friendly, just as they had been back home. And the food tasted the same as it did back home, as well. I had really missed my number 3, no pickle, with a large sweet tea with lemon and two Chick-fil-A sauces. Yum.To all of those complaining about the "hype" and the food not measuring up, you have to remember that this is a FAST FOOD joint. Not some five star restaurant.
Really happy we finally have a chick-fil-a in the Hollywood area. Although the food is yummy, the traffic, parking, and homeless are completely horrible.4 stars

SUPER DISAPPOINTED. I was so hyped up on all these 5 star reviews.. The boyfriend and I went on Sunday, apparently it was closed? I didn't know fast food like places were that exclusive to close on a weekend, coool.So we went on a weekday, it was so hot so I had my air conditioner on blast and was not about to get out of my car to wait for 20 minutes for a chicken sandwich, so drive thru it was. The line wasn't THAT long, it was long but they have it under control and sped it up pretty fast. Its my turn to order, AND THERE'S A FUCKING FACE by the menu. What the hell talk about super catching my ass off guard. Apparently the person taking your order looks at you thru a camera. The one thing that made it that more awkward was the girl that was taking my order, her eye balls were bout to come out of her socket, she looked like a damn pug ( I'm not even lying it scared the shit out of me ) So I ordered the spicy chicken burger and the boyfriend got the basic chicken burger. We get our food and decided to eat in the shade on one of the cutty streets by Highland. What the hell was I looking at. Not only did it taste like a food stamp chicken burger but it also looked like it. The cheese looked all rubbery and old.  The waffle fries were all soggy. I could not believe I just spent $15 dollars on 2 combo meals, PATHETIC. Truth is I probably wont go back, sorry Chick-Fil-A it was just not working out.

This is a fangirl post.{clears throat}Eeeeee I LOVEEE Chick-Fil-A! From the first time those golden strips dipped in Polynesian sauce (unequivocally the best one) passed my lips when I moved to Orange County a few years ago... it feels like rediscovering chicken.I love that my portion of a 3-piece chicken strips meal with waffle fries and lemonade goes down so smooth. I love that I go through exactly one and a half sauce packets with chicken and fries so that I can drink the rest.I love that Hollywood now has a Chick-Fil-A delivery system with two lanes in the drive-thru! I went through twice today without so much as a hitch.Alsooooo I met Zachary Levi there today (Chuck from "Chuck"), in support of Operation Smile. He is a class act, and he loves him some jesus chicken. i do too. have we talked about those golden chicken strips yet? so much less bready than the nuggets.Also, in the time that I was watching the Jay Leno crew film zac and him chatting up some fans (one of whom he gave his hairnet from the day. aha), my Icedream in a cup did not melt in the least. It was at least twenty minutes of chatter. I am more impressed than disgusted, and there's your coveted fifth star.

After weeks of driving by this place and noticing the mobs of people eating here, I decided to try it around 11:30 A.M. right before the lunch crowd. The customer service is good, they are very freindly, well trained, anyways I ordered their #2 combo, chicken sandwich supreme, fries, lemonade. As soon as I took the first bite, I knew the quality of the chicken breast was much better than any other chicken sandwich I have had in the past, the bun was fresh, and I chose the chik-fil-a sauce with it, loved it. Nothing was cold, except my refreshing lemonade. The cost is a little more than other chicken sandwiches, but worth it. I will try their famous nuggets next time. Tip, park at the Rite aide across the street.

Overrated.Seriously, this place was such a let down. KFC's chicken littles are WAY BETTER.Also, the guy taking our order was on a screen...and somewhat judged me when I asked if they served a breakfast item. Rude. and hello! I can see you.The food was just blah. Nothing to write home about. Oh, and it was so expensive. This is fast food. Relax on your prices.

Why is MSG still used in today's food?? I used to look forward to Chic-fil-a as a kid visiting my aunt in the summer. I finally had the thrill of going to the new Hollywood branch. Drive thru was busy, but efficient with 2 drive-thrus. Ordered the deluxe original. So YUMMY. Real chicken w/out all that processed soy crap. However come an hour later I was doubled over in pain! Checked the site & found they use MSG which I'm sensitive to now as an adult. My tummy was hurting for several hours. Very disappointing. Especially for all their hype of using "fresh" & "natural" ingredients. Hopefully they will stop using it. Such a shame. But if MSG doesn't bother you, this place is great.

I had watched over the summer as this location was being built, wondering if the food would taste the same as the Orange County and Santa Clarita locations.  So, when I had some spare time driving back from Beverly Hills, I hit the double drive-thru and ordered some lunch.  I had the #2 meal super sized, and bit into the sandwich at the first red light on the way back to work.  Awesome!   I was half-expecting a let-down given the area it is located in, but it tasted great!  I can't think of another "fast-food" chicken sandwich that tastes as good.  Also, worth about three more stars, is the fact that the employees are all freshly-scrubbed, are friendly, smile and can speak English.

I found myself slightly buzzed off a handful of beers..with no food in my stomach to maybe slow said process down.It was one of those days where I was too busy at work to find food,and too busy finding beer after work to stop for food as well.So check 9:15pm,I'm in need of some food and on my way into the valley to pick up the boyfriend from my current location - WeHo.What an excellent opportunity,I thought..to check out this Chick-Fil-A shit everyone has been raving about.I'm from San Francisco,and seriously had no idea what one of these places was all about.I likened it to a Church's Chicken (we have one of those in Hayward in the bay..its chicken..whatever) but with the cult following of an In-N-Out...by the obvious scores of people always in line; or the fact that there is a security guard perusing the outside of the establishment,or maybe the freakout I happened to see on the news one morning of people camping out in tents for a piece of lard fried chicken.All these things intrigued me,and now,I was hoping,I would find out why.Given the fact the the lines trail out onto the street despite there being 2 drive through areas..the whole process goes rather smoothly.I also found it very cool..or weird...to be able to see my drive through person on a camera as I pulled up to take my order.She even knew what car I was behind,and sweetly referred to me as "Miss Jessica" through the rest of our transaction.The menu threw me off for a minute having never been to one of these places,so I went with the easiest option - 3 piece chicken strips with waffle fries.I thought waffle fries was an option similar to a Carls Jr.,but was please to find that was standard order fare.Well well Chick Fil A...so far,so good...I got my chicken and started driving on my mystical journey.I started on the fries,which were pretty good,til I got one that hadn't seemed to spend enough time in the fryer.It was undercooked potato texture..the kind that will piss me off when I'm making potatoes at home and I want some fucking potatoes.Hoping this was a fluke,I kept eating,though to my dismay,a few more undercooked potato disappointments were uncovered.I shrugged it off,hoping this chicken that people seemingly would offer their 1st born child for - would redeem my slightly underwhelming waffle fries experience.The moment the chicken hits your mouth,you're inundated with this incredible nutmeggy sensation.Thats the only way I can describe it.The air outside was cold,and somehow this lone chicken strip took me back to 2 years prior..a Thanksgiving I had with my Mom,Sister,and some close friends.There were cheap tall cans,communal cooking,shitty movies,a fireplace.Warm,awesome memories.That was the thanksgiving we started our.."Very High Life Thanksgiving" Tradition..where we punish ourselves with copious amounts of cheap beer and brandy eggnogs; And play drinking games where a swig is taken every time something cliche happens in that Jennifer Lopez abortion - "Enough"This chicken strip made me miss those times,made me miss my Mom.Made me miss living in San Francisco,even.But once I actually started eating the chicken..I was once again,not overly impressed or anything.I'm not a big fan of sweet and savory,and I think nutmeg is one of those spices reserved for special occasions..or just shit that isn't fried chicken.I dunno.I just didn't like it.So sue me.I liked the memories it creepily evoked,but I just didn't care for it beyond that.Eh.Ehhhhhhh.That all being said,I may have to venture here again to try something different on the menu,Just to see if I may like some of the other things it has to offer.But where it stands,I rather spend the same kind of money at a Popeyes.

Great food, Great service, Awesome Ice Tea and the BEST hash browns(I like to call them tater-tots) EVER!  I'm giving 4 stars only because parking sucks in that area...and the drive-thru line was 12 cars deep when I went there.I'm gay...and honestly, I don't care who they give their money to - the gay community in this town are a bunch a cry-babies.  Instead of protesting (what a joke that was...) why not put your free time to better use and volunteer for something that actually matters.

So I finally ate here after debating it for a while. To keep it short:- Fries were okay- Chicken sandwich was greasy as hell and pricey- No indoor seating from what I could tell?  High-town McDonalds, is that you? Food:  0/5Service: What service? 0/5Price: 0/5Ambiance: It's trendy. 1/5

So it only gets 4 stars because I am not a true fan of any fast  food.  But, that said, this is one tasty joint!  We'll be going back, oh yes, we will.I am gluten free, so my teenage son was the lucky eater.  He ordered the chicken strips and after one bite he said that it was the best fried chicken he's ever had.  Sorry Popeyes.  With every bite he made num num noises.  And he especially enjoyed the ketchup packets that allow you to squeeze out the ketchup or use it as a tray for dunking.   I only ordered the waffle fries figuring that if a fast food place can't get the fries right, then the rest isn't worth trying.  Well, the got the fries right, and now I'm sad I didn't order a piece of grilled chicken for myself (hoping the seasonings do not have any gluten in them).  I suspect the better taste and flavor is going to be found in the fried chicken, but oh well, sucks for me.  Keep in mind, there is no indoor seating.  Plan to sit outside, or on cruddy days (all 12 of them) eat in your car.

I finally don't have to make a voyage to get Chik-fil-a. The problem with this location is that it is so busy now.  I've been here a few times and every time the food is a bit cold. This never happens at other locations. Not a fan of the regular sandwichesOrder nuggets, fries (well done) and an Arnold Palmer w/ unsweetened tea oh and a bunch of chik-fil-a sauce.
You have not had a chicken sandwich until you've had one from here. If you've never been, you are truly missing out. Just get the regular chicken sandwich before you branch out. Awesome!

I just visited this after putting it off for a while. Seeing the long lines of the drive-thru kinda scared me. However they have two drive thrus so, the wait was about 15 mins or so. Everyone was really nice, and the food was exactly how I remember it. I won't eat there everyday, due to the fact Im not a fast food fan but to me it reminds me of home.

It's been a longtime coming! I'm from Virginia and all of us east coasters who have been craving a Chick-Fil-A closer to Hollywood, finally have it.Unfortunately it's not a walk in restaurant, but being located in a homeless infested part of town, I find it appropriate.So this 5 star rating is for the food. Now I love my fried chicken and compared to KFC, Popeyes, and all the other fast food contenders, nothing compares to the delicious, moist chicken CFA has to offer!So far I've only had the breakfast (Chicken minis, Bacon Egg and Cheese, and the Chicken Biscuit) I can only imagine lunch being just as awesome. I'll edit this review until then.The customer service also provides that southern feel with their country accents. They may be actresses or just plain ol southern bells, but it works!So eat more Chicken! It's better for you!

I cam here opening night. I missed the dancing cows and the super long lines.I got a spicy chicken sandwich and a cookies and cream milkshake.The sandwich was alright- only toppings were pickes. I like Wendy's spicy chicken sandwich better. The cookies and cream milkshake was AWESOME. I would definitely order that again.Parking is terrible. I parked at a meter at 10pm so it was free. The only seating is outside. It's a walk up with three (I think) windows.The store is open until 3am on Fridays.
Overrated. Generic overpriced food. Not necessarily bad I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.

I'm so happy chick fil a has come to LA. I was worried 1- that the food wouldnt taste as good & 2- that the Hollywood staff wouldn't uphold chick fil a's reputation for kind employees but my first visit did not disappoint in either area

Ok I know this establishment is anti gay and closed on Sunday.  So what.  I still love damn Chick Fil A.  I grew up on this stuff and was so disappointed when I moved to Hollywood and there was no Chick Fil A around me.  I'm sorry but I don't feel like driving all the way to the southbay for a sandwich.  Anyway I've been twice now and it was totally yummy!!  The sandwiches were juicy and tender and the biscuit was amazing.  So flavorful.  It took me back to the south.  The service was fast even though it was crowded.  Look I don't care if Hitler was running chick fil a, I'd still go.  Everyone has the right to his or her own opinion and beliefs.
ewwyes I'd like a side of chicken with my order of SALT!

So psyched we finally have a chik-fil-a in hollywood. Now if we could just get the employees to care!   The kid who took my order talked so slow I asked him if he was on mescaline. Then the kid who gave us our food crammed 2 sandwiches and 2 fries in one bag. I got mine out and it looked like it had been pressed in a book.    Even when it's bad, its still pretty good though.

1) The grilled chicken sandwich actually feels and tastes healthy! The bread is fresh, the chicken is perfectly juicy and tender, and the barbeque sauce really brings it home. I prefer the BBQ to the normal sauce.2) The breakfast biscuit sandwich is pretty awesome, too. The biscuit has the perfect crumbly, buttery flavor and texture you'd expect -- in fact, I think next time I'll get the biscuit on its own. The crispy chicken is good but only in moderation.3) Peach milkshake!! It's seasonal. I waited in line for an hour the day this CFA opened just so I could have one! The ice dream is of course to die for as well. Can't wait til the holiday season, when the mint-chocolate flavor goes online!4) About the breakfast minis (which look HILARIOUS on the website menu): the bread is sweet!!  The hash browns (which are more like flattened tater tots) are good -- no sogginess or greasiness.5) On the day this CFA opened, I went over at 9am for breakfast -- I got my picture taken with a cow. I loved that, even after the camera crews left, the cows stood around quietly dancing the whole time! It was unbelievably cute.  I went back for lunch, and the line at that hour was scary-long. But the drive-through line was even more ridiculous. With gas at $4/gal, you'd think people wouldn't mind chucking a few coins in the meters and walking over, instead of stopping traffic on Sunset Blvd? Anyway, they turned on misters to cool us off, but also brought out trays of iced tea in mini cups, as well as bags of coupons and cow plushies.Those probably won't be around the next time I go back, but that's okay!  I'm so happy this part of LA has a CFA now!

Do I dare say BEST CHICKEN SANDWICH EVER?!?! Yes I dare! This was actually my first time here and I have to say their chicken was the best quality fast food I have ever had.Their Spicy Chicken Sandwich and Chicken Nuggets were simply WOW! It was like I was transported to a five star gourmet Mcdonalds. Still being fast food I feel their chicken may or may not be fresh, but they sure do make a great imitation of fresh. Their chicken was so juicy and fried to a perfect crunchy crisp. And their Chick-Fil-A sauce was so much better then any bbq sauce. Drizzle a little on your sandwich and bam!!! So bomb!!!Top off your food with their really good milkshakes and you have the perfect fast food meal. I cannot wait for the Northridge one to open so I can go everyday!
This is like, a dream come true!  Chik-Fil-A is my favorite fast food place in the world and now it's down the street!  The Chik-Fil-A sauce is my favorite!

Probably my favorite fastfood restaurant in the world.  Chick-fil-a has one of the best tasting menu's you could hope for from a drive-thru.My friends and I went to Chick-fil-a on a Saturday Night a 9:00.  Since the restaurant had only been open for 2 days I was expecting it to still be very crowded.  My theory was proven as the drive-thru line was around the block and it appeared as though the dine-in line was going to take at least 30 minute to order.  We parked the car, got in line, and were surprised by the efficient service.  It took no longer than 15 minutes to order and get our food, which is amazing considering how busy they were. The fact that they haven't been open for a week and are this efficient is a great way to establish yourself, so props to the management on that front!Unlike every Chick-fil-a I have been to, this one has no inside seating. Instead, there is a large outdoor patio that allows you to people-watch the colorful people of Hollywood.  I was encouraged to see the restaurant has two armed guards on the premises just outside the dining area.  This area of LA isn't necessarily the safest and having a strictly outdoor restaurant could be an issue, but it is refreshing to see CFA has thought of that and added the piece of mind of having these guards present.Finally, the food was delicious as always.  For me CFA, sets itself apart from other fast food locations in offering a wide variety (at least 7) of dipping sauces that are self-serve and do not charge you extra for.It is great to see another CFA location in LA!

Finally tried this place to see what the fuss is all about. I had the chicken nuggets and I must say, they were very good. I also tried the chicken fingers and they were awesome. Very tender. I will try the chicken sandwiches once all the hype and long long lines goes away. Overall: B+

This place was worth the wait. I can't wait to get my Chick on every night for many nights to come. I went to this place right after it opened to try to get the vouchers but everyone had been camping out for weeks. It was insane.I think Carl's Jr. was in this spot before but it's gone now. RIP Carl's!Definitely stop by if you're going down Sunset!

3 Points for three stars!1. Real Lemons used in Lemonade. (Actually found a pit in mine)2. Real Chicken Breast. (unlike other fast food chains that use fake rubber)3. Customer service in a fast food joint, who knew you could expect that.
