It's Open!  It's Open!!!  I came here on opening day, completely excited that we finally have a Chic fil A in the Hollywood area.  Apparently everyone else was just as excited because you couldn't get anywhere NEAR the damn place.  So I waited one whole day and decided to just go and deal with the traffic.There were tons of customers at the window and the drive-thru line was so long it curved out onto Sunset Blvd.  That being said, I think I waited a total of about 10 minutes to get thru the line and get my food.  These people were working HARD.  There are 2 drive through lanes so that was genius on their part.  Because they were so busy, they had a guy taking payment well before you got through the line and when you get to the window your food and payment had already been processed.  Simply Genius.  Because it's new, obviously everything is clean and purrrrrrrty.  The employees are as friendly as you would expect at Chic fil A.  It's what they're known for other than their chicken.The food is great, the service is quick and uber-friendly and....aw hell...it's Chic fil A!  BOK BOK BOK!!!  I can't wait to come back!!!!
Winner winner chicken dinner. The spicy chicken is actually kickin'. I'm writing a review even before visiting the spot that came to a corner near me!

So I have been following this Chick-fil-a for months anticipating its grand opening. See...my office is about 3-4 blocks away from it...AND I am from Georgia. So yea, it has been teasing me for a while.But fast forward to today, and I get my big order together and head up there around 11:20...I am anticipating a long wait for the drive through, but I am giving myself plenty of time. But I get through and have my large order in my hand at 11:30...YEA. Fast.Chick-fil-a definitely knows how to keep control of a crazy situation and they had A LOT of hands on deck. Oh yea. And they were handing out samples of their brownies to the people in their cars in the drive through.I am going to be coming here a lot.A little bit of the South here in SOCAL. I love it.

I've been waiting 3 months for it to open and I was there bright and early at 7:30am to enjoy my first taste. It was delicious, as always. I had the chicken biscuit with tater tot meal and got the chicken biscuit minis for my girlfriend who had never had Chick-fil-A. She thought they were delicious. I have mostly given up fast food because the quality of most places are so low and the food just does not taste good to me anymore, after trading for healthier options. But Chick-fil-A is still delicious and still a quality product, unlike McDonalds or Burger King where everything is wilted or over cooked and processed tasting. Another notable thing about this location is that everyone who worked there was super friendly and seemed really excited about the opening and working there, which is another thing that is unusual, compared to other fast food places. Most LA fast food places the employees either are completely dismissive to you or look at you like you are the cause of their miserable existence. Not to mention, if they give you food that is smashed and not edible, (ahem, Burger King) the manager will actually debate you and give you attitude rather than simply giving you something fresh and properly prepared. And not only were the people at Chick-fil-A helpful and polite, but it's the first fast food joint I've been to in LA where the staff was attractive and seemed like they went to college. My server looked like she could be on the CW and was super sweet. It's the first time I've been to a fast food place in LA where I actually felt like I was in the South, where people are polite, helpful and cute and SMILE. Not that fast food servers need to be cute, but if almost every store you went to in LA the people looked haggard, miserable, depressed and never smiled, it would make you depressed too. In fact, this was probably my only fast food experience in LA where they smiled not once but several times and didn't look like they hated their life and me for existing, and had to go home later to feed their five kids they don't like that much. It's nice to finally have some good customer service, plus quality in LA where I don't have to pay an arm and a leg to get it.

Sitting in the parking lot tasting chick fil-a all day long to be one of the first 100! its now 10pm, that means 17 hours done, 8 hours left! Lets do this! The chicken is amazing and tastes great. The Polynesian sauce is the best! Check it out you wont be upset you did!

Nevermind that I am #12 in line at this very moment to once again be part of the 1st 100 customers.  This will always be my favorite fast food restaurant, no matter where I go! A shining beacon of hope in a world of fatty mediocrity!
Chik-fil-a, I was a loyal east coast customer, so happy your finally in hollywood, literally a block from my house!! Original Chicken sandwich with pickles is the bomb
Trash. This restaurant messes up the area with unwanted traffic. The food is garbage and is microwaved airplane food.  I would give negative stars.

Avoid this location. The first time I dismissed it, the second time I thought, hmm must be having a bad day, it's hot, after another visit- nope. I don't even blame them employees at this point it HAS to be management, because every single employee I have encountered at this location has the worst attitude, you have managed to hire an entire crew of the same mannerism, even tried to extend my gratitude in the heat and tip $ the girl at the window, nope, nothing. Like, who doesn't smile back and at least say thank you after a tip?  Staff never smiles,  practically throw your bag of food at you, it was literally dropped in my lap! Service it's just horrible, worst customer service ever. Dry a** faces dry attitudes. Sad.
Layout is awful and very inconvenient. Idk whose genius idea it was to build a Chick-fil-A here. I opened my good and there's a hair.

Great food and was very fast but there was a young lady who was extremely rude who took my order. London I believe her name was. She made my experience at this newer location not a good one. I wish she could have been nicer.
I've been here 5 times and every time they forgot something from my order. Worst Chic- fil a I've been to
the wait for your food isn't bad and the area has a lot businesses . there is a target up the street.
This is what I find in my chicken sandwich today so so unpleasant!  please check your food if your buying any food from this location!!

It's chick-fil-a , just with a really weird layout in terms of parking and drive thru and entry - exit points . It's right off the freeway and close to Kaiser . The food and service is typical chick-fil-a ...lots of smiling and their catch phrase when you day Thanks .."it's my pleasure " .

I go to Chick-fil-A practically every day when I come outta work around 10:40 thankfully I'm not far so I always make it on time before 11 hits, but for the past few days I've been going just to find the store closing like bruh ;( , I'm just now seeing they've updated their hours to 8am-10pm which is tough but it is what it is. Now I'm forced to eat wack fast food instead of that soft tender chicken Chick-fil-A got

They were fast and polite, as are all CFA workers, but there's something off about the food here... it's just not as good as other CFA locations. My friend and I ordered one original sandwich each. The filets were small on both of them, and the bread was like... chewy? Seriously you guys should try going to a CFA in Georgia or somewhere down south. It's way better than this bs. Our sweet teas were FULL of ice, and barely had any actual tea, which made it watered down and not reeeaaly sweet tea.

Not going to lie I have been here before but I've had some experiences with some attitudes. I was in today getting my usual Cobb salad and Powerade. Amber was great! It's nice to have great service especially during these difficult times (pandemic), I know tons of places are short staffed. Let's Be kind. Amber had a great attitude and very presentable. 10/10 Thank you Amber for the easy going attitude hon!

I have to start out by saying I would never give my money to this company due to their anti LGBTQ+ agenda, lobbying, and funding. But I was riding with some people who wanted us to hit the drive through. Their drive through system maybe the least efficient thing I've ever witnessed. Absolute chaos. And furthermore, there was an employee walking down the line handing out food to cars rather than having them wait to pull up to the window which seemed fine initially. But what was happening is the the car at the window must've been waiting for their food for 10 minutes while other people behind them us included were just sitting there and couldn't go anywhere. We asked the employee why they couldn't just have that car pull around to a parking spot like literally every fast food restaurant ever would have a car in this situation to do. They responded that they simply couldn't. I would recommend avoiding this place for both afore mentioned reasons.

This place is a joke. Such a kids menu. Food tastes like it is microwaved. Dumb jacks asking for Polynesian sauce to mask the bland taste. Overpriced finger food that should be served on an airplane only!!!I would give negative stars.

I ordered from the app and waited in line with the other cars at the drive-thru. This location is on the grungy side, and the customer traffic has to be directed in strange ways to keep it from overflowing into the alleys and streets... right next to a major interstate on-ramp. The sandwich I received was about half-normal in thickness. The chicken patty itself was fried beyond all recognition, with the consistency of a frisbee. I'll be avoiding this location in the future.

if I could give half star I would. some bs I place order at 1:05pm. got to chik fil a at 1:10pm because I got notification saying my order ready for pick up. got there tragic. only my drink was ready, so I waited til 1:20pm still nothing. they kept saying food not ready. it doesn't take 10min for 4 items... however I decide to wait a little longer. my co worker can in and saw me waiting in line. his food was ready when we both order same time.. how that possible. so I decide to cancel my order ask for refund. they said no refund but we will remake your order. waited another 10min more. fast food and I got wait 30min? they hand me my order, I check it didnt even leave yet. they forgot an item. I straight up said "I didn't walk out the door im still here in front you, where the rest my order?"they didn't comp or anything bad experience. never coming back fuck this place

Honestly so disappointed! Every time I order from here it's the same thing they always forget either the sauce or an item. Last time around I ordered a large Mac and cheese and redeemed my reward points, and instead of receiving what I ordered they gave me the smaller size. I get it it's free but that should not be a reason why as a customer I did not receive what I ordered. This time around I redeemed my rewards for some fries and they completely forgot them!!! I had to remind them at the window for sauce when I already ordered them in my mobile order! There is clearly something wrong the way this location is working not checking orders thoroughly before handing them to the customers. The chocolate milkshake sucks too just like their service! Very disappointed.

I'm a avid chick fil a eater and I usually get amazing customer service but today Daniel Kim was HORRIBLE. Not only did he rush us, but when we asked for extra sauces he replied with "would u like to buy a bottle". He seemed very impatient and annoyed! That's not the chik fil a service I have come to know and love. Our order was incorrect and he would not give us water cups. Overall 0/10, attitude was unnecessary. I hope if you go to this chik fil a, you do not encounter Daniel Kim. He will ruin you're experience.

I expected something totally different from my experience at chick fil la. 1. I waited 5 minutes at the speaker which was not normal for me at a chic fil la drive thru and it was only 6:40 am and there was only one car ahead of me. 2. The woman taking  my order did not even say Goodmorning and I told her my order and she has me repeat it 3 times while repeating the wrong order and then asking if I wanted my items in a combo so she made my already long experience longer.3 I get to the window what looks the whole crew of like 6  is standing in a circle and I'm waiting for her to charge me and then she just hands me my food and walks always and gets back in the circle. This is not like any of my other experiences at other chick fil las which sucks because this one is only 3 blocks away from me and the staff is very rude and did not even provide me with any utensils like usual.
The lines here are insane like 15 cars ahead of me . Only in LA.  Food was OK a little cold but not really worth it . Don't think I'll come back . People were nice though.  Chicken was just OK.

Parking availability is ridiculous !!! I can't comment on the interior or the food of this establishment because I couldn't get in. Because I couldn't park anywhere. Good job Chick-fil-A picking an area that has no space. LOL
Obviously these chicken sandwiches are amazing. But this whole staff rocks! So sweet and very efficient during busy hours. Major props
Yudith was so understanding on my Uber eats order that was 1 hour delayed. She ensured the order was fresh and handled with care. Great service!

I know some people are obsessed with Chick-fil-A but I'm not that big of a fan. This most recent visit was only my second time eating at a Chick-fil-A, and there were some hits and some misses. The worst thing I ate was their chicken sandwich with cheese. The cheese tasted processed; I do not know why but the cheese made the sandwich inedible for my taste preferences. (1 out of 5 stars)My husband, fortunately, ordered two chicken sandwiches without cheese and let me have one of his sandwiches. Having the sandwich without cheese made all the difference (3 out of 5 stars without Chick-fil-A sauce, 4 out of 5 stars with Chick-fil-A sauce).Lastly, the fries I felt were on the lower end of fast-food fries. When we got home with our take-out, the fries were already cold, and needed salting, as it was relatively bland.

disclaimer i don't hate chik fil a but everytime i go to chik fil a no matter what location something in my order is wrong whether it be the sauce or the meal or the drink i don't know what i did to have this curse placed on me but it follows and i have grown weary

I actually haven't had much of an issue with the food here, except for the fact that sometimes the fries are soggy and don't have salt. My main concern is some of the staff have been a little rude. Other staff are really kind and helpful but I've had some stuff just ignore me while I stood there fir 5-10 minutes just wanting to pick up my order. I don't need everyone to be overly happy, but it would be nice to be acknowledged when I am waiting to just pick up my food. Again, not all staff are rude, some of them are super nice but it's very hit or miss. The other thing that is annoying here is the parking. It's the weirdest smallest parking lot and sometimes I have to leave since there isn't any parking.

Keep driving straight passed this location. Rude Employees. I went through the drive thru at 8:21 am and ordered a large coffee. The representative said we only have one size, I said ok whatever you have, he replied That's all you want or what? I told him never mind, I have no idea why me ordering a large coffee ruined his day...I used to come here every single day and spend at least $20..I will never be back. I had Mikes Deli for lunch today...it was amazing and it only up the street.
This single store on LaCieniega NEVER gets our order right!  This is the 5th time they have screwed up the order. We get home, and there is ALWAYS something incorrect. Not going back!

I am a lifelong chick fil a fan. Born and raised in Atlanta and have frequented CFA For the better part of 25 years. This has to be one of the most poorly operated CFAs I've come across. My order Almost always has at least one mistake, and the quality of the food is slipping fast. Don't bother ordering a large fry - they don't fill it up beyond halfway. Theft, to be real.
Seriously Chick fil a I could have had the same low quality chicken sandwich from Arco.

Not only was my spicy chicken sandwich cold and soggy with hard bread, but the medium fry was half full and also SOG-VILLE. Does anyone care anymore? I guess I can expect this with fast food. But holy disappointed?!

I never had a bad experience at Chick-fil-A until today. My son, sister and I came for a quick lunch and the drive through workers attitude was uncomfortable. He was very interactive and was rude with all his responses. He was rushing for me to order and made this an unpleasant visit.

Hate leaving a bad review but this place used to be one of the better chick-fil-a spots and it has gone downhill over the past few months, The last 2 time's I've went they've messed up my order, either missing items or wrong items in the order, the last chicken sandwich I got had the smallest piece of chicken ever in it, this spot used to have big flavorful pieces of chicken in it but now you'd find more meat on a butchers pencil!This spot needs some drastic changes to bring it back to how it used to be, it's clear to see other people are getting tired of it too as the drive thru line is almost empty and that has nothing to do with the speed of service.Gonna give it a couple of months and probably try again hopefully it will be better!!!!

drive through is an absolute fucking nightmare, the amount of times i've almost scraped my car or had someone else hit me, is absolutely insane. horrible horrible horrible coordination and design when it comes to the drive thru line

A woman taking me and my friends order today, a woman with a flower tattoo on her right shoulder, gave us such immense attitude it was unreal. We were nothing but understanding and polite as she took our order but she was awful.
Does this place really need a review? Nope. But I really like this place. Great service. Always packed, but somehow the most efficient lines of any fast food. Never let's down.

Chik-fil-a did a cheap trick on me... wow... i ordered a Large coffee with my Spicy deluxe combo. They gave me the coffee abd when they handed me the coffee i felt that there were 2 cups, one on too of the other, i didn't think much about it, i was cool they gave it ro me with 2 cups because it was hot.   So i got home i started drinking my coffee and then i remove the first cup from the other one, and thats when i noticed that they actually gave me a small coffee instead of a large, what they did was put a small cup inside the large cup to make it seem like it was a large. NOT COOL CHIL-FIL-A .... NOT COOL IF O TRICK TOUR CUSTOMERS LIKE THAT!!!!

I was finally let down by a chick fil a.  there was no line and that should have told me something. They got my food right  just no sauce  now I'm stuck eating these like some heathen just dry dogging it

I don't know what all these bad reviews are about! Got Chick-fil-A for the first time today and it was bomb! Sure, the drive-thru situation is confusing but once you find your way, you're about to be blessed with an incredible chicken sandwich. Enjoy the experience, it's totally worth it.

Awful awful awful! The staff that's working outside in the drive thru does not like their job. They let me sit and sit in the drive thru and wold not help me, i decided to go to the door. They said that they could not take my order there even after they knew that I was standing there and could not get help. I left and went to the location down the street.

Omg this location is not only convenient, it's also friendly! Of course the food is always good and fresh and sometimes the line is long ( especially during covid as we can't go inside and all chik fil as' have long drive throughs in the LA area). It's not long lines all the time though and they move pretty quickly. I unfortunately had a bad experience on my last visit and I called when I got home. I spoke with Michelle and she told me to come back the next day and speak to a manager. The next day I went when I got off of work and the employees were kind and patient and didn't mind getting the manager for me. The manager on duty came out ( Justin the director) he was instantly friendly and it even showed on his face so his friendliness was authentic. His voice is very encouraging and he listened to my experience. What I appreciate about Justin is that he didn't make any excuses, he immediately apologized and gave some suggestions as to what would work to make up for the experience I'd had. He got the deed done very quickly and he was just so friendly and understanding, he's also very humble and has great customer service. He's literally the reason I'm going to go back to this location. Thank you so much for you excellent customer service Justin, you are appreciated!

Had a great experience at this Chick-fil-A I went through the drive-through and there, I was attended by team member whom was very friendly and effective. As for the food it was scrumptious as predicted... Definitely come here again and recommended

Came here on 1/30 and was charged twice. Originally I paid the person who took my order in line on the ipad. When I got to the drive-thru window Joseph, the cashier, stated that my payment did not go through. I was looking through my bank statements and saw two charges, one for $9.32 and another for $28.03! I am a single person who ordered a 3peice meal. I called chick-Fil-A cares twice and left feedback on their website, nothing was done. I continued to follow up but still nothing. Thankfully, I was finally able to find my receipt in my car and called the chick-fi-la location regarding my issue. I spoke to Erik, the manager, and he stated that in order to receive a refund I would need to come to the location w/ the same card that was used for the transaction, in addition to the receipt. So on top of their mistake I am responsible for pursuing the refund. When I arrived Erik, the manager, seemed as if I was inconveniencing him. He suggested that he was refunding the $9.32 - absolutely not, you charged me $28.03 in addition to the meal I ordered, which the original meal was only $9.32! The fact that I had to go out of my way (late for work) to retrieve a refund on behalf of their mistake is so tiring and the constant following up that I am still doing is time consuming. I hate writing bad reviews but this is absolutely uncalled for.

They split the drive thru into 2 lines and one side (left)  is way faster than the other because of the way the line curves. And there's a tough looking security guy ordering people where to go. Also, there's no chance to read the menu before you order because the line is so long. Stressful experience overall, especially when hangry. Shame on you

Ordered one spicy grilled chicken deluxe sandwich and two fries .. they made me wait for 10 mins after the drive thru while everyone after me was leaving with their food.. they bring me the food.. I didn't double check the sandwich thinking it was fine.. got to work and it wasn't a spicy grilled sandwich.. it was a grilled club sandwich.. why make me wait 10 mins if you were going to give me any sandwich you felt like? You could have just grabbed something that was already ready. I'm also 8 months pregnant and had already driven back to work and made the 10 min walk from my car to my office by the time I figured this out... so I got to eat what they picked for me. and also didn't have pickles on it... big problem when that's all you want pregnant . And the bag sticker and the receipt allll showed my correct order. Literally every time I go to chick fil a there is a problem and my order is messed up. Explains why I only go once every 3-4 months.. enough time to forget you guys mess up every time ..now I'll wait until I forget about this until I see you guys again..

I've been a regular at this location since opening. I hate their drive-thru set up as you can enter from 2 different sides. Other than that, a spicy chicken sandwich, no pickles, never fails. Chick-fil-A sauce and the Honey BBQ are both amazing.

Erick took my order this morning(I hope I got your name right) you did an amazing job. You're so kind and I just wanted to show some love. Keep doing what you're doing!!! You made my day! Hope y'all see this cause you deserve appreciation!!

I used to love coming here after work but unfortunately it's business hours have changed.  a sign would be have been nice instead I came over here twice thinking it was just a fluke that the drive tru was closed.

First time this location has let me down. I always appreciate the friendly and helpful staff but my order today consisted of a quantity unfit to fill a gerbals water bowl. I ordered the Chick-N-Strips meal for the first time and was as unsatisfied as a Honeymoon cancelled by Covid. Mind you this thing is around $9! I kept trying to find out if I was missing fries or something but I couldn't find out what a Combo Meal consisted of anywhere on their site or anywhere else. Do better Chick squad. Shoot me a coupon or something.
Drive thru wait time almost always is unbearably long. They also got my order wrong and had to come back to correct it. Their food is ok but this place needs to improve their customer service.

One of the worst locations ever. It's by my job so I gave it two tries and was disappointed both times. I ordered a chicken breakfast burrito and the tortilla was not cooked at all. What's so hard about warming up a tortilla? Not only that, but my cheese is never melted and is cold like it just came straight from the fridge. Their customer service is awful. People taking orders are so rude. Oh & expect to wait a bit in the drive-thru because they are so slow
Horrible. The only good thing is their dipping sauce. I personally thought the batter was tasteless and the chicken was chewy.

By far the worst chick fil a location I've ever been to. Every time I've been here there is always something that is missing from my order. I've spoken with the owner/operator Erica Hartfield and I believe she personally and genuinely doesn't have the customers interest at heart.  I don't think she embodies the chick fil a image that we have all come to know and love. It's evident that my past experiences here aren't one off instances as many other people have also experienced the horrible service here as evidenced by all of the other negative reviews on here. Won't be coming back to this location ever again.

Food and service are great and the line moved very quick for drive thru. But somehow I always get short changed on sauces. There's always at least a couple missing when I get home. Please let the customer know if there's a sauce count limit up front.

Food is good but customer service is awful and rude . Girl taking order has a major attitude, (erika)Cashier (Joseph made up for it and was more friendly.Food is up to par with the rest of the franchise .

This is the second time that I have now came where they have these poor employees that Stand outside during this heat wave. They unfortunately do not have a menu on there person when they walk up to your car and take your order. So I thought I would suggest it to the cashier which was a young light-skinned African-American girl that was so rude and interrupted me midsentence and asked me if she could help me with anything else very sarcastically. I was being very polite just trying to make a suggestion that would make it easier for the customers to order. Very disappointing just like the size of my nuggets.
Went to eat at this location on 8/07/20. Had to download app first to order take out service. Food was ready once i hit final enter button to order food. Hot food friendly service prompt very pleased

I am truly amazed at what happened here at this Chick-Fil-A. There are two drive-thru lines that end up in the ordering line. There was a car waiting to enter the line, so I waved for him to go ahead. He waited, and even the security guard told him it was okay to enter. He still waited. I waved again for him to go ahead of me. Finally he did. After I finished ordering for my family, the server said that the man in front of you just paid for your meal. I was shocked and also realized I had ordered for four!  I got out of my car (mask on of course!) and tried to return the money to him. He would not take the money. He just smiled and said (mask on of course!), "Be safe and enjoy your meal." Then I noticed his scrubs, and said a prayer for this young doctor who had just finished his shift. I literally cried because here was this first responder who was still giving even after his long day. Thank you to the doctor whose kindness shone brightly in this pandemic. May God bless you greatly!  And by the way, it made the chicken sandwiches the best ever! :D

I see many bad reviews on this location! I came here July 2020 during COVID 19 to pickup a No-bun-spicy-chicken-deluxe & the quality of chicken, lettuce, & tomato along with the drive thru customer service were all great. I like their waffle fries because you can actually taste the potato flavor (other fast food joints fail to maintain that).
They've come a long ways in terms of entering and exiting. Far more organized and timely.

I started in the line at 10: 05 I don't eat meat so I was just getting biscuits and eggs and hashbrowns in orange juice. I got on the app. At about 10:15 ish? The chicken was just circling. I got to the window. At 10:40. Nobody was out to direct the line. I even called in the inside so I can secure my breakfast order and they told me to go on the app in the app didn't work. It was the worst experience ever 40 minutes in the Drive-Thru line. And I couldn't eat breakfast. Jonathan Was the manager this morning? Don't eat at that Chick-fil-A. They unorganized.

This store is awesome at screwing up your order and when you ask to be credited for missing items they decline and offer to "make it right the nexttime". The problem however is that making it right apparently means making me waste a bunch of time coming back to the store and waiting in line only to be told I have to download and order via the app for the manager to comp the item that was missing from the last order. Unfortunately the app is a complete piece of garbage and after 20 minutes of refreshing and trying different emails they are unable to confirm my email and as a result I can't submit an order via the app. After dealing with this issue for 30+ minutes I decided that I will just never spend another dollar at this location because they seem uninterested in providing the customer with even basic customer service. My money should have been refunded after the issue was brought to their attention and if I was kind enough to come all the way back to allow them to "make it right" they should have done everything possible to do that.

Went to this place twice to pick up lunch for my guys when our construction site was nearby.  Both times they screwed up the order.  First time I drove all the way back and had them remake the entire order, which they obliged.  Second time I didn't even bother, the guys were on lunch and didn't want them to have to wait again.  Poor service.  Very disappointed.  I do not recommend this location, always double check your order if you do go here.

The system to get in and out is HORRIBLE. If you want to park to go in you have to wait in the drive thru line until you reach a point where you can turn into the parking lot (which can take more than 15 minutes). Currently you cannot enter inside the restaurant which a customer has know way of knowing until you approach the entrance. The employee who approached my car asked me "what I was trying to do" never did they tell me while I'm waiting to get in the parking lot that they are only processing online and drive thru orders only. Just a HORRIBLE experience.

The current situation allows only drive thru ordering and the employees are MEAN and RUDE. I don't know why people rave about this shit - it was nasty; the deluxe chicken sandwiches were overly salty and so was the Mac & Cheese sides. It was literally inedible - DISGUSTING. I threw away the food thus wasted my money. Save your money and health people- eat somewhere else. The FOOD here IS DISGUSTING and staff is NASTY & MEAN.

Trust me I was breader there the food was always not at the night temperature the manager didn't even know wat he was doing the food is cold the buns are from smart and final don't believe fill my IG : @ eknworb and you'll see all the fuckkn nasty chicken it's just nasty don't get grill the grill doesn't even work

It's the second time I go to this location and both of the time they forgot to give me any sauce that I requested. It's a shame... I've clearly ask 3 times when I ordered the food to add also some sauces (as also written on the receipt that I've attached) but nothing.... to unappreciative of my business, which it will go somewhere else for sure from now one...

Horrible service. We purchased this thru postmates and recieved all my salads without chicken???? Called the number and said the store manager would call back to fix. It has been a week and no call returned. Call the customer service and said they would resolve, and when calling the store they said to call the customer service number. Waste of money especially for me as a healthcare worker trying to have my food ready for work.
Simply the worst Chick-fil-A I've ever been at, worst costumer service ever. Does not live to the name of this restaurant. All rude people

**PEOPLE OF COLOR, DO NOT VISIT THIS LOCATION** My boyfriend and I ordered in the drive thru, the young lady working asked us if we would like our receipt, we said no thank you since we paid cash and wanted to save a little paper. As we begin to drive off, we noticed one of our chicken mini breakfast meals was missing. We parked in their lot, and went to ask them for our missing meal. The manager, Joseph, gave us a disgusting attitude (which is VERY rare for this company) and insinuated we wanted a free meal. We paid $20 for two meals and we did not have any interest in scamming the company for a $10 meal. The drive thru lady left our bag of food on the table and walked away. Nobody apologized, but they embarrassed us in front of other customers. We did not mirror their rudeness. We simply grabbed our food and left. This type of behavior should NOT be allowed. It was disgusting, humiliating and down right racist. If I could, I would give ZERO stars to this location. All of my people of color should avoid this location. Since we clearly just want free food.

We all love this food ! At this location though they have a handful of rude inconsiderate employees that behave like they hate the job! And of course they treat us the customers poorly! It is easy to be nice ..And we will bring our niceness to another location Ty

From the drive thru to the cashier are rude and toxic, if you don't like your job then don't work!. Night shift manager is also rude and don't care. FIX THAT PHONE . A big establishment and you can fix your phone at work that's a joke. Educate your employees on how to treat customers correctly. Of all the chick-Fil-a I have been to, this California branch this is the most unorganized place to be in. Have you been to the drive thru.... lol I JUST WISH Carlos JR. Never left. Don't go here if you want shit service. Look at the rest of the rating. I work in customer services. if I managed this place l, a lot of this young fuck tards working their would be fired. Not sorry.

I would like to congratulate chik fil a for there security staff they have.....On April 17th around 7:45pm  I was there buying food for me and daughters....after waiting 20min in line to get into parking lot my daughters had fallen asleep in the back sit....I told the guard that I was picking up food but i couldnt exit my car because of my girls in the back sit....The guard asked me for my name and ran to the door , he picked up my food and brought it back to my car...I tried to tip him but he didn't except the few dollars ...I wasnt about to leave my girls in the car alone n I had consider just driving away .....Before I drove off I thanked him and asked him for his name , he said his name was Marlin , i said like Nemo fish and he said exactly and told me to have a good day....had it not been for his fast reaction I might of cancelled my order and left chik fil a with out food after a 20min wait...Thanks Marlin

Do not go there.  The employee inside that are handeling food are not wearing masks or gloves while handeling your food which is against food ordinance.  I even so one employee sneeze with his mask around his neck and just wipe his nose on his clothes.  You will get sick and be exposes to people.  When I complained to the manager they were indifferent.  They also got my order wrong because the people taking the order were talking to each other.

Normally the service here is amazing but today I didn't get that at all. When I was at the drive thru this very rude lady pretended like she couldn't hear me when I was talking to her. I then asked her if she put the sauces in the bag as well then with a very loud and rude voice she tells me to check the bag with such attitude that even my 4 year old brother was shocked with her tone of voice. I come to chick fil a often and I love it just that customer service today was horrible

Yet another terrible review for this location. And boy do they earn these bad reviews! Clearly and carefully, I ordered a grilled club sandwich combo meal with a smaller diet frozen lemonade. When I got to the drive-thru window I found out that they gave me a large diet lemonade, and I asked them to change it for the smaller. I'm diabetic and can only handle so much carbs and sugar, and the diet frozen lemonade isn't calorie-free. Having a smaller portion keeps me from cheating and having too much. I didn't care about the money difference, but they insisted on crediting my bank card. A whole whopping $0.33!  But then no one seems to know how to do a credit on the machine and I had to wait further for a manager to come over and fix it.But then I noticed that they had given me a grilled chicken sandwich and not the grilled chicken club. You'd think that after this long wait they would simply fix it, but no, they insisted on charging me the $1.75 extra. So, for a 3rd time I hand over my bank card, to a manager who obviously didn't want to be friendly or helpful. Problem is they charged me again for the cheese... because the grilled sandwich they gave me before DID, surprisingly, have cheese on it! It was just missing the correct bun and the bacon. To test them, I pushed my finger into the underside of the bottom bun. All this while, the drive-thru went from 2 cars behind me to more than 10.And of course, when I finally got a sandwich back, all they had done was add bacon to it, since it already had cheese. I also know they didn't make it fresh because the bun was still the same one as before... with a finger hole in the bottom. And it was completely cold. So, $1.75 to have bacon added and have the chicken not even be a little bit warm...since it was the same piece. Greeeeeaaat.On top of all that, the re-made frozen lemonade was not a diet one, and I know this because when I got home my sugar levels were way off... not what I had planned for! Luckily my diabetes isn't very serious because this could be dangerous for someone else.Just sloppy work, and attitude to boot. Why am I being given attitude when I'm being polite about mistakes THEY MADE? So much for "my pleasure"...which I didn't hear once!

The WORST place to order your food.The RUDE employee just told me to order online instead of placing order on the phone on Saturday morning.Wow... what a way to chase customer away.Where is your Basic Customer Service?Are you that miserable to help customers place an order on Saturday morning?Or maybe you would rather the computer take your job away?? Try to be nice and smile , your life would be better!!

Awful customer service. They were a little busy today, but what else is new. After placing an order. The guy outside giving people their food was in such a panic like rush. He shoved everything in my car and snatched my phone out my hand so I could pay with Apple Pay. I will not be returning to this location.

I just wanted to compliment an employee named Jordan who after only having met me twice he remembered my name from that time onward.  I don't come there very often but he is always very friendly and efficient and polite but warm enough to make me feel like a valued person and customer.  I usually do the drive through and it's usually only at dinner and he's often been the one I get to meet.But Chick fil A overall is just amazing and I like how well you train your employees and how they are all happy and warm and polite and sincerely about getting your order right.  Every step along the way is so different than most all other fast food experiences.  I also like how clean everything is inside when I do go inside.  And then...the quality of the food is amazing and consistent.  I had a boss come from Switzerland and he didn't know anything about Chick fil A and he has the money to go to the very best restaurants but he LOVES the United States and he loved his experience and the food at Chick-fil-A.

This location is basically a Wendy's in disguise.  My only problem was going there with Chic-fil-a expectations, my bad. Everything tasted microwaved, my girl doesn't cook well if I wanted microwaved tasting food I could've stayed home.

Worst Chick fil a location ever! It was unbelievable until I checked on yelp after my visit, the ratings are substandard as expected. Poor quality control and incredibly lacking service. This location needs a revamp of management and its staff.

To begin with I don't do reviews , because every where I've went I've been pleased. This chick fil A is the closest one to me and it's so disgusting starting with the people in charge to the food they give out. Now I don't mind driving that extra 5 miles to get me some good chick fil A. I have two incidents, one I've witnessed and one that was done to me. I don't quite remember when this incident happened but I dined in because parking there is horrible , as all of y'all may know.  I go inside and my order is taken by Arianna the sweetest one out of all of them , along with this other girl with glasses , don't quite remember her name. I didn't have problems there until I received my food. It was NOT fresh , the fries were COLD, SALTY and they had the nerve to not top them off. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to make it a big deal, so I sat down and I start eating. (Btw off topic the restrooms are disgusting as well) I notice that these two young ladies are waiting for the food , it was 20 minutes , it was not packed , they asked about there order and they were told it was placed in the mobile holding area. They get upset and say they they have been standing there nobody has called them. A girl by the name "molly " YELLS from the back and says " I YELLED YOUR NAME 6 TIMES AND NOT ONCE DID SOMEONE RESPOND" this girl did not yell 6 times nor did she care to go look for this customer ( it was not packed at all ) then of course the two young ladies respond to the employee and now mind you we have a chick fil A employee yelling from the back arguing and fighting with a customer in the dining area . I was so disgusted seeing this situation because Daniel the manager ( I've seen him and encountered him a couple of times) was just standing there counting money , allowing his employee yell from across the room to this customer. That's beyond unprofessional and disrespectful to the people who are just trying to enjoy their chicken sandwich. Daniel being the manager says nothing to the customers nor " Molly" who arguing with the customer  back and forth . There is the manager for you , the one that are suppose to care about the customers. The second incident was with this young "supposedly " manager " Grace" who shouldn't be one , she doesn't have the patience to help someone, always seems bothered when asked for something. I was carrying out this time (Wednesday of last week) "molly" hands me my food , this time she wasn't insane like last time but I get COLD FRIES AGAINNNNN !!! With no sauce. I said something this time. I notice this girl "Grace" who I didn't know her name at the time, I let her know what happened and she walks away from me , not saying a word and mouth something under breath , I noticed because the other employees looked at me and laughed. She came back and handed me new fries and said " YOU CAN KEEP THE OLD ONES, ANYTHING ELSE" like  if you don't want to work there leave . So disrespectful. And she is in charge , that's scary . Seems like she can't handle pressure. I respond to her and say , if it isn't any trouble can I get my sauces , she says " WHAT WERE THEY" all rude , I thought chick fil A was suppose genuinely love to help people and go that extra mile but I guess not, they hire people who want to work for free and just stand there observing holding a clipboard and assigning people where to go. I don't have this problem in the morning , I've encounter Catherine and Cesar who they truly love helping and they make sure that the customers eat what they payed for . That's amazing ( something is wrong with the night) They need fire all management and hire people who love to help, like Arianna should be a manager there. I'm offended by their actions. ( NEVER GO THERE AT NIGHT) I don't even want to meet the operator , she is probably self centered and disrespectful like these three that I've encountered.

Usually Chick-fil-A has AMAZING service but NOT this one! Employees are extremely rude, you try to get their attention & they keep walking like that don't hear you. Ridiculous that I have to wait over 20 mins for my mobile order!

The manager on duty was very friendly. All employees were friendly at my visit and this location is very clean but of course to the most important thing about my purchase food was very delicious, they were quick about getting my refill and they have table cloths for kids not all locations have them so this place is great!!!

DO NOT EAT HERE. I don't know if I've ever written a negative review on food before. I have been eating chick fil a since i was 3 years old I am 33. I ate at this location and got food poisoning so bad i vomited blood and had diarrhea for 12 hours. I know it was this food because I was dieting with only protein bars and smoothies prior for weeks. I had to get 2 IVS vomited blood and I work for the best doctors in the country and they all confirmed it was E COLI poisoning. SAVE YOUR OWN LIFE. I posted on Instagram and III her people said it happened to them too at this location.

The worst service!!! I give this location a maximum of 2 years before they go out of business. I feel bad for the owner.  There is no way a business; this location can remain in business with the negative level of customer service. Employees chatting with each other about the shots they took the night before, massaging each other, demonstrating new dance moves, clocking out for lunch, looking for their name tag, and jumping up and down. Yes, I've experienced all this at this location. 15 minutes I waited for a cold chicken sandwich. If you don't believe me, you don't have to take my word for it. Just mystery shop/visit this location for yourself. Or read the other reviews.
Friendly staff. Fast service. Very clean. Drive through was also fast as I tried it yesterday.

I'm a huge Chick-fil-A girl, but this location disappoints. The layout is too tiny for the congested corner so be aware you will surely wait in a line for at least 15 minutes for drive through. And even if you want to park and go in to save time, forget about it. The drive through lines are so long around the parking lot that you have to wait just to get to the parking spots. Horrible system for getting customers in and out. I was also pretty disappointed with the food itself. The sweat tea and chicken were okay but the fries were overcooked. :(On the positive, the staff are very friendly and helpful!

Wow, I'm so happy they opened this location, they have the best Chicken Everything!My favorite is the spicy chicken sandwich, but I love the breakfast and the salads too.Try the zesty buffalo sauce, to die for.I come here for breakfast, lunch and sometimes after my workout for a protein load.Delicious food at a good price point, I don't mind paying a couple of bucks more for this level of quality.

I was really excited for this new chick-fil-a in my neighborhood but was greatly disappointed. The stars are for the food quality. I ordered the chick fila sandwich and it was cold, and the fries were very hard and almost tasted as if they were burned. The drive thru process is really nice and seamless, and the staff were very friendly.

I payed for the large fries to get a half empty box. The thing is your blood sugar is low when you order your food so getting short changed is upsetting. Wait times are ridiculous, and their attention to meeting basic orders is poor.

Stopped by this location for breakfast yesterday morning and boy do I wish I had read the reviews first. This has got to be the worst Chick-fil-A regarding customer service. Placed a breakfast order and turns out that right after me there was another person named just like me. A few minutes later a male chick-fil-a employee walks up to the other customer and hands him a bag. That customer looks through the bag and immediately realizes that wasn't what he ordered. He walks up to the counter to inform staff, turns out it's the manager, and informs her that he was given the wrong order. I can see the manager checking the order and then realizing that their was 2 Danny's. She informs the male employee of the mistake and I can see him laughing like it's not a big deal. A few moments later the same male employee walks up to me and hands me a bag. I look through the bag he has given me the other Danny's bag. I immediately grab his attention and inform him that he has made a mistake again and that he has given away the wrong food bag again. He turns around angrily, snatches the bag out of my hand and yells out, "You're not the only Danny in here so you need to relax." Which I reply with, "I know. That's why you need to make sure you're handing out the right bag. You already made the mistake once why not double check?" He then gives the bag to the other Danny and walks behind the counter. I immediately notify the manager of what just occurred and while doing so I can see the same employee staring at me as if he's trying to intimidate me. I've been to several Chick-fil-A's and I have never seen an employee act so rudely. After leaving the restaurant with my food I look it up on Yelp and I begin to read all the bad reviews regarding customer service at this location.

I'm giving three stars simply because this location can't figure out the order ahead/pickup. Every time I come to this location, I wait an additional 12-15 for my food, even though the app says the food is ready. Other than that, the food is in line with all other chic-fil-A's and the staff is friendly.

As a person who frequents chick fil a, I hate to leave a bad review but my experiences have not seemed to change. I visit this location frequently because it is not only the closest to my home, it is on my route to work. Today was the final straw for me. This morning i ordered a chicken, egg, and cheese muffin with an egg white... it took them over 10 minutes to give me just a single sandwich. I asked to speak to the manager - Joseph - is his name and I politely spoke to him about the frequent extended wait times and how this was unacceptable. His response was that she - referring to the woman who is expediting the orders - did not see my order because it was buried within all the small orders. I took this as an insult I worked in the restaurant industry for more than three years, I am more than familiar with the process - this is disrespectful to tell a customer that your team is simply not doing their job and there is no solution to this problem. When I asked how he planned on implementing changes and compensating his customers - he told there was nothing else he could offer me. It's disrespectful and a poor excuse of a chick fil a. Like myself, one of the main reasons people frequent chick fil a, is the service and this location does not even come close to the standards and precedent set by other locations. I have not decided if I will return.

They opened a new place close by and I've never been so I definitely wanted see what the fuss is about. Only problem is the line is always big, same as in & out burger. I don't like long lines, big surprise there . Finally when I knew they were closing soon I went to try my luck. Line was a bit long but I was on a mission. 15 mins later I got my order and drove straight home. Yes I dipped into the waffle fries and yes, they are really good! Different than any other French fry in both texture and taste, highly recommended. Once I got home 5 mins later it was game on. The holy grail of fast food chicken sandwiches was in my hands. Fresh bun I could feel, chicken was a substantial piece but not as big as I was expecting from all the pictures I've seen. Still plenty big enough to satisfy most hunger. I tried my first bite and waited... the heavens didn't open and no angels singing. Was a very good sandwich but not as good as the hype. I tried the dipping sauce, it's like a bbq sauce married thousand island. Which made a lovely child worthy of dipping anything really. Lastly was the mac n cheese...omg! So good! Seriously order it, tastes like a grandma from the south made it. Drooling just thinking about it.  Bottom line is the food is certainly worth the price but the wait? Not so much, so it may be some time before I return.

STAY AWAY!!!! The restaurant is practically inaccessible. They route the drive thru in front of the entrance to the parking lot!!! I got stuck in gridlock for 15 minutes before I was able to extricate myself and drove off. A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!!

so my co-worker Dennis and i decided to try both chick-fil-a and popeyes and see who had the better chicken sandwich.bout 3 weeks ago we headed out to the la cienega store and we ordered the classic/non spicy chik sand.  also ordered the mac n cheese cause it tastes like someone's Nana according to some guy on the tele....so i guess his Nana is a chemist cause there is def something in the "creamy" cheese to make it sooo smooth----it actually upset my stomach---def not just cheese and pasta---also of the 3-4 including our serving that we saw---none of them had that crispy top layer that they show on the tele.  threw in the waffel fries cause why not!...why not---cause they were limp and tasteless.so the guy on tv says that the chicken tastes like what he does on the barby......either the guy doesnt know the ins and outs of BBQ'ing or thinks his dry, tasteless chunk of chicken is the "bomb"....cause that is the findings of my friend and myself....the chicken is dry, smallish, tasteless and not worth the trip out.so yesterday we went to the Popeye's on hollywood and cahuenga and expected a long line....only three ahead of us so that was nice---didnt get mugged,knifed or hit up for money by the street people while in the store.  we again went for the plain sandwich to actually taste the meat.  also ordered cajin fries and biscuits and mac n cheese.the chicken sandwich is way tastier, BIGGER and crispier and actually tasted like chicken.AND IT WAS ONLY 3.99!! UNLESS CHIK FIL A IS ORGANIC AND PASTURED---BOTH OF WHICH ARE NOT THE CASE--WHY IS THEIR'S SO MUCH MORE???the fries were crisp and slightly spicy and good textured. did i also mention that they tasted goodthe mac n cheese was cheesey and slightly lumpy and actually tasted like mac and cheese not like some lab experiment.  the biscuits were tasty...also their regular fried chicken looked pretty tempting!!all in all...Popeye's is just better tasting and less expensive.i will not eat either again as i prefer actual fried chicken--thigh meat being my favorite....if i want a great chicken sandwich, i will buy a couple of thigh pieces at Gus's or Stevies and slather two slices of bread with mayo and a couple of pickles and --PRESTO---I HAVE THE BEST CHICK SANDWICH MONEY CAN BUY

I am a regular customer at this and other locations.  Management at this location is really bad.  The customer service is terrible.  Long wait times and unfriendly employees.  I was at this location on opening day.  Fantastic.  For months it was good.  Slowly the service has dropped off.  Not what I expect.  I have noticed the lines getting shorter and shorter.  Today almost no one inside and still I couldn't sleep get a refill or any attention.  Finally I just set my cup on the counter and walked out.  Food was fine but not the only chicken in town.  This reflects leadership.  Just check how many stars this location has. Hoping for better leadership.

I understand the ratings for this location. I didn't appreciate the 10 minute delay just for a Superfood size.  The entire experience was troubling and the drive thru was being manned by a manager.  I'm hoping it was just a random person with a manager shirt on. I've never ever had to wait, let alone drive to the side and wait at Chick-fil-A.  And for the love of all things holy, change the oil in your fryers.  Yuck, and never ever again here.  You should be ashamed.

Best CFA in Los Angeles currently. High volume location where quality doesn't change even during busy times. I find that the restaurants with dine in typically have more consistency with their items and this location is no different.
For some reason this location doesn't taste the same as the others and my food is always Luke warm I've giving them 5 chances same ol shit ‍

I usually don't write reviews for fast food places but Chick -fil-A really deserves 5 starts! Me and my boyfriend was about to try famous Poppeys chicken sandwich but after seeing huge line decided to go to chick-fil-A instead. And it was a great idea. It was a lot of cars in drive thru but line moved super quick and attendants outside made it very quick and easy. We were picking up food in 5 minutes after ordering it. I am always impressed how nice and polite the employees are. You can tell they are happy with their job ( in compare with other fast food restaurant). The food is always delicious. Chicken in tender and crispy. You can always ask for as many sauces as you wish. And try their light lemonade, it amazing. I love love love this place. % starts for great service and amazing food.

The one time I was actually able to place an order here, I sat in the drive-thru behind 2 other cars for 10 minutes. Every other time I've tried to go, I can't park because the drive-thru line completely blocks the only entrance to the lot

Honestly..... this chick  fil a has a bunch of high schoolers working here that don't give a crap about your order. Very dense workers and half of them look depressed like they don't want to even be here. The chick fil a hospitality ends here with them.. everyone looks confused at all times. Check your bag before you leave the drive through it's almost always wrong.

I'm giving a 5 star rating because Of 3 young ladies that made my experience at this location a great one. Arianna took my order and was so kind to me.Her whole demeanor was very sweet and true to the CFA southern charm that all employees should have.  My friend was helped by Candice and she was astonishing as well. AMAZING attitude and so sweet. Latrice was the young lady who delivered my food to me and she was SO kind and intentive, she took care of me while I ate my meal. So sweet!

I've been here a couple of times. It's better if you go through the drive through. Every time I have gone inside the wait takes forever. It is very unorganized and not as clean. Many customers were frustrated as one customer waited a long time and they forgot their food. They also spelled my name wrong where I could not identify who they were calling. I suggest any other chick fil a besides this one. Save your time and effort and go somewhere else

This chick fila is very busy especially for being right next to a hospital and the freeway regardless of that the staff is amazing very friendly and they maintain a fast pace work flow the food is always hot and the service is always amazing. Mohammed usually takes my order and he is always accurate and so friendly, the store manager Daniel came around and introduced himself which was outstanding.
Wow, worst service I have ever received. This place is disgusting don't eat here. Didn't give me half my order and refused to refund me.

So ofcourse I'm a chick fil a lover and was sooo excited when this one opened because it's on my way to work! The service is amazing per all of the locations that I've been to. The manager Cat is great I see her in the mornings some times and she's always pleasant with me. Overall service is great and this is one place that I actually like spending my money at because of the employees and the service you receive. Like they appreciate u for coming and it really is "their pleasure!" Never have I left any other fast food drive thru and felt a sense of happiness and joy not just about the food but just because of the service!

Alternate reality chick fila.. slow.. unprepared and just not the normal service and speed of other chick fila's.Less than 5 cars in the drive thru and 20 mins for my food.. so much for a quick stop. Hope they fix this one soon..

Katana at drive thru was super friendly and helpful. If you pay by card they take care of payment when you order with the lot attendant so that makes picking up food so much quicker. Smart. The parking/drive thru entrance is a little congested but they have staff support in the lot to help direct cars and keep things moving. The line was semi-long but it really did move fast. ***There is no entrance on La Cienega! You must enter from the alley to the east of La Cienega.

Another time I had to stop after a late meeting, this time through the drive thru.   Placed order, different attendant was friendlier this time but realized the sauces were NOT included when I got home.  I called to see how they were going to make my experience better.  All I got was "do you want to come back for your sauces?, otherwise we can give them to you in your next visit."  UNBELIEVABLE...

I was enjoying going to this location since it opened but it's starting to really be a place for socializing for all the employees. I don't know why they think it's cool to just hang out around the cash register but they do. Food is always on the ball but I wish everyone took more pride in their work.

The worst chick fil a I have ever eaten at. They forgot my fries then when I tasted my food something wasn't right. The taste and quality isn't what I'm used to from other locations. I noticed other customers complaining about forgotten food items ordered. Employees stood around talking and ignoring customers. Katana was the only attentive employee. You can see the frustration in customers.  What a waste of time and money.

Maybe this company is expanding too fast because the quality of service has dropped considerably or maybe it's just this location. I stopped by and got stuck in the parking lot, the attendant taking orders for the drive thru was making traffic worse by leaving several spaces between cars and instead of instructing for them to move forward. Then I get home and no dips! Great!

Super clean in there. Very professional staff. The food was delicious. Was really looking forward to my ice blended frosted caramel coffee drink but the machine was broken. This is my second time trying . I will try a third time, I heard it's a charm.

One of the employee's i believe her name is Catherine is very polite and energetic everytime i visit their restaurant. She introduce me to their delicious cookie parfait which is very good. The wait time for your food goes really fast, i have never had a bad experience since i have been going and i visit them the minimum of 4 times a week..

Went there for the first time last week and drive thru had about 4 cars so I went inside and ordered. This was about 7am. Staff was nice and friendly but the wait was long it took over 15 minutes and another customer inside also asked why are they slower than other chick-fil-A. So I downloaded the app to see if would speed up my wait time so today same time I ordered online and when I got there I had to wait 10 minutes and drive thru was empty as well as inside. I guess the key is to tap I'm here sooner. Food was good. I just wonder how long is wait during peak hours
4th time going and this time I asked for sauces a bunch and they gave me absolutely nothing and rushed me to leave come on

They scored high on the food but LOW on the parking.  OMG...it's almost impossible to get to the LONE handicapped spot!!!!   Great service, though, and the people working in the parking lot are wonderful and patient.

I ordered through the drive through and when I got to the window the man said my right name but the wrong order then he start getting frustrated it took me 15 min to get my right food then when he had the food I was 10 cent short he said it was nothing he could do because his register would be short the basically whole staff had to come to the window to help cause he was being slow the mad has a piercing in his face by his eye very rude very hostile I won't be back they don't have the chick fil a service I'm very use to at all

The worse customer service!!! The manager or owner whatever she wants to call herself Erica is a useless person and has horrible customer service skills!! No wonder this place has like 2 stars! If I could give it 0 stars or better yet a negative rating. I would!I ordered through the mobile app and I had to go back TWICE!! Because they failed at giving me everything!! When I went back the second time the useless manager Erica said that she could no longer give me my order because breakfast was over!! WHAT!!??? So it's my fault you guys failed and now I have to pay for it!! Apparently there is no more stuff left form breakfast! Yea right! I'm sure they have stuff in the back and they could have given me my stuff and everyone in the store knew I was pissed! Because the cashier girl stopped the useless manger Erica and told her something quietly and that's when she came to talk to me. FAIL! FAIL! FAIL! They suck! And to top it off she had the balls to open my food! One by one she opened my food! That's disgusting!! She shouldn't open my food like that or anyone's food! She should just believe the customer! I don't wanna eat the food when she's opening everything! That's nasty! I called corporate to complain and they said that they could only see d a message to the store to help me and I'm like what?? I just talked to them and they didn't help me at all! But whatever I still told the lady to put in the complaint and to send it off to as many people as possible so they know that this location and useless manager are horrible!! I NEVER write reviews on here but this one has me so mad I had to!! I hope that they see this and make a better policy for their stupid fails!!

Super sweet staff.They're super busy but still take the time to listen to the customers and be polite. One employee forgot my milkshake, I was done with my food and still, no milkshake but vanessa made it for me :) and was very nice about it. Noticed Kandis was really making the customers smile and laugh in the long line for the drive thru. Overall they have a pretty good team. The fact that they're so busy isnt there fault but they work with it.

They had great customer service, was greeted when I walked in and was helped out with my order, honestly this company has great service, it is a small restaurant, but it's like most buildings in the area, so it's not really in their control, but I would definitely come back to this location, keep up the good work. I'm going based on memory here but my cashiers name was Dez, she was wonderful. Keep it up Chick-Fil-A

Sooo sad. I wanted to try it for the first time. I heard a lot of good things. But the food was average and the service here at this location sucked. I specifically asked for sweeter because of my diabetes and they still gave me regular sugar. I asked for condiments and nope, nada. Sure they were nice when ordering but the service was not what I had expected.
SLOW. ASS . SERVICEFood ain't even cooked right half the time and they're always forgetting something

Food was not fresh and old. The chicken nuggets were very dry and tough. The fries were stale and not hot. The drive thru line was extremely slow. In comparison to all other Chick-fil-A's in the city, this location is terrible in both food quality and service.

Honestly, I'm  extremely disappointed with this location. I went to try it out around 10pm & my food was legit OLD asf. I tried to take a bite into my nuggets and I couldn't even bite it.  I was so hurt. And thennnnnnn my waffle fries were SO GROSS. I couldn't even finish my food. Complete WASTE. Smh I was also confused about the parking/drive thru situation...Poorly organized. I could keep going but at this point I feel bad for them. I'm truly curious to see what the future holds for this location because after tonight this shit needs to be shut down lmfao and try again somewhere else
I mean,  Chick-Fil-a is meh at worst, ok at best,  it 10 cars deep worth? Nah. If you wanna waste calories go somewhere else.

i wanted to love it... i really did. i was like finally something in this area that not McDonalds. I was visiting a friend at Cedars and decided to stop on my way back to OC... because hey it's chick-fil-a and why not. 1st of all what is w/the layout of this place? it is not parking friendly what so ever. it took 5mins to park and that was in a mostly empty lot. It's kind of strange because its has these secret back alley entrances. I was thinking am i here for nuggets or an illegal poker game.  once i got inside it was like organized chaos. idk if its because it's so new and everyone is still catching on, but the number of people waiting for help vs. the number of people working did not add up. no greeting. no body welcoming in the next guest in line. the young lady who took my order almost gave me a vibe that she was doing me a solid by taking my order. I stuck w/the number once since I am a creature of habit. I asked for it large size w/fries well done (yes it's a thing, and you can thank me later). I was charged, only to find out I did not receive the large size. rather then swipe again for the $.50 i decided to just rock the med drink and fries. the young ladies seemed put out that i asked her about the miscommunication. who knows maybe i did not say it loud enough the three times i mentioned... not like a crazy 3x like rain man... just repeating knowing that it probably wasnt not processing. my food was awful! fries were not well down, and my sandwich... i got the impression that there must have been a bag full of ready made sandwiches in a heat bag (don't tell my i'm crazy) because the bottom bun was moor like a bottom sponge then a bun. the chicken was soggy, the bun fell apart... and my heart broke as i attempted to merge onto the nightmare 10 freeway at 6pm on a Saturday night.  Send in the troop chick-fil-a its a beautiful store, and i'm sure the location will do well but i do not think i'll return until this location gets a little more stable... i guess it's back to mcdonalds.

I have been to CFA twice and both times and I had been treated friendly the workers were very attentive but today oh no. I went and the girl taking my order messed my order up and it's okay everyone gets confused no worries, so I go and tell a worker that they gave me my order wrong so they tell me they'll give me a new order and I go and let one of the workers I didn't want pickles on my order since the girl who originally was giving me my order wasn't paying attention and she comes to me and gives me such tremendous attitude saying "you can take it off" like I'm sure they could not put them in the burger. I don't mind doing it myself I just didn't appreciate the attitude i received it was unnecessary. Being nice doesn't cost so much, and if you don't have patience maybe not the job for you.. again I don't mind taking them off myself but the attitude I think needs to change clients don't appreciate it.
Food good but dumbass employees They told me to wait for Hashbrowns and they fucking forget cmon fam all I want is my damn Hasbrowns.

It's likely Chik-Fil-a's fault for establishing such a high standard for customer service and thus spoiling its customer base and I acknowledge that. Sat in drive thru for almost an hour waiting for breakfast only for me to get to the window for them to tell me breakfast is over. That wouldn't have been as bad, as the young lady in charge of changing the menu board over was unable to do so, which means I didn't know how to adequately pivot to a lunch option instead. I'm ordering lunch, staring at the breakfast menu. Now I know what you're thinking-- Ced why didn't you just get out of your car and go in? That's a valid question. There's a wall in front of the entrance on one of the drive through areas so you can't get to the entrance of the actual store. There's no signage to notify you of this either. Ultimately it feels like not only was the architect of this store slightly incompetent for the LA area it's in, it also feels like this store was opened too early to handle the traffic. No one was outside handling orders (which is the norm) and based on which entrance you use you can get to order quicker.This is the worst Chik-Fil-a I've been to thus far. Utter train wreck.

This is my third time coming to this location because i live down the street and I've been disappointed every single time. The first time i came which was a few days after they had just opened they messed up on my order and gave me the wrong sandwich so i had to call and speak to a manager. Second time i came i was in line for longer than thirty minutes, there was no one outside taking orders , people were trying to cut the line by coming into the parking lot from different entrances. Now here i am again at 7 in the morning and I've already been in line for twenty minutes and there's only two cars ahead of me. I don't understand why it always takes them such a long time to get their customers in and out. Chic fil la is known for having long lines but at least they move fast at other locations. This one needs to hire more help.

Out of all the times I've been here I had never had a encounter with an employee like I did today ( Friday the 13th ) Alanza was such a sweetheart, with such a lovely attitude and personality. Definitely can't wait to come back and get attended by her again....
So you can't get to the parking lot without going through the drive thru line. Which is ridiculous! I've been waiting in line for 10 mins just for me to park.

This chick fil a needs to get its s**t together. I've been here like 5 times since it's opened. The first four times they didn't get my order correct - not once - I kept paying for things that didn't end up in my order. This morning I showed up at 10:15 for breakfast, waited in the slowest line ever (it was only like 5 people long) but didn't get served until 10:40, at which point I was told breakfast was over. Wasted like 30 min of my life

Since this location actually carries the mac & cheese, I made my way over here across town during rush hour. CFA was on the opposite side of the street and I had a hunch the unmarked alley way would lead me to them...and it did. Workers were outside assisting and taking orders, and the first thing out of my mouth is if they had the mac & cheese. I was granted a yes, and was finally happy I was trying this new side. Only about 4 cars ahead of me, there was a really long line after me, so I arrived at just the right time. Cashier Deazhane was Super-friendly, something I am not used to at the Hollywood location. Beaming, she calls you by name and asks how you are, and although other places do this as default, you can't help but smile back and reply in kind. Service was top and as for the food, everything was packaged accordingly, and I ended up finishing this in my car on the trip back up La Cienega. This location is right at the 10 freeway so watch for traffic during the busy times (which is often). Happy to have tried the mac & cheese (small portion for $2.79) and would for sure consider this again. Both associates I dealt with were friendly, something the other locations should learn from. They're certainly doing something right here.

This is the worst chick fil a I have ever been to. Been in the drive thru line for 30 minutes now at 8:42 at night. I used to work at one back home in Arkansas and people would be waiting 10 min absolute maximum even when the line was out the door. Get it together management. Ridiculous.

I must say....the food the 1st week of opening was A-mazing. However, the food has now entered the dreaded rut. Putting food in food warmers. Fresh means freshly made not freshly made at the start of the morning in anticipation of rush hour. If this is the case; offer a choice. If you're in a hurry we have premade food. However, if you're taking time to walk-in you're not in the normal morning rush. The tater tots which were off the chain the first week are now oily and mushy. I'm done. Please change your structure and you'll be outstanding but allow yourself to fall into the food warmer and you will not succeed. If I hear from others that the food warmer situation has resolved; I'll be back.

I went in today after placing a mobile order. Once I was inside I clicked the "I'm here" button. Everyone was getting their order except me. Then I see the manager come with two bags he calls one name out then just leaves the other bag on top of the shelf for mobile orders. I'm still there waiting for my name to be called until someone who came after me got their order already I went to go check the name on the bag that was left on the shelf and it was mine. I didn't understand why that guy didn't even call my name out he just left it there! They didn't even have my drink. People ahead of me were complaining as well because their drinks were missing. What also bothered me was when i was the only one just standing there nobody bothered to ask if I was waiting for something even the manager after making eye contact with me.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE from the two girls taking orders outside , they had very bad attitudes and were very rude. However , Ariana working the window was absolutely amazing and had amazing customer service. I was going to give this place 1 star but she turned that around for me

This chick-fil-A when busy can be very confusing and tiring trying to find the drive thru line. Everybody was coming at diffeeent directions and I didn't know who was going to take my order. I finally get in line and wait for a minute and I'm directed by jean.
