Additionally, one of the drinks requested no ice. It was 3/4 ice. I would have taken pictures but, the whole impeding traffic thing kinda made me in a rush to get out of the street. I have NEVER had a poor experience at Chick Fil A before-- I honestly don't even know how to process this lol What is life when Chick Fil A gets it wrong???

Horrible experience, I'm from South Carolina where the employees know how to act and be respectful and attentive to customers. I've been here a few times and they never are here, today was just stupid. Wait in line, finally get to the register the girls on her phone for a good 10 seconds as I'm standing in front of her as a line formed behind me, she just looked up and said nothing I just told her my order and ignored the rudeness.  she was taking forever just to check me out and then got my order wrong when I asked for a large I got a medium instead she only charged me a large drink, I had to go to work and had no time to PAY for the thing I asked for in the first place to get. I will be calling the corporate office best believe that!
Always a great experience and food always tastes amazing, staff is always nice and professional. Dining area and bathrooms are clean
Best fast food ever created. Hands down. I could eat anything on the menu. The service is incredibly nice at any location you go to. Stand up business. I probably eat here once a week!!
Absolute trash, cashier didn't know how to do the rewards so now I'm scanned for a sandwich that I did not get, unbelievable.
It's refreshing to find a clean Chick-fil-A in downtown Chicago. The n state location is atrocious. Nice friendly staff.

Now I love chick fil a and we frequent their various locations multiple times.  This review is for a particular visit and the food products we received on that visit.  We recently ordered a chilled tray of chicken nuggets (64ct) from Chick-fil-A.  We got the Sweet & Spicy Sriracha sauce to go with it.  Not thinking twice to check the Best By date on the sauce we ate it and then continued to use the sauce a couple days later.  Because I mean what restaurant would give out an expired best by date sauce?  Today I was eating the sauce again and happened to notice the Best By date, "Best By 09/14/18".  Now I had to do a double take at the date and also remind myself again what the actual date was.  Today is 10/24/18, we purchased the tray of nuggets on 10/20/18.  Even then over 1 MONTH past the Best By date.  Thankfully no one got sick but just the thought of having consumed expired sauce just seems off.  Giving out expired sauces is not in good practice.

I would highly suggest ordering your food from their mobile app. You avoid the long lines and they will deliver it right to your table if you're dining in or you can stand by the mobile pickup orders counter if you're taking out. We waited around 10 minutes for our food, which is longer than normal, but the staff was very friendly and checked on us throughout our meal.

If you're not giving Chick Fil A 5 stars, you must not love good food!! So thankful that I live in a state that has CFAs everywhere! They have a great menu selection and even when you're not feeling chicken, their salads  and best part is there customer service!

Food is good.  The light skin heavy set girl at the front cashier October 4th at 940am, needs an attitude adjustment.  Your food is too high to have someone like that as your front cashier.  She's gonna catch the right one. Almost did today.

Here tonight on October 3 at 10:35 PM I'm sitting in the most disgusting restaurant I have ever sat in my entire life. Managers are standing behind the restaurant talking every table is in disarray. the floor is absolutely disgusting. There are like maybe six tables of people in here right now and this is a disgusting facility.

I liked my experience at chick-fil-a because it was clean and the workers were nice. And I really liked the food I got. My overall thought was that I would definitely go there again and I think a lot of people would agree with me.

This is the busiest chick fil a I've ever been to and with that said the staff was amazing ! After walking around before heading to rest we were hungry and ready for a quick dinner. Tons of places to eat in Chicago but we were tired and for the first time during my trip we just wanted some fast food. McDonald's is next door but come on it's chick fil a ! No comparison :-). The line was pretty long but the staff did a great job at keeping things moving. Despite the amount of people they were serving the cashiers were smiling and pleasant calling next in line and answering the many questions people tend to ask about the basic menu lol. Our food came out fast. You don't even take a number they just call your name for you to grab your order and then there were plenty of places to sit even with it being crowded. No sticky/dirty tables when looking for a spot so that's always a plus. Back home in Cali the two locations I go to if you order to eat in they bring it to your table and on the tables each table even has a small vase with REAL flowers. And then someone is usually walking around cleaning as people are coming and going and asking everyone if they need anything like more sauce. More like a restaurant I know I didn't realize how much they were going above and beyond until now. It was just different coming here but I mean it's fast food if you want a waitress/waiter you go to a restaurant :-). I don't think my spot in Cali could keep up with the foot traffic this place had though. Again, super duper kudos to the staff here you guys are great !
Awful.  Is this some kind of southern thing? Soggy and disgusting.  Lots of people standing in line, which moves slow to eat this garbage.  Oh well, I tried it, and it was awful.

This place is the only place to go for fast food. They have the correct model and just what Chicago needs! Thanks to the friendly staff. Special thanks to Beverly for being so nice and hospitable. I ordered the grilled chicken , so good!!

I have been a fan of @Chick-Fil-A since I learned about it while in Indianapolis about 10 years ago. So when they began to open here in Chicago I was ecstatic.I began frequenting this location. I mean I went so much that one of the early morning managers learned my order and was front and center when I came in. I mean this was everyday. Yesterday I went to this location because I was in the area and had been feigning for this location(I think its the best). But I was really saddened that they wouldn't take my money. I had made a purchase, sat and ate but I want more to take home to the kids. Yet I was told they don't take bills over twenty dollars. I had NEVER heard such a thing. But what more could I do, I left WITHOUT the sandwiches I wanted. Not sure if I'll return. As much as I hear ppl talk bad about @chick-fil-a    ..... I always say ... forget that, I'm going to get me some chick-fil-a ....and that ice cream . Please. I love that ice cream as much. Then I still go ALL the way down town Chicago to get some. I always tell or take ppl to try it .... I was just so turned around about the fact that they wouldn't service me because of the amount of money I had. Makes no sense to me.

Absolutely adore this restaurant. So clean, staff is uber courteous, and the food is delicious!Went with a Cobb salad this time and it did not disappoint.I am thrilled they have caffeine free diet coke as well as powerade on tap!
Food and friendly staff is on par with other locations. Lines are just atrocious with empty registers just laughing at your face while you wait in line.

I remember chick-fil-a back in austin, texas when the food was extra fresh and extra hot -- the food deserved the long lines wrapped around campus. Every time i come to this location my food is cold. Maybe those employees walking around in suits making sure everyone is having a great experience should be in the back keeping the food warm, so my mouth can have a good experience, too! Should have went to mcdonalds next door and i dont even like mcdonalds.

My review is strictly based off customer service and, consistency! Second time having Chick-fil-A in a while but first time coming to this location! I'm not really hyped about the food however, the service and the consistency of the employees are a A+.

Love Chick-fil-A but mostly this location since it's close to my school. They ALWAYS have great customer service and even if it's a long line you'll always get out of there in at least 10mins with your full food order, no mistakes lol. I always get the chicken club and waffle fries are AWESOME!! The Chick-fil-A sauce is def a must try, one of my favorites!

We stopped by here after doing some shopping on a Tuesday evening. Seating: Spacious. There's plenty of room for groups and is clean.Service: Quick. Our food was out in under 5 minutes after we ordered. We also asked for a bunch of sauces and the lady was really friendly and gave us everything we asked for. I appreciated that the condiments, napkins, etc. were well stocked.Food: My chicken was well cooked and hot. The fries were not as crispy as I like and not piping hot, but they weren't bad. My bf liked his sandwich though. This Chick-fil-A is great after shopping! It is quick and convenient. I'll be back next time I'm in the mood for some chicken.

Chicken delicious as usual but beware the older cashier with glasses. She is a sauce nazi. Stated 1 sauce per sandwich and 1 sauce per order of fries. Ridiculous! Ruined my experience. Too much fry not enough sauce #freethesauce

Good fresh food, clean dining area and great customer service! I've been coming here since 2013. I always order a spicy chicken sandwich with pepper jack cheese and bacon on a multigrain bun. I loooove pickles, but not on this sandwich. Waffle fries cooked a lil crispy. Add a couple chick-fil-a sauces and a few buffalo sauces for dipping. Soooooo yummy!Curbside service is great! Order ahead thru the app, which is super user friendly, and they will bring your order to your car or you can pick it up inside. Sooooo easy, fast and convenient!

Went here today 10/5/17 the food was great, unfortunately the service was not, Crystal (a trainee) was very rude and unprofessional. She didn't smile and made us feel as an inconvenience instead of a valued customer. Too bad, they used to have great service here.

Great breakfast when I stopped in a few days ago. Staff was friendly, place was clean and the food was good. The bagel, egg, cheese and chicken was a great filling breakfast that did it's job. One of the great examples of how a chain should be run.

This is a fancy Chick-Fi-La. I like the interior design of it. It has a very urban feeling to it.The retrieval system is kind of weird. It's not very clear if you're supposed to stand by the cashier or what. In other Chick-Fi-La restaurants they're kind enough to go by your table. This time, they were just like awkwardly calling people from the cashier, which I wasn't aware of.Anyway. Their sandwiches are great with sauce (my choice is mayo).

Woke up early during the week and stopped by for breakfast on my way to sight see, and the gentleman named SYDNEY was great from start to finish!! So full of energy and smiling the whole time, would definitely go back. The breakfast items were wonderful as well, the worst part was deciding what to get since it all looked good.
All around good Chick-fil-a. Not much of a review can be done because it is fast food. Location is ideal, directly off red line at Chicago.

I received a card in the mail for a free spicy chicken sandwich. I am not a fan of fast food but I heard good reviews about the food. I walked in and stood in line on a  Saturday afternoon (9/23/17). There were 2 cashiers. One was a young African-American woman. The other was a middle added woman with glasses (unknown racial origin). They were both attending to customers. When the older woman finished with the customer she looked at me and did not call me to the counter. She then looked at the other cashier until she finished with her customer. This took about 1 minute. The younger woman called me over and the older woman then called on the person behind me. I explained what happened to the younger cashier and she laughed and told me to ignore the older woman. Clearly something like this happened before.

I like this place than the other location on state st. People here are way nicer and have great customer service. Every time I come here and get breakfast the people who works here are so polite. They even try to clear ur table for you after u eat. I was sitting having sandwich then this lady came up to me and ask me if I would like some water. It don't matter if u work in a fast food place as long as you showing great service and kindly manner to people and you'll be recognized. Thanks for the making my day. Thank you Beverly! :)

Horrible,  won't ever eat here again. Ordered well done fries, received soggy fries. While I waited and waited for new ones the rest of my food got cold and my husband was finished eating.  Asked for my money back. This is the second time in a row that they have botched my order (first time was Skokie location). The sad thing is...no one even tried to rectify my situation. Was told "sorry" and sent me on my way. If I could give zero stars I would.

Good tasting, healthy food. Does get busy at lunch, but they move you along pretty quick. I ordered one of the chicken salads. Might be a little bland, but I'm very health conscious, so it's what I was looking for.

They kind of seem to maybe probably have the best fast food chicken sandwiches.I think i tried 2 of them on their menu from 2 visits here.I think their fries and desserts might be better than their actual sandwiches.I think their sandwiches are really bland tasting without condiments especially.

I may not participate next year cow appreciation day.  Every year, I will get a full entree if I ware a full cow costume.  This year, I only get a sandwich.  Bad down grade!!!!!!!!!. To make a matter worse, it ends at 7 pm. I was in the restaurant st 8:00 pm. It was over. So, next year you should call it " COW APPRECIATION HOURS." Repeat: after this year experience a down grade, I may NOT participate next Year event.Very disappointed

I have craved for some CFA for awhile.  I'm glad I satisfied my craving.   Next door to my temp work assignment.  Love the food, taste, value.  Clean place, nice staff, friendly too.   Nicely decorated.

The market salad is delicious and always tastes fresh!  I like the fact that the toppings such as nuts, granola, cheese, and dressing come on the side so that you can add as much or as little as you want.  The cookies and cream milkshake is also delish!  Very creamy and they make it fresh to order!  The oreo flavor is great.  Remodel of the building looks nice- very clean.

only make it downtown once every 6 months, but every trip is worth it. this time in particular: sandwich = fire. nugs = fire. beverly was a doll--cleared our tray and got us refills. thank you beverly :)
Anyone who hates on chic fil a has emotional issues. Chic fil a sauce for the win. Waaaaaffle fries!!

This Chick-fil-a is absolutely wonderful. Being from the South, I've been to my share of chick-fil-a's, and this one is the bees' knees.  The cashiers are so friendly, and I wouldn't even complain if they weren't friendly, since my goal here is to order food, not rate friendliness. If I get my food, you get 5 stars. What is worth noting here is the dine-in service.  While my companion and I were eating, the manager came around to the tables to ask how everything was. THEN, someone came around offering wet-naps (or wet towels). WTF. I was amazed. This is going above and beyond what you would expect from a quick-serve restaurant (I hesitate to call it "fast-food," since the quality and service are superior to McDonalds, Taco Bell, etc.) I NEVER thought that I would find a more friendly Chick-fil-a than in the South, but I did. I might not agree with the company's politics, but if you want fast and fresh, this is the place.

All I have to say is waffle fries Everything I ever tried from here was delicious but I usually get waffle fries and a strawberry shake as a snack (tell them not to make the shake so thick or u will not be able to drink it until it starts melting)
Meh, was not really impressed. After all the hype about this chain, the food actually tasted just like any other fast food joint. Won't be back.

Sam is amazing. We love her. Chick fil a is great, but sam makes it memorable. She always remembers us and is so pleasant even when it's crazy busy. I feel like I'm back home in Kentucky where hospitality matters- Chicago can be cold and detached, but Sam treats us like we're family.

Fast service in-spite of the long lines.  Large establishment with plenty of seating.  My issue is the absence of ketchup and sauces in the dining room.  You have to request them from the counter.  And they don't bring your order out to your table as is the case at most Chick-fil-As. The food is well prepared.  I simply wish I had access to the sauces.

Still waiting for my coupon. In short, Blackhawks promotion and I called to see if I had won.Got runaround, so I said then how about a coupon? They said OK. That was one month ago. Really? Great way to promote Chick-fil-A.

I'm a weird chick-fil-A fan. I like it a lot. Food wise, i'm speaking for only the nuggets with the cfA sauce. Thats what i get everytime. So I dont typically like to eat fast food, having lived in Chicago 15 years I actually have never ever had chick-fil-A till 2015, and went to the Chicago branch for the first time a few months ago. I dont know how old CFA is tho. but i dont think its a new chain.I didnt expect the establishment of CFA here to be really nice! it doesnt smell like fast food, its clean, the service is very friendly, fast, the nuggets were delicious and cheap. So i go there a lot since i discovered it. After i've done my shopping in the area,this is my stop. It feels good that i dont hav to go to any of the expensive restaurants downtown. I get a lil booth seat, eat my crispy nuggets w CFA sauce. Sometimes i get the waffle fries coz thats good too. Writing this review makes me want some. For real i wanted to throw my birthday here last yr, but my hubs decided to throw it somewhere 'nice' haha. Thats all for CFA.

Please read until the end, this needs to be seen. Racist Manager. This chick-fil-a location is great. I've been staying in Chicago all week, and have been there twice, once for lunch and once for breakfast. When I went, the facility was clear, modern, and comfortable. The staff were extremely friendly. They answered all of our questions (as were from Michigan and we only have been to Chick-fil-a once before) and we received our order very quickly. The food was fantastic, the employees were terrific, however the manager made me very uncomfortable. We went this morning for breakfast (Monday, January 2nd, 2017) around 10:30 in the morning. We ordered our food, quickly received it, and then sat down and began to eat. As we were eating, an African American man came in wearing beats head phones, and nice clothes, with a backpack, and began to walk around the restaurant looking for a seat to set down his things to go order. The (assumable) manager (White) went up to the man and began to forcefully ask him why he was in her restaurant, and said "asking people for money in our restaurant isn't allowed," the man looked astonished, he simply said he wasn't and proceeded to go up to the counter to order his food. As he walked up to the counter, the manager made a motion to an employee to keep an eye on the man. My father and I both saw the incident happen, and I was upset but I didn't say anything until the next incident happened. The employee was friendly to him. The man got his food and left the restaurant. Another African American man had come in when my father and I had just sat down to eat and he had left his phone and went outside to smoke a cigarette. When he came back in, the manager went up to him and in a really rude way, yelled at him saying that he can't do that. The man simply said I'm sorry, and went and took a seat. The manager also yelled at an employee who was working hard and cleaning tables after we were finished eating.At this point I was really astonished so I asked my dad if he saw that, and he said yes. I, personally don't think that the yelling was needed at all. I personally think the woman was being extremely racist towards the two men, because the first man was dressed in nice clothes, and had done nothing that made my father or I think of him as suspicious. For the second man I realize you shouldn't leave your things inside, but yelling isn't needed. I would eat here again, but I would definitely avoid the manager.
Terrible service it was slow and unorganized. Just realized after leaving I didn't get my other sandwich. Second time this happened. Never going there again. Awful.
after watching  the CUBS VICTORY PARADE, My husband  and I proceeded  to Chi fil A at State and Lake.Thequeue  was so long but worth  waiting sandwich  was so  delicious.

Food is always good to me and I've never had any issues with asking (or getting) condiments which seems to be an issue with most fast food franchises. I took one star away ONLY because it's fast food so the food isn't the healthiest per say, BUT it's "seems" fresh-like! Love this place if you're in the mood for good cheapish food and completely over the top customer service !

I can only give 4 stars because well, I don't really like chicken, but for chicken, it's pretty good.  I also LOVE their ice dream - think a vanilla frostee.  There is a long line but the staff is super friendly and efficient and the line moves quickly.  I like the classic chicken nuggets but tried the grilled ones today, for a pretty low calorie count they are tasty peppery bites of grilled chicken.  Not bad if you're watching your waistline.

First time here, to any establishment of this franchise ever. Very clean and great service. I love the layout of the place and the fact that the cashier and I had the same name The chicken cub salad was fresh and tasty.

For being so close to the grossest train line this place is surprisingly clean, moves fast , great service ( Corbin such a gentleman) and when I was done eating someone else asked to clean away the rubbish. Really nice people...I usually get spicy chicken sandwich, but this place had the actually put the heat on it!... yum loved it!

Chick fil a -- anything fried comes in peanut oil.. and it's amazing! Anything you order here is high quality for fast food. I randomly get cravings for chick-fil-a nuggets and could probably eat 20 at a time if I didn't have any self control. It is on the pricier end of fast food, but the service is very personalized (they call customers by name) and they will do anything to be loyal to customers. On my last visit, after a 13 hour shift I was tired, starving, and craving some yummy peanut oil nuggets. I ordered a 12 piece meal, but when I got home, realized they only gave me 8. It was fine, but in my hunger driven sadness, I wrote a customer review to them online just so they were aware (and I wouldn't have to be sad for it happening again). Not only did they respond to my email, the store manager called my personal number and offered me a free 12 piece meal that could be redeemed at any time and would never expire. The sincerity of her apologies made me feel bad.. it was just four nuggets! That just goes to show how great of customer service they have. This is why I love chick fil a!

Chick-fil-A formerly had offered a quality product ....however the size and tenderness of their chicken breast sandwich has changed...it seems to be 40 percent smaller and not juicy as it had been...I knew it wouldnt stay the same...
Love their strips and nuggets! Chick-fil-A is one of my favourite fast food restaurants. Staff are so nice. Food came out quick and quality solid. Lobby is clean, I come here almost half days a week.
The staff is happy, helpful and good!  I've never been unhappy with the food or the service!  A great place to eat whether with your family or for a fast lunch or dinner!  Breakfast is very good too.
The grilled chicken sandwich ...the filet was thin and tough, couldn't cut with a knife . Would not get again . Ask to grill fresh and not worth the wait or quality . Won't go back

I guess im supposed to give more three star reviews cause the yelp algo thinks im fake cause most places really are two stars. anyway this joynt is a solid 3 stars lately what with the new salads and what not. so there you have it. qed eom

Delicious food and fantastic customer service. Love the spicy chicken sandwich. It's tough to get good customer service in the city, but Chick-fil-A manages to do so and that's how they earn my business! The store is clean and employees and fellow patrons are polite, so it's a good all around dine-in experience. Keep it up!

Popped in for a cool down drink on a hot summer day- convenient and quick. Large area for seating and specious decorum. Got this lemonade item that was like lemon ice cream but so much better! It was like a milkshake with this not quite puckering sourness and then a creamy aftertaste! Tried to look for a title in the menu but could not find...

The food is on point, but they are bizarrely stingy with ketchup. This is one of the very few CFA locations where you are not allowed to take as many as you need.  Today, I ordered three complete meals, including fries. The food runner brought no ketchup, so I said, "Can we please have some ketchup for our fries." She returned with one (that's not a typo, only 1) container for all three of us. After a few seconds of silent, stunned disbelief, I asked, "Can we PLEASE have more than that?" She looked at me like I just shot her dog but eventually returned with...one more container...and literally threw it on the counter in front of me.  So now, after two requests and a bunch of surprising attitude, I have two ketchups for three meals.  smh

I found the place to be quite messy, but the food was decent. Its a fine place for a fast food, but I wouldn't ever recommend bringing your parents here, seems to be run by teenagers. But food wasn't bad.

I wanted to write an updated review on this location of Chick-fil-A because the service was outstanding! After placing my order, the lady at the counter offered to bring the food to my table. That was very kind as I was with my daughter in her stroller so that made things easy. Also, while we were eating our lunch, another worker was wiping the tables and I asked where I could get my lemonade refilled. She offered to refill my drink for me. I greatly appreciate this level of service, especially when fast food restaurants are not known for this. Unfortunately my complaint from last year still stands true. The handicapped accessible door doesn't work and needs to be fixed!

Chikfila is always a pleasant experience when the food tastes the same wherever you go! The only awkward part about my experience was the couple in the corner indulging in PDA. Luckily, the taste of my sandwich and warm oatmeal cookie was not altered; I still wonder why the manager decided to walk by passive aggressively as opposed to saying, "hey, get off her neck and eat your sandwich."
Pricey but good chicken sandwich!  Dip with the sauce makes it better!

Ok. So never been to one of these places until my visit in Chicago.  As far as "fast food" goes, this was a really great experience for several reasons. 1) The food was excellent in taste, freshness, and quality (I had the garden salad).2) The staff was very polite and moved with a sense of urgency in getting people their orders.3) The counterperson I spoke with apologized for not having a free cookie for my Yelp check-in, but she added my name to a wait list for my next visit. Unfortunately, I don't live in Chicago, so she was creative and substituted another memu item which I really appreciated. This is reflective of good training in making the customer happy.Overall, a great experience. My salad greens were fresh, berries and apples were crisp, and sliced chicken really tasty.

Another first on Leap Day! As you may know, I absolutely enjoy eating at Chick-fil-A for the food is much fresher and more delicious than other fast food chains. You gotta get the Chik-fila-A Waffle potato fries, Chik-fila-A Nuggets regular not grilled, and Spicy Chicken Deluxe Sandwich! I like the look of this location with spacious seating options. free Wi-Fi, and i enjoy the just baked chocolate chip cookie! Free refills behind the counter!

Usually I don't write too many reviews but today I was so happy with my experience that I had to. I ordered some grilled chicken nuggets with a chicken noodle soup. I was waiting for my food for not about 3 minutes and then the cashier informed me that the soup would be a 10 minute wait because they didn't have any ready. She asked if I wanted a different item or to wait and I told her I didn't mind waiting. She gave me a coupon that says my next meal is on them. This was so nice, and I really was not even upset about the wait at all. Then she told me to sit and asked if I wanted the grilled nuggets while I waited. I said yes and she also brought me over a chicken biscuit. The soup then came out like 5 minutes later so it was not an issue at all and everything tasted great as always :)
The staff and customer service here is always fantastic and this is the best location in Chicago in my opinion! Never had a bad experience here
Really enjoyed CFA. The fries are amazing. And the spicy chicken sandwich was quite tender. The lineup was huge and moved fast so don't sweat the lineup.Wish they would open this in Toronto.

There isn't anything great about this fast food restaurant in my opinion, if you love salty chicken sandwiches then this is the place for you. My wife tried their chicken nuggets in Atlanta's airport and she liked it; so we decided to try their chicken sandwich in their location in Chicago.     At first sight it looked delicious and everything looked fresh so I was happy. But the taste was so salty compared to their many competitors that I wondered what was all the hype about. Don't get me wrong their chicken was pretty good (Real Chicken Breast) but I couldn't really enjoy it because it was so salty. If they pay more attention to there customers salt intake and health then I think this fast food chain will be alot better. But that's just my opinion, so don't stop eating there on my account please.

This is my favorite Chick-Fil-A location in the nation, and believe me, I grew up in the South. I love how this particular location takes food quality to the next level with a consistency unparalleled anywhere. And this operator, Lauren Silich, is totally on-board with gay rights, etc. so I don't have any feeling of cognitive dissonance patronizing this location. Free wife, self-served fountain drinks, wifi, a perfect place to study and dine. Closes late--11pm. Fast service even with the line out the door.
I love Chick-fil-A, and I will never say no to eating here and getting the Asian Salad, or chicken nuggets, or fries, or an ice dream cone or, essentially, any other combination of items.

You know that saying the customer is always right? Well not here folks! Manager lacks any skills to address any issues or concerns with service/food. They're apparently a "special" franchise that doesn't abide by any standards, but rather create their own - just the response you'd expect from an incapable and unintelligent manager. Did I mention their was a hair in my food....yeah. Go to leghorn, a place with a real chicken sandwich. This place is subpar at best.

I don't know what they put in their food but it's good.  I don't eat much fast food so this is my  occasional treat.  One extra nice thing about this store is they have curb side service.  Install their app place your order and hit the 'I'm Here' tab and they will walk your order out to your car.  Great because parking around there is terrible.

As a former employee of the company in high school, I can tell you first hand that they treat their employees good, actually hand bread and prep their chicken in store (no premade filets here), actually hand squeeze their lemonade in store daily, make the best sweet tea in the business (southerns will appreciate), and are closed on Sunday's to allow their employees time with family. Their food is alittle bit more expensive than other fast food, but you are paying for that FRESH, fast food experience. Another huge difference you will see is that their employees are beyond friendly, and if they occasionally make a mistake, they go above and beyond to make it right. This is unheard of in most fast food.

First time here! Thanks to yelp I also got a free cookie. The spicy chicken sandwich was delicious. I was even more impressed by the decor and service. In my head it was always an average fast food chain but the over the top service and the endearing attitude of the employees made the place seem a lot more classy that it actually was. Spicy chicken sandwich. If I wasn't health conscious I would be getting it way too often.

This is a fantastic Chick-Fil-A location.The easy benefit is that there's a quick, affordable, decent alternative to the pricey, white linen tablecloth places in the neighborhood.  Honestly, I don't always have to have a per diem busting meal in Chicago.  Sometimes there's a need for a place like this Chick-Fil-A.A place with a great location, a clean dining room, and friendly service.  I've visited about a half dozen times since it's opened and have been pleased every visit.Despite a city alderman and mayor's efforts to block this business, it's been a great addition to the area.

I like Chick-fil-A.  Their food is good quality for fast food and I like their waffle cut fries.  If there's one knock on them I wish they'd be open on Sundays.  I came here only because my coworker wanted sauce that he asks that I buy whenever I visit the US and if I can get to a Chick-fil-A.  I went to eat on Monday here but they closed earlier than usual because it was Labor day so I missed out.
Absolutely delicious. My vegetarian freind are chicken for the first time and loved it! Very clean and very freundly employees.

I don't get it. Seriously, I just don't get it. The grilled chicken was passable and the fries as well. Other than that, what makes this place so desirable? Chicken instead of beef hamburgers, probably, no? It did not help things that the air-conditioning was nonexistence on a hot day. Noticed that this place did seem to attract quite a few Japanese, Chinese, Korean Eastern Pacific customers - just saying.

Chickfila is Chickfila. There isn't much to be said about this except that it is packed at every hour of the day except early mornings. I usually only ever make it for breakfast. What you can count on is a swift and easy transaction and fresh delicious food. But the wait can be too long for those who are on lunch breaks.
Always great food and employees are super friendly! Very clean inside and nice outdoor seating too.

Excellent service.  Friendly staff.Clean store.I have been in charge of making food orders for a summer camp that my work has been hosting. The camp has around 40 hungry children!! The catering department has helped tremendously in helping me pick out meals for the kids when we are on a tight budget. They have cheerfully been there through the process of ordering food for 50+ people, been attentive to detail, and I have really enjoyed working with them. The children really enjoyed the food as well. Great work, Chick-Fil-A!
Clean restaurant. Professional friendly staff. Quick serving times. Great tasting hot food. Delicious diet lemonade. Fair price for location. I would totally recommend this location.
I work at Bloomingdales Home nearby and couldn't be happier that they are so close!!! Love everything about the food and service here! Long live Chick fil A!

pretty sure this Chick-fil-A will go down in the books as the nicest Chick-fil-A I've ever been to.. oh em gee! classical music playing in the background = perfect getaway from the hustle & bustle of Chicago; sleek & modern interior = I thought this was a fast food restaurant?!?; friendly staff as expected; tasty food as desired; great location; not crowded (although it is a Monday morning); no play place for the kiddos (this is working to my advantage right now BUT I'm sure parents would rather have this)..Chick-fil-A, you've done it again. thank you for your tasty food + friendly service. cheers to you.

The spicy chicken sandwich is my fave! You have the option of adding waffle fries. They taste like your average fast food fries...nothing too crazy. However, the lemonade here is the bomb.com so I recommend that with any meal! Overall, this is one of the more pricier fast food restaurants but you can taste the quality in their chicken so it's worth it!P.s if you "check in" you can receive a free chocolate chip cookie!

we each had the chicken sandwich deluxe with Polynesian saucewith waffle potato fries.we also had  a peach milk shake and a chocolate milk shake.chicken sandwich is very fresh and not processed and with no fillers.very friendly cashiers.

Fast service and a really clean restaurant. Sometimes when I go to a new fast food restaurant I like to go straight to the bathroom to wash my hands and see the attention to detail that the managers put into having clean facilities, and this place has a very clean bathroom. I like the friendly atmosphere, not to mention that Chick-fil-A is my favorite fast food restaurant. Will come back when I am in the area again!

My favorite fast food place. I'm a chicken addict, so this is a given. Also, any place that serves waffle fries is a place I hold dearly to my heart.Pretty much anything on the menu is great. The sauces are unique and taste very authentic. Try the Chick-fil-A sauce at least once. I'm very saddened that they got rid of their chocolate chip cookie sundae. :(

When you get the fries, you HAVE to try the Chick-Fil-A sauce. They have offered it to me for over a year, and I never tried it until today. The guy forced it on me.It's AMAZING! I'll be eating that with my fries from this moment forward. The wrapper just says "Chick-Fil-A sauce."Feature request: please add APPLE PAY support for 5 stars!

This review is for their catering service - although I would give this Chick-Fil-A five stars anyway.  I've catered two events from this location and I'm beyond impressed.  It's super easy to order online, they'll call a day before to confirm everything, they arrive on time, they are SUPER friendly people and give you everything you need (silverware, all the dipping sauces).  The food is great - beyond the yummy fried chicken you can order healthy food as well - the mixed fruit is good (not just melon which is my pet peeve!), great sized salad for a large group, and the grilled wraps are a fave!Everyone at our parties are surprised that a) they have catering and b) they deliver (we live in Wrigleyville) so wanted to spread the word!

Excellent location and great fast food. I love biscuits so definitely appreciate restaurants that have  an abundance of options with biscuits on the menu. I personally believe it is an underappreciated dish on the American restaurant scene. Turning back to Chick fil A, the food is all around great and seems much fresher than say McDs. This location is also so clean, like spotless clean.Also, during lent, they serve fish sandwich which is always appreciated by me as I am a lover of the fiillet o fish at McDs.Only negative would be the doors are hard to get in with a stroller.

This place is always crowded, especially on Saturday, so finding a place to sit isn't always possible. As seems to be the standard with all Chick-fil-A locations, service is fast and super friendly. And the food is always hot and fresh. As a bonus, the lemonade was green for St. Patrick's Day.

Love Chick-fil-a and so glad they are finally here in the city. This location has never disappointed. Even when it is super busy it still looks presentable. Staff is always nice and helpful.Food never disappoints. Five stars for you!

Fast service for food that was not fully cooked. Manager was in cafe and asked how food was but didn't even stop to listen to my response (mid-bite). When I pulled him aside he offered to replace it but by then I didn't have time to wait and was grossed out.
V delicious chicken nuggets. Good place to go! Service is fast even though a long line waiting for orders! Moderate price for a meal! Unhealthy but tasty! Lol

I order my iced coffee from here most mornings and the staff all seem to remember my name AND my coffee preferences! Great environment. It's always super clean and the staff are so friendly. Doesn't feel like a fast food place to me. Also love their breakfast items!

Despite their politics I'm obsessed with the Chicken Sandwich. And all that happened before they even got to Chicago. My first taste was in St. Louis. A friend who was got addicted way before me raved and raved till I was annoyed. I disliked most chicken things not fired and hated chicken sandwiches. So I went to Culver's next door alto where she got her fix. Upon meeting back up she almost begged/forced me to take a bite. God I love that girl. Ever since I've been a convert. Now all it takes to make me happy is a large order of nuggets, two hand full of their classic yellow Chick-fil-A sauce and a couples orders of the Spicy Chicken Sandwich no pickle. Also for some reason I sometimes savor the bun and chicken separately. !-)

I always enjoy a good reliable meal from Chick fil a. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to make sure you are satisfied.  I really enjoy a grilled chicken club with waffle fries.  The cookies are baked fresh and are delicious.

This place is the best! I appreciate how they give the calorie count next to every item on the menu. If you've never been here before... I'd recommend:1) Chik-Fila Spicy (or regular) Chicken Sandwich Deluxe2) Waffle Fries3) Signature Lemonade4) Chik-Fila sauceFew things to note:- They cater to businesses - Place gets SUPER busy during normal meal times. If you place an order through their app, you can skip the line when you arrive and go to the front to pick up!- Closed on Sundays (booo!)

We use to go to Chick-Fil-A when we visited North Carolina. We looked forward to it like we would a big event and eating their excellent fried chicken sandwiches and waffle cut fries. Now that Chick-Fil-A has opened only a short drive from my house here in Chick-A-Go it took us over a year to make it there to eat. The food is just as good and the place is well run and service is very friendly but there is something to be said for keeping places regional, it kind of makes it more fun.The above being said if you are craving a chicken sandwich this is the place to get it, crispy and tasty. After some extensive personal research I have to say Chick-Fil-A is better then any of those over priced chicken places popping up in all the"hipster" neighborhoods. Chick-Fil-A doesn't have to smoke it, sous vide it and triple 4 day marinade it to make it taste great, plus they don't charge you $12 for just a leg and a thigh. Waffle fries are my fav and they're good here but not always as crispy as I like, still tasty though. Everything taste better dipped in one of the many sauces they offer and don't be shy asking for a selection, they're happy to dish them out. Polynesia, ranch and buffalo are my fav but if you like smokey try the Chick-Fil-A sauce.It was not busy the day we went, which happened to be New Years day, correct we had no resolution to remove fried food from the diet. They do offer some order a head no wait mobile thing if you suspect there might be a line. Great chicken sandwich and fires if you want to feel hip get a tattoo of a chicken and a $$$ with the cash you saved.

Overall, I've had consistently good experiences with Chic-fil-A.Pros:- They have an app that also has an option for curbside service. (Place your order on app, drive up to store, employee brings your food to your car). My sister loves this app.- They do such a great job of creating tender chicken pieces. Every Time. Their chicken is so good even my picky nephew will clean his plate.- SO many sauces!!! All tasty!!! For free!! Do not forget about their plethora of sauces!!- Very friendly service. Probably the best service you'll ever get at a fast-food joint.- You can choose pickles or no pickles! Love that.- They have both grilled and fried chicken, spicy and non-spicy options. Cons:- Sometimes I feel like their food could use a little more... something...? I don't know what it is. Maybe I'm not ordering the right chicken sandwich. I know that it's fast-food. I know. But the lettuce is always so flat. I often feel like I'm just eating a bun and a piece of chicken, no matter how many other things I have them put on it. I would rather take home the bare chicken sandwich and add my own lettuce, pickles, tomatoes, and more. When i do that, it's delicious. When I don't, it's a $4 bun with chicken.- Today we went and our order placed on the mobile app didn't go through, so we ended up waiting at least 15 minutes for our food because we had to re-order everything. That was not normal, but it was not fun.I always go to Chic-fil-A wanting to love it, especially because many of my friends and family are big fans. And I will say, their chicken is really really good. But I sometimes feel like I walk away feeling a little disappointed. I will still keep coming back - I want that free cookie! But... we'll see what happens next.PS: Street parking here is not all that plentiful depending on the time of day you go...
I received a soggy old chicken sandwich and the fries where cold. I don't think I'll be going here again.

Went here yesterday for the first time.  Tried the char grilled nuggets.  They were so moist and tender.  Tried the chicken strips with breading.  OMG soooo good.  My friend had the breaded chicken sandwich which he said was really delicious.  Can't wait to go back.

This is the nicest Chick-fil-A! The decor is very clean and modern, and it's a rather large restaurant. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free cookie. Score!!~ Thanks, Yelp!What else can I really say about Chick-fil-A? I mean, the chicken sandwiches are legit, and I love that they're not sheisty with the sauces. Pick your favorite sauces and go crazy!!!

This is a great Chicfila right by the train station! My husband and I ate here both to and from the airport for breakfast. The staff is super friendly and they have incredibly fast service. You also can't beat the free cookie with a check in :)

I went here with my husband and I order the chicken nuggets with fries and a drink. I didn't like the chicken nuggets at all cuz it was to small and you don't even have much chicken meat on them. The fries were alright. My husband order the chicken sandwich and he said it was alright. My husband and I will  not go back here for the food since it's not good to the both of us.

Chick-fil-A has been on my "Try List" for a quite awhile.  I finally had the opportunity to check out this restaurant for a late lunch.I had walked into the restaurant about 3:15pm and there was a line of seven (7) people waiting to order with one (1) cashier.  While I was standing in line, I was able to review the overhead menu.  Eventually, Lauren, Manager, opened another register.  I was finally able to place my order with Lauren.   She couldn't complete my order fast enough (with a little attitude).  I was instructed to step aside and when my order was completed, I would be called.  The line had continued to go longer with younger patrons kept coming in and  standing in line.  My name was called within an appropriate amount of time.  The dining area is large and have various tables available from counters to the communal tables.  The area is very bright with windows facing the street and that can be very interesting......I had the Chicken Sandwich Value Meal which included the waffle fries and a drink.  With the value meal, you have various options for a side, which is a nice option.  The meal itself was okay.  The chicken tasted what KFC's chicken used to taste like.  The fries were luke warm.  The ketchup packets, that you really need to beg for, are unable to be opened.I would consider trying this place again.  Hopefully, with better service and warm food.

I mean, it's chick fil A; I'm not sure you can get better chicken oriented fast food. Not to mention, this chick fil a is very nice. Plenty of seating, outdoor seating in the summer and this location is right downtown so you can get some of the best fastfood and some of the best shopping! Plus if you check in on yelp, you get a free cookie!! This was on 10/20/14.

I wish they could get their catering/ordering team mobilized to act when items are placed for delivery. Fantastic restaurant... I wish it could be five... They need a great catering team. If no one is going to call back, "the same day," then don't offer it.
Can't make a salad without cheese two hours before you close? Yeah, I understand you want to go home at 11 but this is bad customer service.

Eh. . .this place is okay.  Fast food chicken is not what it used to be back in the day.  Chick-fil-A attempts to make an effort to serve up good meals, and I can appreciate them for the effort.  The food is okay if people are out in the street and have a taste for chicken.  However, the food is not spectacular to me, and it's a little pricey for what is served up to patrons.
Been here.  Have two gift cards good for one sammie each.  Love pickles and mayo.

Chick-Fil-A has only one problem. They aren't open on Sundays. This location doesn't have all the sauces out but as soon as I took my first bite in months, nothing mattered. All that existed was the chicken and me. We're married, we had children, and they were all delicious

Chick -Fil -A is good almost in every location we have had our delicious Chick-Fil-A meals. I was glad to see there is an attendant that keeps the restrooms clean because it was kinda gross when I walked in there the first time I used the facilities. The employees are nice. When you check in on Yelp app you can earn yourself a Free Cookie which is always a bonus when you're eating late at night and want something to fill your tummy and get dessert too is very nice.My favorite eats at Chick-Fil-A is always the 12 pieces chicken nuggets with honey mustard it's simple and delicious. If I am up for it some times I order their ice-cream which is soft served but tonight it was just the nuggets and a free cookie a good meal and it filled me up.

If you've been to Chick-fil-A, then this experience is not that different. It's in the city, in a busy area. Funny thing is that it's next to a Red Robin and a McDonalds. Just walk down the line. The world is your oyster.Service at this location is exceptional just like other locations I've been to. There isn't too much waiting in line, and food comes out relatively fast. (Surprise, surprise, it's FAST FOOD.) There is plenty of seating, and it's clean throughout. You can't take this kind of thing for granted in the city!If you can't make up your mind about the bevy of choices in the city, this is safe, and they don't charge you more than they normally do just because it's in an urban location unlike other chains.Pro tip: check in using your Yelp app, and get a free cookie! It's hot! (disclaimer: This is probably a limited time offer.)

This is an excellent Chick-Fil-A.  It's big, fancy, clean, and the product is as promised.  After suffering from an underwhelming breakfast at the State and Lake location, I was hoping to have a more satisfying experience at this location.  They definitely delivered and moreover, there was a check-in offer for a free chocolate chip cookie (SCORE!).  The biscuit was good and buttery (as usual) and the chicken was nicely breaded which is HUGE because I find that the breading varies from location to location.  They were clearly making everything fresh which makes a great product just taste even better.  Also of note: they have additional products such as a breakfast platter with eggs and they sell the sauces by the tub.  I wish that I could have taken home a tub of chick-fil-a sauce...alas I was only taking a carry-on :(

Been a big fan of Chil-fil-a since I first had it in Orlando. I normally don't stray far from the "nuggets". Real white meat breast chicken with their Chik-Fil-A sauce and waffle fries will put a smile on anyones face.

Yeah, it's a chain, but it has to be one of the best, if not THE best chain out there, especially in Chicago. The only real criticism that appears to be put up by people is the CEO's views on gay marriage, but really people, if you don't like it, DON'T EAT THERE. The place does NOT discriminate against gays, lesbians, trans, whatever, that's just the CEO's views. If you don't like it, don't eat there, it's as simple as that. Getting that out of the way, the food is the best. Best chicken sandwich in Chicago by far. If you like spicy things, get the spicy chicken sandwich deluxe. Delicious, filling, and flavorful. If you have lots of money to spend and are craving a Chicken sandwich in downtown, you NEED to go here. It gets crowded, but the staff is VERY quick and genuine to the customers. Lines out the door are almost an everyday thing.

As good as it gets- I have been to both Chicago locations State St and Chicago Ave- food is the same where ever you find Chick-fil-A..the thing that stands out at both Chicago spots is the service.  Despite long lines at times, they are very efficient.fast service, great food.I just recently  tried the  Chick-fil-A  sauce which is a honey mustard & BBQ sauce! I liked it a lot.
I am going to upgrade Chick-fil-A to 4 stars for not using MSG in their grilled chicken sandwiches. MSG is just one of those ingredients that messes me up.

I shamelessly love Chick-fil-A!  We don't have one close to home so if I see one when I'm traveling, I must stop by for some chicken nuggets, waffle fries and sweet tea, thank you very much!  This one was close to my hotel so my colleague and I happily ate here, and service was really nice and friendly.Hey, Chick-fil-A, won't you please open one of your places near downtown San Francisco!  I will be your # 1 customer!  :)

The food here is okay. I like the waffle fries with the Chickfila sauce, but even after eating that I still feel nauseated afterwards. The shakes used to be a lot better, but they don't even use real Oreos anymore. I don't like the fact that everything is fried, and the only time that I tried the chicken salad sandwich I had to return it because it was so bad. The breakfast burrito with the spicy chicken is good, but I feel like it isn't ever consistent. Sometimes it will be full and very good, other times it will be completely empty.

Lines are long but go really fast. This location is spacious, clean and friendly. I checked in only to find that I get a free chocolate chip cookie (saved it for my guy.) I wanted to try the new grilled chicken sandwich. I am extremely happy that I did. Not many places would make me wanna do a couple of cartwheels for this type of sandwich, but move over, here I come. The piece of chicken tasted fresh and was bigger than the soft tasty wheat bread. Just my luck i didnt get a soggy piece of lettuce that other places offer. Don't get me started on the delicious lemonade. Freshed squeezed as I like it.

Gross, processed fast food. Long lines, insincere staff, tourist haven. There are lots of reasons to avoid Chick-Fil-A at all costs. I miss the deli that used to be in this location, it served a wide variety of healthy sandwiches. But now it simply houses a culturally-foreign chicken fast-food chain. UGH. Please, Chick-Fil-A, stay in the south.
Staff is friendly, although it seems at times a bit fake. I guess I'll take fake nice over rude. Chicken sandwiches are barely average and the prices are on the high end.  The fries are pretty good.

the people here are so friendly, kind and such sweethearts!love the foodfood is always nice warm/hotand the waffle fries can never go wrong!love them well doneand dipped with that amazing chick fil a saucethe perfect combination of honey mustard & barbeque sauce!

Anyone who has been to Chick-fil-A knows about their service.  The location on Chicago isn't any different.  Always a very friendly staff and accommodating.  Always pretty clean and on warm days eating outside is an extra bonus.It's Chick-fil-A so the food is basically the same everywhere you visit.  So if you are a Chick-fil-A fan, its a 5 star location for you. I, personally, have a hard time giving fast food franchises 5 stars because for the most part, its the same everywhere.

SPECIAL DELIVERYI had always wondered what was so special about this chicken sandwich. Then one day, I was sitting in my car, when an employee offered me a chicken sandwich. What? In fact, I was several blocks away from this actual location. He tapped on my window and at first I thought this chick-fil-a dude is lost. I was really surprised when he handed me a chicken sandwich. First I was impressed that the sandwich was still hot. Those professional warming bags and sandwich wrap are efficient. What the employee was really promoting was the new app for ordering. The coolest feature I saw was that I could order from the app and do curbside delivery. That comes in handy in downtown Chicago with limited free parking options. It's like having a drive thru without really having one. The chicken breast was really tasty. Each one is hand battered and never frozen and you can taste the freshness. I was not a fan of the bun which I tossed. It seemed like one of those cheap "Jewel brand" hamburger buns but the chicken breast was delicious. Would I come here? I'm not sure because I really avoid corporate franchise fast food. Was I happy to taste the chicken? Yes  I was really impressed with the mobile app they were pushing. Technology can really drive a business and having an app where you can order, pay & choose a delivery/pickup option is really advanced. So it was smart for them to hit the pavement and promote the business. Hey I'm bragging about it now, so it worked marketing department. I just wish more people knocked on my car window offering me free food.

Love this place. I'm from the south and I am glad this restaurant has moved to Chicago.  The chicken is delicious and there are several healthy options. Heralds, churches, and KFC have nothing on this place :-)
if we have to eat fast food, its our go to place. The food is of higher standards than the average places enticing kids with their toys. Their chicken nuggets are the very best in Chicago.

I LOVE chick fil a. This place is great. The lines can get long but they move quick. The staff is also always very friendly and polite, something you don't normally see in fast food restaurants throughout chicago.

Best tasting chicken ever! My first experience was in Mississippi with them. It is more of a southern thing anyways. But oh boy! That chicken was awesome. I would pick chick fil-A over any other fast food any day.  Also there cookies were the best cookies you can find at a fast food place. GO chick fil-A!!!
I love Chick-A-Fillet. This upscale restaurant has the best customer service I have ever seen. I'm confident they hired friendly employees from California.  Please go here

There is a line but they have multiple registers going that make for a short wait.Spicy chicken sandwich with polynesian sauce is as good as it will ever get.*Also check in to Yelp for a free cookie deal offer!

This stuff is good. I mean, good.  Legit "fast food" that doesnt feel, look, or taste like it.  There is a reason these places are everywhere, this stuff is tasty.  This particular Chic-fil-A is set up really nice, like could bring a date there (if shes cool)...

Man I love Chick fil A! Its unlike any fast food place out there. The chicken is excellent quality white meat with so much juice and flavor! The barbeque sauce is outstanding, a very sweet sauce. Love the waffle fries, always a fav. The inside is always clean and pristine with a staff that is eager to meet your needs, always reminding you that it is their pleasure to serve. If you havent been here yet you are missing out!

This place is awesome.  It doesn't feel like your typical fast food restaurant.  I did some shopping on Michigan Ave and stopped in for lunch.  The manager delivered my food to my table and they were so friendly.  The dining room attendant made a point to talk to everyone and was sincere.  They also gave out a free sample of their chocolate milk shake which I will definitely get again when I get a craving.
I'm so happy Chicago has one...it makes me miss my hometown...Memphis,10.

I have been to this location many times as it is on my way to work. This morning I tried the chicken breakfast burrito. I enjoyed it, but I had to add some hot sauce to make it a little bit more spicy I would definitely go back and get one during another morning.

This is definitely an above-average fast-food place, but also comes with some above-average fast-food prices.  The good definitely outweighs the price though.FIrst, they have the Chick-Fil-A cow that makes appearances.  Any place that has a person walking around in costume automatically gains points in my book.Second, they have large portions.  I ordered their soup with salad meal, and it was one of the biggest soup/salad combos I've gotten.  A nice big bowl of soup and a decent portion of side salad.Third, their salad is really, really good.  One of my friends, who ordered a regular salad, literally took the words out of my mouth when she said it was the best fast-food salad she had ever eaten.  It seriously is the best "fast-food" salad I have ever eaten in my entire life too.  Lettuce was fresh, the zesty apple cider vinaigrette dressing was perfect, and it even came with charred tomato crispy red peppers as a topping.  And this was their side salad!  The Chicken Tortilla soup is also pretty good.  I know most people will probably come here for the Chicken sandwiches or their Chicken tenders, but don't be afraid to venture to the outskirts of the menu with soup or the salad, you won't regret it!

We stopped here for the Christmas light parade on Michigan Ave.  It was a zoo.  They had two friendly people working the door that helped you find a seat.  They all hands on deck at the registers, so there was basically no line.  When we sat down with our food they had someone walking around asking if we needed any extra sauce, napkins, etc.  this is a fast food restaurant... awesome service. Not to mention the food is some of the best fast food you can buy. So, manager and folks at Chick Fil A downtown Chicago... awesome job.

Overall opinion; If you are only going to do one thing, do it well. Chick-Fil-A provides quality chicken sandwiches.     The business is a private company, so lets just pull the wool over our ears and ignore the somewhat recent controversy with marriage laws. This is a review on the restaurant, not the parent companies beliefs or business practices.This was my first time ever eating at a chick fil a. I have heard they had delicious food, and after working a long shift at the Signature Lounge walking towards the Red line I noticed they were still open. Even though I eager to head home, My lizard brain stopped me in my tracks and made me look into the restaurant. For a being so late at night, the place was still moderately busy.  So I figured "why not?" and stopped in. I was surprised to see such a small menu at first. There isn't  any options that other  chicken strips, nuggets, or sandwhiches on the dinner menu. The breakfast menu looks incredibly sexy and I would love to come in again and try it sometime. But that's a different review for a different day. I ordered the Spicy Chicken deluxe meal with a strawberry shake instead of a soda.  My first intial opinon was that all ingrediants were bright, and looked fresh. It was a smaller sandwhich but it definitely looked much more appealing than the same sandwhiches you could order at another fast food joint.First bite...Wow. Just wow. it was an interesting experience, because its just a fast food sándwich, but my brain was caught off guard by how SOFT the entire bite was. It was delicious, and all of the flavors blended together well. The pressure cooked chicken titty was succulent and did not dissapoint. I didn't think it was very spicy either, which was fine. But that sandwich was a smooth as silk going down, and very fun to eat. The Fries left me hanging a little bit. They were definitely fresh, and salted right, but it wasn't what I wanted from a french fry. Is it weird to call a french fry boring? Because it left more to be desired. Kind of like that one friend that you try to get to participate in group activities, and then regret it once you realize that you were better off without him. Also, the staff was very polite and seemed to still have a little bit of their souls intact even though they worked at a chicken joint. I was eating alone and noticed them walk through the lobby at least twice the 20 minutes I was there. Pros:Clean, everything was so very cleanDa ChikkenThe owners cheesy smiles on the placard by the soda machine.Cons:I was still hungry after eating a $9 dollar meal (however I am a big guy, your results may vary) Mcdonalds Fries  still reigns supreme. But the waffle fries were definitely fresh when I ordered them. My honest opinion, the place is a guilty pleasure. If someone shouted the word "CHICKEN!" and you had to write down the first 3 places that came to mind immediately, Chick-Fil-A wouldnt make the list. But if you were sitting around with friends and got to talking about it, you would definitely want to eat that over anywhere else.

It's hard to rate fast food joints against nice sit down restaurants. This place would be a 4 or 5 in the fast food joint world. It's clean and the servers are very very nice. The restaurant is spacious with plenty of seating.I came for food which ended up being dinner after walking down the Magnificent Mile on my first day in Chicago. I've never had Chick-fil-A before and I had trouble pronouncing the name. I kept wanting to say "chick-fil-uh." Anyway, I had the original chicken with waffle cut fries, Polynesian dipping sauce, and an unsweetened ice tea.The chicken was pretty good. The waffle fries were the bomb though! Omg. They were slightly crispy and I couldn't stop eating them. The sauce was tasty too until I saw the ingredients but even then I was still eating it.And as I was eating, every couple minutes the guy who was cleaning came around to sweep. That's how clean this place is! I didn't mind the frequency, it just meant he was doing his job and making sure the restaurant was spic and span.I would definitely come back if I wanted to get something to eat in a jiffy.
Yeah, chicken! Super busy during lunchtime during the week, but the line moves quickly. Hard to find a place to sit though. Decent fast food place in river north!

This chicken is great... but lets talk about the employees.  They are amazing!  It is like they tele warped people from Truman Show straight to downtown Chicago!  Everyone smiles, they are so polite, they clean and are productive, they seriously brightened up my day!  My husband even commented that they had the best, happiest, friendliest staff he had ever seen!!  I kind of felt like I was in the twilight zone because you don't get that often in Chicago but I will take it- and return!!!!
Great experience for a fast food restaurant. The staff is friendly, efficient, and everything looks clean. Polynesian sauce is great, but so is the honey mustard!!

This location provides a vibrant and friendly atmosphere. The service is quick and the food is fresh. The chicken sandwiches, salads, etc. are all very, very good but the chicken minis for breakfast are absolutely delicious! I only wish they served them all day.

After all the hoopla about how terrific this sandwich was, I hadda chime in.Here's my personal opinion and quite frankly over tested (I eat a take out chicken sandwich 3 times a week usually) ranking for the best fried/breaded chicken Sammie in the area.   I drove 25 minutes to get this for the boys and I and I gotta say, kfc's original recipe chicken still wins every time.    Steak and shake has a surprisingly competitive sandwich, giving the famous wendy's spicy chicken a run for it's money, but both are better hands down than this chick fil specialty.   I wanted this sandwich to work for me, despite the drive, but all the same gonna give it a 3
As always, you get the friendly customer service that you would expect at Chick Fil A.  For those who prefer no breading, they have grilled chicken nuggets!

I love this place, I wish we had it in Canada.When we found that Google Maps said the restaurant was open until 11:00 p.m. I was sure that it was wrong, but this was a stand alone restaurant, and the hours on the door confirmed they were open until 11:00I had what I always have, the classic sandwich, it was amazing, they really know how to make chicken here.Staff were quick and friendly, the restaurant looked very clean. I will certainly be back next time I am in Chicago.

I've been a loyal customer to this location for over 6 months now. I've always had great food and a pleasurable experience dining in.In the past 6 weeks I've noticed the quality of the chicken seems below average and tonight was horrible!The chicken was over cooked and dry, portions on tenders were smaller than usual and the restaurant itself was filthy! Garbage cans were overflowing, flies were present at my table within minutes of opening  our food. Worst of all my 5 year old son slipped and fell in a puddle of urine in the men's washroom. The whole left side of his body was wet and smelled of urine. Disgusting!I sent my food back the minute I took a look at it .I was told all the tenders they had were from the same batch. That whole batch should have been thrown out! Very disappointed. It will take me sometime to get over this experience. Not sure if I'll return

Stopped in herer after going to check out To Master the Art (which you should do yourself a favor and go see) at the Broadway Playhouse.Never tried it before and a lot of people hype it so I wanted to see what these chicken sandwiches were all about.The waitress was SUPER friendly and SUPER enthusiastic about the food here and it was infectious and I got sooooo excited to eat this spicy chicken sandwich I ordered.That's where this story ends.It wasn't all that.....I could have had the same experience with Wendy's Spicy Chicken sandwich. Chik Fil A dipping sauce was good though. Tasted like a mix of Honey Mustard and BBQ Sauce.You get this gooey warm chocolate chunk cookie if you check in on Yelp. Do it. That cookie was LIKE THAT!

Karl was super helpful at the register. I was a Chick Fil A virgin before yesterday - I got the yummy homemade lemonade - it was GREAT ! they even have a diet version which i did not try tho.I got the Spicy Chicken sandwhich #3 - which is simply the chicken, 2 pickle chips, and the bread. It kind of gave me an upset stomach.... i dont think it was fried - but definitely breaded and baked? couldn't really tell by looking at it.The Waffle fries were UNREAL ! Im not rushing back or driving 4 hours to come again, but hey - im just not a fast food chick. Glad i got to try it tho.CURB SIDE PICK UP IS AVAILABLE AT THIS LOCATION - which is super cool!!

Stopped here between hopping the L-train. Hadn't ever been to one of these before. The food was AMAZING! The chicken is so moist and juicy. The downside is that now I will want this standard of meat when eating at other fast-food places, and they won't live up to it. I will be going back.

For fast food, Chick-fil-A has good service and the food tastes fresh.  The people who work here say 'my pleasure" when you say "thank you".  It's refreshing to see employees who work in the fast food service industry and enjoy their jobs, or at least appear to.  I usually just do the grilled chicken sandwich, a healthy alternative to the fried one, so I can enjoy those delicious waffle fries.

I had a good day today.Part one:I had a dream that I was Thelma in "Thelma and Louise"....but skipping the early part of the story, where she leaves her douchey husband a note in the microwave and then things get ugly with the guy at the country-western line dance-o-rama. The dream went right to Brad Pitt and driving around with my best gal pal, blowing up the trucks of a-holes who don't know how to apologize. FUN. FUN. FUN.Part two:I tried Chick-fil-A for the first time. I'd always heard positive reviews, but I never had it. Of course Chick-fil-A came to my college after I left (if only I'd been on the 9 year plan...). While it's been in my general neighborhood for awhile...I just never made it there for one reason or another. But, all the stars were in alignment today.I had the original sandwich with waffle fries. In terms of fast food chicken sandwiches, Chick-fil-A's rules. RULES, I say. And the waffle fries have probably ruined other fast food fries for me. They have set the standard for "fresh", that's for certain. I am not sure when I will make it to Chick-fil-A again, but I'm already torn between getting the same sandwich, and trying something else. I hear the nuggets are something to behold.And here's another thing...every employee I saw there looked like they could work someplace else. I'm not used to that in fast food places. Everyone was so pleasant...and so...hygienic...and so...employable.... I'm glad Chick-fil-A is close to home, but not too close....if it was any closer, I'd eat there way too often, and, like Thelma's douchey husband, you'd be able to park a car in the shadow of my a$$. We can't have that.
I love everything about Chic-fil-a! Great service and great, quality food. I love the chicken nuggets or the chicken strip salad with fried and their freshly squeezed lemonade!
Second only to Taco Bell in my fast food filled heart. Spicy chicken sandwich deluxe ftw
Delicious, fast, and cheap.  Juicy chicken, crunch fries, good service.

Everything about this place is amazing, the sandwich, the fries, the sauces, the customer service, etc.... I think the food speaks it for itself, so I'm not gonna bother writing how good it is. Even though they don't put anything in the sandwich but chicken and pickles... the taste is still amazing (after i put my sauces in, of course!). I just love their huge variety in sauces as well - love the Chick-Fil-A sauce! Lastly... they have the best customer service... ALWAYS! Everyone's always happy and helpful, which is probably one of the reasons why I love this place more than any other fast food chain!

Chick-Fil-A has delicious chicken sandwiches made with real meat!! It's a different kind of fast food with awesome customer service!! Every time I come to this location there is a long line, but don't worry it moves quickly.

Had SUCH a great experience there yesterday! As a mom Of a 16 month old, I appreciate all of the help I can get - especially when it's packed out at lunch time. One of the workers brought over a high chair and put a plastic protector on the table for me after offering help! Then, later, a separate worker brought a balloon with a mini stuffed cow over to our table for my daughter! SOOO sweet!! Their food is ALWAYS great, but the service to me and my sweet babe was over the top wonderful - I HAD to post about it and I posted a pic of my girl with the balloon - she loved it :)

I had lunch here today, and I am so glad that this chain is in chicago now.  I tried the Spicy Chicken sandwich, and no exaggeration it does have a "bite." Not for the faint hearted and I do enjoy spicy food.  The service was great, and the lunch crowd was all but gone.  It was yet another 40 degree day in the Spring, and many of my table mates were enjoying the soup.  I have had Chic-fil-a before, but its been a long time, and I will definitely return.

Friends suggested the place. I'm more of a beef type but always down to try a spicy chicken sandwich if its good that is. So after walking the streets of Chicago during a winter storm we get there. Walk in & the first thing that this worker says is "we close in 10mins" its 7:30pm on a tuesday -_-. Regardless after walking through that storm feet are soaked I needed something to warm me up. Ordered the spicy chicken combo(sandwich/fries/drink)(under $8), told the cashier it was my first time & he hooked me up with his personal favorite sauces for dipping, which was cool. Got my food pretty quick, the chicken seem old i would scale it on the level of a McChicken. The waffle fries were fresh but lightly seasoned. Started mowwin down on the spicy chicken & forgot it was spicy cause it wasn't at all lol. High school spicy chicken sandwich was spicier. Quickly just ate it since that greeter dude was creeping still.

First Chik-Fil-A ever to get in mah belly, and what better day than St. Patrick's Day to try it?  Admittedly I'd had seven green beers, but I have to say I'm not totally sure what the fuss was about.  I will admit  that the chicken in my spicy chicken sandwich did seem more "real" than chicken at say, McDonalds.  When you bite into the sandwich you can tell the meat is higher quality- kind of ridiculous to make that a criterion for a good fast food sandwich, but compared to the alternative it is preferable.  The buns are really soft and squishy, I wish they had more substance.  The waffle fries were good, nothing special.  I tried the Chik-Fil-A sauce which was really unique, and I liked it but didn't really feel the need to add it to anything.  Clearly everyone else loves it though - I say, what's wrong with ketchup?  The sandwich was only a little spicy to me, though some others thought it was lip-tingling so I guess that just depends on your spice tolerance.I would like to try their chicken fingers or chicken nuggets sometime because I'm a sucker for for that crispy goodness.This location is big and bustling, but shouldn't be hard to find a table.

Most efficient restaurant I've ever seen, didn't even have my change back and the tray of grub was ready to go!  First trip ever but It's damn good, I think they just execute everything perfectly, no soggy fries here.. that's for sure.  Got standard Spicy Chicken Sandwich/ the thing doesn't look all that great but it is-- Large Chicken Breast slathered in good sauce, pickles on a shitty little bun! It works and works very well.  Standard Waffle Fries, smallish order I thought?  Here's the great part--Their Sauces:: I only tried the "Chick-Fil-A" Sauce.. some kinda BBQ/ Mustard/ Egg Yolk concoction? To Die For to say the least!  Inside, it's packed and very sterile.. great people watching on Chicago Avenue..GTFJD

I don't know whether I should be embarrassed or proud to admit that I came here 3 times in two days (2 days of shopping on Michigan Ave= 2 meals and 1 snack stop)...
