I usually don't like to give fast food restaurants ratings higher than 3 stars just due to the the nature of chain restaurants... but I was just too impressed by this place to give it anything less.  I've never been to a Chick-Fil-A before this one, but my boyfriend is obsessed and was insistent that I try, so I gave it a shot and it was fabulous. The food is obviously delicious, but the really impressive part of my experience was the inside of the restaurant and the customer service!  The interior (bathrooms included) are really clean and fresh looking-- there are even fresh flowers on every table! The decor is pretty, and there is tons of natural light streaming in through the huge store front windows.  I would sit in this restaurant and chill out/charge my phone etc. just as easily as I would choose to relax in a Starbucks.  The staff is super friendly and helpful and were professional and polite and made us feel welcome in their business.  This is a great place for a quick shopping break!P.S. If you check in here with the Yelp app you will receive a free chocolate chip cookie!

Sooo I finally tried this place and unfortunately I have to admit I was super disappointed :/ This seems to be a midwestern staple, but everything from the chicken to the fries was just "Meh."  I like the fried chicken at Popeyes or KFC better, and even the waffles fries that everyone raves about were soggy and bland. My friend and I agreed it would be our last time there. If I'm craving some fast food to clog my arteries next time, I'll walk up the block to McDonalds.

Clean restaurant, polite and efficient service, the dining experience at this location is great.  So glad to have one in Chicago, and have it be right next to public transportation AND NU transportation!In the summer, I' rode intercampus here just to eat here more than once a week. If I'm nearby downtown, I almost always stop by for a sandwich and/or strips and/lor waffle fries. Most of the time all 3! There's a student deal where you get a free drink with an entree and any sized fries. Unlimited refills of soft drinks and tea. Free cookie for Yelp check in. The occasional no-purchase necessary free survey chicken sandwich. One drawback is the occasional lack of consistency in the quality of the food. Some days the chicken just isn't as flavorful, or the fries may be more soggy or undercooked. I'd say it's good 4 of the 5 times I go, which seems a little low for me. -1 star, but just for that.

I have been wanting to visit this location for several months now since I heard that it had opened.  Unfortunately, I'm normally in this part of town on Sundays when they are closed.Finally, we were able to visit here and it was amazing.  It's considered fast food, but is miles better than McDon't.  I came here knowing the food was going to be good based on previous visits to this chain and this did not dissappoint.  However, the best and most unexpected aspect of the experience was the amazing customer service.  The team at this location was great. We had a toddler with us and they prepared a table with a high chair as we were placing our food order.  You're not gonna get that at Wendy's.  I can't wait to go back again!

yeah, it's fast food. But I have a sweet spot for this place because I grew up eating here (in Atlanta). And it's still good.  Hands down, Chick-fil-A makes the BEST chicken sandwich and REAL chicken nuggets. The waffle fries aren't too shabby either. Try the shakes too. If you've never been here, try it.

I never used to understand the hype surrounding Chick-fil-A.  However, I have a fairly recurring lunchtime appointment in the area, and this is one of the only passable fast food joints so I kept returning.  I'm now sold!  The chicken is so fresh and non-processed compared to other chains!  The Chick-fil-A sauce is like crack.  I could eat containers of it alone.  The specialty shakes and brownies are delicious.   The sides never wow me the same as the chicken and could be better.Service is fast and efficient.  Being next to Loyola, just off both Michigan Avenue and the Chicago red line stop, it is always crowded.  However, they fill people's orders quickly and efficiently.  Sometimes it's a battle to find a seat, which is annoying.  I think they underestimated demand during peak hours and could use an even bigger space.  That said, the food and service outweigh the ambiance, resulting in a high four-star rating for fast food!

First off, I LOVE Chick-fil-A. I have for many years and when we finally got one in the city, well lets just say my trips down Chicago Ave became more frequent. In most cases I tend to avoid going downtown to avoid annoying riff raff, then they moved in. It all changed! Second, they have Belly Rewards Card....for anyone who doesn't use it, you must be crazy. Its free you scan your card when you visit and bam they reward you. After a few visits I received a free medium sized meal. NOT BAD  Third, Their staff has always been the most friendly in the city. In my opinion nothing is more enjoyable then going somewhere where the workers actually treat you with a nice positive attitude and smile. Even with how high volume the location is everyone always is very hospitable! No downfalls in my opinion. It is always clean, the food is delicious. Staff is friendly. Rewards!

I love this place. Super easy to get to from the Red Line and right close to the Ma Mile shops. Food is awesome, service is better, and they work at light speed. Food is always fresh and served hot .I always get the spicy chicken sandwich with waffle fries, definitely can't be beat. A couple times ago, they passed out free samples of the new Peppermint Shake, and now they got me hooked on it. Place is usually packed, but you can normally find a seat by the window and hang out.Occasionally you'll see a couple sketchy people coming in asking for money, but you are in Chicago and that is kind of the lifestyle, so no points docked for that.

Chick-fil-A, you are so delicious and so hard to find the further north you go. People often pass up the grilled chicken sandwich but it is brilliant! What really makes it is the honey BBQ sauce (honestly one of the best things you will taste in the place) so be sure to ask for it with any sandwich you order. Lemonade and a cookies and cream milkshake are always essential.

i love chick fil a - food comes out nice and hot, the people that work there are efficient / nice, and it's so tasty! also i have great memories associated with chilck fil a from college so i'm a little biased.usually i get the original chicken sandwich with extra pickles + small waffle fries..sometimes i get a lemon-up if i am in the mood (lemonade + 7up or sprite etc). as far as the sauces go - chick fil a sauce is yummy and different, ranch, honey mustard, and buffalo sauce = all good. i have also gotten their chicken nuggets which are tasty and look more like real chicken.don't worry if the line is long bc it moves quickly + ensures you get fresh food. now come to the northern suburbs!

I don't even think a review is necessary here. The service is great, the food is totally delicious and amazing, and the location is convenient while shopping downtown.Order a #1, no pickle, lemonade, waffle fries. Ask for the honey BBQ sauce (in the packets) for your sandwich. Its SO good.

A little bit of home in Chicago!I always get the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich with waffle fries and a diet lemonade. Just order it. Don't question it! And don't forget to get your favorite dipping sauce. I prefer the Chick-fil-a sauce myself b/c it tastes like honey mustard with BBQ mixed together!!! Don't forget a milkshake if you're feeling feisty!Service here is like it is down south. Everyone absolutely goes out of their way to make you feel at home whether it be refilling your drink at the table or saying "my pleasure".Love!
It's OK. But not the greatest franchise around. Maybe i'll give it a second try, And perhaps post something different.

Nothing beats Chick-fil-A's patented (or patentable!) lemony juicy chicken at any location, but this one in particular had the best service I've ever had at a fast food restaurant. While we were eating at one of the mod communal pub-height tables, we were chatted up by one of the friendly employees. The place was huge, clean and inviting, and well-laid-out. Bathrooms were sparkling. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and it melted in my mouth. Never disappoints!
Chick-fil-A always has the nicest people working there!  Food of course is good.

This is the best fast food spot in this area. WHY! ok, keep reading!1.The service is his absolutely amazing, they walk you food out to you, (however, they do sometimes give you the wrong bag, check before you leave).2. This place is always spotless, clean, clean, clean...the entire place is always spotless.3. They are never out of ketchup...I love ketchup. Ok, really, the condiments bar is clean, things are always separated, and in the correct bin. 4. The seating lobby is huge with a superior seating arrangement to most high-end spots in this area Streeterville/Gold Coast.5. FREE THINGS: a. Wi-Fi, b. refills, and c. every time you check in on Yelp! you get a free dessert. If you are lover of free, go here.The $ you spend is worth it for a quick lunch. 6. Clean again. The bathroom, at least male, was spotless. For fast food, this particular Chick-fil-A is 5*s.

The waffle fries is not as great as I expected.But the sandwich is definitely better than I thought.I ask for char-grilled sandwich ,but they gave me egg sandwich without chicken,but anyway it is better than I thought.And I think I will try more.

Ha...yes, you're reading this right.  I'm giving 5 stars to Chick-fil-A!  Are you going to say this makes me anti-gay now??  What is wrong with this country, someone expresses an opinion, you don't like it, and now we're all supposed to boycott it?  I guess a world where everyone has homogeneous thoughts and there are consequences for dissenters is one you prefer to live in?  Okay, all of that probably didn't belong in a Yelp review and I need to prove that there actually is a substantive reason why I'm giving this place five stars.  Number one, this place is kept impeccably clean which is pretty rare for any fast food spot.  I step up and order, and the person taking my order is friendly, eloquent, and looks put together.  Does Chick-fil-A pay more or something?  I'm pretty sure every other fast food employee I've come across hates their life (and thus you), mumbles a couple of words to you, and looks like they've worked a 24 hour shift.  Anyway, I get the spicy chicken sandwich, some waffle fries, and a cookies and cream shake.  Clearly a dinner of champions as I ate every last crumb.  A couple of days later I go out and run a marathon over 30 minutes faster than my previous best.  Coincidence?  I think not...

What can I say.  I love it here. I never go to Mcdonalds or Burger King, but I could eat here at least once a week.  I really like the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich with small fries.  The chocolate milkshakes are also great.  The sauces (I normally have ranch and BBQ) taste heavily processed, but this is fast food.  The quality of the chicken is great.  Even the bun is tasty.  Staff are extremely friendly and always have a smile.  I never grew up with Chick-fil-A, but I can say I love it (for what it is).

Finally came here after hearing how great this place is.It was good but not so good that I find myself praising this place.I had the original chicken sandwich with the Chick-fil-A dipping sauce (kinda reminds me of honey mustard + zesty sauce from BK). The sandwich is very plain and when you unwrap it, it looks unappetizing. I remember the face expression my gf and I gave each other when we unwrapped it- a little disappointed. I have to admit that soon after the bite and dip, we were very satisfied.I did hear that I was supposed to get the waffle fries after the fact. So I will make sure to get that the next visit.
My food was really horrible and thrown together and the service was horrible Bad politics too.

Gotta love this place (less their political stance, of course). As a student at Loyola, it is thrilling to have an amazing fast food place in the first floor of a school building! Just as a note, take advantage of checking in on Yelp and Foursquare, using your Belly Card, AND following them on Twitter!!! They always do deals so you can get anything from free ice cream to free 8-piece chicken nuggets to green lemonade on St. Patrick's Day!Most of the food is great. Lemonade is AMAZING. My personal favorites are the deluxe spicy chicken sandwich and chicken nuggets. ^_^ The waffle fries are good, too! Everything is good! I haven't tried the salads yet, though. Service is really impressive. Much faster and better than fast food competitors' in that they call the customers "guests" or "clients" and are highly efficient. They're nice and get the food ordered and out to you quickly. The place is so popular the line sometimes goes outside even with 10 people on registers!!!

If you order the kid's meal, don't bother choosing apple sauce for the side because the two times I ordered the kid's meal and asked for the apple sauce they still stick me with the waffle fries and the idiot I am I trust them so I didn't check my bag before leaving the place. To my surprise and my son's disappointment when we got home and looked in the bag. Thanks Chick-fil-A. oh, and ordered 2 meals (about $11), only got 2 chick fil a dipping sauce. a little cheap on the sauce, eh? you think the yellow sauce was made out of gold or something they have to keep it behind the counter under constant guard.

Maybe I just don't get it... Chick-fil-A was just OK and nothing more. I tried the waffle fries and spicy chicken sandwich. Neither were spectacular or especially standing out. Although I did like how the sandwich came in a separate bag to keep it warm. Perhaps the continuous hype is due to the lack of Southern fast food chains in the Chicagoland..... Perhaps I'm just a difficult person.... Because I'm certain I can find something similar at McD's and Wendy's.

I love Chick-Fil-A for so many reasons...  1.  I love that their employees have Sundays off.  I hate it on Sundays when I am craving a chicken sandwich, but love that their employees have a scheduled day off every week to spend with their friends and family.  Can't say that at most fast food places.  2.  The food is delicious and service is stellar.  I guess when you only do one thing (chicken) you really do it right.  It's simple, flavorful, and juicy.  It's 0.7 miles away and absolutely worth the walk every time.  My kids love it, too.  The staff actually look like they LOVE their job.  The employees work quickly, and always with a smile.  Get the lemonade, it's made fresh with real chunks of lemon pulp, and you get free refills.   3.  Kids night on Tuesdays.  If you have kids, it's awesome.  For every adult meal, you get a free chicken nugget meal for your child.  The meals usually come with a book, which I love.  I also like that the kids can get the squeezy applesauce instead of fries.  They have a nice craft table too, with 2 CFA staff members working with the kids, last night they made airplanes.  They let us trade our kids meal toy in for an ice cream, too, which the kids thought was cool.  (We got 2 of the same book anyway, so no I had no problem trading one in for ice cream.)  Before we left, in addition to everything else, the staff at the craft table even gave my kids a little stuffed cow.  They marched home shouting, "Eat More Chicken!" which is the CFA motto, and took those little stuffed cows to bed with them.  :)  Very happy children who loved the meal and experience, and cannot wait to go back.  4.  The Cow.  I have only seen the cow here on Kids Night, but wow, The Cow was WORKING IT!  My kids loved it.  He sat at our table, smelled the flowers on the table, tried to "steal" my 2 year old's applesauce.  He danced around like crazy, even going outside every now and then.  (It was awesome to watch the people passing by on the sidewalk react to The Cow!!)  The Cow was incredible, and adults as well as kids were enjoying his/her entertainment.

My favorite spot in the city! CFA provides great food, friendly service, and the best social media interaction out of any restaurant I know of. Try anything on the menu, you can't go wrong, but my favorite is Spicy Chicken sandwich, Fries and Sweet tea or diet lemonade. As for their service, this is the only "fast-food" (believe me this is a many steps above the average fast-food) place I know of that has employees offer to get you a drink refill and take your tray when you are finished.  Also, if you have any children stop by on Tuesday evening for fun activities and the Cow!!

I love Chic-fil-a! Chicken biscuits in the morning cannot be beat and the #1 combo is a perfect lunch. They get busy, but the lines move quick and food comes out fast. Amazing peach shakes in the summer.

Amazing is all I can say. 100% accuracy on orders every time, delicious food, and the best service to all comers you will ever find in any restaurant... regardless of fast food or black tie white tablecloth sit down service.  If the line ever gets to long, the manager of the restaurant will frequently walk through the line handing out samples of lemonade or shakes and thank you for your patience. Great people, great product, great restaurant.

The grilled chicken fruit salad is excellent.  They provide a healthy bed of lettuce and the usual add ons such as red cabbage, cheese, and carrots.  The grilled chicken comes in a good portion and is perfect, of course.  But the four fruits, especially strawberries and blueberries, are like a dessert, making the salad a complete meal.  The balsamic vinaigrette goes well with this salad.When you specialize in chicken fast food, you can do it better than competitors (such as McD, Wendy's, etc.) who offer it just as one of many dishes.  It shows at Chick-fil-A.

An a patriotic American who wears 3 flag pins (one holds my pants together), I wanted to support an American business, that made it on it's own. I like their food very much and the people there are friendly. When I finished my super-sized pop the nice man opened the shunt in his head and gave me a refill. Nobody would do that in a hateful dumb stupid doody head lib place.

This is my review for the Chicago Street Chick-Fil-A. It is based on the two times I dined there this past week.Pros:°Waffle fries are out of this world.°Friendly service.    They even went up to our table to ask if we needed drink refills.     When your order is ready they call you by name instead of a number.° Well managed.     Long lines move fast.     They don't mess up orders.° The chicken nuggets are first-rate.° The restaurant is very clean.Cons:° At this time there is no Chick-Fil-A in my city of residence: Las Vegas.

It's so good that Chick-fil-A exists, because I met my life partner here! Which is really funny, because we've always joked privately that fresh hot yoni always tastes like either chicken or fish.  Myself, I've always preferred the chicken flavor;) So what were the chances of meeting the lesbian love of my life here?  YOU TELL ME.
Love their spicy chicken deluxe sandwich, chicken strips, and waffle fries! :D

Chick-fil-a is processed food loaded with garbage ingredients, chemicals, etc... if you can pronounce half the names in their ingredients that makes you smarter than a lot of Americans. There are even several ingredients in their chicken sandwich and other items that come from oil refineries... I guess that qualifies as food somehow?  There are ingredients in it that are banned in Asia, Europe and other parts of the world... But not here in the good ole USA where corporate lobbyists control what we eat.Enjoy your cancer, Amercia!Every time you shop here, 15% of the sale, and 50% of the actual profit from this store goes to the bottom line of the corporate fascists that run Chick-Fil-A.The staff is friendly at this location, though.

Call me the devil but I had to try this place in spite of where they stand against anything that is not heterosexual and milky-white Christian. I have never been to a Chick-Fil-A before, ever.  My first visit has left me kind of understanding all the hype about their food, but kind of not. Service was friendly but the sandwiches themselves were surprisingly small, like McDonald's-style small, had I been expecting too much for the price?  Probably I was, I don't know where I got the idea that Chick-Fil-A would be an economical choice.On to the positives - the chicken itself was definitely moist and flavorful, I generally avoid fast-food chicken because it often gets done up so wrong, but it seems that Chick-Fil-A has got that almost just right.  Ditto on the waffle fries, not too soggy or too stiff.I don't know if I will ever visit a Chick-Fil-A again, but if I do it won't be during the lunch rush hour.  Had I spent less wait time and less $$ I might be more enthusiastic about returning.  And there are plenty of other places in the city where I can spend the same money on a good meal without having to worry about the crass politics of the people who are profiting from my spending.

I have been coming here as often as I can since they opened last year. I LOVE their chicken nuggets and milk shakes (especially oreo)! I think the waffle fries could be better, but my nieces love them. I tried the original and spicy chicken sandwiches but stick to the nuggets. Went today for Chick-Fil-A appreciation day!! Worth the wait half a block away :)
BEST PLACE EVER.Get waffle fries, Polynesian sauce, and a chicken sandwich.  Just get the #1 with sweet tea and you will not be disappointed.
Overpriced, average taste and slow service. Go to McDonalds next door and get a McChicken.
The chicken sanwich I had was no different than burger King. Same chicken, same bacon and same tase. Go to Burger King and eat there. I will say the fries are very good

this place is AMAZING!!! the staff is supper friendly and the food!! ...oh my! the FOOOOD!! never thought i will ever eat fast food that is delicious! just one word: AMAZING! PS: too bad they don't have more stores open around Chicago area... :(

I wanted to really test this place, toss it through the ringer as it were. The inside is very nice and modern, the outside is cold looking, sterile. Work on that. The staff is very friendly and the service is quick as to be expected at a fast food joint. Like I said, I wanted to test this place, so after my class at Loyola, I biked over here, got the Chicken pieces, 4 sauces, fries & cole slaw and went to the gym. Then I stuck my food in the locker while I worked out, for 1.5 hours. Then I biked home and ate it. It was still good. Well done Chick-fil-A. Chicken - Better than the McDonalds, wendys, arbys Burger king noise.Waffle Fries - These were OK, I reserve judgement because I let them sit awhile, and fries don't like that. Cole slaw - nothing to write home about, but they give you a lot. Saw says. (sauces) =Buttermilk ranch - oh yes creamier than snow whites thighs. Polynesian - really awesome. Cross between sweet & sour but not gross. Bbq sauce - least favorite. Too sweet, not enough smoky. Better than all the other fast food BBq sauces tho.Cheese sauce - this was new and the cashier said it was really good. When I ate my food it was so long after I ordered it I forgot what this was. When I first tried it, I thought it was butter. I am not complaining mind you. Overall, best fast food experience I have had in awhile. Give them a shot.

Chick-fil-A is my guilty pleasure.  I usually order the 4-piece chick-n-strips meal with a diet lemonade.  The honey mustard sauce is great.  I dip both my strips and waffle fries in it.  I love that this location gives you free refills on the lemonade.  I've been to other Chick-fil-A restaurants outside of Illinois that charge for lemonade refills.  The staff members are friendly and when a customer says, "thank you" they respond with a "my pleasure."

Chick-fil-A is the best fast food restaurant ever.  There is only 1 in all of Chicago, and it's a darn good one.  The first time I went, I ordered the chicken strips, and they gave me my chicken before I managed to put my credit card and receipt in my wallet.  That's how fast this place is.  Also, UNLIMITED SAUCES. That's key.  The sauces are really tasty, especially the Polynesian sauce and the Chick-fil-A sauce.  The artwork is fun and Chicago themed too.

What!? A clean and friendly fast food restaurant? I was in downtown Chicago late. Downtown Dogs was closed - WTF? I needed something fast and was able to track down this place via Yelp Mobile. Friendly and helpful staff. I ordered the spicy chicken but some reason they told me it would take longer. I saw all of the people in line before me get their food.   Liked the waffle fries and the spicy chicken. If it weren't for the long wait, I would add another star. You can't be fast food if you are slow.

Customer satisfaction is measured by consistency, and that is exactly what Chick-Fil-A does!  I love coming here for the special blend of spices on their sandwiches, waffle cut fries, and a Dr. Pepper (or sometimes a chocolate shake).  The breakfast chicken minis are delicious.  They need to open more of these restaurants in Chicago.  I've been to the one in Schaumburg and I really like this one downtown; they both look brand new, and the service is always quick, friendly, and amazing.The only reason I gave four stars instead of five for the rating is because unlike the other places this location does not offer the slices of lemon pie.  Sounds like a small thing but the pie is excellent.

While visiting Chicago, a friend and I stopped here for a quick bite while out & about.  I do love CFA, and since we don't yet have any in the Bay Area, I was more than happy about stopping here.  The chicken was, of course, excellent, but this review is more about the service.I have never NEVER encountered a more friendly & welcoming staff at a fast food establishment.  The cashier was extremely friendly, but what really sold me was while eating, the person who I believe was the manager, was walking around asking people if they needed anything, or if we would like refills on our beverages.  This was by far the best experience I've had at a fast food restaurant.  ***Bonus points for having a very clean restroom in the middle of downtown Chicago & for the free wifi!***

First of all I have to say.  I love Chick fill A.  It's healthy, good and is an easy lunch or dinner.  They have a lot of healthy options on their menu.  This Chick fill A is the most beautiful one, cleanest one, as well as the nicest Chick-fill-A I have ever been to.  The restaurant itself at this location is big and spacious.  The customer service at this location is also the best that I have ever experienced in a fast food restaurant next to IN and Out Burger in California.  The lady who run us up was nice, then they handed you, your order personally and smiled.  It was weird.  But I have to say I was impressed.
I looove chicken salad but not from here. In fact, none of their salads do it for me. I'll stick to what they do best: chicken sandwiches.

I'm not going to type out all of the things I love about Chick-Fil-A.  We all know they are great.  This was a much needed opening in an area serious lacking something quick.  Michigan Avenue is great for your high class chains, but missed out on quick options.  This location is beautiful and the line moves very fast.  I can't imagine the amount of money this place makes with all the traffic. KEEP THE BUMS OUT.

Definitely my favorite fast food establishment of all time. The chicken is cooked in peanut oil and is only made of white breast meat. I have yet to encounter an odd nugget. The fries are never soggy and always crisp. They are waffled shaped. I typically order a kids meal (6 nuggets, ice cream substitute, and regular lemonade) and a medium chicken noodle soup.

Ahh Chick-fil-A.  The wonderful fast food restaurant that McDonalds wishes it could be.  It is so great that they finally arrived in Chicago after being in the suburbs for over a year.  This is a great spot that I love visiting, and is close by the Grand Station on the Red Line.  The customer service here is the best- this company makes sure that their employees treat their customers in a professional manner, and the staff here will make sure you have the best experience possible.  The food here is fantastic!  The chicken sandwich, the spicy chicken sandwich, and the nuggets are always top picks and the waffle fries compliment the main dish perfectly.  To drink you can get the standard Coke products, or try the awesome lemonade!  The milkshakes are excellent as well- with my favorite being strawberry.  Some people do not like the company's conservative values though hence some lower ratings- to them I say this:  they treat their customers better than any other fast food restaurant, and they offer far superior products (real chicken pieces, not ground up left overs).  With them treating their customers like they matter, whats to complain about?  To individuals who have not tried this place: go to Chick-fil-A and "Eat more chicken!"

You get an automatic five stars for simply existing in Chicago!I only get to have Chick-fil-A when I'm in Houston, and that isn't very often.I love getting the #1 with a lemonade. It's delicious! I also like the spicy version of the chicken sandwich. I just sort of wish they'd open more locations. It's my favorite fast food joint.

Great service and employees!  I was never a big Chick-fil-A person, but I come to this one regularly because of the people and atmosphere.  Be sure to check in on FourSquare and get a Belly card; lots of free food available with those.

Being from Seattle, I had never heard of/had Chick-fil-A until recently. First of all, the restaurant is surprisingly really nice and clean, not something I'd expect from a fast food place. The servers were friendly and I thought it was interesting/refreshing that one guy calls your name and personally brings you your food! I had the spicy chicken sandwich and it was pretty good. I'm not crazy about the waffle fries or Chick-fil-A sauce (which is basically honey mustard) but I would definitely go here again!
The best fast food service you'll ever get.  Their oreo milkshakes are to die for and all their food is so fresh & yummy. It's a bit more expensive for fast food, but worth every penny!

My favorite fast food in Chicago! Chicken tastes so much better than most fast food places. Definitely fresher and more like a home-style. Just wish their chicken nuggets can be bigger cuz I cannot get enough of them!

youtube.com/watch?v=sO-m…Chic Fil A is awesome, even if they have questionable business practices.  Waffle Fries!  I have been singing the song to this link in my head for days.  It makes me want to go there.  Only 3 stars for their non-humanitarian views on life, but whateves.  Chow down at chick fil a.  These drag queens are the best.

3 stars with the benefit of the doubt that the restaurant is cleaner and less raucous on any other day of the year than Saint Patricks Day. I thought my grilled chicken sandwich was whats to be expected for a $6 meal, nothing that will knock your socks.

So far Chick-fil-A is the only fast food I've ever tried that doesn't make me feel like I'm going to die after I eat it.  Even better, it tastes really, really good.  They move their lines fast, and customer service is great.  At my last visit they were out of the waffle fries, which did kind of suck, but they gave me vouchers for two free entrees, which definitely didn't suck.  College kids are everywhere (to be expected) and parking is scary.  If you bring a friend and leave the flashers on, you'll be OK. Faves are the spicy chicken sandwich, fries, and that carrot raisin salad!  Nuggets are microscopic, but tasty.   It's definitely more expensive than other fast food joints, but not going into salt and grease shock after eating is worth a little extra for sure. If you haven't tried Chick-fil-A yet, do it.

Check in here and you get a free brownie!  Just pack on the calories!Boo to the crazy Sunday hours...ie not open at all.  Some super religious company...but hey, I cant hate on the delicious chick-fil-a food.Love the waffle fries...why are these so much better than regular fries??Also, they actually have some "healthy" options on the menu if you arent looking to totally gorge yourself.The chicken sandwiches are good and I like that you can get most of your own condiments in packets by the napkins.  Free refills on pop...yeah to my addiction to fountain diet coke. :)
I love their spicy chicken sanwich! I used to like the southern style chicken sanwich in McDonald, but soon the chick-fil-a became my favorite when I think of spicy chicken.

Oh, how I love place.  A solid fast food choice, for some reason I feel better about eating here then I would any other fast food place.  This location is very clean - and really hip.  The service is really fast and I truly enjoy the experience here.  My favorite are the chicken nuggets - with honey mustard sauce.  I also LOVE there COOKIES AND CREAM MILK SHAKE..... so dreamy.  It's hard for me to pass this place and not stop.
CFA rocks no matter where your at.  The service was fast and consistant.  The food was ideal and tasty!  Yum!

I don't think this place needs any explaining. We stopped here on my first night as a student at Moody Bible Institute as a student.  We got shakes, but one of my dorm brothers ate. Chick-Fil-A also has some great deals for College Students! Eat there!

I was excited about all the Chick-Fil-A hype but after having been there... I don't get it.Why should I pay almost $10 for a meal and then have the person behind the counter judge me because I asked for an extra ketchup packet. Cheapskates!The spicy chicken sandwich is pretty good, better than the Wendy's Spicy Chicken. But they need to invest in some real vegetables. Again, on food this expensive I would expect green lettuce, red tomato, etc.

It was a bad bad thing someone told me there was a Chick Fil-a in Chicago... I've always been a fan, but being from the north a Chick Fil-a was only something we could get when we went to visit family in the south. So I went and this Chick Fila is so pretty inside. They have this really cool coke bottle light and it is exceptionally clean for a fast food place.  My chicken tenders and waffle fries were delish as always. And the staff their was great. My tenders took like 5 extra minutes and they gave me a free entree for a return visit... Chick Fil-a you had me at hello....
Quick to order but takes abt 10 to fill during prime time. U can call ur order in ahead of time

It's comforting to know that there is a Chick-fil-A within walking distance from work.  My usual is always the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich with fries.  Sooo good!  The line gets pretty long during lunch hours, but they take orders quickly to get you in and out the door.  If you want to dine in during lunch, you may have to wait awhile to get a table.

this place is the amazing.in classic fashion, the spicy chicken sandwich and waffles fries are amazing. the reason this particular chick fil A is perfect is the cleanliness, the service, and the speed. i went went it opened and the line was literally out the door. i was at the counter in 7 minutes flat. fast food at its finest.

When Chick-fil-A opened in Chicago last summer, I did not understand what all the fuss was about. People were standing in line around the corner, for god's sake. It's only a chicken sandwich, right? WRONG!!! I finally caved in and tried it, and oh my god it's SO. FREAKING. GOOD. I cannot even explain it to you. I love the original chicken sandwich with provolone cheese. Best chicken sandwich I have ever had, hands-down. Also recommended are the waffle fries, lemonade, and brownies: yum! And don't be intimidated by the long lines. This place is run with a military-like efficiency. The staff is amazing, and you will be in and out in no time. Go now!

It's Chik Fil A. It's outside the red line. I can walk there from work when I had a day from hell. I mean, I used to walk there from further when I had more frequent days from hell. Every time, I get a #1 with NO PICKLES (I need it to have a bun, I can't do the nuggets) and they have never once given me a pickle. Until it came here I used to just stare longingly at the closed one in the Florida airport, since I was always there on Sundays by some horrible twist of fate. Now I can have it whenever I want and I'm still way excited by it because... it's Chik Fil A. In Chicago. What? I need to go there for breakfast.I try not to let the politics get in the way of my fried chicken. Also, their waffle fries need more salt.

First time I ever had this was during a Sorority Convention in the Georgia where they served us chicken sandwiches for breakfast, coming from Illinois I was like chicken for breakfast? Interesting. Mind you trying to serve 100+ guests the food will get cold so I didn't get a full on taste of what Chick-fil-A had to offer.Well, the other week myself and two workers stopped by before and meeting and trying to be on a "healthier" binge I was super excited to see the 4 piece grilled chicken nuggets, score! NOT! 4 meager pieces of grilled chicken nuggets that weren't even bigger than the size of my thumb! Both my co-workers were shocked as to how small the size were. Let alone I wasn't even close to being full. Yeah maybe I'll opt for the salad next time vs spending $3+ for something I finished within 10 seconds!

I know I shouldn't like Chick Fil A due to their eh-hole beliefs on certain political/societal matters, but I JUST CAN'T HELP IT.My first CFA experience was in Georgia during Spring break, and I am still as much in love with it as I was 7 years ago. It's quick, yummy and the cashiers are nice! I've always been greeted with a smile and people who actually ENUNCIATED their words!!! O.M.G. Imagine that! *choir of angels singing...aaaahhh!*It's hard working and studying at Loyola and not going there for a quick lunch/dinner. There will always be a line, so be prepared. But it moves quickly...hence "fast" food.

Again: NO ketchup packets (no packets OR dipping tubs!). I'm assuming they now keep them behind the counter, but I didn't see it at the register with all the other sauces. Not cool!Note to workers: if someone orders fries, just automatically place at least one ketchup packet into their bag. Sheesh, talk about hoarders!

I have to say, the chicken is good, but nothing remarkable or spectacular. Personally, I prefer my fried chicken spicy, a la Popeye's. The service at Chick-fil-A is nothing short of remarkable. When they first opened the restaurant on Chicago, the line was out the door and down the block. Believe it or not, I think I waited in line less than ten minutes before I ordered and god my food. And you will not wait more than about two minutes for your food, if that.What I don't like about Chick-fil-A is the political leanings of the parent corporation. I won't go into it here, this is not the place. Do your own research if you're interested. But the politics kills Chick-fil-A for me. I'll eat more chicken, but I'll do it somewhere else.

umm...what.  first chick-fil-a experience today.  the service tried- the line went fast, they were polite, but they forgot half my order.  the best part of the meal was the fries, but they were maybe a little bit better than average.maybe since i have only been once, i haven't built up the necessary amount of chemical-y whatever to crave it like the rest of america, but i suppose if i was in the neighborhood again, hungry, and wanted a cheap meal, i'd go back.

When it comes to a chicken sandwich, this is as good as it's going to get. Regular Chick-fil-A sandwich was lightly breaded and perfectly moist inside. Great seasoning. Dee-lic-ious. And as far as fast food chicken sandwiches go, this one is kind of healthy for you because it's pressure cooked in peanut oil, which is trans fat and cholesterol free. Also tried the grilled chicken sandwich--tasty and fewer calories. The golden wheat bun and the pickles are a nice touch. Can't go wrong with the waffle fries. Surprisingly large seating area in this place. Service is fast and efficient so even if there's a line, it goes by quick.

ive been waiting 4 this 2come to chicago & now it finally has! wooo hoooo! im soooo excited! i love their samiches! my fave is the chicken in a biscuit thats only available 4breakfast. they should make it available all day cuz i could eat that thing any time of the day! my bff & i went there the other day cuz shes never been ther before. she ended up likin her samich & i enjoyed my nuggets. LOVE their waffle fries! now that i know its available in IL, im gonna b all over chik fil a!

Hate their stance on gay rights, love the food. Delicious. My only complaint is that if you go, be prepared to dodge hordes of tourists. Otherwise, customer service is fantastic, the food is amazing and the location is perfect.

Okay, had to go see what all the hub bub was about. These places have been springing up like hot cakes and I heard there were even people camping out at one that opened recently near my house to get in for opening day. So I stopped by one recently with my family to see what this place was all about. First impression.....reminded me of a clean McDonald's ....without the greasy smell. Ordered the spicy chicken sandwich, it was good, and definitely tasted,  looked like I was not eating something that resembled chicken but was actually chicken. However,  I still felt like I was eating at a fast food place, and in the end, still had that fast food regret feeling when I left. So bottom line.....I don't think it's healthier, but this chicken probably clucked at one point as opposed to the so called chicken you get at other places that serve in a similar manner.

I've grown up with Chick-fil-A, so I understand all of the excitement surrounding the new one on Chicago/Wabash. Unfortunately, it's a little too close to home for me (literally, it's blocks away where I live), so I have to make a conscious effort to try to forget that it's there. I don't go nearly as often as I'd like, since I'd prefer to stay in my current clothing size, but the food is really, really good. The chicken sandwiches/strips/nuggets outshine any that I've tasted at comparable fast food joints. The staff is oddly perky, which I appreciate. The restaurant is clean and feels less like a McDonalds, and more like a Panera. This location is extremely busy though, so be prepared to get death stares from patrons if you plan to "hang out" after you're done eating. There just isn't room.

Chick-fil-A has recently exploded in the last few years, it started popping up in California, where I'm from, about 6 years ago. My friends from the south have always raved about how great it was. Admittedly, I was not impressed my first go around and really annoyed that it was not open the first time I tried to go (not open on Sundays). What really changed it for me was ordering the chick-fil-a sandwhich on a golden wheat bun with some honey mustard on it...My life has never been the same. It was probably one of the happiest moments of my life when I found out that there was a chick-fil-a opening in downtown Chicago. If I could, I would live above it so that I could eat there 6 days a week... as a bonus, its probably one of the nicest chick-fil-a i've ever been to. Go here. Get the chick-fil-a sandwich on a golden wheat bun with one of their sauces (I recommend chick-fil-a sauce or honey mustard). Get the waffle fries. Get the sweet tea. Get the dreamsicle for dessert.
Some of the best fast food in the world. I'm glad it's finally in Chicago.And everyone who works there is the nicest person you will ever meet.

While I almost feel kinda guilty patronizing this establishment because of their extreme religious beliefs, but...DAMN! That was a good chicken sandwich.Like, it was so good, I can't stop thinking about it. I'm trying to come up with excuses to go downtown just so I can get another. I went with the plain chicken sandwich and it was the end-all, be-all of fast food chicken sandwiches. Best ever.My sole visit to this location is the only time I've ever tried Chick-fil-A ever. It's been over a month and my mouth still waters when I think about it. The restaurant was busy, the line was long, but moved very quickly. All of the staff I encountered were great and so nice. My only complaint (and not Chick-fil-A's fault): Hey assholes reading books, doing homework and not eating!! Can't you see this place is crazy busy? Get your ass up and go do your homework at coffee shop. I need to sit down real quick and scarf down my sandwich before it gets cold, okaaaaaaay?!??

My first encounter with Chick-Fil-A was over four years ago in Atlanta, GA.  Words cannot express how overzealous I am to have a Chick-Fil-A in my beloved city of Chicago!If you want a Chicken sandwich done right, Chick-Fil-A is the place to go!  You can have it grilled, crispy, cajun, spicy, tenders, nuggets, sandwich, or even in a salad!  Yes, there are many combinations for you to enjoy Chicken here!  My personal favorite is the deluxe Spicy Chicken sandwich on a wheat bun and buffalo sauce for my waffle fries.  I think about this sandwich all of the time, it's so good!  Another upside here is that they have a variety of sauces to compliment your chicken meal and they don't limit the number of sauces you can get!  Also, props on the Heinz Ketchup dipping packages! :)What really blows me away at this Chik-FIl-A location is the phenomenal customer service!  All of the employees are so wonderful and delightful.  Heads up: it gets super busy during peak grubbing hours so prepare to wait in line (it moves pretty quickly).

I've never been to a Chick-Fil-A before but now I know why all my Southern and Texan buddies  (yeah, Texas, you get your own shout-out) enjoy this place so much.The staff was friendly, the place was clean, and the chicken was to die for.  The also shouted out your name and order which added to the high-energy, mmm-chicken ambiance of the place.Delicious!

Dearest Chick-fil-A,Oh you, what can I say about you?You're just so good. I don't really know why you're so good, but you are. Maybe that's what true love is- when you love yet don't know the complete reasons why.I can tell you some things I love about you. I love your fabulous buns (OMFG good biscuits) and I love how you're always at the right place (excellent location, although touristy) and the right time (good hours? iono, just adding this to make this review flow). You have substance (good chicken) and I like substance (good good chicken). You have just enough of this and just enough of that (well seasoned).You fulfill me (I don't think this needs to be explained).I can't be with you as much as I want (expanding waistline) but I'm always thinking of you. XOXOXO Jimmy

Being from the South, I have been to a lot of Chick FIl A's and this one does not disappoint. They are ALWAYS busy but somehow manage to get your food out in a timely manner. I like that a hostess walks around and fills up drinks and throws away your trash for you. Chick-Fil-A is all about doing little things like that that aren't expected at a normal fast food joint.Their staff is fantastic. I don't know where they found such happy smiley people but I honestly want to know so I can hire people just like them.As far as them being closed on Sundays goes, the company I work for is open 365 days a year so I respect them for giving their staff time to spend with their families even if it means losing money.

probably the best fast food in the world....in n out, five guys etc...can't compete.waffle fries make life betternice interior, nice setup, nice prices, nice location....five stars for its category, just incredible edible fast food

ok, so the spicy chicken and the shakes and the fries and the CHICK-FIL-A SAUCE.  the best.  12 stars if i could.but really CFA?  whats up with the corporate homophobia?  gays LOVE chicken and dipping sauces.  trust me, i seen it with my own two eyes.  get off that weird horse of yours and see that all tastebuds are created equal.  you can do it.

Okay, so I must preface this review by saying that I'm from the south and I grew up with Chick-fil-A for the past 21 years of my life. When this location was planned, I drove by weekly, checked online for daily status updates, and I was upset when I missed the grand opening because I was at home in Florida. Everything is good here! I personally love the chicken strips (3 or 4 pieces) with waffle fries and YOU MUST get Chick-fil-A sauce. I also like the original chicken sandwich. I cannot tell you how many people I have brought here to try it for the first time. That staff is so nice, the space is so clean, and the food is terrific. Even though the line is sort of long at times, it goes super fast and you always receive service with a smile. I have had breakfast here as well, the chicken biscuits are amazing. As a testament to the service here, I had to wait for five minutes for my order once and I received a coupon for a free sandwich on my next visit. You can also check in on foursquare and receive a free large waffle fry on your fourth check in. The inside also has original Chicago decor including a bench that was an original part of the stands in the old Soldier Field. All of the pictures are also Chicago-centric. They also have a lot of events for the community, yes I've taken a picture with the cow, and kids nights. The owners also regularly walk around and check how everyone is doing. Their milkshakes are also AWESOME! I go here once a week and I'm not afraid to admit it.

This was my first visit to Chick-fil-A and it did not disappoint.  Many friends (from the South) had recommended it.  Very thankful a location finally opened in Chicago!I went for breakfast and order the Spicy Chicken Biscuit Sandwich.  I was never a fan of breakfast biscuits, though these were pretty soft and moist. The chicken itself had a nice kick and was very filling.  The place seemed pretty big, wasn't too busy when I was there, but it was also close to 8:00 AM. In all, I'd really love to come back for lunch sometime and try some of the other non-breakfast options.  Will def come back again.

This place makes me so happy, you just don't know. Its opening day was marked on my calendar for weeks, and I was elated to learn I'd won free Chick-Fil-A for a year (or 52 free meal cards) but I swear this isn't why I'm biased. When I tired of my free #1 meals (OK, that is rare) I actually do pay for others, and I'm happy to do so.  Yes, I'm from the South, and it warms my heart to find this little pocket of efficiency and friendliness here in downtown Chicago. I'm proud to say I've converted many a dubious Chicago native to CFA fandom.Perhaps no other brand inspires such a rapid following in Southerners as Chick-Fil-A, and for good measure. Simple, delicious, craving-inspiring food served with a heaping side of politeness. Get takeout, and they take your name and personally bring it to you lickety-split. Eat in, and more often than not, someone will offer to clear the trash from your table before you've realized you even have trash. Now, where else do you see this at fast-food prices? One time I was in there with coworkers for lunch, and an employee asked if we'd like a free jug of sweet tea. Hell yes, please. Not 10 minutes had passed when we were offered yet another free jug of sweet tea. Why, hell yes, we'll have more, thank you. Add in the outdoor seating with a sweet view of the Trump down Wabash, and this is my little happy place.

ughhh why must you be closed on sundays!!! (yes, yes i know the reason).  When I moved to Houston a couple of years ago, I discovered Chick-Fil-a.  When I moved back to Chicago a few years later, I realized that while I would not miss the humid weather of Houston, I would miss the food especially Chick-Fil-A.   I am so happy they are finally here in Chicago!!!!  I love their chicken breakfast burritos.  great way to start my morning.  I wish I could eat this every day, but then I'd be in the gym 2 hours a day/5 week just trying to burn off the food!

I know, my friends will ask me why I haven't reviewed Chick-fil-A yet.Being an Atlanta girl, I went three times in the first three days they were open. I then averaged about once (or twice) a week. Now I think I have a more manageable schedule. I have also run into several friends at this Chick-fil-A, even though we didn't plan on meeting. So yes, I come here rather often.The service at this Chick-fil-A never fails. Being a frequent customer, I have had the opportunity to get comped meals - if you ever have an issue, you can kindly let someone know because they want to be aware and fix the problem. And, that usually includes some kind of apology to you and free chicken in the future. Who doesn't love free chicken and knowing that management cares about feedback?I usually stick to the class Chick-fil-A sandwich, which translates to the amazing chicken biscuit in the morning. Chicken for breakfast? Heck yes!This Chick-fil-A may be one of the reasons I want to stay in the Gold Coast - if I move too far away, less Chick-fil-A goodness.

I went on my quest for Chick-fil-A yesterday and I do mean quest being that this Chick-fil-A is downtown and I had no reason to be downtown other than to obtain the coveted cuisine of Chick-fil-A. With such a huge population of Chick-fil-A junkies pouring through the doors, this is more of a factory than a restaurant. While the flow of service is quick, the experience is somewhat reminiscent of an airport check-in. The workers are very friendly and helpful but the environment isn't memorable of anything except being crowded.I am completely addicted to their nuggets and the girl at the check out made my day by honoring my sauce sampler request (I asked to try them all). I think I would still eat at Chick-fil-A even if everything they served tasted like crap, as long as I could get an order of their waffle fries. Lemonade...ahhhh.Okay, I'm getting a craving just typing this. Darn Sundays!

Dammit.My little brother insisted we come here after a harrowing shopping experience on Michigan Avenue...I tried to pursued him to go somewhere else, somewhere that served vodka.So I begrudgingly at a spicy chicken sandwich, waffle fries and a lemonade. And who woulda thought, I liked it!  I think the chicken isn't mechanically separated or at least that's what I was told and I'm clinging to that statement. (check this link and you'll know why: snopes.com/food/prepare/…).I don't know if I can come back...I can only do fast food at 3am via the drive thru with me huddled in the back, pretending like that big mac is not really for me.

Ok. So having gone to school in FL for four years, I had gotten pretty used to having a Chick-fil-A around, aka I was spoiled. I'm so glad we finally got one in Chicago!I love chicken, love it. I really don't like burgers/red-meat all that often, so this place is perfect. Their wraps and spicy chicken sandwiches are my fav, with waffle fries of course. I also love just about every sauce they have to offer, which is a lot!There reason I don't give this place 5 stars? They are so Christian they close on Sundays, which is ironically when I find myself wanting it the most. But worst of all, they're pretty anti-LGBT which infuriates me!

Best chicken sandwich you will have. I really wish there was one of these closer to me. The thickness of the chicken and the quality of the toppings makes this the best. I dare you to find a better chicken sandwich
Finally!! I can now stay in Chicago forever. I was worried that lack of chicken might drive me out.

I got some Chik-fil-A today after getting a gift card from a place I have a post office box at as a reward for checking in on Foursquare. Technically, the gift card was supposed to be for Target, but I used it to get a meal at the restaurant on Chicago Avenue downtown. I got a meal of chicken nuggets and fries with a large lemonade. The lemonade was way too tart and had too much ice in it so it was watered down, but didnt help tone the tart taste. The fries and nuggets were not that good I've had better food at Food Life at Water Tower than Chik-fil-A. I didnt care much for the food if they had something more interesting than the nuggets I would be inclined to try it. Unfortunately this place seems to be popular with the clueless college students who burn up their money on fast food garbage than anything that's deemed nutritious.. I would consider the place if it's a last resort, but there are other places better than this restaurant hands down.

I've heard of Chick-fil-A for as long as I can remember. It was sort of like watching the Sonic commercials while living in New York, and the closest Sonic being in the neighboring state, New Jersey. But while in Chicago, I finally encountered a Chick-fil-A and knew I had to try it. Although it was only for breakfast, it didn't matter, I was going to get my Spicy Chicken fix.I was surprised when I walked into this establishment. It was clean, vibrant, and just felt like a step-up from the drab Burger Kings, Wendy's and McDonald's. The LCD screens serving as the menu really put it over the top, making it feel more like a gourmet fast-food joint. Especially after I put my order in, one of the staff personally came up to me to hand my meal in a brown bag. Wow, that's service!I ordered the Breakfast Burrito with Spicy Chicken ($2.69), consisting of red and green peppers, scrambled eggs, breaded pieces of spicy chicken breast, onions, and a blend of Monterey Jack and Cheddar Cheese all wrapped in a soft flour tortilla. I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious it tasted, as if prepared at a diner with fresh ingredients. It didn't taste like one of those frozen burritos you stick in the microwave or McDonald's unappealing breakfast burrito McSkillet wraps. And the separate package of Spicy Salsa really took it over the top adding a refreshing perspective to an otherwise solid burrito with some subtle heat. And I have to say that Chick-fil-A's breakfast burrito was quite hearty in all its glory of 450 calories and 24 grams of protein! 24 grams! I found myself full until lunch time.I usually refrain from eating fast-food, but I'm actually now a believer of Chik-fil-A and wish they had some in the metropolitan New York area. Sadly, they do not yet. But if you're lucky to pass one of these and are in the mood for fast-food, I highly recommend checking out Chick-fil-A.

My first experience of Chick-fil-A  was B.C. (before Chicago) years ago during a visit to Florida. After hearing rave reviews about it on WMBI 90.1 in Chicago, I was excited to try it. Unfortunately I was on my health kick at the time--no fried foods, so I ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich. It was okay, but I wasn't impressed--no offense to CfA it's just I have never had a grilled sandwich I really liked, let's face it, Chicken is meant to be fried.  Refusing to leave unfulfilled--who knows when I'd ever get to try CfA again, I ordered the Original Chicken sandwich, took a taste of it and immediately realized I had ordered wrong. It was too late to enjoy it since I was already full with the Grilled, but that one bite was enough to understand what the rave was. Yesterday feeling totally embarrassed after making an uncharacteristic foolish-urban-cyclist move that makes all us urban cyclists look bad , I decided to stop at Chick-fil-A. I continued my normal workout route and on the way back I made a "via point" turn, if I may borrow the term from my GPS, to Chick-fil-A on Chicago Avenue. The line was long, but it moved pretty fast.  I ordered #1 on the menu board.  They offered some sauces to go with. I asked for the Buttermilk Ranch and later noticed they also had their own namesake sauce which I should have tried instead. Then I overheard the couple next to me loading up on the Polynesian Sauce so I asked to exchange the Ranch but the nice clerk let me keep both. I loaded my dinner into my backpack til I found a spot along Oak Street beach. I pulled out the sandwich and found it packed in a cute little foil bag that retained a good amount of heat from the 30 minutes it took me to start eating the sandwich at Oak Street Beach.  Delay due to the fact I had to stop to admire the incredible mural on the east wall of the underpass. The sandwich had a rather large piece of chicken in it. One bite and all my bad feelings from my earlier bike mistake disappeared.  It seemed to tie the whole beautiful evening with the perfect unseasonable weather together like a big shiny bow. Even if did take a little bit of a bath in the Polynesian sauce as I was digging for my water bottle in my back pack. Sauce was good--kind of like a mild sweet and sour sauce without the sour, but the sandwich had enough flavor to stand on its own. The Original Chicken Sandwich is the way to go!  One bite and in that instant you'll know.

One of my favorite fast food places.  I rarely eat fast food but this is one place I can not pass up.  The staff is uber friendly and so quick!  I walked in at 1:30pm on a Thursday and the line was practically out the door. From the minute I stepped in until the minute I sat down with my food it took less than 10 mins!!  They have it down at Chick Fil A.  So efficient!  I actually feel like the employees are happy to be there unlike most fast food places where you would think every staff members dog had died that morning or they just got a speeding ticket or something.  Also, the food is quality!!  The spicy chicken deluxe is my absolute favorite!!  I also love the fact that they ask if you would like any sauces and they are free!!  My favorite is the buffalo!! I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a quick cheap and tasty meal!!

I was in the area and hungry so I thought I'd stop by Chick-fil-A to see what the hype was about. I had only visited a Chick-fil-A once at a mall and thought their chicken sandwich was really no big deal and super hyped up.  But my second experience changed my mind.This time I ordered an 8 piece chicken meal (which included a drink and waffle fries).  The 8 pieces of chicken were super small. Much smaller than the size of McDonald's McNuggets.  But the chicken tasted great, was filling, and looked like real chicken meat (unlike McD's).  Their waffle fries tasted great with the ranch sauce too.  While eating, I had a change to peruse their entire menu, which had a lot of healthy options.  As I was leaving, the line to Chick-fil-A was almost out the door! (This was around 4pm)There is a lot of seating and the set up is very open.  They have many different size tables which even includes a communal table with stool seats.  The restrooms were clean and their door offers a no-hands touch handle! You'll have to see it to understand what I mean.  Service here was  really great!Make sure to grab some napkins before leaving if you take your food to go. They don't include it in your bag.

My first time at Chick-fil-A.  Big, bustling, crowded, lunchtime.  Many tables, but not many vacant.  The attractive cashier with the unexpected British accent--is that Brixton or Bermuda? --hands me my drink, but not my food.  "We'll bring it out to you when it's ready."  I start to walk away, then:  "Just stand over there where we can find you.  Next."A minute or two later, another young woman walks straight toward me and hands me a white paper bag.  I'm uncertain.  How does she know it's me?  "This is MY order, isn't it?  For 'Tom'?"  She gives me an angelic smile--or was that a Jonestown stare?--turns and walks away from me without saying a word.I wade into the crowd, scanning occupied table after table, until I find one open seat way at the end, by the door.  I sit, take a sip of my Dr. Pepper--it seemed like a Southern kind of drink to order--and nibble on my waffle fries.  The waffle fries are interesting, but not very good.  They're not crispy, they're not very hot, and they're limp.  Then I bite into the sandwich:  CHOMP! Num, num, num, num.Holy Hell, this tastes good!Now I thought the spicy chicken sandwich was a minimalist Creation--just chicken, bun, a couple of pickle slices....  THIS sandwich has lettuce, tomato, jack cheese...HEY!  Wait a minute!!!  This is a DELUXE spicy chicken sandwich.  I've been upgraded!CHOMP! Num, num, num, num.And then I hear it, in the distance, from the direction of the order counter on the other side of the room:  "Tom.....Tom....Tom?"They can't be calling ME, there MUST be another "Tom" in a crowd this big.  Shouldn't there?CHOMP! Num, num, num, num.Oh my Gosh!  I've taken the wrong order!!  (But it's an upgrade, not a downgrade, so I really can't complain.)  And now, someone who actually paid for this sandwich is giving Hell to the counter people for losing their order.CHOMP! Num, num, num, num. "Tom...Tom...Tom!"All those Christians behind the counter.  They all know I did it.  They are ACCUSING ME!!CHOMP! Num, num, num, num."Tom...Tom...TOM!!!"  I hear my name shouted across the room, over and over, louder and LOUDER.  They're calling me on purpose, to get me to confess my sin. CHOMP! Num, num, num, num.It's not my fault!  It's your stupid ordering system!  There wasn't a name or order number on my bag!   I asked the woman who handed me this white anonymous paper bag if it was for me, and she didn't say anything!  IT"S NOT MY FAULT!!!I'm going straight down into a lake of fire for this.*Burp*

Long line is intimidating but it moves fast. Lots of seating area, but also LOTS of people so inside and outside gets filled up fast. Love the chicken tenders and chicken nuggets...nuggets are small and go fast when you have a hungry bf!!! so we get both! fav sauces polynesian, and chik-fil-a sauce

By far the best chicken sandwich in the Chicagoland area. Their service is always fast, friendly, and helpful with any special needs. Even with long lines there never seems to be a dull moment in the clean, well organized restaurant.The Chick-fil-A sauce is great!
In love with the peach milk shake!!!The spicy chicken is just ok, the burger buns standard, but the shakes are AWESOME!

I'm so torn on my rating of you, Chick-Fil-A!First, your politics SUCK. like, hard core. But I realize that the piddly $9 that I gave you the other day doesn't make or break your campaign donations, and I know a full-on Karen C. boycott isn't going to change a thing.That being said, your chicken is DELICIOUS.This is the prettiest & most efficient Chick-Fil-A I've ever seen. You can't go wrong with sweet tea, chicken, waffle fries and Polynesian sauce. I'm also a girl that loves some creamy cole-slaw, so if you still have room, get that. Please stop being a$$holes to people I love so I can eat more of your Chikin.

Chicken all day everyday!!!!!! If you have never been to a Chick-Fil-A, you gotta try it. Simply amazing!! Best sauce is the chick-fil-a sauce. Very fast service, clean, the soap in the restroom smells amaze balls! P.S. All the staff have to say "My Pleasure" when you say "thank you" to them. Give it a try........

I was pleasantly surprised by the food and the atmosphere here! The inside is really nice. Love the LCD screen menus. I ordered the 3 piece chicken tender meal with fries. I really like that there is very little breading on the chicken. They are pretty small but good for the money. The fries were waffle cut, kind of salty but I liked them. The service was really fast. I was really surprised how modern the restaurant is. This place was constantly busy, I know it's the location. The bathroom needed to be cleaned a bit, I went at an off time so I was surprised it wasn't cleaner. They have milkshakes that look good, I love the clear glass, I was too full to try one this time. I will for sure be back!

I am a transplanted Atlanta girl and am THRILLED to have my Chick-Fil-A back.  I'm a die-hard Chick-Fil-A lover, I've even been to the original Dwarf House close to the Atlanta airport and have the keychain on my keys!  I went on opening night, which was super busy, but still extremely clean and the line went fast.  Every time since the staff has been friendly and polite.  The place is clean and the food is just as I remembered!  TASTY!!!!  Waffle fries are always hot and yummy and the seasonal peach shakes are definitely worth a try!  The cole slaw is good and I really like the new packages of sauces and ketchup...very handy little containers!  IT'S A FANTASTIC addition to Chicago!  Before I had to get my fixes when I went home, but now I can just pop over when the mood strikes...I love it!!!!  EAT MORE CHICKIN!!!

Chick-fil-a=AMAZING!It is about time one has opened in Chicago.The staff is Super Friendly and efficient.  I went the week after this new location opened.  The line was out the door, but don't let that fool you.  I waited no more than 10 minutes.  It moved extremely fast and they even passed out giftcards because the line was so long.  The space is HUGE, MODERN & CLEAN!!!I ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich and a Lemonade.  I would recommend these two items to any man, woman or child going they were DELICIOUS!The only disappointment is that the calorie count for these items together or individually is that extremely high.  But evey once in a while you need to INDULGE. :D

I've been dying to come here ever since it opened, and finally got the opportunity to this weekend.  Let's go with a symphonic version of the storywait wait waitwaitwait(okay, I can only play so many rounds of Angry Birds...)waitorderslurpwait"Sir, you're supposed to go the register that rung you up to get your food..."grabchompchompchompchompchomp(ahh, is that a REAL tomato and lettuce that's actually green and leafy?)CHOMPslurpslurp(what is this awesome ketchup packet?  you heinz geniuses!)crunch crunch chew(oh my god heaven is a waffle fry)chew chewtossAHHHHHHHHHH

I just want to say sorry Chick-fil-A.... I went in there today and I ordered the soup and waffle fries, cos I didnt have any money. And then the gentlemen who distributes the food accidently gave me a huge chicken sandwich and fries. IM SORRY. BUT IT WAS SOOOO GOOOOOOD. LOVE YOU GUYS. IM SORRY FOR THE SUCKER WHO WAS STUCK WITH THE SOUP EEEEEEHHEHEHEHEHEHEH

OH M GEEE! so glad they finally have one in chicago. ! had it 4 times this week already. thank u high metabolism for still keeping me skinny or else i wouldn't be eating here that frequently. i always get the #4 (spicy chicken delux) with a diet lemonade (diet only for the fact that they have less sugar in it...but its still pretty sugary). the WAFFLE FRIES are to die for!but sadly since their  very traditional southerners, they don't open on God's day a.k.a sundays and their also anti-gay supporters. yeah bummer. I'm a gay rights supporter, but I can't help the fact that chick-fil-a is so good...i guess I can't boycott it. :(*also their awesomely FASTTTT in giving u your food! *thumbs up* :)
Good waffle fries with cool ketchup packets.Super friendly staff is worth one additional star.Sandwiches were alright. Kind of expensive fot he size.
I really like this place.  But I don't feel like commenting on the food.I will say this...the flower on the table was a nice touch.  Especially since I ate here with another dude.  Bromance.

I was meaning to go since I have heard many people from work go there.  I went in today at 1:30pm and there was a line to the door. However, the wait was rather short. The restaurant is spacious and plenty of seats.  I ordered a spicy chicken with everything.  It was very tasty and filling. I also had a soup and side salad.  The veggies were fresh and delicious. Next time I will get an ice cream or milk shake.

I've been to both the Aurora location and now the Chicago Ave location and to be honest the only Chicken items I have tried are their strips.  Truth be told, I think the chicken strips at Hardees are better.  I like Chik-Fil-A's selection of dipping sauces, buffalo is my fave!  Their waffle fries are really good and the shakes are OUT OF THIS WORLD!  I had the cookies and cream with a little something extra and it was so thick I couldn't get any to come up through the straw for a little bit!  Once it did come up it was so yummy!The lines were not that bad - we went on a Saturday afternoon.  We were able to get a table right away and the staff was very friendly. The Chik-Fil-A staff were constantly making their rounds cleaning up tables, sweeping up, etc., which I appreciate as most fast food restaurants tend to get really nasty, really fast.  Would I return, sure why not?  if I am ever in that area in am craving some good fries and a shake I will definitely stop in!

ill workout an hour to eat the spicy chicken sandwich after. so worth it. maybe those workouts should be 2 hours1 star knocked off because the workers here aren't nice, compared to all other locations ive been to (ga, pa, in)

First time at a Chick-fil-A.  Good food, but greasy....I had to run to the bathroom half-an-hour after I ate here.  I guess my stomach's not a fan of the grease!  The culprit may have been the waffle fries.  Grease oozed out of them as they were folded over to dip into the ketchup.  I had the spicy chicken sandwich which was very tasty.  Not spicy enough for me of course, but it was good enough.  But that's why they have packets of hot sauce available, which I love (tabasco!).  Also, their dip and squeeze ketchup packets are great!    Service was fast and friendly.  I think I'd come back in a few months to try something else, but I wouldn't frequent the place.

My first Chick-fil-A experience.  Ever.  And it was great, I understand what all the fuss is about.  CFA is a good Fast food alternative, and that's "fast" with a capital ef.  The lunch rush was handled very efficiently.  There was plenty of seating, although some rude patrons started piling their trash on an adjacent table so my brother and I couldn't sit there.  My nine-member family needed a cheap, quick place to eat during our day in the city, and CFA was an excellent choice.

I hate this place and wish they never opened in Chicago.It was hard enough trying to fight off the freshman 15 with these jerks right around the corner from campus but now they have really done it! They are now walking distance from my apartment, tempting me with delicious delicious (2x) chicken sandwiches and waffle fries. Don't want a new addiction? Then better not order their Polynesian sauce.Don't get me started on the nuggets. Shut the front door before I tell you about the sweet tea. Mix the sweet tea with their fresh lemonade and just die and go to "Rubenesque" girl heaven. Gah, I hate this place!
The service was amazing and the food was good.  The spicy chicken sandwich with waffle fries definitely hit the spot.

I've been wanting to check out the Chick-fil-A in the Water Tower area, and so I finally had my chance last week. My friend and I came here for an early dinner before attending a show nearby. Fortunately the crazy lines have died down, but there was a good crowd while we were here on a midweek evening. The service was very fast and friendly too (I guess it's a Southern thing). I ordered a combo with deluxe chicken sandwich, waffle fries and pop. The breaded chicken patty was tasty and generous in size, and topped with lettuce, pickle, tomato and pepperjack cheese. My friend had the spicy version and said it had a bit of a kick. The waffle fries were also yummy and there were so many in the container that I was initially afraid that I would drop some of them. I admittedly chuckled when I saw the fast food place nearby touting its new chicken sandwich, as I cannot imagine that it would come close to the tasty Chick-fil-A. I told one of my buddies (who was raised in the South) and he was jealous that I had me some CFA.
The only real negative is that I tend to think I want Chik fil A when it's a Sunday.
This place is overhyped.  Come on, it's a chicken sandwich.  I admit, it was good and if I'm hungry and in the area I will get another one.  Not in a rush to get there though.

I feel really awkward being this amped to rate a fast food joint. But you have to understand that I haven't had Chick-fil-A since I was an 18 year old college student working at a Florida mall. And I haven't seen age 18 in a long...long time. It's just as I remember and that makes me happy. Bless you, waffle fries. Bless you for being in Chicago!

I absolutely LOVE this Chick-fil-A. I went to school in Florida and there wer Chick-fil-A's all over the place and I hated them. Mostly because I remember them being super salty. But this one is wonderful!!!Super fast service, the chicken isn't dry, the employees are friendly. I work downtown, and I've gone there almost every day for lunch.Definitely an A+++

When my coworkers heard that I've never been to a Chick Fil A, I swear their jaw hit the floor. I didn't really understand what i was missing until I went. Cool atmosphere and just amazing food. I like that the  menu is very simple, but there's still enough variation if you don't want to get the same thing every day. I couldn't find a chicken sandwich from a fast food place that I really loved. I usually only get burgers when I go to McDonalds, Wendys, BK and places like that. Chick Fil A has the best chicken sandwich that I've ever had from a fast food restaurant. Not only that, I love spicy chicken sandwiches and the way they make theirs is absolutely phenomenal. Great place, great food.

1. Delicious waffle fries2. Super friendly workers and it is very clean inside3. The ice in the drinks is that little pellet kind that is not too hard4. The chicken was juicy and deliciousA+ would eat again.

I'm from the South, and I really think that's all that needs to be said as far as a review goes.  But if you want me to get into the gory details:  I spent my first few years in Chicago without Chick-fil-A, and when I would visit my family and friends in VA, it wasn't pretty -- I'm talking one girl, ordering like three sandwiches, chicken nuggets, coleslaw, waffle fries, brownies, and my personal favorite 1/2 lemonade 1/2 Dr. Pepper, and then stuffing half of that into my mouth before my Momma could even get the car out of the parking lot... yeah, it's an event.But now I have a Chick-fil-A right off of the Red Line.  In fact, I can stroll right by the place, and NOT go in, just because I know it's there, and there's no rush, no panic, no ohmygawd I'm finally South enough to be driving by a Chick-fil-A but it's closed because it's Sunday...  Nope, this girl is just strollin' on by, with a satisfied smile, because there's a Chick-fil-A in town, and life is a-okay.

Very good Chicken sandwiches and waffle fries!The best casual/fast food chicken sandwich.  I went to one a while ago in Florida and when I saw this one downtown I had to go!  Anytime I an in the area I will stop by.

There is a lot of hype about this place. It's okay, nothing amazing. Prices are a tad pricey, but then again it is downtown Chicago. Due to the hype there are lines and chaos when it comes to ordering.

Okay, Chick-fil-A, your food is effing delicious and greasy and great for when you're hungover or PMSing, BUUUT your crazy religiosity is cramping my style. Not open on Sundays? EVER? Get real.
