What's that? Your company donates money to gay re-education programs to help rid people of their gay? That's dumb and I don't agree with it. My stomach and my brain don't agree on this one. Might as well avoid it all together...

Dear Chick-Fli-A, I really wasn't sure I was going to like you because I'm not a fast food person...but that ended quickly. As soon as I saw your tower of Heinz & Tabasco goodness, I was hooked. Did you know that those are my most two favorite things ever? Oh, you did... Soooooo, you made the stack bigger since I was coming? No?! Really you didn't? That's for everyone huh? Ahhh, you guys sure are sweet to do that for the packed restaurant at 9PM on a Monday. Who woulda thought that a fast food joint would be packed at 9PM on a Monday... Think no more, I now know the answer. You're breasts are juicy and your fries are waffley. You're a smooth SOB Chick-fil-A, and I will be back, pinky promise!xoxo, ChristineYour condiments #1 fan

Great food and a speedy process!  I can hop the bus, stand in line, get my food and get back to my office in 30 minutes - all because these guys are fast!I've never been disappointed with my choices here and they always get it right.  You just can't beat these guys for fast food.

I am impressed.The last time I had Chick-fil-A was in a food court mall in the deep south of the U.S.  Funny how they really classed up what normally is a regular fast food place everywhere else in the country.Still, I enjoyed the nicer decor and courteous, fast service.  Oh yeah, and the chicken sandwiches are still as delicious.  A bit pricey for a chicken sandwich, but then again, what isn't in downtown Chicago?Check it out!

Wow.  Great addition to Chicago.  Trumps the sketchy McDonald's next door by far.  What makes it so great is the excellent customer service, generous servings of tasty sauces, and a clean restaurant with a fast moving line.  The chicken is delicious of course, but it's a bit more on the pricey side.  I recommend the fries as well...though they could use some more time in the fryer and perhaps a dash more of salt, but hey, I am glad Chick-Fil-A is here.

good food, fast service, great dining area.  surprised to see how nice, clean, new, modern a fast food joint could be.  don't let the long lines intimidate you...they move quickly!  I only wish there were more locations around chicago. the polynesian sauce - yummy for fries.  it resembles McD's sweet and sour, but it's slightly different.

What a surprise! I walk out of the Chicago station and there is a chick-fil-a!  I am so glad Chicago finally got a Chick-fil-a and even more excited that it is right on between the L and the Mag Mile!For those of you not in the know this is perhaps the greatest fast food chain known to man fyi.  Get the chicken nuggets.

My friends have been raving about Chick-Fil-A for years.  I tried to go a location in Texas.  Sadly, to find it closed on Sundays. Then I heard a Chick-fil-A opened in Chicago...I made a bee line to find out what the hoop-lah was about.First impression...MASSIVE lines out the door.    The lines go FAST, so don't let them scare you away. Food...wow!!  Impressed with the original buffalo chicken sandwich, crispy waffle  fries, and EXCELLENT CHICKEN TENDERS.  The quality of the salads was impressive (for a fast food place).the Chick-fil-a HOUSE sauce was yummy. (there are a ton of choices for sauce, you need to ask).  their sauce packages are cute and fun for dipping.  My friend thinks the SWEET TEA is one of the best.  I want to try the ice cream dessert next time.I was with my 2 young kids...which can be hairy when your eating in public.  one of the managers came by to see if we needed anything. Bonus points for Chick-fil-a!Clean facility, efficient, lots of seating, family friendly, cheap!Quality fast food...can't wait to go back for more!  2 thumbs up for Chick-fil-A (which is just a fun name to say...=)

This is the first time I've been to Chick-fil-a after being downtown a afew times since it's been opened.  I had some time to spare before my appointment, so I figured I'd give it a try. I first walked in and it was busy !!!!  I finally got to the counter to order and just ordered a chicken sandwich with the waffle fries and a soda. The sandwich was good, cooked to perfection ! I just added some mustard, for that extra kick. I loved the waffle fries !!!Seeing as it was my first time, I will definitley come back and try something different.

I didn't want to love this place, but my boss introduced me to Chick-fil-A in Atlanta, and I can't help myself from wandering into the Chick-fil-A near my work. I've had their chicken sandwich and the chicken tenders before. The tenders were good, but the sandwich didn't blow me away. I thought it was very plain. So when I was looking to get a quick dinner before class, I ordered the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich to go. They put the sandwich into a little black takeout container. When I opened up the container approximately 15 minutes later, the sandwich was still very much in tact. The sandwich wasn't smashed and flattened like they are when you order McDonalds' McChicken sandwich. Wow, I was impressed. Then when I bit into my sandwich, wow, it's actually spicy! No offense to Americans, but I usually find that most American restaurants don't understand spice. I was prepared to add some hot sauce to my sandwich, but I didn't need to. Pepperjack cheese was a good choice for this sandwich (though I have to admit that I'm really not fond of American cheese at all). So now I'm torn between supporting Chick-fil-A for their food or boycotting them because I disagree with their stance on marriage equality. Will my fellow queers understand if I want an occasional spicy chicken sandwich from Chick-fil-A?

Thank you.  Thank you God for answering my prayers.  Whenever I'm in Indiana, Texas, Pennsylvania, I find the nearest Chick-fil-A and make my hosts stop. And I jump up and down with glee to get my fave chicken.  And now, we have our very own location.  It's a warm, fuzzy feeling.I have to admit, I was SUPER impressed that the line was out the door both times I've been in since they opened and my total wait was under 5 minutes.  That's incredible.  They were prepared for the rush and acted accordingly.  Thank you for thinking ahead and for the friendly, helpful staff.  The key to Chick-fil-A?  It's fast food without the greasy, cheap fast food feel.I am a fan of the nuggets and the original chicken sammich.  I'm crushing on those cute lil pickles.  Yummy!The only reason they get 4 stars:  I really hate that the chain isn't open on Sundays.  Boooooo!And... I really wish they had a drive thru over there.  Oh well.  Not a deal breaker.

I went the first day they opened and waited in the long-ass line for my chick-fil-a. The last time I had it was in Indiana while I was in school and I sure do miss it. I made sure to ask for extra Polynesian sauce with my chicken because it's delicious with the waffle fries too! One thing I did notice about the employees is that they are super-fast: at taking your order, taking your money, giving you change, giving you food, it's all fast! I bet they make them drink 5-hour energy's before they start their shift. All in all, I've been back 3 more times and will be back for more! :)

Chick-fil-A sauce. If you've never had it before, your taste buds are going to explode when you try it (it's a scientific fact). I ordered a #1, the original chicken sandwich and waffle fries, and it was the best fast food meal I've had in a while. Daddy likes. It's really dangerous because it's downtown by my school, so I may gain 50 pounds if I keep destroying this place. So many sauces. So many chicken options. The chicken is just freaking slamming. You need to make this happen. Boom Chick-A Boom Boom!

I was hoping that Chick fil A would come to Chicago someday and I'm so glad it's here!  Any place that makes teenagers say things like "how can I help you?" and "my pleasure" in a cheerful and honest way has to get 5 stars, right?I love their chicken nuggets and chargrilled chicken sandwich.  It's also great that you have more than just fries to choose from as your side.  You can't go wrong with a little fruit cup!

I have been a huge fan of Chick-fil-A since my college days in Atlanta.Ah the waffle fries.  Ah the lemonade.  Ah the chicken sandwiches??  Hmmm.... My chicken sandwich from this location was very bland.  I always order the chargrilled deluxe chicken sandwich, but this one wasn't all that great.  I only ended up eating half of the sandwich.Perhaps this location is a bit off.

Before I write this, please note that I am biased to anything chicken. With that said, my faves are the nuggets and the spicy chicken deluxe sandwich, meals of course with a sweet tea =)Always use bbq and polynesian sauce for the nuggets and they sure are delicious.The Spicy Chicken Deluxe is my #2 because of the portion and just the right amount of spice.Thank you to the chicken gods for bringing a Chick-fil-A closer to home =)

Dear Chick-Fil-A Nuggets,I love you. I really do. Do you love me? I'd like to think so as you certainly seem to.  What's that, my love? How can I tell? Oh, I can tell because of your seductive cow advertisements that seem to incessantly entice me to come hither over for greatness in the form of chicken nuggets glazed in polynesian and honey mustard sauce. Oh yeah, don't be silly, my love --  you know I can never decide on what sauce to toss you in. Everything tastes so decadent on you.  I really love that you bring your friends (aka waffle fries) to celebrate our love with us. So delicious and thoughtful. If I could only bundle you up and take you with me wherever I move across the country, our love would last forever. Wait -- who am I kidding?! You're the love of my life. There are no boundaries with love, my love. That's right - it's you and me forever.Faithfully yours,DH

Truly the best fast food chain I have ever been to.   Fast, friendly service and clean restaurants every time I've been there. I'm a fan of the #1 Original combo with waffle fries but you really can't go wrong with anything here.  Finally, you have come to Chick a go!

So, after hearing all of this hype about Chick-Fil-A, I decided to check it out for myself.  I tried the Original Deluxe minus the cheese and pickle... basically it was a breaded chicken breast with lettuce and tomato.  With my chicken sandwich, I the had fries (waffle-cut) and an oreo shake.  I can pretty much sum up my review in one word... Meh.  However, if one word isn't enough for you, then read on...The entire ordering system in there is an organized chaos... once you find the line, an employee will direct you to the next available cashier (each cashier raises their hand when ready for the next customer), the cashier will ask you for your name then ask for your order.  Once your order has been placed, you step back and wait for another employee to come out from behind the counter with your order whilst hollering your name.  It was crazy busy in there, but I was in and out surprisingly fast.Now... my shake looked pretty, but turned out to be a little on the watery side.  I like THICK shakes.  The fries were decent, but could use some kind of seasoning in my opinion.  They actually messed up my sandwich order.  I asked for no cheese and no pickle, but the cashier put extra pickle.  I guess I could've noticed had I been paying attention to the screen, but I was just trying to get out of there and away from the crowd.  So the chicken breast itself was decent, but again lacked in flavor.  I had to remove the pickles myself.  The bun is too small and squishy.  I think it was a combination of the flimsy bun, the heat of the chicken, the soupy tomatoes, and pickle juice... but my sandwich was falling apart as I ate it.Oh!  A co-worker of mine ordered a chicken caesar wrap (when I ordered it, the cashier asked me what kind of dressing I wanted... duh!).  It's a pre-made wrap, with the dressing on the side.  Defeats the purpose... don't you think?Overall, I didn't think Chick-Fil-A was anything to write home about.  I was hoping for some flavor.  Nothing spectacular.

What else can you say...Chick-fil-A in CHICAGO.  that is awesome.  everyone is so kind, so energetic.  you can feel the youth and excitement working there.  love the decor, the flat screen upfront that gives local upcoming events and twitter posts.  the line is always out the door but it is worth it.  i just wish ya'll were open on sundays.

First time eating at Chick-fil-A and it was a good experience. It was packed, but the lines moved fairly quickly. I waited no more than a few seconds for my name to be called.Headed outside to sit in the outdoor area to eat and people watch. I gobbled up my grilled chicken sandwich and it was ok. I would have to try it next time without the cheese and bacon. The chicken is flavorful by itself, so there really is no need to dress it up or drown it in ketchup. My fries were a bit soft, but tasted really good, so next time I'll ask for crispy fries.I also ordered 6 pieces of nuggets for later in the day, and I have to say I couldn't stop laughing when I opened up the container. The nuggets are super tiny, but very tasty, and served well as a snack. If your hungry, go for a bigger amount of nuggets. (The Polynesian Sauce is really fantastic!)I washed it all down with a nice cup of ice cold sweet lemonade. Overall, their flavorful tender chicken is the draw to this place, and I'm impressed---smiling employees is always a plus. For a fast food joint specializing in an affordable chicken menu, I'll come back again...not too soon as their menu offerings are not the healthiest, but it is a great place to cheat on any diet.

Did anyone else notice all the young white kids who work here?I love their simple delicious chicken sandwich and am a sucker for the novelty of waffle fries, so it sucks that I 100% disagree with the owner's politics. However, they do have the CUTEST Heinz ketchup packets - squeeze or dip. 4 stars for pure deliciousness and SUPER FAST service and friendliness.

Awesome for fast food chicken. Went at 2pm and the place was packed. The sandwich you could tell was made very quickly and not much love had been put into it, however, it was still Chick-fil-a delicious. The service was fast and friendly and the the store was very clean. We will be back for sure!

Goodness this place is delicious.  Give me the spicy chicken sammie complete with ketchup dipping packets and I promise I will never go to McDonalds for another chicken sandwich ever again!Oh, and the staff is super friendly!

Let me be up front about this. Before this store opening up, I hadn't tasted CFA in about...5 years. Before that, it was probably 10 years.  The taste of bread, chicken and pickle is so distinct in my memory, that when I eat it now, I can feel my childhood mall around me.There is a halcyon taste to their chicken nuggets. There's little chunks of kingfisher sprinkled into every deep fryer basket full.I went 3 times in the first week and I'm only slightly embarrassed.ok, so this place can get really crowded, but they're reasonably quick. i kinda wish there was a smoother pickup system. you can get a sammy for $3-$4.politics. sigh. let's just say that the opening day of chick fil a had me VERY conflicted. I was considering camping out overnight. i also had the longest facebook post thread of my life because of chick fil a. I'm not gonna lie. I have serious reservations about eating it. but it's so good!

I wanted to hate this place because I despise the politics, homophobia, and right-wing religious fervor of their owners.  But I tried it anyway.3 stars is the best I'd give any fast food place, and this is definitely the best service I've ever experienced in this type of place.  Despite a long line, my order was taken and filled quickly.  (I wish I'd noticed that the deluxe sandwich has cheese on it, cuz I'd rather it didn't.  Next time I'll ask them to 86 it.)  Half-and-half on sweet vs. unsweet tea - no problem.  When the wandering dude asked me how everything was, I complained about the fries not being crisp.  No problem - back in a few minutes with hot, crisp fries just out of the fryer; and by the way - next time ask for them well done and you'll get them the way you like it.  (Apparently some people prefer squishy fries - go figure.)  I was a bit intimidated by the lack of obvious table space, but found a spot to sit without much trouble.  And yes, the staff must get paid by the smile!As for the sandwich, it was OK.  I'd like it crisper.  I'd prefer it without cheese, and would rather have to ask for cheese than remember to say "no cheese."   Especially this cheese, think Kraft slices.  Not worth the calories.  I like having the sandwich arrive with no sauces so I can add what I want.   I like the special Chick-fil-a sauce.   I wish the bun was toasted cuz the bun gets kind of mushy once you add sauce. I don't know about the guy who couldn't find the ketchup packets - probably because these are a different shape and size than normal.To those complaining about the prices.  A deluxe sandwich, fries, and soft drink for less than $7 before taxes - I don't really know where you can do better.Noise level of the place when busy: conversation-challenging.They seem to have a good selection of non-sandwich options, and I'll try one of those next time.

When I went to college in Arkansas, Chick-fil-A was late night gas station chicken after drunken club antics. I then started to see this particular chain show up in airports. Each experience I had was quite subpar. This past Wednesday I had a few drinks at Vertigo and was in need of some food. I thought about going to McDonalds on Chicago Ave to grab a Big Mac until I remembered this joint just opened a few weeks ago. A few people were telling me the food is the beezneez, but again I thought back to my prior experiences. I walked in and the line wasnt bad. I ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich combo. Lots of spice and flavor was involved. The waffle like fries definitely hit the spot as well. Great space also....I can now say I am a fanOutside seating is available as well

From west coast and this place and jack in the box not only are the best fast food but the best commercials.  Went last weekend and had a great spicy chicken sandwich.  Wow this place is packed.  Has to be the most productive branch

So they finally brought Chick-fil-A to Chicago. And this location is brand spanking new. The interior is very nice and clean, and the wait staff is ridiculously polite/attentive. I think they are trying to create a good impression, so it remains to be seen how long this will last. Upon entering, there was a greeter that was handing out menus (!!) to people in line. You know, just in case the giant flat screen menus on the wall weren't enough. The place was very crowded as well, which is understandable given the hype surrounding Chick-fil-A (downside: it can be tough to find a seat, which is almost unheard of for a fast food place). Ordering was painless and the food arrived quickly. There was also a manager-type guy who walked around to literally every table and asked how we were doing and if we needed any refills. It was a nice gesture, but started to get kind of creepy after awhile. I'm here for fast food, not for fine dining!The food was very good, but pricey for fast food. Chick-fil-A has a reputation for being a very good fast food place, and now I understand why. Definitely worth checking out.

I'm from Alabama and have been addicted to Chick-Fil-A for many years.Most everything they make is delicious, but my typical meal is an original chicken sandwich or chicken strips, with fries and a lemonade.  The polynesian sauce is great, even for dipping the fries.  Beware though, each of those packets is around 100 calories.  In fact, typical meal is over 1000 calories, so rid yourself of any delusions that Chick-Fil-A is "healthy".  It may be better for you than McDonald's, but it's still fast food.The fact that this location is always busy is a plus, because the food has been fresh every time I've eaten there.  Good luck finding a seat, though...Don't be intimidated if you walk in to find a long line, they are incredibly efficient at keeping the line moving.  I walked in to find a line of 20 people, but still had my food in just a few minutes.You may call me boring for this embarrassing admission, but I must confess:  Chick-Fil-A is now my favorite restaurant in Chicago.

I had to give Chick-fil-A a try because I know someone who is obsessed with them and has driven to the city of Fairfield from the Bay Area just to satiate her cravings.  Since this spot was on my way to Wrigley, my friends and I decided to give it a shot. First thing I noticed was that there were at least ten cash registers open and ready to take our order.  Since it was still breakfast time, I got the original chicken sandwich on biscuit along with the sausage, egg, and cheese on ciabatta.  My biscuit was a bit dry but the chicken itself was tasty.  Much more flavor and taste than KFC.  In terms of the ciabatta sandwich, I didn't like how the ciabatta worked as a breakfast sandwich.  Perhaps it could be a texture thing but I wasn't feeling it.  I now know that muffins, bagels, and biscuits are now the way to go.The manager there came around to check on us and see if we were enjoying our food.  He even offered some directions in case we needed to get to the game.  I'm not sure he does this for all of his customers but we obviously were tourists from the Giants gear we were wearing.  But points to him nonetheless as I've never gotten greeted by a manager at any fast food establishment at anytime in the past.If there ever was a Chick-fil-A to open in the SF Bay Area, then I'd hope that they make it similar to his location in terms of its size and the food it produces.

My coworker and I pretty much ran here on our lunch break and it was so worth it!  Service is excellent and quick and the food was fresh.  I had the original chick-fil-a sandwich and waffle fries and it was delicious, but will try a different sandwich next time.  On our way back to work, we got a vanilla soft serve cone.  I was happy for the rest of my shift :)

Food: Good.Service: So high-touch that it's bordering on creepy. If you've been there, you know that's true. What do I do when someone comes up and essentially begs me to allow him to refill my cup? What do I do when he comes back AGAIN???

I've been a Chick-fil-A fan ever since I was first introduced to it on a roadtrip through the south two years ago. If you like chicken and you like fast food, you gotta try it. I've been a loyal McDonald's customer ever since I can remember, but once Chick-fil-A takes over Chicago, I don't see myself ever going back.

I had my first ever Chick-fil-A sandwich here when they were passing out free ones to promote the opening...I was impressed by not only how delicious it was, but by how fabulous the marketing department was at promoting the grand opening! So naturally I had to go and visit on opening day. The lines were crazy but I've never seen a more pleasant, efficient staff at a fast food place. You definitely get a feeling for their southern hospitality. The chicken is delish and fresh and the chicken nuggets are the best fast food ones around, especially when you dip them in their signature Polynesian sauce. And better yet? You can dip them in as many tubs of sauce as you like, they were all out and waiting to be grabbed!

The food is awesome!  I was super intimidated by the huge line that wrapped around the corner and down the block.  The line only took seven (7) minutes!  Don't be intimidated by the huge lines!!!  They move it quick and your food is ready in seconds.  Once I was seated their staff offered to get us more sauce and refill our drinks!  This place is the BOMB!  It might be the best lunch spot in the city.
Very excited about this atlanta import. I have been working down south for some time and my coworkers have convinced me to sign on--pointer: indeed the strawberry milkshakes are the best!

Exclamation point!During my first-ever visit to a Chick-fil-A, I approached the counter to see workers baring their teeth at me.  "A show of dominance?" I thought.  But the corners of their mouths were upturned.  This was... a smile.A smile?  Don't these people know they work in a fast food restaurant?  I was immediately suspicious.I put in my order and the woman offered me a wide array of sauces, including Buffalo.  For free.  Bonus sauce for free?  Curious.I sat down and enjoyed a lovely spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries.  These fries occasionally had potato skin on them.  And they weren't horrific rigid potato shards like you'd get at McDonald's.  They were soft.  Edible.  And, dare I say... delicious.I looked around the restaurant to see small vases with flowers at nearly every table.  It's like I was on "Punk'd" or something.  This was a fast food restaurant.  But none of the workers was acting like it was a fast food restaurant.As I got up to leave, an employee immediately offered to take my garbage.  What?  What madness is this?  Are they trying to get me to join some sort of cult?  No one is this nice.  Look at the dead-eyed layabouts shuffling behind the counter at the "Rock 'n' Roll" McDonald's.  That's fast food.  That is the terrifying, empty world I expect when I order a quick meal.So I am seriously skeptical of a fast food restaurant that has excellent food, friendly workers and a clean atmosphere.  There must be something sinister at work.  I will go back to investigate again... and again... and again...

Yay!  So glad Chik-fil-A has opened in the city.  Now I don't have to schlep myself out to Wheaton for my cravings.  The location is decent - kinda off the touristy path, still in the Gold Coast and close to the red line.  The space is good - lots of tables inside and a few outside as well.Food - they haven't changed one bit.  I loved their spicy chicken breakfast biscuit.  To the cows of the world - you've been saved.

OMG. Really the most delicious Chicken Sandwich that you will ever have. The place is pretty big. Thank goodness! Because this place is hella popular. Try the freshly shaken lemonade and dip your waffle fries in Polynesian sauce. They are closed on Sundays so plan accordingly. Right now, I think all of the corporate training people are still running the joint so service is impeccable. We'll see how it transitions when the Chicago employees take over. TRY THIS PLACE! Hopefully they will continue to open more in the area.

So I went back here a few days later to see how the restaurant is doing now that the grand opening has settled a bit (or maybe because I just had the craving for their chicken).Anyway, I got the chicken deluxe sandwich this time (last time were the tenders) and it was excellent.  It was less filling than the tenders, but still very good, tasty, and overall cooked perfectly.The service was still good and very fast.  I saw several staff members walking around asking if customers needed refills, which is so not typical of a fast food restaurant.  Imagine if McDonalds did that!One thing that I noticed, though, was that they kept the ketchup behind the counter this time.  Last night they had a container out in the open by the drinks.  But I guess because their ketchup packets were 3x larger than the standard packet and really cool/cute looking, they decided to hide them to cut down on costs/waste.  The other sauces were still kept by the drinks.  So far, so good! I'd definitely go again.

The only reason I'm taking off a star is because I do not approve of their religious background and many of their political stances.  Additionally, I'm not extremely keen on giving a 5 star review for a fast food place, which is what this place is, first and foremost.That being said, I was extremely impressed with the speed of service, so as far as fast food places go, these guys have it in the bag.  It's especially impressive, seeing as how new they are, but I guess there's not much of a happy medium for new places; they either start off great and get worse as the employees get more comfortable, or they start off slow and get better as the employees get more comfortable.I was merely walking to the bus stop thinking about what I wanted to pick up for lunch when I ran into Chick-fil-A.  I've always loved fast food, and I won't deny it, so I jumped at the chance to try a place that's well known elsewhere but new in Chicago.  When I walked in and saw that the place was PACKED and had a line almost to the door, I almost turned around and walked back out, but I figured, what else do I have to do today?  Good thing I did, because less than 5 minutes later, I was walking out with my food.  The line took less than two minutes and I hadn't even put my debit card back in my wallet before my name was being called.The sandwich was not much different than most other fast food places, but it was still tasty.  My favorite thing was the huge rack over by the take out area that was FILLED with to go sauces.  Being so used to McDonalds, which does not hesitate to charge you for any condiment you want other than ketchup, I was thrilled with this.  I got to take home ranch, bbq, honey mustard AND "Chick-fil-a sauce"  (pretty similar to honey mustard) for my food without having to pay a quarter for each one and without having to inconvenience anyone.  Excellent.  Next time I'm waiting for the bus or walking down Chicago I will definitely be back in for a sandwich.

I don't get what the big whoop is all about with this place. Reminds me of the mystique surrounding Krsipy Kreme. I tried 'em before and i thought "oh, they taste like donuts."Same goes for Chick Fil A. "oh, tastes like fast food chicken"Whatever. As for their anti-gay stance, it's corporate; not just an isolated franchisee's decision. If you want to support that kind of thing, have at it. But i'd rather eat crap than give my money to bigots that hide behind religion.news.change.org/stories/…

I've first tried Chick-fil-A about 2 years ago... up north near Milwaukee area? I was excited that they were finally here because I have to say that their waffle fries are really delish!Today, I ordered 3 sandwiches to go for us.Our total order was almost $19 total.Very nice and friendly staff kindly guide you to make the line move quickly...Order comes out pretty fast!I ordered the original chicken sandwich meal with the lemonade.The lemonade was way too sweet for me.Maybe I'll try the unsweetened tea next time?Spicy chicken Sandwich definitely has a kick! Grilled Chicken Sandwich was just alright. Unfortunately, it wasn't as tasty as their original, but then again, how can you beat deep fried chicken?I liked how they used some sort of whole wheat looking bun for the grilled chicken sandwich. I wonder if we can make any bun substitutions for the other sandwiches.I'm not sure why the Grilled Chicken sandwich was in a styrofoam box, where as the other 2 crispy sandwiches were in a foil lined bag.Strawberry milkshake was pretty decent. It wasn't too sweet and didn't taste fake. Also had real strawberry bits in them. I don't normally drink milkshakes, so I didn't have anything to compare it to. Downside of carrying out was that the the buns get a little soggy from being packaged up too long...They have the condiment bar to the side so you can pick out the sauces of your choice to your content. But be aware that majority of their sauces have high-fructose corn syrups and preservatives in them. I'll probably come back again, but will plan on eating it there to avoid the soggy buns.

Although I'm not a fan of the company's conservative view points ... I am a fan of the food, and for the volume this place gets, it was impressive that I was through the line in 5 minutes, placed two different orders, and found a table with no problems.  Plus, everyone was super nice, and a nice young lady came and refilled my drink for me.

They're doing a great job so far. Even if the line is out the door, it only takes about 4 minutes to get to the front. After you order, it takes about 4 seconds to get your food. Awesome service and everyone is really friendly.The place is still clean (but it's still new too). The food is great, especially as far as fast food goes. Get a #1 and some Chick-fil-a sauce. YummmmmDon't forget...closed on Sundays.

2 1/2 stars.  I think the hype exceeds the truth.  Everyone is very friendly and welcoming when you walk in.  I would love to see in a few months if it's still the same.  The food was fair.  We ordered the combo 1 and the combo 7.  Combo 1 is their original fried chicken sandwich, an order of waffle fries and a soda.  Combo 7 is the grilled chicken, fries and soda.  The fried sandwich was of course delicious...I mean what isn't good fried???  Perfect spices but it looks so pathetic on a bun with two pickles...nothing else.  Yes, you get to choose from a bevy of sauces to put on it but I still think it would be nice to include a piece of lettuce, tomato and maybe a slice of onion.  The grilled sandwich I would pass on.  The flavor of the chicken was good but it was definitely a rubbery piece of chicken. The biggest disappointment were the fries.  I love a good waffle fry but these were way under cooked and not very hot.  Maybe because they just opened and they were very crowded that they were trying to get the food out a little too fast.  Should I go back again, I would definitely tell them to make my fries well done.

Writing an update as it has officially opened (I wrote the first review to fill out their address/phone number/website/opening date for them since I didn't see them on Yelp yet).  Right as I walked in around 1pm on a weekday for lunch, I could see it was packed and was a tad worried it would be a long line to get our food and a table.  To my surprise, the line moved fast because there were a TON of registers.  Right after I paid, she told me to wait to the side for my food but before I even walked that far my food was ready!  All the sauces are good (if I had to choose I think my favorite would be the Polynesian)...and I love how the ketchup packets are squeeze OR dip.We were lucky and some seats opened up next to the window.  I was impressed that they even paid attention to the little details.  Every table has a real plant or flower centerpiece.  Nothing extravagant, but it was a nice little touch that you don't see at most fast food restaurants.  I also saw some employees walking around with cleaning wipes, so I feel assured that they're keeping the tabletops clean.The nuggets and waffles fries were even better than I remembered...probably because the food never sits there for very long since there are so many customers!  Their daily made-from-scratch freshly squeezed lemonade is good as well, and some of their employees even walk around and offer to take your trash and refill your beverage!Amazingly nice staff, clean and nicely decorated, and great quality fast food.

First time trying this place and hear all about them through twitter from various people around the states. I had their char-broiled chicken sandwich w/ lettuce, tomato, pickle and honey bbq sauce and it was very tasty. Especially for a fast food chain like Chick-fil-A, I wouldn't mind going back. But I did let them know that their honey bbq sauce, ketchup and bbq sauce all had HFCS and would love to see them eliminate that from their sauces. The service was fantastic so don't hesitate waiting in line it was sooooo worth it.

On my first visit to Chick-fil-a Watertower I was greeted with: Loud applause and cheering, friendly smiles directing me where to stand, a cookie sample stuffed in my hand, and a menu offered; you would have thought I had just finished running a race, not that I was going to go eat some chicken.  But that just made the experience even better!Only having briefly visited this fast food joint in a different state, I wasn't sure what to expect with this downtown location.  I must say I am very impressed with how efficient and friendly this location is.  There are employees everywhere you turn, literally, I think Chik-fil-a's new location may help decrease the unemployment in Chicago with how many workers they have.  Both times I have been here (Yes I've been here twice in the last two days, don't judge me) my food was ready by the time I had finished putting my money away and was given to me with a genuine smile. Pretty much everything is good, you can't really go wrong with fried chicken, but I think the Spicy Chicken Deluxe is the best.  I also love that they have a very organized sauce station where you can choose what sauces and how many you like.The cookies and cream milkshake or the chocolate chip cookies are a sweet way to finish your meal.  I think Chick-fil-a and I are off to a beautiful and fattening friendship!

Whereas there's not too much you can do to ruin the food, I was very unimpressed with the service. Every other Chick-fil-A I have been to, the service is what gets me. At this location I felt like a cow in a stockyard. The guy at the register didn't make eye contact; after he swiped my card he failed to even speak to me again. No "thank you," didn't tell me where to wait for my food, just called out "next guest!" in my ear and allowed the next person to push me out of the already crowded register area. Say thanks at least and tell me where the dipping sauces are hidden behind some random pillar in the dining room. And the staff "working" the dining room could take some tips from their smaller sister stores. Talk to people and don't have a look on your face like you're slave labor in a sixteenth century Turkish prison. I'll be back for the food because I'm an addict, but the customer service here is horrendous.

Restaurant ReviewThe craze has finally hit chicago! I still can't believe the cult following behind chick-fil-a. I have now officially tried it twice in my life and can say that it is definately better than a lot of other fast food options. We were in line for dinner during the grand opening and was suprised by the efficiency of the staff. I was expecting to be in line for 30 minutes, but I walked right up and ordered with the friendly staff. My food came in less than 1 minute which is a plus/minus. The spicy chicken burger deluxe had a healthy size piece of chicken with fresh garnish and cheese. The only downside to the speed that day was the temperature of the chicken. The chicken was lukewarm and likely had been waiting to be served for a short bit of time, but the chicken had just the right amount of spicy. Another positive, is the waffle fries which always hit the spot! Great job on opening day.Pro- quick service, fresh/good quality food, good flavors, friendly staffCon- the chicken patty was lukewarm..., hopefully it will be better once the massive crowds die downHidden deal- management was passing out coupons for free breakfast items

FINALLY! Was headed to lunch when I spotted a guy with a paper bag and big styrofoam cup emblazoned with their logo and knew where I had to go. Waffle fries, the best classic chicken sandwich you can find in the fast food business, and awesome dipping sauces (Polynesian, honey mustard, BBQ, etc). Fast food so good that people will put up with it being closed on Sundays and a homosexual ex-roomie would nosh on it regardless of whatever their evangelical founder has to say. Now I no longer I have to suffer heartburn from wolfing down this rare delicacy so fast on my visits home to GA.

It's Chick Fil A, nuff said, now only if they were open on Sunday.   Also if you order the grilled chicken you are a moron.Also I noticed some people commenting on Chick Fil A's recent controversy regarding the LGBT community.   I believe this was a Franchise owner in PA that contributed money to these organizations and don't necessarily think you should rank them 1 star when yelp is more about ranking the actual specific restaurant.   Go rank the PA Chick Fil a one star.  This specific Chick Fil a had great service, the food was ready within minutes and was very good for fast food standards.
A haiku:I support gay rightsfreedom, respect, toleranceBut these NUGGETS, MAN

This is OFFICALLY the FTR of the first Chick-fil-A in the city as it is not even open yet. I was able to attend yesterday as I work in the neighborhood and they had a pre-opening of sorts for local businesses. Large, clean facilities. Friendly staff. This location will be jam packed on a daily basis. It's still fast food, but is certainly a higher quality fast food. And I totally respect them sticking to their beliefs and being closed on Sundays. But they need to stop with the hating on the gays. Not cool.

I love Chick-fil-a!!  I'm from the dirty south so I've missed it oh so much!  I was so excited to see it opening so close to me.A few nights ago, after leaving the bars at 2 am, I was walking by and passed this location.  There were people (managers? owners?) inside so I waved and one of the guys came out to say Hello and said to come back on June 16th for their grand opening.  How nice of him.  I love them already.Also, I have seen the cows walking around and they were giving out free chicken sandwiches.  I'm a nugget gal myself and loooove the waffle fries.  Oh and the oreo milkshakes - delishhhhh.Okay, so this location isn't exactly open, but I love them already (I hope it doesn't turn shady like some of the other places on Chicago Ave.) and I can already tell they're going to have great customer service.

CHICK-FIL-A! OMG!!! The only reason i'm saying 4/5 stars is because all Chick-Fil-A's are closed on Sundays.  And i feel like every time i've gone on a journey for Chick-Fil-A, it's always Sunday... but maybe thats how they got me  hooked. Cause this chicken is better than crack!
Chik-fil-A, I love you.Thank you SO much for coming to the city!

I give Chick Fillet a AUTO 4 stars because they are a CHRISTIAN company and do not worship SATAN like "Starbucks".  Also, the CHICKEN is very MOIST and tasty.  But I take OFF a star because they LIED to me and told me when I CLICKED the button my food would be ready when I ARRIVED.  FALSE WITNESS!  I stood there for 20 MINUTES!  You need to stop letting these DELIVERY companies use the restaurant.  The CHILDLESS KARENS can get off the COUCH and get their own DAMN FOOD!  Or maybe DIET!

I stopped here to order some chicken for takeout. We will eat it with my wife at our house. I'm lucky that there are few customers inside and no hassle to wait for my order. I only ordered fried nuggets. This order took 8 minutes before it was served to me. The packaging was good. After half an hour I'm at my house and give the nuggets to my wife. We eat it after I change my clothes. My wife loves chicken because of its crispiness. She also likes the flavor of it. She said that it seasoned well. For me the only good thing is the skin because it's currency. I don't like the chicken since it's hard and too dry but its flavor was good. I just only give 4 stars to this place.
This chick fil a HIT. They were quick w it too. Chick fil a for the gays!!!!! They gave extra nuggets too :)))

Horrible Customer service the own manager Rosa or rose had handed my little sister her refunded change with aggression due to me sending her back due to a mix up how dare anyone receive a customer like that especially a 14 year old who was just listening to her older sister came back sad and THE OWN MANAGER never had a bad experience with any chick-Fil-a until I came across this location and my food was Cold at that never returning here again

I asking for a small sample of their sugar-free lemonade and the Manager told the cashier no she  was very rude i never had it before I didn't wanna purchase it and then return it back because I didn't like it    .

I like their chicken sandwich and that is what I just literally ordered from my last visit. I have been here for a lot of times and there would always be a long line in the drive thru. I think the longest time I waited was a bout half an hour, it was understandable because a lot of people go in here and I really wanted their food so I waited for that long. . It is not the establishment fault  if I waited longer because before I went in the drive thru, I could see that there is a long line  and I still chose to wait for my turn. Their food is really good but if you cannot wait and does not have a patience to then this place is not for you.

Undercooked nuggets - again!!  I was really excited when this location opened, but this is now the second time I've received undercooked nuggets here.  I got an eight piece nuggets and almost got sick when I bit into mine and they were undercooked and gross (chewy). I know they go through a lot of nuggets here, but if chicken is the one thing you do, donut well.  This is the second time I've had this at this location.

The WORST SERVICE ever! I came here as a grubhub driver for a customer that placed an order at 11:33am today and upon arriving at 11:46am I asked one of the employees if they can confirm this order and he said they might be still working on it have a seat it should be out. I waited.. 10 minutes passed I asked another employee I believe his name was Jamie and I asked him can he check on the status of this order he said if it isn't out yet they are still working on it.. another 10 mins passed still nothing 10 minutes turned into 20 mins that turned into 35 mins and I asked Jamie once again and he said if it's a big order then they might still be working on it. The order was for (4) 30ct nuggets and (8) large French fries. Not one time did Jamie look on the screen or anything to confirm that the order was in queue so I asked Jamie if I can speak to a manager his words were "they ain't here" so I asked someone else if anyone can hear me "Is there a manger here?" A Latino woman walked up and said yes may I help you I explained to her I have been waiting here for 35 mins for this order I show her the details on my phone she looks up the order on the register and says oh I see it here let me process the order and push it through the queue meaning it hasn't even been started yet. So you can see my frustration here at this point. I then tell the manager that her employee I point over to him told me that there was no manager on site and she then says oh I'm sorry about that I'll speak to him later about that. I walk over to sit down and I then say to Jamie "oh I thought your manager wasn't here which turns into an argument. I go outside and here comes Jamie bringing 2 bags one in a paper bag so full that when he hands the food to me the bag falls to the ground and rips and another bag. I go back inside to ask for another bag because the one he pushed into my hands falls and rips. And I get the bag and leave. I was so angry that i didn't even realize what he just handed to me so I go back into my hot bag while I'm already driving towards the customer and realize he gave me a bag full of chicken nuggets in boxes and Big bottle of ranch and a salad. On my way to the customer I explain to them what happened and I am sorry that this happened but the service here is horrible. I do not recommend this place. The delivery was dropped off at 12:41 pm. It shouldn't take 1 hour to make this order and then at that get the wrong items. As a delivery driver as a customer you don't want to be treated poorly or even ignored especially if I'm picking up an order for someone who has paid over 100$ for something a restaurant with such employees can't get right or even try to. I added the picture of the employee who was disrespectful and rude.

Have gone through the drive thru on multiple occasion where I have received the wrong order. The management has never once taken accountability and given a refund. I always considered ChickFilA to be better than this, but not now.

I was happy when I found out they had opened a Chick-Fil-A around the area! I have ordered breakfast sandwiches, grilled and friend chicken sandwiches and they are delicious! My food is always warm and perfectly cooked. I must say it is a busy location and the wait time is longer despite the multiple ordering stations they have in place.

I do not have enough words to describe how much I hate everything about this Chick-fil-Av.  Truly the ultimate epitome of incompetence!!!Most of the time I look at my order and something is missing. I even place my order 20 minutes before arrival to speed things up and yet I'm still told to pull up in front of the drive through and wait 10 minutes. Today I came by and ordered a spicy chicken biscuit. When I arrived to my office I discovered that they gave me a regular chicken biscuit instead so I had to throw it away since I hate their regular chicken patties. Every other Chick-fil-A I go to in the city is a well oiled machine and is a shining example of how to operate a business but for whatever reason, this one is always a terrible experience for one reason or another.

Awarding this place 5 stars in solidarity with the workers who are forced to put up with incredibly rude, ornery customers. They're dealing with a ton of orders between drive-thru, in person, and mobile ordering options. It's one of the more tempting breakfast and lunch options there is, and a whole lot of people want to eat the most delicious made to order above average fast food around. Just don't go if you're in a hurry. Maybe pretend you're in New York where having to endure an agonizing wait for seemingly basic food items like chicken tenders is considered a mark of quality. The employees appear to be working and not screwing around, which isn't the case with many fast/fast casual dining establishments. And my food was still hot 20 minutes after I picked it up, which also isn't the case with many fast/fast casual dining establishments. Even with the lengthy waiting times, nothing about the service bothered me as much as multiple customers' notably pissy conduct.

Disappointed in the service of this location. Staff are friendly enough, but this is not the first time our order has been wrong. We were also missing items from order. We ordered the kale crunch side  and were missing the almonds .  What is the kale crunch without the almonds?! Just kale. No crunch. Jokes aside, we were also missing nuggets from our order and got 2 sauces for an order of more than 30 nuggets. Hope they can get their act together as I love chick fil a!

Just ok. I'm a CFA junky, and in our last neighborhood it was the fastest drive through even if the line was 3 times as long. Unfortunately in Bucktown the service is friendly but very slow. I've noticed this the last 2-3 times I've been (about 6 weeks) but today's lunch "rush" looked like a lunch hang. I also find my orders are lacking the perfection I expect from CFA...today my meal for 4 people had one napkin over three bags and only one fork when two of us had meals that needed them. I also asked for "a couple" sauces and only got one. I'm happy to wait in line for 17 min if the order is perfect, but it's frustrating when it's not. I know this location is newer and I'll probably give it another chance but I may need to find a new biz if it doesn't improve.

The line goes by pretty fast and the service is usually really good. Today I was disappointed when getting a frosted lemonade, I drove up to the window to hear "what is this? They added to much milk" and getting up set and handed me the drink anyways. It was basically milk with lemon chunk flavoring, not even frozen. I still like chick fil a but don't recommend this store anymore.
The slowest Chick-fil-A ever. The staff is mis managed. Crew members are unorganized.

I waited in line outside and when I finally was able to order I was told they no longer offer chicken strips only the spicy ones ... the kids loved them and would go 3x a week and get a fruit cup with it ... now have to find another place :-(  BRING them back !
I had placed a mobile order for pick up, they shorted me an item so I went back, was given wrong item and the food was ice cold.

Long lines- service was fast- the Chicken Sandwich was good- but not great- better than McDonald's or KFC- not as good as Popeyes...Not open on Sunday's-this is everywhere- their policy- Sorry, but I don't care about your religion or beliefs, I want my chicken! Oh well- there are plenty of other places-
Brand new and super fast! I was intimidated by the long line on a Saturday night, but I was out of there in five minutes. Great customer service, as always.
As great as all other chick-fil-a I've visited.  Great fast food and amazing service.  What more can be said?  How long of a post can I write, Yelp?

I admit I was a little nervous driving into the drive thru lane (I don't think they allow walk-in orders. You either order via Doordash for carry out or order via the drive thru lane) because both lanes were super long on a Friday evening! I don't know how I got out of there in less than 15 minutes, but I am impressed! They had people outside taking orders (rather than using the drive thru kiosk) and it was so efficient. The food was hot when I received it, and everything was delicious!

If you have time to kill and can wait  for good "fast"  food  this is the drive thru  for you, iv been 3 times since their January 14 opening. The first  time I waited slightly over an hour to get through . The second time 45 minutes and the third time about 35-40 minutes. Crazy! However, the staff is great and the food was quite good each time  ( hence why I have gone back ). I get the market salad with grilled chicken and the Apple vinaigrette . It's delicious. My kids like the spicy chicken sándwich and live for the chik - fil - a signature sauce ( we tried to buy a bottle but it was sold out). Good waffle fries. The lemonade is hit or miss- first order perfection, last time WAaaay to much sugar ( so much I tossed it) . Pricy for fast food but the quality is better than your average fast food joint. I had to knock a star given how long it takes to get a drive thru meal.
Place is as good as any other chick fil a. Wish they would let you stand inside to wait for pick up while they call irders

My husband and I love chick-fil-a and were super excited to see one opening so close to us. However my first visit was pretty disappointing. I went before working a night shift (I'm a nurse) and ordered drive thru. They gave me the wrong sandwich so I went to the door to tell them. The girl I spoke to went back in to get me a new sandwich- which was still not the one I had ordered and paid for. I told her and she said I was wrong and it was "impossible" and asked to see the sandwiches.. saying that in front of other customers there made me feel like she thought I was lying. She went back in and 10 mins later she brought someone out with her who I explained the situation to- she asked for my receipt which they did not give me when I paid and then went back inside. I told them I was a nurse and really needed to leave to get to the hospital on time for my shift. They finally came out with what I had originally ordered. All in all it took about 25 mins and I was then running late to work- I ate fast as I drove and ended up with a stomach ache for the next few hours, not exactly how I wanted to start my work day. Went to treat myself before working and ended up feeling frustrated and having a stomach ache- disappointed in how staff handled the situation, first time I've ever had a chick-fil-a staff member be rude to me.
Finally a Chick Fil A with a drive through! Went the first Saturday and it was not only great food of course but the staff was awesome. CFA has just figured it out
Don't be scared of the long line, it went quick and they are SUPER efficient and friendly. Welcome to the neighborhood

I came by on opening day, so naturally it was a bit chaotic (with higher than average number of cars in line).  I will say, my order was perfect and EVERYONE I interacted with was legit friendly and calm.  There was no chaos on their end.  I even saw a gentleman guiding traffic from the side street into the parking lot/line and helping those who had already been served get out and on their way.  Super impressed by their demeanor and how well it all went.  You'd never guess it was their first day open!
We went for breakfast and had great service and it convenient getting in and out. Excited to have this in the neighborhood!

Finally one in Bucktown! This is a stand-alone so you can't miss it. They have two drive-through lanes. I had the Chicken Tortilla Soup. I met Josh F. who is the operator. The staff and service is great. This is the first one this year and another one during this G.H.C. (global health crisis). Chick-fil-A is chick'n it again this year & the year just begun.
comment

I went there today to grab a lunch before my next class. It was delicious the food was prepared well and fresh. Even though this Chick Fil A is for Most UHD student it was a great place to eat. The service was proficient and I would definitely come back there again.

I live down the street from this location and I have a three year old. You'd think that would be a good combination but instead I am Charlie Brown and this location is Lucy. Tempting me to come back only to leave me absolutely enraged for like the 50th time. First the chance of getting your order correct is batting about .485. And if you don't cover every conceivable detail of the order like your prepping the space shuttle for launch can 100% percent count in the order being wrong. In our two years of misery we've experienced:- ordering a large amount of nuggets at the drive through. Paying. Going through the line. Sitting in the parking lot for 15 mins until someone came out to tell us that they can't sell us that many nuggets a through the drive. My favorite and most frequent is when I order a "meal" of nuggets for my son and then also order Mac and cheese only to get my bag and discover that they have substituted Mac &cheese for the fries. If I specifically order the meal and then I say I'd like to also order X it means both. That should be standard English. I shouldn't have to double and triple check every item in the bag. I don't know why I'm typing this because I'm a fool for ever returning to this location. Maybe my on public shaming will finally guide myself and others elsewhere.

Just moved to the area and visited this location for the first time. I was so disappointed in the staff, food and management. I was greeting by an associate on foot, but I had to yell to place my order. She finally walked to my vehicle to get my order. Of course, when I finally received my order it was someone else's. I return the food and they did not throw it away although it had already been touched by me during a pandemic. I finally got what I ordered and the fries were cold and the chicken had fatty pieces. My drink also wasted in my vehicle because the lid was not on properly. I rated them 1 star because o spoke with management because I preferred a full refund but Sloane Pardue refused for whatever reason and simple gave me a reward for more chicken. I will not be visiting this establishment again thanks to that encounter. I see why the ratings before me were poor but reasonably so.

Free food in Houston, Texas!I had a notification on my phone for free food! The Breakfast Before Books Program encourages everyone to start their day off right with breakfast! The only thing is that the offer is redeemable only before 10:30am. Also, Chick-fil-A is closed on Sundays.Another obstacle was finding a nearby location. I drove to three Chick-fil-A restaurants in the downtown area and all three were nonexistent.Hmmm...I was determined to get a free breakfast, so, thank goodness that this location on Shearn Street  was open.After parking easily, I walked up to the counter (because the drive-thru had a long line). I showed my QR code to the cashier and got my free Chicken Biscuit - no problem!Wow!This makes me want to return tomorrow! The REAL chicken was moist, tender, and seasoned well. The biscuit was soft and didn't fall apart. Yum! Too bad that the free offer is only redeemable once a week.Next week, the free food offer will be Spicy Chicken Biscuit... shucks! I'll pass on the spicy!

This location is good. Food is always hot and only twice out of all the times I've gone here has my order been missing something (which was easily corrected by just going inside). This place gets EXTREMELY busy but the line goes by impressively quickly despite that.
Friendly staff but wow the drive thru was so slow. Got stuck in the line for so long with a screaming baby for just a drink and fruit cup. :(

I feel bad for the employees at work here because I'm sure they have heard a lot of complaints today! I love Chick-fil-A and I would not write a review if I hadn't had a bad experience here twice.  Several months ago I had some time before work so I figured I would grab breakfast at the drive thru and the system was so slow that I ended up being late to work because I got in the line and couldn't get out when I realized it was going to take forever.  Today, I have the day off work so I decided to try again. Today was even worse! Their payment system went down I guess so they had to take everybody's order and payment all over again. I was there for at least 20 if not 25 minutes. I imagine they made a lot of people late to work today and I saw several people pulling out of the line without anything to show for their wait. My food as always was delicious but I will not come back to this location because it seems like just can't get the drive-through situation correct.
Please add a drive thru abort path for when your system goes down again. Absolute disaster of a morning you have caused.
I came for the breakfast. Got in line at 10:15 but the line was so long that I ordered at 10:32 and they said I couldn't get breakfast. Not pleased

I had a great experience with this Chick-fil-a. I used door dash to have it delivered and the whole order was correct and fresh tasting. I even asked for extra pickles on each sandwich and they made sure to do that. I mean, has there ever been an awful Chick-fil-a?? Even typing this review is making me want to go and get some.

Call me bias, but Chick-Fil-A has NEVER disappointed, especially this location. All of the employees make you feel welcomed and are truly so kind and helpful.  I seriously need to know the mastermind behind their employee training because a lot of these major retailers and companies need to take notes!  They always have a traffic control officer or person to assist with customers in the drive-thru and those entering the parking lot. I usually ordered their grilled nuggets and large fry w/ Chick-Fil-A sauce.  I have yet to receive a bad order or the wrong items. Keep doing what you're doing Chick-Fil-A......keep doing what you're doing.

I wasn't expecting to see such low reviews for a Chick-fil-A, but it makes sense. The location does not hold up to the usual standards in customer service that you receive from other locations. It's a very busy one & they do move with urgency however, they have flaws in how guest should be treated when visiting. Especially if I've spent 10mins in line to support the business.For starters, the traffic cop (a woman) is rude as hell. I'm not sure if it's the heat outside or what but she is unnecessarily aggressive. She stands in the middle of the drive thru yellinging at people & that's not how I'd like to be greeted when first arriving anywhere. Secondly, I ordered my chicken sandwich (no pickles) then received a free one because it was my first mobile order (with pickles). I personally can not eat pickles. So I asked the manager if I could swap it for a sandwich without pickles. Since it's the same price. The manager wasn't tryna hear it, which is odd cause it's just pickles & I'm at Chick-fil-A. I kinda hold y'all to a different standard than i would a KFC per say, usually y'all very happy to ensure their customers are pleased with everything. I ended up giving them the sandwich back, saying "thank you" then leaving. I'm disappointed in this location & I'd rather go to the one on Kirby that's currently under construction & only offering waffle fry chips with meals. At least they are nicer.
Disappointed today, drive thru staff was rude to me and the car in front of me I could clearly hear them all talking shit about the lady in front of me, on top of that we were 1 sandwich short smh

I have never written a negative Yelp review, but I truly felt inspired after tonight's experience. I have had too many negative experiences at this chick-fil-a to count. The amount of employees with sour, negative attitudes outweigh the few pleasant ones, which is unlike any other chick-fil-a I've been to. I'm not sure who's operating that inefficient and disorganized drive through. I honestly wouldn't mind the wait and confusion if it wasn't for the frequent and unnecessary eye rolls, snarkiness, and incessant whistle blowing from the employees. I accounted my numerous previous experiences to the employees just having bad days, but after my approximately 10th negative experience tonight, it's obviously the standard here. Has anyone else had the same experience with this location? I'm honestly confused.

Let's start by saying who doesn't like this place?I'm not a huge fan of it, but I do eat it once a month, or less. You have to when you run out if options, I am in a virtual annual sales meeting at Home , watching and interacting from the comfort of home, the last thing I want to do is drive, so I order in for two , up sized it for more fries and drink , asked for specific sauce because every have different preferences, but to make it shorter , I get the food in a good time, but as I open my sealed bag I see the fries are half empty, and there was no sauce of any kind, and I don't keep anything like that at my place , just ketchup, my next option was to drive to a close location, but I couldn't because of my limited time, also that would defeat the purpose of paying a delivery fee. So in the end it was a bad lunch , it was like eating milk and cookies , without the milk if you get what I'm saying. Someone should look at their location and get it together, delivery and pick up to go is the new way, please get the orders properly packed. Disappointing!!! We expected more out of Chik Fil A.

Very poor service at this location, especially when when ordering via curbside pickup. If you order ahead of time, expect to wait 30 minutes for curbside pickup and for your meal to be cold. Very disrespectful workers who have hit my vehicle and been abrasive when I needed help/there was something wrong with my order.
Literally the best Chik-fil-A that I've patronized. The associates are extremely friendly and my order has always been correct. Plus, the line moves really fast.

I arrived at 10:32 after placing my order on the chick fil a app so they couldn't accommodate me. They were very respectful and made an effort to accommodate me and try to take my order however said that breakfast had already been stopped. Terrible experience with the chick fil a app I suppose, nonetheless, thanks for the kindness and effort of the store.

Employees are good for the most part but this location is constantly messing orders up. AND you all desperately  need to come up with better protocol when it comes to closing time while still having people in line. We waited for over 15 minutes in line for y'all to take the cars order in front of us and completely and purposely ignore us the second it turned 10. I was taken back by the employees demeanor when she realized it was closing time. We tried to ask her but she walked away and turned off the lights as we were talking to her?? Then we were stuck in the line because there were people behind us and no one knew what to do! It was so unprofessional. As someone who's worked in the food industry, I implore you to come up with a better system or atleast train your employees to treat people like they actually exist after closing. Unfortunately for now I'll have to consider this location the most unprofessional chic I've been to so far :/ I hope you all take your reviews into consideration because I don't seem to be the only one with issues here!

Never have I ever had such a poor Chick-fil-A experience than at this location. They must be paid by the mistake because it's always one thing or another. This location seems to habitually charge customers for items they did not order, not provide a receipt, then discourages reversing and reprocessing the order correctly, and instead encourages you to call customer service. If you're craving some fried chicken then consider Frenchys, Louisiana Fried Chicken, Breakfast Klub, or Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken. The food tastes better and is better quality than Chick-fil-A's and the service can't possibly be any worse than the sh*tshow these clusterf*cks muster.

For real I love Chick Fil A. It's my favorite. So it hurts me to leave this review. But this specific location never not Fs up! Always the wrong drink. Always the wrong side. Always missing SOMETHING. This is not normal Chick Fil A behavior but this is their closest location to my house. I have to go to a different (much further) location because girl will drive for some good customer service and chicken. Get it together Chick Fil A @ 2222 Shearn. I'm a Silver Status member just points from Red Status so I believe my review to be credible.

I visited this location on a Friday around 13:30.  I was very impressed by the efficiency of the line.  At first,  it looks like a hot mess but it does work and make since as long as someone is directing traffic.  I feel like the chicken got smaller.  Anyone else feel this way?  Also, I ordered a large fry but the large fry container was not full.  It looked like a medium.  But if I ordered a medium would it have looked like a small?
They always take care of me quickly and the food is always warm staff is polite and clean cut and I have eaten in did drive thru and curbside I love their salad and grilled chicken. Sandwich

I usually love chick-fil-a but I had a bad experience tonight. I got a notification on the app that they just started serving the seasonal mango tea/lemonade, so I decided to drive over just to try it. I don't drink tea for religious purposes, so I just wanted to get mango lemonade. They did a similar drink last summer and I had no issues customizing the drink, because it's 1/2 tea, 1/2 lemonade, and a pump of syrup so it's easy to leave out the tea. The associate in the drive thru was very confused by my request and had to go ask someone about it. When he came back he told me that they couldn't fulfill my request. This didn't make any sense to me so I asked him why, and he couldn't give me an actual answer. He also said that leaving the tea out defeated the purpose of the drink, which was an unnecessary and rude comment. In the end, they wouldn't make the drink the way I wanted and it was a waste of time because I only went there to try the new drink. Poor customer service if you ask me.
One their employees got covid & heard it spread yet they still there. Also wk ago found hairs in the food, very gross location !!

Terrible wait time with no compensation. I ordered the fish strips. The person who helped me left me out waiting for 20 min and told me that they hv no more fish while blaming the person who took my order. Then they did not offer anything complements. Terrible

I love Chick-Fil-A just like everyone else, but could a manager please tell the people passing the food to the drivers in the drive-through to please stop talking over the open bags of food. I understand no one is doing it deliberately, but educating your workers on keeping food clean is important to stoping the spread of COVID19. Cover the bags of food by folding the paper over in half or make them wear face covering please.

As friendly as all chick fil a's are, but this manager was not helpful. They got my order wrong, the switched it for me, I had to wait there for someone to stop talking to ask about my refund for the wrong item. Then I wait for a refund, then WAIT to RE-PURCHASE what they messed up on and then they ask me to pull forward and wait. At that point it would have been best to just give  me that item free and not of charging me again for a cheaper menu item. Instead my whole lunch break was wasted just trying to get the correct order I ordered in the first place. Will not being returning.

Awesome customer service s usual, but the quality of the food has gone down hill fast these past couple of months. The chicken in the chicken sandwich is so thin that sometimes it's all breading that you are biting into. What a shame.

On 01-24-2020 I ordered a breakfast bowl with chicken and requested egg whites instead of scrambled eggs. Afterwards I was told  they don't make the bowls like that anymore.......what??? Just this week I went to two different greater Houston area Chick-Fil-A restaurants and there was no problem getting the breakfast bowl with egg whites. Guess I will just not come to this location any longer.

I went to chick fil A last night and let me just tell you, Mark Silva is such a great person. He greeted us with much respect and went beyond to give my friends and I the best service ever. I definitely recommend to check this location out.
Always forgets to add ranch dressing to mobile orders. 3rd time in 3 weeks they've just decided not to include dressing with my wrap. Bunch of crap.

I requested the fries and sandwich to be crispy because I find them soft and soggy usually by the time I get home.  The employee told me it's the new year, they don't do that anymore, and they are working on fixing this issue.  I asked if my food would be soft/soggy, I was told no.It was soggy. I also paid extra for lettuce & tomatoes, which were very wet, which made the sandwich even more soggy.  Also, the bag that the food was placed in was too small and wouldn't even close.  Open bag = cold fries on top of them being soggy.  Cookie was hard and not fresh.  What happened to the quality?

The only chick fil a I've ever been to where I got bad service. Typically at restaurants when they get the order wrong they give you what you wanted complimentary. I specifically asked for spicy deluxe and got spicy because the lady messed up the order. Then the manager came and told me if I wanted the deluxe I would have to go back and pay the additional dollar or so for the upgrade. Def not great customer service when your customer has to help you fix your own mistake.......

I placed an order for a small chicken strip tray at 3:15pm for pick up at 6:30pm. I arrive at 6:38pm and Melissa asks me to wait a few minutes. I take a seat and and at 6:58pm ask her "hi I've been waiting 20 minutes for a tray.. do you know what's going on?" She asks a gentleman and he's not sure either. I ask for a Manager and Vanessa comes out and i let her know what's going on. I ask "did they lose my ticket? Are you in the weeds? What's going on??" She offers me cookies, I decline. She goes to the back to see what's going on, comes back and offers me a "gallon of anything." I decline. I continue to wait and the gentleman comes back and says "you had the nugget tray right?" And I say "no I had the strips" and he says "oh I gave the other lady yours" I wait as he tries to go find her. She comes back and says "I think this is yours" we swap. I'm out of there. It's now 7:10pm. I leave and don't see Vanessa again. Look, I've worked in the industry. I get it, you're busy however, a 40 minute wait time from 6:30pm(when my order was scheduled for pick up) is 100% ridiculous. I don't want free cookies, I don't want a free gallon off anything. If this wasn't a tray for guest, I 100% would've asked for a refund and left without the strips. I would've appreciated Atleast a heads up. This ticket wait time is ridiculous. The only apology I received was from the gentleman that checked for my food when Melissa asked and handed me my food. The worst service I've ever received. *just realized they didn't even pack plates and utensils...sweet. Thanks y'all.
Will most likely never return. They were very rude and wait was too long. By far the worst chick fil a location I've been to.

Not the ideal location to visit didn't get the customer service I normally get one of these at a Chick-fil-A the woman's very short kind of rude and didn't have a smile on her face she was ready to go home she should just go home don't stay at work what about attitude about energy

This location in my opinion is the best in Houston drive-through moves very quickly their fries are almost always crispy and not over salted seems like they really pay attention to the recipe on how to round a franchise but this area does demand it if they are quick look out the line would be miles long and there's way too much competition for people to not just go elsewhere.Because of their speediness it makes it my top pick for fast food in the immediate area.

I had to wait about 20 minutes for my drive through order because my was not ready when I came to the drive through window. If I had to wait that long, what is the point of using the drive through to wait 20 mins for your order

The most friendly service I've ever experienced in my life. Food was delicious hot and fresh and I'm not sure the manager was I wish I could call him out my name but he was super nice and made me feel so welcome :-)

I would've never thought I would give one of the best well trained employees restaurant such a poor review. This is my third time coming to this specific location and sad to say that each time something is always wrong with my order. The first 2 times I dined in my order came out wrong each time. The third time I went through drive thru and when I get home my order is completely wrong again! I am so disappointed that I will not be returning to this location.

This is one of my favorite locations, very clean "at least I thought" up until this morning I ordered a large coke zero with my breakfast meal, finished the drink decided to pop the lid and enjoy the ice, well what do ya know, theres a frickin bug/knat on my ice boy was i disgusted! BE AWARE!
Drive through line during lunch time is insane and the employees are not trained well enough to handle it. What a nightmare.

This place is what all American restaurants strive to be and fail at miserably. Every single one of these places I have been to has been above and beyond any other fast food. The customer service is second to none and the food while a little plain is amazing but they aren't trying to be anything they are not. They sell chicken and they do chicken as good or better than anyone else. Eat this food. Support this chain. They are in it for the long haul

I came from a CFA that takes pride in taking your orders and going above and beyond. There are times I come and the drive thru is hectic and busy that you would think they would have someone to help take orders. It just makes it go by faster when someone is directing traffic and taking your order.

I love this Chick Fil A location!!  It is always a fun place for my family to have a fast tasty meal.  Sloan puts on amazing family events such as Bingo, Dinosaurs, Farm animals, HPD, Houston Fire Department, Dynamos, Astro's, and so many other fun family events!! Friendly quick service.
