The employees were nice, but seemed unconcerned. Food was delicious, as always. But knowing there are choices, I've made mine, and I'll encourage others whom I know to follow suit. Wouldn't be such a big deal for the owner.... but perhaps s/he doesn't care either.

DO NOT GO TO THIS CHICK-FIL-A they are extremely unsanitary and careless. I ordered lunch and a milkshake. As I'm almost done with my milkshake I see something black at the bottom of the cup I dig it out and realize it is a cap of some sort. I am still unsure about the cap being a cleaning supply cap or something else but it is needless to say about how extremely grossed out and disgusted I am in regards to this matter. I have absolutely escalated the issue and if I am for any reason sick by this issue I will make sure to let everyone know what type of unsanitary and disgusting company Chick-fil-a is! Unacceptable coming from such a large restaurant. Do not dine here everyone. Thy will place weird objects in your food!!!!!!!

Didn't get my order right. Didn't give me straws and then argued about it when I asked. Still didn't give me enough straws, I didn't realize until home. Never had an issue before with a different location. It obviosely matters where you go.
Trey and Andrew helped us with our some what big order! Trey was the BEST! Great customer service. So sweet... highly recommend coming to this location:)

Today, June 3rd 2017, is receipt day. If you come into this metro location and order and save the yellow receipt, you will be able to get your order for free in July. The rules state that you can redeem your order at any point in July - there are not dates the offer is limited to.
They have placed locks on the restroom doors.  This is not good around kids.  Both have the same code and other customers share it anyway so what's the point?
Every single time I go to this restaurant, they mess up my order. I don't understand why they constantly mess up our orders. Someone please retrain these people.

If every day could be a Chick-fil_A day, I would choose this location. Yesterday, was my first time dining in. I have used the drive-thru often which has always been a smooth process, but my dining experience surpassed my expectations. You feel the positive energy the moment you walk in the door. Wow! a busy lunch hour rush with all hands on deck working hard actually enjoying their jobs. Everyone at the cash register had a smile. I went through the line fast, my order was repeated to me and delivered to my table. As I dined and ate my food, I witnessed how happy the staff was. They were pleasant to everyone they encountered. I had to give the working manager a kudos. Ended up being the owner's wife. I told her this was the best service I have ever received. I am from Phoenix and have seen locations come and go. Then to grow to one of the best fast food chains. Well, I am glad they are here to stay.

Love Chick-fil-A. Came in to use my $100 gift card I got for Christmas. Unfortunately, their gift card system was down. The cashier (according to the receipt), Kaylene, said he would take care of me and charged my two entrees for $0.00 so I got my whole meal for free  Greatly appreciate the customer service. Food was delivered promptly and the seating area looked well maintained.

The staff is not friendly...the order took forever...and then I go to use the restroom...and you need a special code...I'm sure this is done as a means to keep the homeless from using the bathroom...it is a sad world that we live in when we deny people the basic rights to use a bathroom...additionally I will say for a company that speaks so highly of their Christian values it's quite hypocritical that you turn around and deny human beings who are struggling to be treated with basic human respect and dignity.

My wife went to restroom while I ordered a breakfast.I said give me chicken sandwiches with cheese and a sausage and egg on Muffin no cheese. I paid for the food.When order came my wife had returned. She says oh no I don't want cheese on my sandwich. Someone behind the counter said, I will see we if we have anymore biscuits. It was 10:30 AM lunch time, we were not aware. Order comes and Cheese on all of them. I send it back.So my wife orders lunch. I paid again for that. No reply from manager.My food comes there is still a chicken sandwich with cheese and the sausage egg & Muffin I ordered had no egg just sausage. I send it back. At this point. I said just give me a refund, the little manager did so. No trying to make it right for the inconvenience. My wife went back later said we were  not satisfied with service. Maneger:I'm sorry. My  wife said, sorry doesn't cut it, just letting you know so you can learn. End of story.#EATATHOME BAD SERVICE.The cook can't read. Hailey was great she put in right order. The cook kept screwing up. Learn to read the screen cook.

We were those rude consumers that walked in 15 mins before they closed and stayed to eat in their lobby. I usually hate those consumers but I appreciate that they didn't kick us out or gave us attitude even when we seemed to have been taking our time to eat.Their food seemed fresh, even close to closing. They gave us more sauce, free of charge with the amount of food we ordered. My personal favorite to dip my nuggets in are the polynesian and the garlic ranch. Don't get the honey mustard tho, it tasted fake to me ... if that even makes any sense.

After reviewing my receipt while waiting for my food I noticed the prices I was charged were more than what was advertised on the menu board.  I asked the employee about it, he had no idea and said the tax had been added to each item, I explained to him that did not appear correct since there was already a line item specifically for tax.  I spoke with a manager who, after passing what seemed to be a knowing glance to the employee,  was less than helpful, she said the menu should match what the register charges and had a nonchalant attitude towards the situation, when I told her what they were doing was wrong and that customers expect to pay the price listed on the menu she said all she could do was give me an ice cream for my "inconvenience"  I did not take the ice cream nor do I plan on returning to that chick filet in the future.  I wonder how many other customers they have defrauded this way.

I usually love chic fil a when I'm on the run and in need of something quick and tasty. However, the last two times I've ordered a cookie with my meal and it's been overcooked and way too crunchy.. not sure what's going on. I returned one the first time thinking it was a fluke but the replacement was the same. We'll keep coming back for the nuggets and fries, plus the great customer service, but I am bummed about not getting dessert.
Staff was friendly and helpful. Chicken egg and cheese bagel was awesome! The owner Dave appreciated our business and we'll be back!
My first ever Chick-fil-A experience and I was NOT disappointed. The service was fantastic, my chicken sandwich was juicy, spicy and delicious. I can't wait for one to open up in Vegas.

Is there a pickle shortage at this restaurant?  This is the FOURTH time I've asked for extra pickles and have gotten 2 total!  I spent $27.00 on food, I had to repeat everything over three times because the drive up window lady wasn't listening, ok fine, frustrating yes, it's fast food.  I pull away and look at my sandwich which even has EXTRA PICKLES printed on the label, and I have a total of TWO.  I go inside and say I want extra pickles, I give them a number: 8.  I get my sandwich, go to the car and there is a total of FOUR pickles on my sandwich.  I go through the drive through to return this stupid sandwich and am asked if I just want a side of pickles, I said I didn't see the difference between a side and putting them on the sandwich to begin with, but as long as I get more than two.  I got 3.  Advice-when someone is spending 30.00 for fast food, can you just give them what they ask for?  The place is clean, but every drive through experience we've had has resulted in at least one wrong item; go inside for accuracy, although even that is a crapshoot.

Mobile app. I didn't know how to use the Mobile App, and the friendly server walked me through the download and the check-in. She also gave me a tip: do not complete your order until you walk through the door so that your food gets to you nice and fresh. I waited at a bar counter with the Mobile sign above. I got my food nice and toasty and enjoyed it there. I love their Chik-Fil-A sauce and their freshly squeezed lemonade. When you hang out there, the servers are sweet and come by to fill up your lemonade for free. Remember, they don't open on Sundays. Try their breakfast biscuits and hash browns. Yum!

We live around the cornor from yhis spot and were frequent visitors until they started to get our order wrong EVERYTIME. Im not sure what is so confusing about plain biscuit, either they add chicken or forgot to put them in the bag and recently they have been giving me plain english muffins. I personally don't care for fast food but will make exception for their breakfasts, but not anymore. This location has a problem, to many teenagers not listening to what customers order.
I don't eat fast food, I have refused to go anywhere with a drive through for the last 10 years but Chick Fil A is the exception! They're amazing and have great Chick Fil A sauce.
Awesome customer service, always polite and I love the food.  Very fast and sufficient.
Great food. Wish they had croutons for their salads. Wish they had more dessert options. Love the honey roasted barbecue sauce. They soooo need to bottle it and sell it.
Always great chicken here. This place is nice and clean, just sad that this area is bad that they have to give you the code to the bathroom on the receipt.

Chick fil a always has great service no matter the location. This locations customer service was just as great as expected. I was greeted upon entry and the workers even brung me my food. I ordered the chicken soup and I was about to go get a spoon when one of the workers was already on her way to bring me one. What great customer service. Once I finished my food my tray was full of trash and another worker came and asked if she could clean my tray for me. Another excellent customer service! The food is always great for being fast food. It is on the pricer side for fast food but I don't mind paying for the great service! Their chick fil a sauce is to die for!

Had my first Chick fil a experience here. Amazing!! Staff was super friendly and food was greater than expected! I ordered the spicy chicken deluxe meal with a the chick fil a sauce. Yummers... The sauce along with the waffle fries are phenomenal. Would definitely come here again!

Fast, friendly service.  We hit up the drive through for a quick lunch before heading to a work meeting after landing in Phoenix.  I hadn't had Chick-fil-A in years, so I went with the classic chicken sandwich for my meal.  I didn't realize that it was deep-fried, so that probably wasn't the healthiest thing to eat...  but it was tasty and delicious and definitely hit the spot.  Just ordering the sandwich alone without anything else made me feel a teeny bit healthier, as I told myself I was eating fewer calories, LOL.  There was enough protein to keep me full until dinnertime, so definitely a good lunch when on the go!

I've never received "bad" food from chick fil a. Everytime I've ordered something from here the food is A+ but with my drive thru visit yesterday I received the nastiest sandwich ever! I'm so grossed out and the only reason I didn't go back and ask for a replacement was because I had already driven all the way home and opened up the bag then. So unacceptable so I threw it away and just ate the fries. Next time I'll make sure to check my sandwich before I drive home.

This location is okay. I'm not sure why they felt the need to build a business on a tiny parcel of land, but that seems to be the trend. Food was good; service was good. That said, it's too small. I can't even imagine trying to navigate the parking lot or inside on a busy day. Will definitely drive to other locations when I want Chick-fil-a.

Honestly this place always hits the spot. For some reason I had a doubt about coming here.... 12pt chicken later in a satisfied customer. One thing I really like about this chain is how clean and welcoming they are. Second time at this location and I will be back. Thanks!

This location does not live up to the expectations I have of Chick Fil A. This location is on my way to work, so I get breakfast here at least once a week, sometimes twice. My issue has never been with the food, it's always hot and delicious. My issue is with the employees. I've always said please and thank you (my mother raised me with manners). Usually when I visit a CFA and say "thank you" I'm met with a "my pleasure", this location occasionally says "you're welcome", but never "my pleasure". It's this little things that make a difference. Additionally, I get frustrated because every other trip I make there they try to get me to order a small soda. I usually only order a sandwich, and tell them "that's all thank you" literally half the time the girl at the window puts down a small coke. Why?
The food, staff, and cleanliness = 5 stars. People who give 1 star and rant about nonsense without any knowledge of the use of punctuation should be ignored.

My husband and I grabbed lunch here today. Linda the manager was so awesome. We had missed breakfast and my husband was very disappointed. She even gave him a gift card for breakfast on them. The staff was so nice both in the drive thru and inside. The food was hot and fresh and excellent as always. We can't wait to visit them again soon!

I have heard the tales of Chick-fil-A.  I have seen the billboards and seen the commercials.  I have thought about driving (happy I saved the gas) from Vegas to Utah to see what the hype was about.  I figured after conducting a yelp reconnaissance since we were in the Phoenix area taking in the glory of Padre Spring Training, if we could visit a C-f-A we would.Having consorted the yelp oracle and wanting to visit another restaurant in the immediate (relative) area.  It was an easy choice to visit this location even thought our bellies were full.  I needed this to bask in the light of the legend of the mystical chicken sandwich they provide.Following the OnStar instructions we arrived. Negotiating the parking lot upon our arrival was easy enough as the lot was not filled to capacity as I had expected.  With entry made, we stood a the counter and reflected on the menu.  I knew a sandwich was all I could stomach.  The GF ordered some strips and the Boy ordered up a Spicy version of the legendary sandwich.The lady behind the counter seemed indifferent as we ordered.  Neither impressed this was our first time ordering or our 10th time.  The GF asked for a sampling of sauces and I am happy that she did....more on that later.We stood by and the meal was on a tray inshore order.  We made our way to table and I observed a clean and tidy restaurant.I unwrapped and bite into the illustrious chicken wedged between the bun and....was not immediately inspired by the taste. I tore open the bun to inspect it's geography and was not impressed even though I observed to pickle slices I had missed in the first bite.  After adding a contains of a container of Chick-fil-A sauce did I begin to enjoy my sandwich.The GF fingers were a great combination of crunchy and moistness. The Boys sandwich was as uneventful as mine sans a little spice added to equation. It was an A-OK experience and with that we we were on the road.

Mark P. obviously hasn't been to this location because it is on Peoria and not Dunlap, but he did write an amazing story. Anyways this spot is like any other Chick Fil A, clean, courteous, and delicious. Though not many are as kind or "hook ups" friendly as Arrowhead or Go the extra mile to remove ONLY the onions from my chicken breakfast burrito as Deer Valley, this store meets my expectations as the best quality food quickly joint for a quick lunch bite, even with all the new choices in the area, it is still my go to place. I ordered my Chick Fil A sandwich "protein style" and they were very generous with the lettuce they wrapped it in, and are always happy to give you a LARGE ice water (unlike Canes who charges for any cup smaller than their little Dixies) here is the kicker, the protein style is actually cheaper than the regular sandwich! Love this place

By far the worst Chic-Fil-A I have been to. It is packed, which is understandable but causes the employees to be rude and rush you through your order. I hardly had any time to put my drink, which they got wrong, in my cup holder before she was throwing my card and food at me. I got home and when I remove my sandwich from the bag and it is so the chicken burnt that it is literally crumbling into pieces out of the bun. I had ordered it with extra pickles (aside from the two that they USUALLY put on their sandwiches) and was not surprised to see one measly pickle on my singed chicken. A dollar chicken sandwich from McDonald's would have been more satisfying to both my appetite and wallet. I will surely be making the extra bit of a drive to the Arrowhead location from now on. Much, much better service and quality!
My husband and I enjoy the grilled nuggets from here with the sauce they serve, but sure what it's called but it's great.

I have a weakness for GOOD fast food. Culver's. In-n-Out. Cold Stone (does that count?). Well, the time has come to add Chick-Fil-A to that list. There are no words for how delicious their original chicken sandwich is. Toasted bread, surrounding a thick piece of chicken that is crispy on the outside, juicy and moist on the inside, paired with the best waffle fries I've ever consumed. No pickles for me, as I'm allergic, but oh dear lord. This place is my diet killer. A month-long health kick met it's end at the hands of this place. I don't even realize I've stopped till I'm sitting there at the booth with my food being brought to me by a friendly, smiling employee. Forgive me, my body, but this will forever be my sin. Delicious, delicious sin.

First let me start off by saying I love chick-fil-a but this location at Dunlap my wife and I went there at 930 in the evening we each place our orders I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich there was not many people in the restaurant a few employees but they were sitting down at tables over 80% of the tables were dirty... one of the employees who is sitting in the Restaurant walked behind the counter and placed her order directly at the register her name was Olivia... Holly was the cashier who took our order. My wife and I were sitting not too far away from the area that you place your orders at we noticed that Olivia walk from the booth that she was sitting in and got her food probably 2 minutes after placing her order she got her food before ours next we hear employees yelling out for Olivia they were yelling to come back after she was sitting down for a couple of minutes and for her to bring her food with her. I immediately got up and walked to the cashier area and I watched Olivia hand off her sandwich which was in a in chickfila box they told her she grabbed the wrong sandwich I watched the manager pass the sandwich back to the kitchen I asked Holly the cashier if that was my sandwich and if it was I do not want it as it went out to a table and was out there for a few minutes I would like a new sandwich I figured it was mine as there was no one else in the restaurant ordering food. She asked the manager and she said yes it was a grilled chicken sandwich the manager then told the employees in the back they're going to need to make another chicken sandwich I thought this was real tacky as they were going to serve me that sandwich I forgot to mention yes that sandwich along with my wife's sandwich and fries were already on a platter ready to be served to us. I confronted the manager about this she denied all responsibility and just said that she didn't know I told her you did see the employee bring it back to you and hand it to you and you handed it to the back all she kept saying is I'm sorry I didn't know. This chick-fil-a is obviously poorly ran which is a first that I have seen... the employees obviously do not care about customers do not care about cleaning the restaurant and have absolutely no pride

I don't agree with Chick-Fil-A's politics, but I really agree with their food. Love the chicken, love love love the fries.  I understand this isn't a 5-star fancy pants restaurant, but this place really does deserve 5 stars in the fast food realm.  The place looks fabulous (in comparison to other fast food joints), is super clean, and the workers are all happy and go out of their way to help.
The Grilled Market Salad was amazing and the service was too! Nice to see happy people who love their job's! I'll definitely be back!
Food is uninspired, dry, tasteless and bland.  Not worth the effort, not just because of the food, but because it is always busy for some reason.

Every time I come here everybody is really nice and joyful! Food always comes out fast, and the workers are always there to give you what you need! We were helped by a nice girl named Miranda who refilled our drinks and even cleared our tray. Great place.

I love this location, the problem is that it gets soooo busy here it has an effect on the quality of food being made. The line to the drive-through gets 20-30 cars deep at peak lunch and dinner hours. I've been here about five times total and twice my food has been a bit undercooked.I know it recently opened, but by now the kinks should have been worked out. If I had to choose, I'd go to the Chik-fil-a at 31st Ave and Beardsley instead of this.

FINALLY! So glad this is now open. No complaints here so far. Take into consideration that it's brand new and it's still being worked on. Staff is ALWAYS extremely helpful and nice. Food is amazing. This location saves me about a 45 minute round trip to the other location. Thank you.

So sad everything is open dine in also except for this location we are 117 f and you still only do drive through rent build up take your order no receipt than get over charged not good you order my bank notified me once I paid Than you talk to manager very sad he even was root never got My change back from 30 order I only ordered 2 items 10.99 Hopefully someone will inspect see what employees have to do outside 117 degrees . Can get a hear stroke First and last time Chick F.

We did the drive thru.  Was very busy two lines where they were taking orders, one line to pick up food.  Was very fast and the food was great.  I had the grill chicken sandwich with the works.  Love the chick-Gil-A sauce.

The Chick-fil-A at ASU West campus is a gem!   It isn't real busy yet but their food is always fresh and tasty.  The employees make the visit memorable.  Just like most Chick-fil-A's, employees are very friendly and attentive to customer needs.  Whenever I visit campus, I make it a practice to visit this store. Keep up the good work!

I really enjoy going to Chick-Fil-A at ASU West when I need a quick meal. The food is always hot, fresh and delicious. The customer service is great. The employees are friendly and efficient. Highly recommend.

Amazing as usual. In true Chick-fil-A fashion we had a phenomenal meal. My wife and I went in for a quick dinner and each ordered salads. The gal at the front desk was so kind and polite. She was patient as we modified our order. The food came out so quickly it was great. The salads were delicious and made exactly how we ordered them. For the price we paid it was a true value. We were stuffed and satisfied.

Horrible customer service ATTITUDE!  Pushy employees at drive thru,  wouldn't refund before I even got food after they refused to scan for loyalty points on a $50 order.  They won't have to worry about getting my business again.  They were absolute jerks.  I used to love this place, but no more!
This place takes forever and in the middle of a pandemic employees are never wearing masks...

In the height of the pandemic with omicron surging, they have two employees outside in the drive-thru right now taking orders maskless, with the majority unmasked inside. Please take better care of your customers and employees.

Disappointed in the customer service, had to starve on my lunch since the manager did not want to make our order. Apparently using Yelp to order is not a good option, Yelp called chick-Fil- A and they refused to make our order. Yelp refunded my money, witch is great but just a bad experience.

This may be the slowest Chick-fil-A I've ever been to. Still in line 35 minutes later and four cars ahead of me.They take about a car every 5 or 6 minutes which I have just never seen at a Chick-fil-A

Why is this location ,12301 N Tatum Blvd, the WORST location in the nation?!?Please get new owners/management in there as they are ruining your brand!  Very unpleasant, uncooked English muffins and cheese isn't even melted on the breakfast sandwich. (This has been the case on numerous visits.). I knew better than to go to this location, but my husband ordered on his app and chose this location since I was in the area.  I pulled up to the driveway and told the clerk outside that I had an online order.  He said the payment didn't go through..  This is very strange as we order breakfast from the Mayo Blvd location 3-5 times a week and have never had an issue!  Why would the app process the order and let you select "I'm at the restaurant" if it didn't go through.  He said there would be no way to refund if it processes twice.  So I drove to the window and spoke to the "?manager?" blonde lady.  She kept saying it hasn't been paid for.  I showed her the screenshot from my husband's app showing it took $ off his app..  She Made me pay for it again, handing me a receipt and said if there was a problem come back.  Well there is a problem.  The $ was taken from his app as well as my cc.  This is not about the $8, this is about taking care of your customers.  Not driving them away.  I left a message 4 days ago, no calls back.  My husband went into the restaurant today, was told nothing they will do about this. They will not refund him the $. Close this location down or get a new owner PLEASE.  We love the Chik-fil-A's off Mayo Blvd in Scottsdale & 44th St & Indian School in Phoenix.  Class acts at these 2 locations.
Warning NO LONGER ACCEPTING in store orders DRIVE THROUGH ONLY be aware. I do not recommend anyone continue to fund this establishment, this whole COVID BS has gotten way out of control.

I will never buy food from this location again. I received greasy nuggets. I called and complained and was told I would receive a credit to my app. But when I called back 2 weeks later the manager Danya (sp) told me she checked that nuggets that day and they weren't greasy. I'm not a lier and that's unprofessional to call a customer a lier. The management at this location needs to improve there customer service skills or find another job along with the unprofessional server at the drive thru window. This locations has ALOT of negative reviews- I should of checked yelp before my purchase.
Their attitude in the morning in drive thru is unmatched. Get a new job if you don't like yours. Like come on really??? Avoiding this place before I tell the employees to fix their attitude myself

This location is so slow and almost ALWAYS messes up my togo, curbside, and DoorDash orders and NEVER Fixes the problem with some new excuse every time. Someone needs to seriously teach these people how to take and package an order.

Waited very long for curb side order. Decided to go inside to see what was taking to long. My order was just sitting on the countertop. She said sorry I was gonna run it out. Worst part was the store wasn't all that busy. Poor service from the manager
Love chick fil a there chicken sandwiches are hands down the best forget all the. Rest they are always friendly and have smiles on there faces and we will be here agay

Previous orders placed online for pickup were fine but I want to warn you - AVOID THE DRIVE THROUGH AT ALL COSTS!!!  Started in the line under the awning and it took 30 minutes to get our food and our order was wrong ‍They forgot one of our fries which we caught and so I walked into the store to get them.  When we got home we realized there wasn't any bacon on my grilled chicken club and my wife's 8 piece grilled chicken nuggets were fried!  Fries were undercooked and soggy.Thankfully we didn't eat the food in the car because they didn't give us any napkins either.

Chick-Fil-A is hands down my favorite fast food restaurant in existence. But for some reason this location is always certain in providing me with an unpleasant experience. Be it cold served food or just simply a skinny chicken sandwich. Other locations that I visit much more often have never disappointed. I'm always thrilled about their thick juicy chicken sandwiches and today topped my pot to never visit that location again. I am under the impression that they bread their chicken in stores. Not sure how they breaded a breast as thin as my slice of cheese.

The worst Chick-fil-A!!! Just finished waiting 45 minutes in the drive through line at 9:00 and the line actually started UNDER the awning! This makes 4 bad experiences in a row! I should have stopped at 3 strikes and your out. I used to love Chick-fil-A but it has changed so much. The chicken is a lot smaller than it used to be, the French fries are always cold and soggy and why won't they bring back the regular chicken strips? They say they are testing the spicy ones. Sorry Chick-Fil-A, you will no longer be getting my money.
Always amazing. Best food of life and staff is always happy. Only issue is trying to get in and out of the drive thru cause there are always such long lines.
Slowest drive through I've ever been too. Avoid at all costs. You'll get your food faster if you go in and order.

I went through the drive through last week. My order was simple Number 7 with honey mustard dipping sauce. I asked for one additional sauce... I was given 6! My fries were cold and soggy as I was pulling out of the drive through.

We had this location cater our wedding reception for 100 guests. Everything was perfect. Food showed up right on time. Sylvia had great suggestions. Let us use the catering boxes to keep the sandwiches/nuggets warm and the salads cold. Divided the order in half. She even stopped by the event to make sure we had enough dressings and sauce. We were so happy with how it all worked out.

Now, no matter what you do the left lane is always skipped over by about 3-4 cars no matter how much longer you sit, they do not take the cars in order as they arrive. Trily terrible logistics plan. It only saves the parking lot from being longer. The order takers are now also now not nearly as nice as they were before and probably bc it's such a stressful situation they now have to take more orders more quickly. Not good for personnel and not good for customers. I will finally be quitting Chick Fil A.
Worst Chick-fil-A , never quick lines are always out of  control waste of time! Better off doing a mobile order.

I love this place. They support local heroes with discounts and always get my order right. Even when my daughter needs a grilled cheese.... The app let's you preload funds and earn free bonuses. Last week I got a free platter of nuggets. Totally perfect for bringing dinner home to the hardworking family.

I was heading home from Hobby Lobby with my 2 year old in tow, and we were in need of a quick dinner because mama spent too much time shopping! This isn't our neighborhood Chick-fil-a, but like all of them, they had a good sized line around 5:45 PM! The gals working the line were definitely diligent in making sure that it moved along quickly and it even looked like there was a manager out there supporting them. Love to see that! We were in and out in about 10 minutes and loved our meal, as usual! I always go with the Deluxe chicken sandwich with buffalo + ranch sauces and my little man loves the chicken nugget kid's meal. The fries are my absolute favorite out of all fast food concepts. YUM! We had them all eaten by the time that we pulled into the driveway... ha! I may have created a car-eating french fry monster in my little dude. I would recommend this location if needing a CFA fix! It is also located in the heart of loads of shopping and errand spots!
For this location only! Go to the ones in Scottsdale. They literally were stingy on giving me any condiments!!!

Just got back from driving up to chick fil a and what a catastrophe, not only did repeat our order back to us they then left food out of our togo bag and we didn't notice until we got home. We had faith it was all there because they read our order back to us. That wasn't the worst of it, as I was eating my nuggets I got well into eating when I grabbed my next nugget and out of the box with the nugget came a long thick black hair, we're all blonds here. I thought I was going to throw up... COME ON PEOPLE TAKE SOME PRIDE IN YOURSELFS. What trash! I hope I remember this garbage treatment so I don't ever waist my time going there again. This location should be fined severely and closed down.
As I write this, I'm sitting waiting for my curbside pickup order that's supposedly been ready for over 20 minutes. Why I'm waiting? Great question.

Gosh darn it I should have just avoided the company that hates on the gays anyways because they can't even give you your full order! We went through the drive through and ordered two meals, they gave us two drinks, two fries and ONE MEAL. How can you give the dipping sauce for chicken nuggets WE DID NOT GET? It is not that hard to put a checklist of items in a bag, come on.
Hands down the worst chick fil a in AZ! I waited 25 minutes in the shortest line only to get half my order. I go in and wait an additional 15 minutes to get the rest. This place is a joke!

*****BEWARE***** After calling the customer support number they looked up my account and it sounds like this location is SCAMMING customers by saying their coupons do not work when they do, requesting payment, then pocketing the cash.THIS LOCATION RUINED CHICK-FIL-A. I loved Chick-fil-A, I had a coupon emailed to me for a free sandwich and a free one from the app. They told me this is no problem once I got to the window, after a 25 minute wait, I was told it won't work and I have to pay for both sandwiches. I refused and left, I will never eat Chick-fil-A again. They lost a loyal customer and over a lifetime many thousands of dollars over a sandwich....

I love the Chic fil A app and use it often.  This location has a huge drive through wait and I have been waiting for 20 mins and still have not gotten my food.  This is ridiculous.  The Deer Valley store I realize has a separate line for app purchases but you cannot compare the 2 when it comes to obvious in organization.  Absolutely unacceptable.

Be prepared to wait FOREVER if you place a curbside order. Received a notification that my order was ready at 9:20 maybe a few minutes after arriving. A few more minutes go by to where 2 more cars pull up, but sure they decided to make and fill those other orders first prior to bringing mine out. That being said it sat there ready for over 10min before it was brought out. Didn't get my order until after 9:30... Probably seems like forever as it's 110 degrees and the a/c is out in my car. Thanks Chick fil A!

Ugh, I hate writing this review.  I saw employees wearing masks as chin guards 'noses sticking out of the top of the masks' as they are coming from the back food area.  I love their food, service and location.  I am more sad than angry at this point. I truly love the food and they are the gold standard of service, but this was just scary in the pandemic times.  I will return once the pandemic finishes.

I've been going to this Chick-Fil-A for a few years and have never had issues until recently. The last time I went they forgot to put any of the sauce in my bad that I ordered. Today we went and I ordered a sandwich which I had a reward for. We also ordered a Deluxe Chicken sandwich. The girl scanned my reward and we were off to get our order. When we got to the window and were handed the bag, again no sauce, but also no Deluxe Chicken sandwich. There were also frys that we didn't order. I explained to the girl we were missing one sandwich and had frys we didn't order and she just gave me a blank stare. To top it all off, I was charged for the sandwich I had a reward for. I would have gone into the store to figure it out, but at that point after waiting in line for 15 minutes My husband was annoyed and starving. That was his first time to Chick-fil-A and he said he will never go back. I am truly disappointed.

Is it a "Great Day Here @ Chick-Fil-A"?I would give 0 stars if I could, and I understand why the reviews for this location are so poor. I drove here Monday night to purchase food for my family. 4 meals, $50 worth of food, 45 minutes in the drive-thru and my order isn't even correct.They read it back at the menu correct, they read it back at the window correct. They gave me my bags and I even had asked, "is this everything? are you sure?" and they verified and assured me that everything was correct. I get home, (I live 5 minutes away), Fries are cold, chicken strips are missing, and a sandwich was missing as well. Also, I told them I needed lots of ketchup for FOUR meals, and you gave me 4 packets? Do you really only use 1 packet for a LARGE FRY AND SANDWICH?I called to speak to a manager and get this resolved amicably but I cannot even reach the store, nobody answers. Shocker seeing as how the store is ran by 16 year olds.Not sure I'll ever visit this location again, I've been to a dozen locations and this one by far has the worst service I've come across. This isn't the first time this has happened here either. McDonald's is a shit hole and they at least get my order correct 99% of the time.0/10 for service, 0/10 for execution, and 0/10 for demonstrating the core values Chick-Fil-A represents in my community.

Worse experience we've ever had at Chick-fil-A ... from the condensing and rude young girl who took our order outside, to the long wait for the delivery of the food ... chicken was hot, but fries were cold and mushy. Girl outside taking drive through orders definitely needs some customer service training ... We asked for regular chicken strip filets and she said "we haven't carried those since January. We only have spicy chicken strips". I said "what does someone get if they can't eat spicy food" and she said "well, they don't get the spicy chicken filets!" No shit! My husband is just out of the hospital from colon surgery! A few suggestions would have gone a long way! And, why in the world would a restaurant that specializes in chicken take the regular chicken filets off the menu and only offer spicy? That's ridiculous! When we got home and the fries were cold and mushy, we said, we will never go back to chick-fil-a again. You lost two good customers because of your lousy customer service and cold, lousy food.

I did a mobile order and it was wrong, I ordered 2 orders of chicken nuggets got only one, ordered crackers for my chicken noddle soup and no crackers, ordered chick-fil-a sauce 2 per order of nuggets and only got a total of 2. Thank God I checked the order before leaving the drive thru or I would've had to go back. Usually I have no problems at this location but lately it is not the same as this is the second time that my order is not correct and I am missing items. Not the best experience.

Don't stop here! There is another one less than 10 mins away. They do not hold themselves to the same  standard the other Chick fil A restaurants. I started taking a new route to work and came here before work a few times this week. Everyday there has been some kind of issue. But today my complete order was I corrected and when I called to let them know the  manger disconnected the call with no resolution. Poor quality service here. Save yourself the headache and go to the next one.

worst "I dont care" type of attitudes I ever came across, one even being from a manager who wasnt paying attention and kept talking over the complaint we were trying to give. then when we went to pay for our order, that manager said "let's see if this goes through". thanks lady. thanks alot chik fil a. nice representation.

If I could give zero stars I would. I came in to eat and I come and sit at my table with my friend.  The manager Eileen or whatever she is at this company got mad at us for saying the word  sh*t. She told me she can make us leave and even got up from her table to stand right in front of us. I told her I can speak however I want, it's the first amendment and then she got all quiet. I have never been so disrespected in my life for speaking the way I want too.
Awesome customer service, awesome food and clean and great atmosphere. I love Chick-fil-A. It is tops in fast Food.

Every single time I go to this location (drive thru), my order is always served wrong. They are also stingy with their sauce. I always state how much sauce I'm requesting and each time I go to the window there's random sauces piled on top of the food or not the right count. Then when I ask for more sauce the employee always looks bothered every single time. Well maybe they need to learn how to count properly?

Unbelievable!!! Watch out!!! This location served my son (who has a severe allergy to gluten) a sandwich which was ordered GF on a regular bun.  This was on our way to a diamondbacks game and he got sick - ruined the night. I called and they offered to give us a GF sand which on the house (I was satisfied that they were trying to make it right) but when we went in they declined. Horrible customer service - NEVER coming back!!
They are out of chick fil a sauce wtf!! What manager is that stupid that he does not order enough of the most famous sauce of the restaurant!! Some dipshit obviously....

The food at this location is always on point but getting the food you ordered correctly is always the issue. I've gotten my order wrong nearly every time I've gone to this location and had to call only for them to tell me that they double check everything before they give it out, essentially telling me that I'm lying. Additionally, the line is always around the corner and takes 30+ minutes to get through every time. Thats a little ridiculous. You would think for all that time they must have checked their orders 4+ times but thats not the case. Shame.

Service with a smile! Thank you Catherine! We had a fairly large to-go order with some modifications which she listened to closely and made sure she got correct. She offered and repeated back our order as well which is always a plus! On top of that every time I approached the counter she was on top of it and got me everything I asked for. This has been one of the best experiences I've had at this location by a mile! You did an awesome job Catherine, keep doing what you're doing! Thank you for being so kind and patient and for making us feel welcomed!

Chick-Fil-A/Saturday/ANY DAY...It's always good.  Coming at lunch time on a Saturday was daunting, as I thought every family with a kid post-weekend sporting event would want the (as we call it in our family,) "The Lord's Chicken!" The location was busy, but is run SO efficiently!!Tables op and our food was at our table in 5 minutes.  Don't know who the tall/slender/blonde  manager was on duty, but she ran that place quietly and effectively.  That's one thing about Chick-Fil-A, they hire the best of the best!  Later we saw the location GM, and he was immediately active/helping customers right away. Even the grandkids were like, "Man, for a busy place, we don't have to wait long for anything!"  I think the people in the drive-thru might beg to differ (not the location's fault so many people want drive-thru!)From the diet lemonade, chocolate milk and even the water - everything was wonderful.  Our food was scrumptious...seriously, it's the best franchise food around.  I think our clan wolfed their food down so they could go enjoy the very clean/awesome kids-play area...which meant I got to feast on their leftover fries...suckers!  Snooze ya looze.  Thank you for another fun/yummy family experience!

I normally eat here but today I felt like the customer service was extra better.  The guy that took our order outside was very nice. Unfortunately I don't catch his name but I will next time I am in. He took his time to help me without me being rush. Being able to have a 2 second conversation with him was nice. Also food is always great and once again wasn't disappointed . He got our order right and we received out order in no time. I really recommend it specially if you get him as you order taker :)
Best chicken in the world,spices chicken sandwich it's like fire in your mouth but great people that don't like any thing on burgers or chicken sandwich it just has pickle so just say no pickles

Slow service and rude staff. Waited in the drive-thru line for almost 15 minutes for two sandwiches. When I finally got to the window to pay I politely told the woman who rang me up (coincidentally wearing a name badge that said "customer service") that had I known how long it would take to get my order I never would've gotten in line. The woman looked at me, ignored what I said and took my money as if nothing had happened. After I paid, I said that when a customer offers feedback it's customary to acknowledge it. She looked at me, glared, and said "sorry." So rude. Happy to take my money elsewhere.Tried coming again. Why is this location so slow?!

The folks at this Chick-fil-a are "ON TOP OF THEIR GAME"!!  Food always Hot and Fresh. Catering is always on time Hot and Delicious! Yesterday I drove into the drive thru to get my favorite "Key Lime Frosted" and I guess the gal who preps the machine was off that day, so I was unable to get one, no biggie. Today I drove in, same place, Drive Thru and was greeted by 3 of the employee who gave me the Key Lime Frosted for FREE!!!!!!  This is the epitome of CUSTOMER SERVICE!  They all apologized and all had BIG SMILES on their faces!!!!  MADE MY DAY!!!!!!!!  I love you guys over at the Tatum Chick-fil-a!! I am a customer FOR LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!!
Justin is the best manager ever! He truly listens and provides off the chart amazing cumstomer service!

We come here almost weekly. Service is always good and food comes out fast. The manager really goes above and beyond to help people feel welcome and create a great environment. Chicken is always hot and delicious. Can't go wrong with the diet lemonade either.
When stating I want a number 12, don't assume I want a 12 count meal.  Even better, repeat my order back to me.  This is the 3rd time this has happened.  Your service is sliding.

Guys and Gals,This is my FIRST and definitely not my last experience at Chick-fil-A. American Ingenuityat its finest. Each server wears a Customer Server Badge. Pam was my server. I aske multiple QUESTIONS because I care about getting ti know people wherever I go. It is never about me! It is about who i am asking questions of. Who is acrooa the counter.One of tge vest Breakfast Experiences other then Starbucks. They are trained to provide High level CS like Starbucks.On a scale of 1-10 my Experience with Pamwas a 15!

The line was soo long and wrapped all the way around the parking lo, but it went fast! As usual the employees at chick fil a were nice and courteous even though they were very busy. Pam was so sweet and polite and had a great personality while we were in the drive through line. While we were in line, I could hear her on her head set and she spoke with such authority and kindness. The grounds were clean and misters were running. Great service.
This chick fil a is less than a mile from my apartment so I'm here at least once a week. The drive through isn't the fastest, but the service and food are always great!
Every drive thru is different. Can't complaint about chick fil a. They are always friendly and efficient. Drive thru was quick and painless.

Food was excellent Jessica sticks out in my mind the most I went and sat down she brought my food to me I wasn't used to this restaurant getting my napkins I asked her where they were so I could go get one and she said I will go get one for you excellent customer service!!!! I can't believe this place is a fast food restaurant. Jessica you're the best!!!!
Amazing customer service speed and great food like always great atmosphere you can tell the employees love there job and are always kind and caring
They're usually pretty good but this time the customer service was lacking. They also got my order wrong and got moody when I asked to correct it.

I am SOOOOOO appalled at how I was just treated at Chick fil a. I have taken my family here at least 3-4 times a week for the last few years and after having a minor problem with my app, talking to 2 non helpful managers, and even being forced to call corporate, I will probably never come back. Why, WHY would you, as a manager, be rude and act like you cannot help someone who is having some type of glitch on his mobile chick fil a app.Your employees have always been super nice and I've always appreciated it. To the tall blonde manager, I am extremely disappointed in the way you treated me. As a business owner, I would have gone above and beyond to help you with a problem. I needed and asked for your help on a simple issue. All you had to do was offer a simple solution. Instead you made me never want to return and embarrassed me.  That was so uncharacteristic of why is otherwise an awesome company.

Busiest chick fil a I've been too! Although they're all pretty busy. This place seems like the Disneyland on the weekend of all fast food places. I find it's quicker to go in instead of use the drive thru a lot of the time. But they never seem overwhelmed they get the food to their customers in a timely manner and pump out those delicious chicken nuggets with chick fil a sauce and waffle fries. Keep up the good work chik fil a.

What can I say beside who doesn't love Chic-fil-A ? Um no one !!! It's great for grabbing some yummy lunch or dinner and letting the kids burn off some energy in the playroom always clean and friendly staff. I love that they are always having fun events and they also have a rewards app now that can add up for as much as I bring the kids in for play dates.
Five stars for letting us order at the drive-thru at 10:02pm, even though they close at 10pm. Plus the food was good and service was good.

I love Chick-fil-A, but I hate this location! The employees are terribly rude and will try their hardest to avoid doing things. When our food came so did my husband's shake, but it didn't come with a straw. When he asked the old lady who brought out the food if she brought one out, she said no and told him he can get one himself from the front. She didn't say it kindly either. She was short, didn't make eye contact, and started walking away as she answered him. Why bring me my food if you aren't going to bring me the supplies to eat my food? I've never been to a Chick-fil-A where I felt like such an imposition to the workers and it wasn't even a busy time of day. I'd rather she sat down and called our number at the counter so I could have gotten a straw when I went up to get more order rather than when I'm comfortably seated. Halfway through my meal I run out of lemonade -because it's 90% ice- so I went up to the front for more and it took several minutes to get assistance. The line was non-existent, but they were socializing, yelling to each other to coordinate their breaks, or just avoiding eye contact. I finally was able to maintain eye contact with someone and he filled up my cup without saying anything to me other than "sugar?". I took it that he was asking if I want the regular lemonade versus diet, so I said "Yes, please", then thanked him when he put the filled cup on the counter. As we were getting ready to leave I wanted some more lemonade - again these "drinks" are mainly ice so I wasn't getting much lemonade and I'm a breastfeeding mom so I need a lot of liquid anyways. His eyes got huge and he stared at me like I just asked for 20 packs of sauce with my order. I made a joke and said "I know, I might as well have bought a gallon jug, right?" because I'm friendly and thought he was trying to be funny, but he just kept staring at me like I was asking way too much of him. Finally he snatched the drink from my hand, filled the cup, and brought it back to me. I put out my hand and rather than giving me the cup, he set it down away from me and turned his back to me so quickly that I couldn't even thank him for refilling my cup. I have never had a restaurant experience where I am significantly more polite to the servers than they are to me. This is not Chick-fil-A, this is a chicken version of [insert cheap fast food restaurant here]. I live 5 minutes away from this location, but I'd rather go down to the Camelback location just to avoid this one. Or I'll just go to In N Out right across the street because I don't want to take the chance that I'm going to get that much attitude when I'm trying to grab a quick meal.

My sister and I often come to chick fil a for dinner. And we have always had great experiences at this chick fil a, as well as others. But this visit stood out because of one of your employees. Marcus was kind and joked around with us while ordering our food. He brightened our day, and made us laugh. We've never experienced a worker interact so much with their guests like he did. It brought warmth to our hearts, especially in a time like this. We will be coming more often to this chick fil a because of him. God bless him and all of you. Happy holidays!

Made a bad night really special. On Nov 8th around 8:30pm, me and my boyfriend went to pick up some dinner after a crappy day, and an even crappier week. All I wanted to sooth my sorry soul, was a spicy chicken sandwich from Chick-fil-A. We placed our order, and pulled through to pay for our food. I had knowingly left my wallet at home. so my boyfriend reached into his pocket to get his. He sighed deeply, and turned to me and said, "I left my wallet in my backpack at home." My stomach dropped, and I was pretty crushed, because seriously....all I wanted was a stupid chicken sandwich...So we pull through, and I let a young blonde woman know that we forgot our wallets at home and couldn't pay for the food. She smiled and without missing a beat said, "Don't worry this one is on us." No guilt, no second guessing, just no problem and a smile.Touched, we thanked her and pulled up to get our order. Not only did we get our (delicious) food, we also got a few extra of our favorite sauces as a little icing on the cake.You didn't know how stressful our week had been. You didn't know that all I wanted was that chicken sandwich....you were just being kind to a stranger in your drive thru. I want you to know that this stranger really needed, and appreciated it. Young-blonde-woman-who's-name-I-don't-know, thank you for your kindness. And thanks Chick-Fil-A for empowering your employees to show that kind of compassion to your customers. It was the most delicious sandwich I ever ate :)

It's a good Chick-fil-A.  Prompt drive-thru service.  Nice touch with the shade along the wait.  It gets pretty packed and the cars go out of the parking lot.  Food was fine.  It was good for a quick dinner with my parents.
Yummy eat em ups thanks hot food great people who very assertive and showed much more care than most places. Highly recommended

You know the rep chik fil a has? They have outstanding customer service right? Nope! Not this location! Each and every time I go here because it's closest to work they have a snotty ghetto attitude. And they love to argue with you about how many sauces they can give you!! I order TWO separate meals and ask for only 3 sauces each. They try to shag me by giving me 2 total! Then they argue because they try to charge you extra for sauce!  Definitely need a make over at this location.
Worst service ever. Dined in and got no straws after ordering two drinks and also NO napkins . Won't drive thru service is better I definitely won't Dine in again.

I have had ALOT of bad experiences at this location but this is ridiculous. Ordered a #2 chicken sandwich... I get this?? How do you forget the bun?! Honestly I'm just going to start driving the 20 minutes to the Deer valley location because between this stupid shit, last time I didn't get my fries and paid for them (with NO Return phone call from the manager), and the terrible ATTITUDES from the children that work there (I thought maybe I was being petty but apparently this is a thing here)... I'm over it. Get it together Chick-fil-A, or at least learn ACTUAL customer service when you f up.

Considering the website says Chick-fil-A is "in the people business," we did not see any sign of that "fundamental commitment" today. My husband ordered dinner for our family and paid cash at the drive thru, then got home just to find they had neglected to include his sandwich. Upon calling, one of the "managers" said she saw it sitting there. Just drive back over here again, which he wasn't about to do. We were then given to an "upper manager" Trini. My husband suggested she just have someone drive the sandwich to our home. She hung up on him. So I called back and spoke to her. Very unhelpful, unpleasant and unprofessional. They should read the Core of Chick-fil-A statement on their website. Owner, Lourdes Hatten, has some problems.
Stopped by for lunch today,  very fast responsive service and the food was hot and fresh.  Couldn't have asked for better.  Good job guys.

Teen girls goofing around in the window, not doing their job. Messed up about 50% of the order: gave us the wrong drink, then gave us the wrong thing again after "fixing" it. We were also charged for extra items that weren't asked for; however, we expected more from Chick-fil-A and trusted them enough to drive away without checking. Hire more mature workers who don't stick their nose into other people's business that are outside of the window. I don't think it's necessary to have 5+ teen girls in the window.

I'm not from the area but where I'm from our chick fil a has good customer service, and isn't stingy on their sauce. They give our handful. But I came here twice, employees looks to be in their teen years or early twenties. They have some attitude. Seem to not care. Second time coming here I wanted to make sure everything was in the bag and they replied so rude as if they wanted us out of there. They weren't packed like the first time we came here. The first time a young man was handling our drinks, thank god we caught how many he gave us because he forgot one, his fault because we witness him conversating with other employees. Asking for sauce and not give us a lot. Overall the food is good. Just they need to work one better service and positive attitude!

There was a male manager who was especially extremely rude. If something goes wrong they don't have to take it out on the customers. They could say it nicely even if something went wrong. They could also use trash cans at there drive thru just like all the others.

Went here for 2018 cow appreciation day. I had never been to this CFA and it was ABSOLUTELY PACKED FULL! It had a line out the door and the parking lot was crazy full. Even the drive through was full of cars. Despite this location being the busiest CFA I have ever visited, our food came out the fastest of all six CFAs I visited that day.

Always to go this Chick-fil-A location since it's closer to my place. Ordered through drive-thru spicy deluxe sandwich, they read me back the order at the pick up window and my receipt also shows spicy deluxe and label on the sandwich box also shows spicy deluxe. Came back and opened the box and it's grilled sandwich, how come the order go wrong at three different check points. Is this way u run a successful franchise with bunch of folks who does not know how to run the process flow for delivering a simple order. Management needs to wake up at least now, also see bunch of reviews the same way.Got to drive back again and change my order...staff inside have no clue how this happened and they apologize just because they got to say something.Bunch of lazy folks with no focus on customer service are running this location. Stay away !!!

There are a lot of food choices in the Valley. Moreover, there are quite a few Chick-fil-A's to choose from. That being said, I would highly recommend you NOT spend your money at this Chick-fil-A. I ran through the drive thru one day with my kids and ordered lunch (I hadn't been to this location in years). We asked for 3 ranch and 3 chick-fil-a sauces with our meal. When we got up to the pay window the girl informed me that we'd have to pay for the extra sauces (they only give you 2). Ok, no problem. But then she rolls her eyes and gives me the snottiest attitude about it. She says "yeah, it's because, you know, people like this (me) who order to much sauce". Ummmm....sayeth what?! Chick-fil-A is typically the Ruth's Chris of fast food but this location is more like a dirty Burger King. Take my advice and Spend your hard earned money at a different Chick-fil-A.

The one on Camelback is so much better. The grilled nuggets taste better, the service is better, they actually give me the sauce I ask for...it's honestly gotten worse over the past few months. They almost always give me the wrong sauce but the last time I went I didn't get ONE of the correct sauces I asked for. I feel like they are just lazy teenagers who don't give a crap. I didn't realize the difference in the food until I recently went to the one on Camelback and the grilled nuggets tasted fresher. Take some notes from that location!

I usually visit this chick-fil-a at least 2-3 times a month because it is the closest to my house, but may be driving farther to go to a different location in the future. The last three times I have visited (always through the drive-through) the cashier has gotten my order wrong (either something completely wrong, or made incorrectly), even when they say it correctly back to you when you're ordering. The last time I was here I had ordered a milkshake with no cherry as I am allergic to them (which I also said), drove up to the window, and was handed a milkshake with a cherry on it. When I gave it back and let them know it was supposed to no cherry, I watched the cashier through the window pick the cherry out with a napkin and cover up the leftover juice with whipped cream, then give it back to me. After asking if it had been remade, the guy didn't know what to say and didn't answer me until I told him it needed to be remade and I had seen him just pick it out with a napkin. Fast forward two weeks later, my husband and I are at chick-fil-a again, and we order a grilled nugget meal. Pulling up to the window, we are now given a regular (breaded) nugget meal. When we asked about it and gave it back to them, the cashier (who didn't apologize) informed us they would need to charge an additional $0.80 for the price difference. Seriously? So now we're again waiting for several minutes for the correct food after getting the wrong order. The service as this chick-fil-a used to be great, but lately is seems like all of the workers are high school kids wanting to gossip and hang out without paying attention to helping customers or doing their job. Judging from the other recent yelp reviews, we're not the only people this has happened to. The service/management at this store really needs to get it together.

Went there a few weeks back and they forgot to put my sandwich in my bag. I called and let the manager know who took my name and advised me she would replace my meal for me. I go back today and guess what,  she made me Pay for my meal...she gave me a free sandwich..lol..I told her it wasn't FREE because I had already paid for it....now were talking a kids meal..nothing outrageous....but was rude and didn't care if I am getting screwed....I told her I was going to call Corporate and she told me go ahead she didn't care...Well they not only lost my business at this location...I will post this so people will go somewhere else. What a liar for a manager!

While it's not the place to go for anything healthy the salads are very good and generous in size.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich that had a funky taste. The lettuce covered it like it was hiding the piece of chicken. Almost as a warning "why are you eating the grilled chicken" It just is not the place to order this item. It was rubbery and tasted like it was 100% rib meet. It is shaped like a breast and has lines on it like it is grilled. 4 stars for the salads, stay away from the grilled stuff and go with the signature fried stuff.

So did a mobile order for the first time. It was super easy! Also ordered breakfast for the first time at Chick-fil-A. I got the chicken biscuit & 4 count minis & hash browns. It was delicious. The chicken biscuit was super good, you can taste the honey in the biscuit. It's good with any sausage for example mayo, ranch or polynesian. Polynesian sauce is my favorite for the chicken biscuit & minis. They do have a couple of outdoor seating. There's a play place inside. Download the Chick-fil-A app to earn points to earn free food.

Had a horrible experience at this location. Was given wrong order at the drive through. When we got home we realized it. Called the restaurant and they wouldn't acknowledge their mistake. Asked to speak to manager and they wouldn't connect us. STAY AWAY FEOM THIS LOCATION!!!
Someone pease tell me why is my cheese over my sandwich instead of inside the sandwich? Did someone missed that part of training?

Our family loves Chick-Fil-A.. BUT this location needs some work. After the 4th visit today, the drive-thru team is rushed and impersonal and doesn't care to listen to what we ask for. They have messed up 2 out of the 4 orders, and they don't take the time to make sure it's right. When I asked for additional sauce they say oh it's in there, when in fact it's not. The other location at Shea and 101 is by far better customer service and always cares on what we ask for-and checks. Wish this location would get it together!

This CFA was always busy and full of kids for mine to play with. We wound up here several times on a recent visit to our family. I mean, it is CFA, they treat you well, the food was great, and the play area was big enough to fit the 10 or so kids that were in it every time!
My favorite fast food joint, by far. Fries are always fresh & the chicken is always hot. The only "complaint" I have is when I'm craving them on Sundays, they're not open! Haha!

Oh, Chic-fil-A how I love thee. Let me count the ways...1. Good food2. Fast service3. Friendly staff4. A clean store5. Philanthropic givingOur two boys love coming here for dinner. We will use any excuse to come. We have never had a bad meal or experience.

We love Chick-fil-A food but we'll go back to the other location we frequent next time we want some. I spoke with who ever the "manager" was at this location more than 5 years ago about a large ladder being stored on top of the area small children play in and apparently it is still not a safety concern to this restaurant.

Cobb Salad was great!!! Always friendly and polite here. Thanks Chic Fil a. Oh - and the Cool Wrap is also very good. Not crazy for the grilled bites as there are too few for the price. Stick to the salad and also try the wrap and you'll be in good territory.
I love Chick-fil-A and go there often.  Their recent coupons for free items have expanded the items I like to order.  Always polite and pleasant staff.
One of my favorite chicken places to eat. Always fresh and delicious Staff is alway helpful. My drive through orders are always complete. No worries

This is extreme to have to yelp. But it's that bad. Simple problem: wife is allergic to pickles. 3 out or 4 visits had pickles on her chicken sandwich. Wasted money since we live 5 mles away. Called the 3rd time. Mgr Said too busy to talk to me. I left my name and number. No call back. Called again, no mgr available. Placed an online complaint. No call back. Just received an email asking how my complaint was resolved. Filled out survey saying it was never resolved. No call back. At all. From anyone. You turned a simple complaint that was your fault into a loss of $80 a week on sales. Good job chick-fil-a. I'm completely done and so is my family. I hope you reprimand and terminate your terrible regional and general manager. They don't care about their customers obviously. I tried 5 times now, with not one call back. The survey asking how my complaint was resolved ess the biggest slap in the face. Not cool.

Solid Chik-Fil-A. I came here for lunch and ordered a Chik-Fil-A sandwich with medium fries and a drink. The staff was incredibly friendly and brought me my food when it was ready. The food was great! Just like every Chik-Fil-A I've been too. The chicken was nice and crispy. The fries were great with polynesian sauce and what can i say I'm a fan of the place, so it was very enjoyable. As I was only on vacation, but come down here eery year for Spring Training I will definitely drop by again in the future when I am back in the area.
It's very nice and clean. Mad house during lunch time so plan ahead. The frozen lemonade it delicious
Incredibly clean, friendly and fresh. First time here and I will definitely be returning.

Yum, not sure what there isn't to love about this place. Food is great and fresher than many other fast food places. The staff is friendly and always accommodating to my children and I. Yes, they get busy, but they are great at still getting you in and out.

I can eat like 1000 of these sandwiches. Great food, everyone knows that. This place does a lot of community events and has great employees. I had a complaint about the coffee and the owner called me and apologized. I appreciated it very much. Thanks for the fun and great food!

So I order a chicken sandwich with no Pickles. At the drive thru I check and it has pickles. I point this out and ask for a new sandwich. Was a quick turn around and I though nothing of it. I get home, take the top bun off and its covered in Pickle seeds. They didn't make me a new one, just took the pickles off. Now how a restaurant should handle an issue like this imho.

Ok,this place is amazing!If you had a stomach ache before,(which I did),I never got one for 2 WHOLE YEARS!!!!And don't get me started on the chicken deluxe...They have everything from Soup to chicken to sandwiches to salads to you get the point...And they have also a lot of dressing choices,hot sauce,ketchup,ranch,etc.I also want to tell you about their Chick-Fil-A sauce..If you like eccentric/Unusual sauces,it's good.I think manyWould like it either way..Overall I rate 5 stars.Now,this is "Overated Review" but Food is good,not to greasy,AMAZINGLY customer support,and CLEAN restrooms.They also clean every table when the person leaves,and another clean every 5 minutes,so there's that.And the Play Area,(not5),but I can tell it's amazing,EVERY kid wants to go there,and from the looks of it,it's clean!The drive thru also serves the Best Drive Thru food,and it's exactly if you were to go inside!Also,The cashiers say words like "Your Welcome" and have a positive smile that you can't resist!

If you are going to eat fast food this is a much tastier option than some other chains out there. An added bonus is that their lemonade is delicious! The restaurant is usually clean and the service is quick and friendly. I like their original chicken sandwich and the fact that their fries aren't overloaded with salt. The chicken is well seasoned and juicy and the pickles add a little zing. They are always happy to offer up sauces with your order in case you want to jazz up your sandwich or fries.

Always busy but fast and efficient nevertheless! The chicken is nicely breaded, flavorful and juicy! You can get it grilled too. The chicken can be a sandwich, nuggets or on a salad- all good choices!
They need to just stick with their chicken sandwiches and waffle fries.  Their coffee tasted horrible as there's no coffee taste at all.

Usually good service but not today! I forgot to exchange out my daughters fries for fruit and when I went to ask they said no. I've never had issues with the customer service until today! Pretty disappointed by them. Maybe the person who took my order should have asked fruit or fries but his service was lacking as well.
The best customer service...matched only by their great food! I love the Broccoli-Kale salad and grilled nuggets! And lemonade! And milkshakes!! Always friendly.

'My pleasure' is something you will consistently hear at this location, and so do I take great pleasure in devouring everything on their menu from the chicken strips to the grilled chicken bites, and chicken tortilla soup.What makes their fast food concept so special? The chicken. It is so juicy and fresh.   Even the breaded entrees are not overshadowed by the hard and crusty layers of breading other ff chains glob on - on efforts to save on the protein. Here you get generous portions, each one delivering taste and freshness. Especially the grilled chicken has a tooth some and juicy flavor.What u love most about the sides? Kiddos get a plethora of fruit in a fruit cup ranging from crisp apples and blueberries to tangy sweet mandarins.The lemonade virtually tastes like a fresh squeezed lemon with simple syrup and I am consumed by how amazing it tastes.The most terrific thing? It is so kid friendly that twice a month they have an hour or so of activities for kids. These include a scavenger hunt or art contests, art projects, face painting, and more. The wow factor is that is is absolutely free.The staff are consistently friendly and engaging, they even bring your order to the table.I come her about twice a month with my girls, my 5 year old asks to go every day! And yes, as far as fast food goes, they can't do any better.

Clean.  Great customer service. Family oriented.  Excellent tasting, high quality food.  They have a program to promote family togetherness by challenging the family to put our cell phones in the box for the whole meal to earn a free ice cream....the kids were all over this!  Brilliant!  The marketing director greeted us and took care of us the whole meal...refilled our drinks, asked about us as people, and spread positivity to our experience.  I believe her name was Sylvia...what a great person.   We do not have this restaurant where we ar from.....we are very impressed.
Decent place to grab lunch.Biggest gripe is you have to go to the counter and ask for a refill on your drink.Get the spicy chicken sandwich with the honey bbq sauce!

I am so impressed with the patience and kindness of the workers at Chick-fil-A. They are always so nice and proactive with getting you what you need. It is a parent's dream - the play place is awesome and I can get a Diet Lemonade and sit in the booth and watch my 3 year old play. The salads are fresh and delicious. The kids meals are great and I really appreciate the toy which is always educational and interactive.

Y'all already know. It's a Southern thing, brought out here to provide delicious fried chicken with a smile and a very subtle Southern Baptist sense of humility and service.You'll NEVER have inconsistent quality. Your kids will love it. It's impossible to get sick of it. I grew up near the original, I will never live more than a mile from a branch of this staple.

We like bringing our kids to chick fil a because of the nice family atmosphere. We unknowingly came here on a fundraiser night. Even though it was very busy, the tables were cleared fast and the bathrooms were clean. I didn't give 5 stars because we were slightly disappoint in the under cooked fries and chicken nuggets. We still are everything up but I prefer when the fries and chicken are crisper.

I was here for the opening of the store. I did that overnight thing where I hung out in the parking lot and got 52 free cards for meals. That was mang years ago.Since then, I've gone back many times. The food has been consistent and the service has always been great. When I worked nearby, I would come here for many busy lunches, and they always kept everything moving very quickly.

I'm never coming to this location again.  The lady literally burped the second she opened the window to give me the food. She also gave me the wrong order and I didn't get a chance to look at it until I got home. I called to let them know they gave me the wrong order and the manager offered to fix the order if I drove back to the location,  but it wasn't worth my gas money to drive back.

What's not to love about Chik-fil-A? Their food is good and the preparation is consistent. This location in particular always has very friendly staff. Remember that they are closed on Sundays. I've caught myself pulling in there a couple times only to realize that I'm there on a day that they are closed. I appreciate that they are closed on Sundays and holidays so their staff can spend time with their families, however, so I don't mind one bit.

First time at a Chik FilA  ever.In a pinch for food while running around town.Ordered a cool wrap.Paid six dollars.This "wrap" tasted worse than what I imagine the sandwiches in gas station coolers taste like.Salty, non food bright orange cheese shreds with cold grilled chicken by-product pieces and lettuce all wrapped in a dry tortilla. Truly disgusting. I thought about returning it for my money back.Threw it away instead.

I love Chick-fil-A, especially their fries. But one thing I don't understand is why they don't post their closing hours anywhere.  I literally searched it doesn't sites and none of them had a time for that location.
Great staff. Very friendly and attentive. Tables that turn quick get cleaned just as quick. Nice! Their new salads are fresh and crisp.

Why is it that Chick-fil-A seems to have great customer service at almost every location? Why can't the other fast food chains get it right like these guys? Friendly employees (none of which I saw using a cell phone on-duty), fast service and my order is always right. Keep it up Chick-fil-A, whatever you're doing is working! :O)

This Chic filet has been here 8 years. I use to go to a CFA in North Carolina once in a while. I found this wonderful jewel of fast food restaurants 6.5 years ago. Lourdes, who is the owner of this franchise has a great store, great staff, and it is always decorated nicely for the upcoming holidays. When you walk in it is warm and inviting. All the other CFAs are boring and all the other fast food restaurants cant compare. They are corporate sterile. No imagination.The restaurant is always clean and the service is excellent. They want everybody to be happy and have a good time. You are treated better than family. If you have occasional problem they will make it right and treat you with respect in QUICK EARTH TIME. You don't have to visit the manager to be berated and called an idiot to get satisfaction.
